text: After ordering online and receiving a message that stated my food would be at my office at 12:15pm. Mind you I ordered before 11am because it was for a very importan meeting with my boss. I called when I noticed it was already 12:15pm only to be told that they were short a driver and the food would go out when he got back. Ok, I can understand that. However, I don't understand the fact that no one gave me a call to let me know. Instead, the manager told me I should've called the order in not placed it online??? Really! Okay, I wasn't too happy, But it was worst when I received the order and was told that there was no soup because they didn't have it. I was pissed off at that point. I called back only to have the manager not really sound like he cared. He did ask me if there was anything he could do, but all I said was that the communication was seriously lacking. They still charged me and did nothing to keep my business. I am always ordering for my office, however, I will not use Earl ever again.
I love this place. I eat the Double Philly with cheese sauce more often then anyone should. Great service. Thank you

This is the best Chinese buffet I've found on the north side!  We go almost every week with the kids.  The food is freshest during typical lunch & dinner times but they're open all afternoon.  The price is reasonable (includes fountain drinks & desserts) and you can order off the menu if you prefer.

Good food at reasonable prices.  The best part was the lunch special that gives you the drink and fries for free (normally a $2.25 add on) for free when you purchase a burger or a sandwich. 
I got the breaded tenderloin which was more money than the burger but was really big and worth it. my son got a double burger and fries and my daughter got the kid's chicken nugget meal with fries and a drink. Good fries too! Thick and tasty rather than tiny shoestring ones.  
We all ate it fast and were stuffed.   I wished we had saved room for ice cream or a milkshake. they looked great.

The food ...good stuff! Delightful, great portions, leftovers for sure. 

I didn't care for the actual ambiance though, I felt like a time traveled back to the 80's in India.

Just ordered for take out. Super fast and great service!!

I ordered the Sushi Royale which was to come with Miso Soup. When it was delivered the soup was missing. I was a little bummed, but thought - not a big deal. Ten minutes later, a knock at the door, and they delivered my soup! Couldn't believe they came back JUST for my soup. Such a nice guy. 

Great service. Will definitely order from here again!!

I think I like this place so much just because it is much, much better than Butter's down the street.  My man likes the turkey.  Collards are average.  The corn is damn addictive and I love the potato salad.  They are beyond slow.  So call ahead or give yourself a good amount of time even for the most simple order to be filled.  (I feel like cornbread to go would take them 10 minutes just to ring it up.)

Looking to get your oyster shucked, look no further. Just tip your head back and let those slippery Sally's slide down your throat for a truly unforgettable fine dining experience that will get your ticker ticking and send you off to the races perky as a peach... in other words... simply fantastic!!

My husband and I always come here when we go to New Orleans. They have the best coffee (their vanilla lattes are always incredible!!) and the best donuts. You won't regret it. If you are in the mood for bagels instead, you'll love Steins bagels next door. Both places have an amazing vibe

I have been wanting to visit Marjie's for months so when my family was in town for Jazz Fest I decided to give it a shot! And I'm so so so happy I did!

First of all, Marjie's is located in a shot gun house on Broad Street. There is no parking lot/ easy parking so we parked on a side street and walked over. The restaurant was crazy after Jazz Fest Thursday but we were the luckiest people in the city because we got a table for 4 outside on the back porch. While the inside of the restaurant seemed a little bright/ like someone's home, the back porch was PERFECT for dinner. It is super comfortable and there were string lights which made me feel like I was at a cute little garden party.

Our table for 4 decided to order a bunch of food and share it family style, which I highly recommend! We started with the charred Brussels sprouts (obviously because they're my obsession), which were a little sweet, crunchy, and delicious. We also got the springtime som tam (double spicy)- great fresh veggies, coal roasted sweet potatoes - salty and sweet and oh so good, hush puppies - pretty good but just tasted fried to me, the chili butter yard bird - cooked very well, the herb rubbed gulf fish - great flavor, and the spare ribs - I didn't try them but my family really enjoyed them. All of the food was unique, thought out, and very flavorful. There wasn't one thing that we ordered that I didn't really enjoy, so I know that all of the other menu items are probably amazing as well. And the food was affordable! All of that food plus 2 beers and tip was around $125 - a steal for dinner for 4.

I'm sad that it took me so long to visit Marjie's but I will definitely be back! 

Food - 4.5 stars
Price - 4.5 stars
Service - 4 stars 
Atmosphere - 3 stars inside, 4.5 stars outside

Eh, this place is fine" is the thought that keeps coming up as I figure out how to write this review. In my stable of establishments to patron, this is filed under "Go to if you're looking to give the impression of a fancy restaurant and food doesn't matter.

None of the food is bad, per se, but I also cannot think of one dish that has knocked my socks off. The same can be said for the drinks. I ordered a apple cider mule last time I was here and I'm not sure what the problem was, but it wasn't good and that is something that is hard to mess up in my opinion. I also had the filet and the cream of tomato soup. The filet was very tender and good, bit the flavor wasn't great if that makes sense. Finally, the  soup was too thick and salty for my tastes and that is saying a lot considering I love salty food! I hate to give a restaurant an okay review, but okay has just been my opinion of the food here.

Prices seemed decent but close to the more than I would have liked to pay' end considering the service was spotty and the food was mostly average.

Other than that, the ambiance was great for getting dressed up and a romantic dinner. Low lighting, and polite wait staff makes this a great go to for dates if you're trying to impress someone early in your relationship.

Don't let the fact that this place is in an older motel scare you off!  The food is delicious and the prices are fantastic.  The rib plate comes with 4 hugs ribs and one side for $8.50.  The sauce is served on the side and is just the right kind of spicy.  The sweet potato fries are particularly perfect (and I am super picky about my sp fries!) and have a hint of cinnamon sugar about them.  The homemade salsa was chock full of fresh ingredients that tasted like they were in the garden this morning.  All in all, this was an amazing place to feed our family as we passed through.  You simply can't go wrong here...and you won't regret it!

We finally got Five Guys in Hendersonville!
The burgers are great and the fries are outstanding.  And they give you a lot of fries!
I recommend "The Cowboy" best sandwich around the area. Always very friendly staff and they work hard to maintain the lobby.
Good spot for breakfast. Cooked the eggs just like I like. Cajun potatoes were yummy not too hot. Staff was friendly and we were well looked after.

Tried it for the first time the other night because I had a gift certificate for the place.  The area where we sat was dirty - could feel the crumbs on the sofa-like seating and had to dust them off.  Bleh, not a good start.  We ordered from the a la carte menu.  We started with the Casablanca salad which was good, but under-flavored.  We had the chicken tagine and chicken kabobs for entrees.  The chicken tagine was awful.  The seasoning on it was too dense and pungent to eat and the chicken itself was bland and on the dry side.  The kabobs were also bland and dry.  The couscous that accompanied the kabobs was simply awful - bland and tasteless.  
For the life of me, I can't understand why a Moroccan restaurant serves pita bread rather than traditional Moroccan bread.  But, even still, the pita was dry and on the harder side, not overwhelmingly fresh.  
We did not get dessert.  We did have the Moroccan mint tea, which was good and tasted authentically Moroccan.  
The kicker was we weren't able to use the gift certificate for the a la carte menu, only for the "feasts".  
We won't be using the gift certificate at all because we won't be going back.  
To top it off, the belly dancer was not good.

I played Yelp Roulette for Castleton.  They were some other options I wanted to try like burgers and BBQ, but I had that recently. #40 on the list was Joella's.  As I looked at the menu, it claimed the winning spot for my supper.

Joella's is a little different from your standard fast food chicken places.  You get to choose your level of spice, more side options, and dipping sauces you do not get from other establishments. 

I went with the Jumbo tenders at the Ella's Fav level with red-skin mashed potatoes and green beans.  For checking in to Yelp, I also got a big wing, which I almost had to argue about receiving.  The tenders were big, juicy, and on the spicy side.  The green beans were ok but the mashed potatoes was very creamy and delicious. The wing had good flavor but has the flaws of most wings, not enough meat and some maneuvering.

One sauce comes with the meal and one sauce is just not good enough for this sauceaholic. So I chose 5 and paid an extra 50 cents for each one.  A description of the sauces I tried are: Jojo (Mustard BBQ), Bama white (a lot of horseradish), cheerwine BBQ (Cheerwine is a chery flavored soda), pimento ranchero (ranch with pimento cheese), and my favorite  - the spiked honey.  I am having a hard time thinking of a sauce similar to it.  Either way, that's the sauce I'm choosing next time then either the Jojo or Pimento Ranchero.

For dessert, they have pie in a jar.  I had the chocolate peanut butter one which was very fulfilling. I get to keep the jar too.

Sweet tea was Indiana level sweet tea which means barely sweet.  But it was fresh-brewed. 

I thought of Joella's as a better Southern Pop-eyes.  If you love fried chicken with some heat, come give it a try.

We decided to come here because I was craving ovenq roasted wings and Anthony's is very well known for their wings. The whole experience was very average and is more like 2.5 stars. Our server was TERRIBLE! Gave us the wrong food, didnt hardly speak a word to us, was not courteous and didn't even say anything as we were leaving. The food is decent however it is really overpriced. $13.30 for an order of 10 wings is a lot. Their pizza price is the same. $25 for a large and it is not anything special. There are much better pizza places to spend your money and we won't be coming back to this restaurant.

Outstanding! Our first, middle and last impression was the service. Of course the food was spectacular but, in particular, a manager Daniele was simply a quintessential pro. If we could have given 6 stars, we would.

Arrived in Santa Barbara fresh off the train hungrier than all get out. Wandered over to the pier bc we'd heard that the Santa Barbara shellfish Co was good --- after being ignored for several minutes & not feeling the love, walked over to Brophy bros & our mood lifted immediately with attentive service & a nice fresh bread basket. Hubby ordered the clam chowder & immediately made plans to return tomorrow. Fab views, great food, fair prices...yep, we'll be back!

This tiny location is hidden away next to the Straz Performing Arts Center. Super friendly staff and they offer a wide range of different coffee drink options which is surprising since the place is so small. They have 1 power outlet and not really a place to sit and work all day but it's great if you are watching a show at the Straz and need your coffee fix. They offer seating outside and no bathrooms. Sitting inside you can hear the show that's performing through the walls which I thought was amusing. They serve Buddy Brew coffee so you can't go wrong with that since it's a local favorite. Good luck finding parking but if you're in the area or going to the Straz Center I recommend checking out this place.

I'm currently at the airport in philly. the service at terminal e is not very good. check number 2270 started off asking for a beer  not sure what I wanted  ordered came in a real big glass then realized there were small pint size  bartender never ask what size I wanted just gave me larger size just to run up tab. then I ordered food ask if fries came with she said no then I ask for side of fries. when food came philly came first just set in front of me never said anything g walked away I said I was suppose to get fries sId on there way philly was more bread then meat was not very good. when fries got there they were not a side but an appetizer  i was talking with customer next to me about size and borrowed menu fries were 8 dollars wow I said excuse me to the bartender that was standing with her back turned doing paperwork so she could leave she said that's the only way they came I said I ask for a side but she never told me they only came that way again felt like the were just trying to run the tab higher. I said I dont want them she said ok took fries and dumped them in trash never sorry or anything.  so she said to me a bit later have a good day and took her stuff and left. so I ask the next bartender for a manager. manager came I explained the problem as I was talking the girl bartender came up and I told her that I've been in service industry for years and said you should ask what size beer and explain that they dont do sides. as I was asking some other bartender that was ringing up a item in pos system said everyone else does the same thing with a attitude. I said I beg your pardon manager said dont worry about her. really  that employee should be fired. anyway I said I really deal like your just trying to get as much as you can from me because I'm at airport he said that's correct. wow again. I will never eat there again and worn everyone watch out they dont care about you. sorry was hoping for a better experience.  manager did adjust my large beer and buy me one but still deal cheated. I've never done a review before has to be bad for me to rant like this.

I really enjoyed this place. It was some of the best Korean I have had in the city and I would love to come back and try a salad. I was able to get my kids sandwiches which were really good as well. The pricing is about 5.99 a sandwich. Bimpap was 10.99 which is going rate I have noticed. Go there!
First time here. Great service. The food was very well prepared and quickly served. The sushi was presented nicely and very good tasting. Will definitely be back.
Great customer service very welcoming and atmosphere. The barista asked if it was our first time. And went over the menu with us.. Awesome coffee with free refills! Indoor and outdoor seating!

I normally really like Sakura, but I tried to to get a to go order tonight and the staff was beyond rude. I left without ordering to get carry-out elsewhere.  Not sure I will be back, too many other choices with better customer service.

My husband planned a fabulous birthday evening for my 40th along with a group of friends.  While the Paramour is beautiful and in the past we experienced a nice dinner, this visit was not exactly great.  When we arrived my husband planned for appetizers to be served with drinks in a private setting while we waited for dinner, several of the apps were more room temp than hot when served.  The space we sat in was very pretty but not at all private, At dinner we sat in a very nice private dining room, several guests were quite pleased with their meals, mine was less than mediocre.  The following day my husband reviewed the bill and noticed we spent $100's less  than the anticipated amount.  My husband contacted the manager and asked if they would offer a gift certificate/credit and mentioned that the servers and party planner never mentioned that we had not spent the amount allotted. Much to our dismay and disappointment, the Paramour was less that cooperative refused to do anything and more or less indicated it was our loss.  just very sad as we have shared this story with friends and co-workers we have discovered this to be more a common occurrence than a rarity.  We will not return due to the horrible customer service, mediocre meal and shadow they cast upon the memories of my birthday..

Food is good but they run out too soon. Been there twice for dinner around 6pm looking for their brisket and they had sold out. When i finally came in early like 4 pm i was able to get it. It was amazing! My only complaint would be they need to plan for more demand
Salmon Burger and sweet potato fries good...but giving 5 stars for being divey, GF Beer and Black /White Dog photos ever square inch of the walls!

We were looking forward to a wonderful evening at Oceano Bistro with a large group to celebrate two birthdays. We had heard good things about this place and gave it a try. A couple of people in our group loved this place in the past. I don't know if the quality has slipped or if this is the new normal, but the whole group left feeling very underwhelmed by the experience. Being Restaurant Week, most of us ordered off of the special menu with a few regular menu items added. The problems started when the servers forgot to bring out two of our chowders as the first course. Eight people in our group of ten were eating while two of us had to wait until they were almost finished before we had to chance to tell them that we had not been served our first course yet. Once the chowder came, it was pretty bland. It wasn't bad, just needed more salt, pepper and spices. Next came our main course - mine was trout with mushrooms and green beans in a mushroom sauce. The trout was excellent. The mushrooms were very good, but were very sparse. Needed many more mushrooms. The green beans were too raw for me. I like a little fresh snap and crispness to my al dente vegetables, but these were way, way too raw and had no flavor either. Dessert course was either bread pudding with ice cream or a cupcake. The bread pudding was good, but the cupcake was very dry and non-edible. 

Lastly, they did nothing to recognize the two of us that chose to celebrate our birthday at their establishment. No drink on the house or complimentary appetizer or anything. A small gesture goes a long way in showing your appreciation for your patrons and making a lasting impression. 

This place was trendy and nice all around, but I was not impressed. The next time I celebrate my birthday, it will be at another establishment. There are plenty of wonderful places in which to spend my time and money.

The service was mediocre, our server took a while to greet us and didnt check on us more than twice. My boyfriend and I don't normally eat a lot but in order for us to feel full, we both had to order more food, it just didn't seem filling. I'm not really an egg, quinoa or waffle person so I felt limited overall on what I could choose from. I didn't really care for what I got to eat. After 20% tip we spent $56 on two people for brunch. Probably won't be back.
I'm not vegan but I still love and prefer the vegan bowl! It's great and doesn't cost as much as other vegan places do

They are back to being really good again -- good job Chick fil A! 

Probably the best one in the area -- great employees and fast.

The greatest neighborhood in all of Philadelphia has one of the greatest establishments offering great food, a terrific beer selection and reasonable pricing. The staff is friendly, efficient and polite. The atmosphere is relaxed and fun!  This is a spot that can not be missed!

Great place to go for dinner! The pimento beignets are delicious...and the fried green tomatoes. The hot chicken was pretty hot but our waitress Lindsey was so awesome and brought us a glass of milk. The peanut bombe was out of this world. Great service and food!

Unbelievable flavor in this food!! Make sure you try the couscous curry wrap that was amazing. Also the buffalo chicken wrap was very good. 

However the real specialty of Tareks Cafe is his breakfast. All the eggs and omelettes are amazing and full of flavor. He also makes his muffins homemade and fresh everyday so make sure you pick one up on your way out!

Ordered a burger and diet coke. Small misunderstanding and my order never got put in. Instead of apologizing I was told by the manager on duty it was my fault. I have been a customer for some time, not sure I am coming back.

We were visiting here from TN and found this close (about 7 mins) to the airport. It was smaller than the pictures on Yelp make it seem but that didn't take away from the experience at all. We went about 430 on a Saturday evening. It wasn't busy at all. The bar was open and there are about 6 tables in the front but they also have a more secluded room in the back with a pool table for private gatherings. When we first walked i. The music was playing 
So the vibes were nice!  We got a table and the man behind the bar came right over to greet us and get our drink orders. They had a full bar and carried a lot of different beers. We just ordered Corona (no pun intended lol). A young lady then came over and took our orders. We got the chicken Philly egg rolls w/tots  and the fish and chips. The eggs rolls i believe are homemade (not frozen) because she asked if we wanted onions, mushrooms, and jalape√±os in them-even gave us a option on which cheese we wanted in them. The fish was crispy and fried to perfection and the fries great too! Overall, this visit was great and they service was also great. The guy even gave us some good places to visit while in the city! Great service !

This place is super cute! We were able to snag seats at the bar on a busy Sunday afternoon and our experience/service was 10/10. 
You can't go wrong with the mimosa kit, the juice options were sooo goodn
The truffle fries were hands down THE best fries I have ever tasted in my entire life and I'm not even being dramatic. 
The burger was also delicious with the perfect runny egg on top.

This is a newer local bar and restaurant. I have had a decent experience each time I have gone. The bar is nice, drinks are strong and they are reasonable. I have had pork chops, mofongo, tostones, and rice. Each platter was delicious. I do feel the staff are "standoffish" or seem like they do not want to be at work. Overall it is a nice restaurant and bar with good mud

Very disappointed that the manager and staff that was preparing and serving the food I was planning on having wasn't masked. We do have a mask mandate.  We left.  I wear a mask all day so I don't share my respiratory droplets on my customers. I want to stay employed so I mask because the ramifications of what will happen if I test positive for covid will affect many many people. I go out. I see people.  But someone is masked because it's the right thing to do. Russell's you can do better. I'll miss you.

This is the only thing open late night near Mount Juliet. I've been waiting for 15min no answer on the intercom, drove around and looked inside to see if anyone was working, saw an employee with dreads sipping on a soda with not a care in the world

My husband and I stopped in for the first time tonight.. We had the calamari app which was tasty and cooked perfectly. I had the captains platter and he had the reef platter which we both enjoyed very much. Our server from Mass. (Cheryl) spelled the same way as mine, was very attentive and personable. I would highly recommend her seeing it was only her 2nd serving shift at this establishment and she was fantastic:))

My husband and I love craft beer, so Philly Beer Week is one of the best times of the year - when we have time to enjoy it. I actually had the weekend off for once, so we made sure to hit up as many of the events and bars as our livers could handle. BRU Craft & Wurst was celebrating their 1st birthday so we hit them up for a late lunch.

They had a live band performing (mostly covers), and although they were good performers, DEAR LORD was it loud inside! We asked to be seated as far from them as possible, and it was still incredibly difficult to hear one another. A place that primarily shills beer/alcohol should foster conversation, not lonely consumption. We like the concept of the 'self serve' drafts that charge you per ounce, but for this latest visit we stuck with the bar's draft list. They had some sandwich specials as part of their celebration - we shared the roasted pork and garlic pork sausage with sauerkraut, both of which had pickles and chips. The food was great with our cold brews, both meats super juicy and tender and instantly put us in a summer state of mind. If it wasn't for the loud music, we would've hung out longer and had another drink, but our ears were ringing and we left to enjoy the sunshine.

If you want an experience with impeccable staff, service and good...tululahs garden is the place. After eating there after the Moshulu, I was so upset that I didn't book them. The difference of attention from staff and care was most noticeable and the food was to die for. I Agree with Jackson and the other reviews below about the Moshulu. Food mediocre, staff inattentive and lack the care for guests and definitely not the place if you want your occasion to be special. I can't believe the difference of how we were treated with a special occasion at tululahs garden a week later, vs Moshulu. I told the staff at tulalahs how awful our whole experience at Moshulu was and how I wish I would have booked them instead. I dined at Moshulu years ago for a brunch buffet and was really excited to come back. I made a very special request weeks in advance and although requests aren't guaranteed, staff wasn't prepared with any knowledge of what I asked to be written in the book. Hostess didn't seem knowledgeable about seating logistics. Our table was immediately inside the door to the left facing the parking lot which defeated our initial excitement and choice of booking this establishment, which was really stressed ahead of time for having a water view. I wasn't made aware of a dj on top of the ship so couldn't eat there with grandparents and loud music, Even though I asked lots of questions when booking. Waiter came over and told me it was an "off day" for seating rooms and an "off day" overall. We decided to remain at table but the rest of our special night was ruined because we chose this special place for the views and atmosphere and to celebrate a very special and meaningful milestone.. If you are seated in the ship on the left as we were, I would opt to spend that kind of money at an excellent restaurant with excellent food and stellar service such as Amada or any Jose Garces restaurant. At no point throughout the evening did any managerial staff stop over or check in or ask how everything was. When we got the bill the 20% gratuity was added to the check so it didn't matter how they treated us. The manager walked by us as we were leaving and didn't say a word, just headed upstairs. No goodnight, no nothing. The lack of care and professionalism made this worse. Plates stacked on table while tea was being served. Crumbs everywhere and nothing reset. I don't care too much about a reset table but in what's listed as fine dining, I was surprised. Worst $550 I have ever spent and we love spending money on great food, service and experiences. It was such a letdown. When I called the next day to speak to a manager, the Owner's daughter was very nice and promised a call back later in the day. I didn't receive a call that day, No call the next day, the day after. I called back a few times as The lack of acknowledgment first at the restaurant and now by phone, really solidified the lack of care that the manager on duty displayed that night. I finally received a phone call exactly 7 days later. Manager was rude, condescending, and placed blame on me and questioned my feelings. He scoffed at my explanation of events and only apologized for how I feel but nothing on the restaurants end. I was frustrated and questioned by someone who didn't show his face once that night but claimed he was there and claimed his staff was beyond excellent. He told me I was a waste of his time. If this was the case, why would I have called and why would I be leaving a review on yelp? I opened a yelp account years ago and I don't remember using it since years ago. The manager really could have made things so much better by being nice, respectful and at least trying to understand. He instead made fun of me, made me feel like everything was my own fault and insulted me. I would have loved to be invited back for a redo in a nicer location on the ship as I originally requested or on s day where it wasn't "off" as the server stated but now, not only will we never come back there or any sister locations in the city, we will never recommend  Moshulu or any of their sister places to our friends or any one else. I stand by Jose Garces establishments for their professionalism, food, and service. I have never been treated so poorly by someone who chose his career in the restaurant business in my life. Awful, hurtful and sad. Waste of money.

I love this place, I am a local and never been a "regular" at a bar. But the staff is so welcoming and fun I would recommend to anyone visiting or living in the city. They have drink specials everyday & Thursday $5.00 pizza night is great, but can get kinda crowded. It's a must if your in Mid-city.

The Hollister Brewing Company is the gem of Goleta. Even more so when your wife forces you out to all the shopping in the area.  They brew all their beer right here on site - so very fresh and they've got a great brew master - really tasty beers across every variety. And you can't miss with their food. Fresh delicious and reasonably priced. I in fact make the trip out from Santa Barbara frequently for this place (and pick up some light bulbs from Home Depot to justify the drive out). And for you beer drinkers - they keep a beer on a Cask keg system all the time.  A return to mid evil Europe :) so tasty ....
Great service even when it's crowded! I use the app and order online and it's always ready within 5 minutes of ordering! Easy to order before I leave my house and ready when I get there.

The place was pretty busy so I was excited. The menu looked great and as a vegetarian I had lots of choices. I ordered a flatbed sandwich with avocado and asked for egg whites. The cashier struggled with the order but finally got it.

The bad part was that it took a long time for everything. My espresso shot was cold and bitter. The sandwich tasted pretty good but was also cold and much smaller than what was pictures on the menu. Lastly I never got the side of fruit I ordered. My wife had a parfait and said it was just ok.
WAYYYY too expensive for the mediocre sushi they serve.

This is my first & probably last trip
To this location. All of the workers had an attitude. The bartender was very rude...the waitress told us we couldn't have our drinks on the floor (LIES) & the chick at the prize shop had an attitude as well. Horrible experience. :(

I purchased 3 slices and after eating the first slice and a few bites of the second slice, I noticed a small bug, I picked it up and checked it carefully, I didn't want to overreact without being completely certain. I even showed a couple of people who verified that it was a bug,  and then I found another small bug. So horrified and fighting the urge to throw up, I called the store and told them what I found, I was told to bring it back to the store, which I did. The owner was horribly rude, he tried to convince me that it was oregano, which it clearly wasn't, and me in my stupidity forgot to get a picture. He then proceeded to toss me my money back and banned me from the store, as if I would go back there.Just a horrible experience.

Edited to include the private message the owner sent me

Hi this is the owner perfect circle pizza thank you for reviewing me on yelp but couple things!first there was no bug or fly like you were pretending and get some education to tell the deference between bug or fly and Oregano and about my cleanest to the my store I guarantee man my bathroom are clean the you house not ti mention my shop you can come even close to compare to any place in Drexel hill you can even call health department and just mention my place and they will laugh at bc they know about my shop thank you again we just not you place and have good day

Making a PETCO trip I stopped in for mid day fuel! This is a must for everyone to check out! All day breakfast Vegetarian / Vegan heaven!  The Egg sandwich ~ GF bread, spinach, cheese & avacado plus side salad. So Good! Everything is fresh and cooked perfectly!  Staff friendly, Happy and very attentive!  Cool music, eclectic hipster vibe. Gem of The City!

Incredible people,  atmosphere Coffee! Luna was a gracious host. Great place especially if you are tired of the same old chain coffee/tea. Very tranquil environment. I would highly recommend a stop when in the city. Absolutely Fabulous!!

One of the best meals I have had a NOLA this year.  This new restaurant lives up to the hype and anticipation.  The marinated shrimp had beautiful complex flavors - none which overpowered the other.  I still wonder where they get bonnet peppers in Nola.  The Roasted Brussel Sprouts and roasted beets were next level. The hamachi & melon was an unexpected yet perfect pairing.  From the hostess to the bus boy the staff was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu and ingredients.  The restaurant is in a comfortable space and the crowd was energized and vibrant. I will definitely return
This is a great place for good food before going to the Riverside Theater. Besides its great quality, the food is very reasonably priced with generous portion size. I highly recommend this place.
Tried this great new spot and the food was good. Nice portion size, great gluten free options.

I love this place. The staff is incredible and the decor is amazing. We came back from the Eagles game sweaty, hot and aggravated heading to the restaurant in the back. Our server was awesome and the staff at the front desk extremely helpful and pleasant. This is not a chain hotel, this is an experience that is warm and inviting

This was the best service we've had in a very long time. With a party of 7, we know its going to be difficult to get seating snd srrvice, especially during Matdi Gras, but we were seated immediately, and I asked for a view and got that too. Steven, our waiter, was OUTSTANDING. He was very knowlegable about the menu and make suggestions for dessert. He was completely professional in his delivery of food items and graciously retrieved extra drinks and sauces for us. We'll definitely be bsck next year. Chris, the manager was also very accommodating and gracious. He stopped by our table a few times to make sure our visit was perfect. Completely pleased with the generous food portions and tasty food.  This is a must visit restaurant and nar in New Orleans. I would give 10 stars!

Went here with family while visiting in Indianapolis. The brisket was amazing! You barely had to chew it! It was the most delicious, tasty brisket I've had. Took a bite of my nephew's fried biscuit which was tasty too. Definitely a return visit when I'm in Indy again.

Tang Bistro's been on my radar ever since it first opened. A lot of Northern Chinese spots seem to have opened up recently (South Silk Road, Blossom Northern China Cuisine and Chinese Crepe). TB specializes in Xi'an cuisine.

We came on a Tuesday evening and the place was half full. The inside is quite spacious and even has a patio facing out onto 109 Street (after all, it housed Urban Diner). The menu is beautifully done and more upscale than your normal Northern Chinese spot.

- Liang-pi (cold noodles) ($7.50) - crap, I didn't realize that you had the option of getting this non-spicy, mild, medium or intense! Would love to see how "intense" it really gets. The cold noodles had a chewy, slippery bite. Comes with the usual bean sprouts, julienne cucumbers and spongy gluten. Good but I prefer Noodle Feast's version.
- Cucumber salad with garlic sauce ($6.50) - the cucumbers had a satisfyingly crunchy bite. The vinegar/garlic sauce was bright and refreshing. Would get this again.
- Spicy pig ears ($9.50) - the spicy pig ears had a tasty chili oil sauce. Great texture but the portion was pretty small for the price. CC thought it came in a "ear shaped" bowl.
- Scramble egg & tomato ($10.50) with hand pulled noodles ($2.00) - the hand pulled noodles had a great chewy toothsome bite to them and the egg & tomato sauce worked well with the noodles. The combo felt like you were eating Italian with an Asian spin to it. The egg reminded me some sort of delicious cheese. I know that sounds weird but it was good.

The dishes are a bit on the oily side of things but everything was solid. Will be back to try more dishes. 3.5 stars.

I don't know where all the negative reviews come from but this place was awesome! We got the two hour unlimited game card for $23 each and it was probably the most fun I've ever had at any arcade in my life! I played Jurassic Park, Transformers, Werewolf and House of The Dead 4 and they were so awesome. My favorite was the Werewolf one because the seat moved along with the game so it wasn't a sit game the whole time. Also, the race car games move as you drive too. I have nothing but great things to say about this place and I am so glad I got to go and experience it! Loved it! Definitely plan to go back and bring friends and family!
Another great lunch!  Signature Ribeye was outstanding, as usual!  All of the staff was attentive and professional.  I love this place!

I seriously love this place so much it hurts. The staff here was more than welcoming, the lattes were both incredible in taste and aesthetics, and the grits made this New England girl a true believer in southern cookin'.

If I lived within a 30 mile radius of this place it would be my go to spot for brunching and lunching. Also, their baked goods are unreal. I'm so upset I didn't try the goat cheese and blueberry muffins or the sweet potato, but the snickerdoodle cookie had my friends and I talking about this place for days.

Plus, it's just TOO cute and everything is local and fresh. You seriously cannot go wrong here.
Honestly the best corn bread I've ever had.  Service is excellent and freindly.  The portions are generous. The food is delicious and filling. Very reasonably priced for what you get.
Kim is the shit!!! Talk about bottomless mimosas... this is the spot damnit!  Food needed salt but everything else was perfect!!!

Came here for a work event...let me preface this by saying I didn't have to pay. Drinks were good, food was average. Service was average. We had a fun time, I would come back, but maybe not during a peak time.
The burger is blunt. I oredered Medium but I got Well done.. It has no flavor, it was so dry.

Food is delicious, service is slow. I'd give five stars but it took ten minutes for the server to come to us on a slow night (I checked the time, and yes only four tables taken not including ours) if she hadn't have been so nice it would've been more annoying but whatever.

Wow... The service here was fantastic. They took care of us from the moment we walked in until we left. Very attentive but never intrusive.

The food was yummy  too. From the starter bread to the appitizer to the entrees... Each was fantastic. My only regret was not having enough room for dessert. They looked delicious  just could do it. This way we have something to look forward to next time.

I didn't want to write a review on Abe's Place until I actually sat and had a meal in their restaurant instead of take out but I couldn't resist. To be honest the only thing I've eaten from here has been the wings and they are pretty bomb!

 Compared to other wing places I've eaten at, their wings are way bigger in size. So far I've only had the buffalo flavor but I definitely plan on trying many more.
Last minute detour into this restaurant on a late monday night was awesome. Food was delicious and plentiful. They tailored our sons dish due to allergies and he loved it!

Nice staff but very average quality Mexican food. Their fish selection consisted of Tilapia. That should give you a good indication of the level of quality. However, I took my chances, ordered the (Tilapia) fish tacos, took one bite and sent it back. This place really more or less resembles a fast food Mexican joint.

As a disclaimer, I am reviewing it as Kanu and not the new pizza joint. I actually didn't know that Kanu switched to being a pizza place until I sat down and wrote this review. I was just there two weeks ago. So, as most people point out, the place is classy but expensive....and the portions are a bit on the skimpy side. I like going during happy hour (which I don't think they are having anymore) when the drinks and some appetizers are at a discounted price. Atmosphere is trendy and fresh. My only complaint is the chairs aren't that comfortable to sit on and chat. My girl friend and I split two  appetizers and had some wine. Both appetizers were fresh and tasty. I am not going into details in describing them because I am not sure if they are even still on the menu. I am willing to give this new pizza place a shot, but I really hope they have a happy hour.

Meh.

I was not very impressed with this Wasabi location. And I will preface this by saying I have been to two other Wasabi's (the one downtown, and the one out in Town and Country) and both of those locations were pretty good. The service at this Wasabi was wonderful, so I am not complaining about service. It was the food. Just terrible. I ordered a lot of nigiri.... amaebi, ikura, maguro, sake, tataki tuna, and uni. I was really excited for the uni too. But it was AWFUL. I seriously cannot believe they would sell this to people. Did the chef even taste it? It was not 'old' or 'sitting out' for too long, just to clarify. It must have been from Maine or maybe the urchins they harvested weren't in season....I don't know what it could have been. But my taste buds do not lie. It was sour, and even bitter. Instead of being soft and smooth in texture, it was almost chewy and it was definitely firm. Blegh. Totally cockblocked as I was prepared to buy a shitton of the stuff. The other things I had were only so-so. The tuna and salmon did not have great flavor. The tuna tataki was the only redeeming piece of sushi on the entire plate. I left still hungry as I sent the uni back. They were understanding about it, but ugh. It was just awful. I am not going to bother to come back to this location if they aren't serious about ordering good quality seafood for their sushi. :(
On the bright side, Bob's called me the very next day to tell me they got fresh urchin in-stock. Totally made me rejoice because the uni from Wasabi was just that terrible!

Came her for the first time after I had been wanting to stop by for years on a Wednesday night. The place was PACKED, I think because of the gem show, but we didn't have to wait too long for a table. Unfortunately our table was right next to the front door, and it was a chilly night, so we weren't super comfortable even while wearing our jackets. Some of my review is probably a bit tainted by the fact that they were so busy, but they didn't handle the rush super well. It took awhile for someone to come take our orders, and then awhile for our food to arrive. The food didn't come all at once, but one thing at a time, which was a bit annoying when you're really hungry and just want to start eating. Also, they forgot an item from my order, so I had to wait awhile for it to arrive. I ordered the chicken vindaloo, which I expected to be spicy as vindaloo usually is, but it wasn't very spicy. I didn't find the flavor that great either, personally. Most of the Indian food I've eaten has been in the UK, so my standards may be a bit high, but I wasn't super impressed. I also had a chicken biryani that was ok but not great. Our naan was quite burnt, rendering parts of it inedible. However, the shining star of the meal was the chicken tikka masala - that may have been the best chicken tikka masala I've ever had. While I wasn't thrilled with my dish, I would definitely order the chicken tikka masala again. I also ordered a takeaway order at the same time that I placed my main, and I had to ask multiple people for it and go back to the counter in the back before I got it, after sitting and waiting for what felt like an eternity. If the chicken tikka masala wasn't so good I probably would never go back, but for that alone I would brave the crazy service just to have more

Have been here quite a few times growing up, and coming back for the holidays, I knew what to expect. It's a good restaurant by Burlington County standards, but if you've been outside of the area before and come back for the holidays, you know that this place is so overpriced and doesn't offer anything of quality. First, the decor is so outdated you feel like you've been transported back to a 90s banquet hall inside. The Christmas Eve menu was a mixture of fried food, steamed bag veggies for sides, and pastas in jar-like sauces. Among our dishes, we had the filet (40$ for a steak that wasn't prepared properly either the first or second time and was the size of a baby's fist); chicken francese (supposedly in a white wine sauce, but really just was a creamy/congealed butter sauce). This place is ok for senior citizen groups looking for a slightly-fancier alternative to a diner, but if you're going to pay the price this place charges, why not just go to Philly or NYC for quality food?
The food quality has gone down. I eat mostly at the one on 36th & Powelton. They don't have many vegan options like they use to. You leave there with buyer's remorse.

Everything here seems simultaneously full of potential yet disappointing.

The beer list is usually good, but there's only one place to read it - a dark, small chalkboard. Seems that people seated anywhere other than at one end of the bar aren't privy to that info. When I went last, it was difficult to see what price each beer was supposed to be. Happy hour prices are a vaguely advertised mystery.

The location is great. It's a spacious corner property with bike parking and lots of street parking, but the space feels haphazardly furnished, like someone threw a couple of church pews chairs into an empty hall with some tables and added a bar at one end as an afterthought. The lighting is nice for a cozy bar atmosphere, though.

They have outdoor seating and serve food, but the service is incredibly spotty. Bars shouldn't try to be restaurants if they're not interested in good food and have a way of delivering it to tables. The nachos I tried a couple of months ago were barely passable. I've been spoiled by the Cantina for too long, it would seem.

"Eehhh."

I used to consider Penang to be one of my favorite restaurants. Up until two months ago, my partner and I ate there at least twice a month, frequently taking friends who'd never tried Malaysian food and and who weren't quite sure what to order. We begin every meal with the roti canai appetizer, which is wonderful, and we were attempting to try every entree on the menu. The last time that we went, however, we didn't have such a good time. We were starving, and we were eager to have a good meal. When we entered the restaurant, the young woman behind the counter asked us if we were there for the tasting party, and we told her that no, we just wanted dinner. She kept recommending it, and we finally said that we would give it a try. We were asked to pay up front (an anomoly) before she took us to a section of the restaurant that was separate from the rest, and seated us. We sat there hungrily for more than 20 minutes without being offered food or told about food. Whoever was running the tasting party ran it like a hot mess. The young woman who appeared to be in charge (not one of the regular staff) ran back and forth talking to people that she appeared to know. We finally decided to leave, so we got up and asked the hostess for our money back. She asked us if we wanted to sit down at a regular table and order, but the restaurant was much busier than when we first arrived, so I knew it would be at least another 20 minutes before we saw any food. I firmly said no, and we left. It was an extremely disappointing experience, and I'll hesitate to go back again. It's a shame that such a crappy experience has soured me toward such a good restaurant.

I always enjoy going here. The sandwiches are great, and the staff was very helpful. I got the Thanksgiving sandwich and the combination of ingredients was really delicious. I will definitely come back.

The worst hookah i've ever had 
And you cant tell the different from the morrocan tea and the water they give you which is just tap water and the charge you for it

I first came here back in February, when they hosted my friend's art show. They were so sweet and accommodating - at the time I was too broke to be eating out or even buying coffee, and they didn't give me a hard time for sitting in there for ages without ordering anything. (I make sure to tip extra now, to make up for my first visit...) I went back yesterday for the first time, and was struck anew by how much I loved the atmosphere - the art, the coziness, the friendly baristas. And this time I found out how good their food and coffee are! Their bagel sandwiches are delicious and will leave you absolutely stuffed, and I disagree with the reviewer who said their coffee was over-roasted. Their iced coffee, at any rate, was perfect and not nearly as acidic and bitter as, say, Starbucks'. I wish this place weren't so far out of my way, because I'd come here every day if I could.

I had a pretty good experience here last week. Came in with a friend for dinner on Tuesday night and we were somewhat in a rush. The wait to sit down was 10 minutes but we didn't want to wait for that so we sat at the bar which was empty. We waited at least 5 minutes for someone to come over and had to ask to see a menu so we could quickly place an order. I havent been to olive garden in a year and at first glance of the menu I thought the entrees looked a little over priced. To my surprise we also got a choice of soup or salad and we get unlimited breadsticks. The soup and salad is actually a pretty large portion. I ordered lasagna and took my leftovers home. I had a full size meal leftover. 
Overall olive garden was clean, the employees were nice, but in no rush.

The food was amazing!! Our service was pretty slow (there was a moment where we thought our server had forgotten about us, it took him 20 minutes to bring our drinks out), but the restaurant was extremely clean and everything we had was delicious!
The worst Chinese restaurant I've ever eaten in Tucson. Their chow fun had more veggie than noodle. The cabbage piece were so thick, didn't bother to slice it. Big couple of chunks. Ugh. No thank.

The Grand Isle was the perfect place to end my trip in New Orleans. The service and food were wonderful! 

My friends and I started out with the Crab Dip and the Crawfish Beignets. I absolutely loved both! The Crab Dip was piping hot and accompanied by crispy bread while the Crawfish Beignets were so flavorful and unique! 

After trying these two amazing appetizers I knew I had to order more! Thus, I also ordered the Chargrilled Oysters which were out of this world!! The oysters were smoky but the Parmesan cheese on top brought the perfect contrast! 

For my main dish I ordered the Creole crawfish pasta with a side of the Smoke Fried Oysters. What can I say? I'm a hungry girl! The Creole Crawfish Pasta was creamy and yummy! The Smoke Fried Oysters were crunchy and the remoulade sauce was the perfect touch! 

Overall, my food palette loved this restaurant! Thank you for having us!

The fried pickles were great as they were spears and not chips.i went on a Saturday and the place was dead. So the atmosphere wasn't great. As a former restaurant owner and having a spouse who has been in restaurant Mngt for 30 years, I didn't like that the Owner was drinking and working behind the bar. In fact, if anyone from the "alcohol" commission saw that, they might have an issue . Very unprofessional. The two female bartenders were very attentive but would like to see their work when The was more than one person at the bar.

My parents recently moved to Newtown so they received a coupon for free dozen bagels from Newtown Bagel Co. Since my parents always have a bagel and coffee for breakfast, I went with my mom to pick up some bagels for them while I was visiting. We felt bad asking for just the free bagels, so we asked for 2 dozens and picked up 2 tubs of cream cheese as well.  

There was no one in the shop as we went in at around 1:30 pm and they close at 2 pm on most days.  We were greeted by a gentleman, but he went into the back as we were picking out the cream cheese and a younger girl helped us with the bagels.  

I felt a bit awkward because as soon as I told the employee that we had a coupon for a free dozen and wanted to get a total of 2 dozens, she said they are pretty low on bagels and asked if we wanted to come back tomorrow and said they probably only have about 2 dozens left (which may have been true if she counted just the ones that were in the bins... but there were about another 5 dozens prepacked on their countertop.)  I knew most bagel shops close early and expected to have a less of a selection available to us, but I didn't expect her to ask me if we wanted to come back another day.  Maybe she was just being considerate... because she wanted us to have more to choose from?  But I just felt that wasn't the thing to say to customers that made their first trip there (with a coupon which made me feel a bit more uncomfortable). She must have known it was our first time there because only first time customers can use the coupon.  

Anyways, I told her that we would see what they have left and go from there... and we were able to pick out the 2 dozen bagels and they still had about another dozen or so left in the bins alone.  I was thinking maybe she said that because they would have to reject other customers that came in after us if they ran out, but they were going to close very soon and they still had a good amount of bagels left.

I wanted to see if she would offer to cut the bagels for me... since throwing them into a bagel cutter is way less work than me sitting at home and cutting 24 or so bagels, but unfortunately she didn't offer and I didn't ask since I just felt a little bit uncomfortable there.  Afterwards when I mentioned this to my mom she said maybe they don't have a slicer... which.... I doubt, but if that's the case I apologize for mentioning this at all.  The employee did offer to give us some freezer bags though, which was nice of her.

As for the bagels, I enjoyed the bagels... they tasted just fine.  I read some other reviews and some people said they were too light and didn't fill them up... and I can see why they say that, but I don't mind because I actually don't mind a lighter bagel.

I would go back and grab some more bagels if my parents needed some when I'm in town, but my first experience wasn't exactly what I expected.

Amazing experience!!! First of all our server Nick was superb! My fianc√© and I loved having him as our waiter - super knowledgeable about the menu, so nice & when we did the whiskey tasting & told him to pick his favs...he did not disappoint! Would go back again and probably request to be seated at a table Nick is serving because he was that awesome. 

And the foooood!!! We did the chef's tasting where we got to pick 3 starters, 2 entrees, 1 side, and a dessert that is portioned for two for $45 pp and WOW. Everything was the bomb - my fav was the smoked ribs and the mussels (the meatiest mussels we've had). We also had the octopus (delish), the burrata (creamy), the hanger steak (cooked to perfection), the crawfish Mac & cheese (tasty), and the ricotta dessert balls - HEAVEN! 

Had to share a lengthy review because we already can't wait to go back!! Highly recommend.

This place has great food. I absolutely crave their thick juicy burger. Fries are yummy. Their traditional wings are some of the best in west county St Louis. Their bbq ribs are delicious. Highly recommend this place. And they were super fast delivering when ordering takeout! I love supporting our neighborhood restaurant. They also have a tv and heaters outside which is perfect COVID safe place to watch the games

Best bacon I've had, great burger - very yummy food all around 
Great spot and worth pulling off the interstate for

Flavorful, healthy, classic southwestern breakfast. Hash browns were freshly made and had just the right kinda chili-enhanced snap. Eggs, coffee like you'd expect it. (Coffee was slightly better than the classic diner fare). 

Lovely setting. Good service. Nice price. 

Great neighborhood joint. Wish we had a place like this in Skinker-Debaliviere.

I like the decor, love the breakfast and the coffee is top notch.  When i'm feeling nostalgic about the 90's grunge days, this is my nashville go to spot and it gives me a little time to ponder what ever happened to that Afghan Whigs CD I let my roomie borrow.

Great place! The atmosphere for a Monday night was really nice! Lots of menu items that all sounded delicious. I love the local brews list (but a bit pricey...$10 for a Green Bench IPA!?). I had the Belly Up burger which was really really good. The fries are crunchy, the pork belly is always a great alternative to bacon. But the egg, THE EGG! Awesome place to go after work. Especially for the specials ($6 for a $12 burger!) 
Definitely going to be a regular!

This place brews its own beer, but it's more like Miller Lite than the craft beer you can get at a lot of places in Indy. My porter was a bit flat and flavorless. Rock Bottom brews stronger, more full-bodied and flavorful beer.

The food isn't too bad--we had an appetizer pizza that boasted basil, tomatoes and sausage, but the latter was M.I.A. The chicken lettuce wraps could have benefited from more finely chopped chicken. 

This place isn't all bad; the hefeweizen is pretty good. So are the big screens above the bar, if you're going to watch a game.
Found this today. Great place with well made traditional meat pies. Give them a try!  Owner was extremely nice, also.

I've found a new fave place to become addicted to!!! Everything is so fresh and the restaurant looks clean. A huge plus!! There's endless combination possibilities for building your bowl and burrito. I got noodles as my bowl base and loaded up with spicy tofu and shrimp tempura. The sauces are where it's at!! As a drink, I got a freshly cracked coconut. So refreshing. I will be back

Update - CLOSED? - Went on Oct 14, 2017.  Lights out, door locked.  No "closed" sign, but no one in the store.  Called them three times on Oct 28, no answer.

-----  (ordered review) -----

My daughter was attending a middle-school fund raiser at a nearby Applebee's, so my son and I had to find a way to burn an hour of time.  I punched "bagels" into Yelp, and Brooklyn Bagels caught my eye.

I grew up in Brooklyn, so the phrase "Brooklyn Bagels" has a very specific, almost sacred meaning to me.  Sure, I appreciate the appeal for any bagel restaurant to apply "Brooklyn" to their name - it's not legally-defined, and it improves business.

This place is the real deal.  I don't know exactly what makes bagels from Brooklyn so special, but out of all the bagel restaurants I've been to in Southampton / Willow Grove / Warminster / Hatboro / Horsham / Huntingdon Valley area, only this place nailed it.  The texture and flavor are perfect.  The New York-style menu spans much of the room.  The owner (I presume he was the owner) is friendly, and the sandwiches are excellent.

The ambiance isn't great, and seating is limited - but from what I recall of similar places in Brooklyn, that too is authentic.  

I strongly recommend Brooklyn Bagels, and as you drive there, make a point of sticking your hand out the car window and flipping off any "Manhattan Bagel" franchises you pass on the way.

The bacon, egg and cheese on a glazed doughnut was nothing short of amazing. I am a fan of savory, sweet dishes and it was perfection. I went back the next day for another. 

They have a cheeseburger on a glazed doughnut, but I told myself that I wouldn't try it until I lost 5 of the 15 lbs. that I need to shed. That doughnut burger is surely something I am willing to work toward. That's going to be one hell of a cheat/reward meal.

We recently moved to the area and have gone here to eat/drink about 6 times. The Shrimp po boy is delicious and the portions are great! 
 Although I have noticed that the staff is more concerned about not working/hanging out with each other than actually doing their jobs. 

Our last visit there was an absolute nightmare. We were seated but never waited on. After about 15 minutes I got up and went to the girl who sat us and asked who our waitress was. We finally got waited on and received our food. Although I have had the Shrimp Po boy at least 3 times prior, this time it was terrible. I have worked in the food industry for 11 years and could tell specifically that the oil desperately needed to be changed in the fryer. When this isn't done frequently it causes the food to taste burnt. 

They were not very busy and about 5-6 of their employees were all sitting outside next to the bar just chilling while we received terrible service and food. 

I've read some of the other reviews and apparently this happens frequently. 

If they could get their staff in order this place would be 4-5 stars.
Great breakfast! Great service. Unique menu. More than just your normal breakfast items.....they step "outside the box."  We had a group of 8 and everyone enjoyed their meal.

My in-laws treated me to lunch here and what a treat it was! I had a Mediterranean burger, a lamb and beef blend, it was soooo scrumptious my spouse and I came back a few days later, we just had to have another before we went back home. It's an engaging decor with lots of memorabilia, and a very friendly staff even though the place was totally packed when we were there.  Thanks Mom and Dad G.!

This is the most humiliating place I have ever eaten. Hamburger and wings were burnt Chrispy , yes they served it ! They gave me back my hamburger with about a 8 inch hair in it .  I'M DONE FOR LIFE.....  YOU MAY AS WELL EAT WITH DOGS !!!  Their filthy .

So good, we went back the next night too! Fantastic seafood, great service, and live music too. The shrimp, oysters and scallops are all phenomenal. The coconut rice is a family fave. There's a lovely outside seating area, but we love being inside near the music. We saw two different acts and both were really good. This has quickly become our fave restaurant on Treasure Island! We'll definitely see you next time!

Love it, Love it, Love it.
Been there a couple of times.  I live in Carson City and will make the drive just to go to the Depot.  The food has been flavorful and fresh.  The onion rings are delicious.  The beer is very tasty.  Prices are reasonable for the quality you are getting.  I will be going back and telling all of Carson City how great it is.

Not bad for a chain restaurant in a train station.  The food came out quickly and no one really bothered us while we killed time waiting for the train.  There was a little bit of a fruit fly issue though, but that may have been a fluke.

Came in for dinner and it was our first visit here. Walked in and was welcomed right away and the place was very neat and cool decor. The place was busy. The menu had a lot of options and we got the wings, philly, chips n salsa which was amazing. Our server Molly was very sweet and on top of things. Very pleased with our first time and we will definitely be back again and again.

The food, drinks and service were sub-par. Upon ordering out drink, we were told that we had to order food as well which was not part of our plan and was not something that was mentioned prior to us being seated.
the food is pretty good, and they also have good beers. the popcorn that comes with the Bourbon flight is amazing!

If you're visiting Santa Barbara, you have to eat at Brophy (Brothers). A pirate tends bar downstairs, for chris'sakes. Go raw for as many courses as you can stand while you sit and watch a sunset fade into the horizon behind the marina. Wait longer for a seat on the upstairs patio unless you like sitting at the busy bar. Key advice: Don't get too plastered at The Endless Summer while you're waiting for a table. You might forget your keys at the hostess stand.

Many positives...beginning with easy, ample and FREE parking behind the restaurant!  Our order was taken promptly and the staff quickly advised us about the menu in regard to vegetarian and gluten free items.  Amazing iced-tea (unsweet tea mixed with their yummy housemade strawberry lemonade).  I enjoyed one of the best salads ever...the Pepper Patch with an amazing dressing, roasted jalape√±o vinaigrette.  The side of roasted vegetables was tasty!  Our son often orders quesadillas when we eat out and he rated the Veggie Quesadilla at Urban Cookhouse as topnotch!  The crowning glory...the strawberry lemonade milkshakes.  We enjoyed dining on the outdoor patio in the shade.  The staff was excellent, attentive, helpful and friendly.  We will be dining here again!  Great place for lunch, afternoon snack or dinner!

The first time I came here I just got bagels and this morning we got breakfast sandwiches. I was impressed with how much filling there was. It was tasty and filling. I had bacon, egg, and cheese, and my boyfriend had scrapple.  However, after trying the bagels on two different occasions I have to admit they are just not that good. They don't have the right texture. They are almost crumbly and fall apart as you are eating them. They seem more like bread. It's slightly chaotic inside and can be confusing to order. I would come back for a breakfast sandwich or to try some of their other breakfast selections since they are local. I would not order bagels from them, as I much prefer the bagels from another place.

Probably one of the better restaurants at Peppermill. 

Fresh and tasty sushi, good bread, decent service, and fair prices (given that they are serving quality sushi in Nevada). Plus, the theme is pretty legit. You can practically swim around with the whales and bum around with the crustaceans in this place. 

I just hate when you order a drink and the waiter says "Uhhhhh errrrr I have to bring it in from the oustide. May take longer." ...JUST BRING ME MY A-A-A-A-AL-ALC-OHOL!!!!
BK is trying to improve customer service. .. I was asked my name to "better serve" me. Whopper not hot...barely warm :(
I aways enjoy my meals here. They have a wonderful staff and my coffee cup never has a chance to get low.

Positives- Nice gluten-free menu options as well as some better-than-average pub food selections. Nice local beer selection as well.

Negatives- I have been here a few times with friends and I don't think I'll go back. Not because of the food or the service but because everything takes so long. I've never left this place, in and out, in under 4 hours. Takes FOREVER to get seated and even longer to get food. I value my time too much to give this place another shot. I think they must tell everyone that walks in the wait is about 40 minutes.
It was really a great meal and authentic.  The staff was attentive and friendly and it was a good atmosphere.   Really regret not trying specialty gelato dessert but seemed reasonable at the time.

Had pretzels nuggets which were super pretzels with a tasteless white cheese sauce.  Had the typical salty super pretzel saltiness.   Had PJs Stingers.  Over whelmed with salt.  Teaspoon of oil at bottom of wax filled plastic basket.   Cheese steak egg rolls nothing to write home about but again salty.  Confirmed my ongoing critique that this place is not the place to eat.  Service good.  Atmosphere good.  Beer selection hearty.
Love it!!!! Drinks amazing with real fruit juice.  Food amazing!  My favorite on the gulf coast.

65 degrees in February is quite unexpected in Philly but the perfect opportunity to explore this city. Walking through Center City, I came across this unique French bakery offering a range of pastries from croissants to flourless chocolate cake. Being a pastry lover, it was difficult to resist adding another bakery to the list of places that I have been to but  I am glad I took the chance to try their pastries. The employees were very kind and helped me select a few pastries that met my dietary restrictions.

The taste of the pastries was between 3.5 or 4 out of 5 while the customer service was 5/5. I look forward to stopping by again to try other pastries from their selection.

Delicious brunch food, and even better service. The French Toast is soaked overnight, and the potatoes come with some kind of delicious cheesy sauce. 

We came here on a Friday for brunch, so the place was pretty empty. Only a few tables had filled by the time we left. 

If you are heading to the WWII museum and looking for great service, good food and reasonable prices, give it a shot!

What a great place. I was staying at the Hilton next door and this place became my home away from home. Assistant GM was absolutely the friendliest reception I have had in a long time. Wish this place was in Phoenix so it could be my new Cheers. Wow I felt like I was home hanging out here. If you're in downtown Tampa you MUST MUST MUST stop by here for a drink and some laughs.
Great location, tasty food, staff was great.  Reasonable prices. Good music.  Wide variety on menu.

LOVED this place when it was Tijuana Flats - used to go there at least once a week and was so excited when I heard they would be reopening under a different name. Then they kept pushing back the opening, first the end of January, then sometime February, then late February, and finally March 9th (even though they said they would be open March 8th when called).

Even though it's under the same management with the same staff with similar food, it just isn't the same. For one thing, they've given the place an "upscale" makeover, complete with Apple computers as registers and taken simple things like napkin dispensers off the tables. If you were a fan of the cheesy double stack tacos, you're out of luck - they must have been a Tijuana Flats-only item.

My husband and I ordered our food and 20 minutes later, we were still waiting. Someone came over and asked our name because apparently the order never went through (so much for fancy technology). Then 10 minutes later, our order came out but it wasn't entirely correct. When we pointed this out, all we got was a blank stare. No one ever apologized for the wait or the mistake in the order. The food itself was just ok, but that could be because they threw it together in a hurry. All in all, it was a pretty disappointing experience after waiting two months for the reopening.

Best local spot in town. Amazing wait staff and the the manager Brandy will go above and beyond to make sure you have a amazing meal and experience! She adds a personal touch to every trip that makes you feel welcome. Best burgers, beer and Brandy in town!!!

I stopped in here on my way up to Northern California and went on a roller coaster of thoughts with this place.  First, when I walked up and saw the open air cafe I was blown away by how cool this placed look and was stoked to see there was a line b/c that generally means that you are in store for a treat when locals take the time to wait for fare.  

Then after waiting in line for a while it occurred to me that maybe the line was due to the comically slow service.  I waited about 10 minutes in a line of about 6 people before putting my order in.  I considered a few times going somewhere else, but decided I should wait it out.

Finally, I had arrived and was able to place my order.  I got an Ethiopian blend coffee and their extra thick sourdough toast with almond butter.  Both were totally worth the wait.  The coffee was a perfect complement to the wonderfully sour toast.

Long story short, this place is definitely worth the trip, but don't plan on getting in and out quickly.
Food was decent but a little pricy for what it was. We could have spent $20 more and ate next door at Delicia!  (Which is fabulous if you haven't been!!)
In the middle of the French quarter this restaurant is a bit of a tourist trap; specialized in oysters I was a bit disappointed in my dozen natural ones - fresh tastes different...

As I'm not opposed to eating any meal by myself, I took the opportunity to try Fare for brunch on a beautiful Saturday morning. The outdoor seating area is delightful and quite spacious for downtown Philly. My puggle and I sat comfortably on a bench (her underneath on the floor) and were immediately served our own water (hers in a doggy bowl). We enjoyed a relaxed brunch with well balanced  & free flowing coffee and a friendly (and cute) server. The eggs florentine was tasty and the perfect size. They seem to chose healthier options here like wheat toast and sweet potatoes which I love. We will definitely return possibly for wine because I LOVE wine!

The gelato here is to die for! They make it from fresh ingredients and you can truly tell. My boyfriend and I come here once a week just to have gelato and espresso. Their lattes and cappuccinos are also fantastic. You can get gelato in your latte and that is their signature item! The service is always fantastic and the prices are reasonable. You can get three scoops in a small and their flavor choices are vast. The price is about $5 which is reasonable since they pile the gelato as much as they can. I highly recommend the Mediterranean salted carmel, the amaretto chocolate chip and the amarena cherry. Those three flavors together are a tasty combo. Although the hazelnut, coconut, baileys and wedding cake are also amazing. Too many to name so come here for the best gelato in town and see for yourself.

I have been to Katie's Pizzeria, so I had high hopes for Katie's Pizza & Pasta and it did not disappoint! We were quickly seated at the most perfect table for two outside, next to the little garden. Both Ted and Katie were nice enough to stop by and chat, even giving us a few peppers from the garden. 

I had the Asparagus Pizza, which was delicious. The crust is a bit chewy, in the best way possible. My boyfriend had the Basil Tagliatelle and loved every bite. I recommend the Sgroppino to drink. They are quick to serve, but it would be nice to get a little fresh bread and OO while ya wait or with the pasta, just in case there is left over sauce :)

I loved the artichoke salad from KP and was disappointed to see it was a whopping $14. The pizzas aren't terribly large, but had to enlist some help to finish it. So if you want to share a pizza, you might need a salad or a small plate as well. Katie's isn't easy on the pocket book, but it's great for a treat!
Stumbled by this location by accident picking up Chinese food next door. Good to know we now have a Popeyes within [somewhat] driving distance whenever the craving kicks in.
Love this place, good portions, good prices.  Quiet atmosphere.  Cooked to order food!!

This is a convenient, clean place for local residents to get a decent, if unremarkable, meal.  The menu is "Midwest" with lots of comfort food and little variety when it comes to low fat or health conscious items.  The remodeled dining room is complemented by a nice bar and reasonably priced drinks.  The staff is friendly and the kitchen is consistent.  If you're looking for a nicer meal without a lot of pretentiousness, you could do a lot worse.  Just don't expect a memorable culinary experience.

Good music, decent beers, but what really got me was the people there. Not super friendly and fairly clicky. I know that this is not the establishments fault but its who hangs out there. I was by myself but if I went back with a group of friends this might be a cool spot to grab some drinks.

Visiting St. Louis abs stumbled upon this absolute gem! Had to eat at the bar as it was packed on a Saturday night but the bartender made it worthwhile. Such excellent service! The food was unbelievably fresh and such unique pairings of flavors really made it special.  I ordered the Black Garlic Butter Pizza abd was not disappointed! Each flavor stood out with the lemon and honey making it extra special. The videos of Katie cooking on the big screen made it easy to see why this food is so very special. I only wish I could get this quality in Los Angeles! Thanks for making it a special night! 100% would recommend!

Whenever I know I'll be waiting a long time, I like to use that time to write a review ... and given the experience I've had so far this evening, I'm sure I have some time. 

We had a large party, so some delays are reasonable and to be expected. What's not expected:

1. Half hour for drinks
2. 45 minutes until the bread baskets showed up.
3. Did I mention we didn't see menus for twenty minutes after sitting down?
4. An hour and forty minutes into the show we had our food.
5. We sat outside, which was alright until they turned the lights out on us shortly after receiving our food ... luckily there was a flood light halfway down the side of the building to kinda light part of our end of the table, feel sorry for the assholes at the other end.
6. Multiple people ordered multiple drinks that never showed, some ordered appetizers that never showed.

I had the chicken parm and it tasted pretty bad. For comparison Fazoli's has better chicken parm and I can't eat that garbage without shitting myself. The chicken tasted like it had been left in the deep fryer too long and the kitchen staff hadn't changed the oil in quite some time.
Food is really delicious and not that expensive,server( giovanna)very attentive and friendly,definitely my weekly hangout.

I adore The Lemon Bar! The staff is very friendly!. My mom had the The Spring chicken salad sandwich with a house salad and I had the Turkey avocado melt with a house salad and a lavender lemonade. The food was SO good and the lavender lemonade was a dream. I bring all of my out of town guests here
Good barbecue. Been here a few times, I always get the pulled pork with spicy collard greens. The cheesy spinach is really good. I'd definitely come back

We got the fish tacos and chowder. It was excellent. The service was even better. I have a cilantro intolerance and the chef went out of his way to make the tacos cilantro free. He actually made up a completely separate and on the fly Pico to go on top of the tacos. And it was amazing. I highly recommend this place.
