The vibe is awesome, the food is great, and I have never been to a resturant where they tried to accommodate my cilantro distaste like this!

Wonderful option for healthier yet tasty pizzas. Their pizzas are like flat bread style and for those who are gluten sensitive, then this is your place.  We had a gluten free pizza, and wanted something different. We had prociutto, fig spread and cheese on our pizza. It was very tasty.  A personal pizza is a good size for two people so that you can save room for their amazing nutella dessert pizza. Their prices are even better when you go on creative loafing and get a gift certificate there. Can you believe our bill came out to 1.50. Yes I swear, it was awesome.
Parking is not the greatest in Downtown Tampa. I really don't like driving around the area, but you will end up paying a small price on the meter.  
You can sit outside and enjoy fresh air since the outside is mostly shaded, as well as bring your dog. 
It was definitely a great afternoon. Would be back again. This is my first try at this location, but I have been to the Westchase location which is even nicer. But they both are as equally tasty.

Super disappointed and frustrated with the service at this place. I began ordering and the lady, while leaning over as if to fall asleep on the counter, rudely interrupted to let me know everything was pre-made. It was as if I literally pulled her out of her nap. I was excited about trying this place but abruptly left after the miserable service. Get another job lady, maybe where you can sleep on the job for real.

Don't recommend their "raw" sushi. It looks old like its been sitting in the refrigerator to long & it's not very nice looking "cuts" of fish. Gross! I recommend going to their S. Virginia location. Much nicer sushi!!! If your planning on ordering California Rolls this place is ok.
Not impressed at all over priced terrible service and just doesn't taste good. I love pizza and was excited to try this place but it was a huge disappointment
The best coffee in NOLA...unpretentious, friendly and wonderful. So glad to give these wonderful people our business.
Love this place!  Great for GF diners and the non GFs can enjoy flatbread and beer.  My new go-to in Conshy after Plymouth Meeting errands.

Man! I tell you. This place is awesome. The stacked nachos are off the chain!!!! Try it and you will see. The menu is small, but each of the foods are an amazing meal. Feels like bar rescue, simple menu but delicious. They do have a daily menu on the side. On a blue paper. That usually has something nifty. 

Let's talk about the beers.  So, this place has a lot of beer. They don't have the "mainstream" beers per s√©. But what they do have is an amazing selection. One that would make you lose it. They do have their version of Blue moon or shock top. DON'T get that. Tastes like bitter old lemonade. Everything else is pretty good. They will have some private beers. Again, no buds or millers etc... 

But between the food and the beers, I highly recommend this place. Service is great too!
The food speaks for itself!!  The flavor and presentation were the best I've had for Mediterranean food!  The real deal!

I've patronized the Night Kitchen for many years and have always loved everything I've bought there.  Until this time.  I bought a lovely looking cherry tart for $22, an average Night Kitchen price.  Usually things are worth every penny you spend, but this time the tart was all crust with hardly any cherry filling.  I was SO disappointed.  I will no longer assume that everything sold there is top quality.  So sorry.

Tonight I had most wonderful experience I've had in a long time. the staff was polished , prompt, professional clean and proud of their establishment. i ordered the seafood trio. the salmon was perfect in execution. crisp sear buttery in the center i never knew salmon could taste so delicious. tandori sauce for the scallops was exquisite, perfect flavor. shrimp was well seasoned yet not over done . my drink was an old fashioned spirit forward with a healthy pour just how it should be. and the most wonderful risotto. the panna cotta was divine, Alex their pastry chef is a hidden talent in this gem of a restaurant her talents are reason to go back. Walter the server was precise in his service, well done to all those who made my night. thank you thank you thank you
Best bacon I've EVER had. It's sweet, thick & delicious. Best bloody Mary's also! Highly recommend this place for breakfast.

After making a star appearance on dirty dining (and being shut down), you would think the owners would make more of an effort to provide good service and a clean environment...think again.  Tried to call for carryout, the young woman who answered the phone asked me to repeat myself six times, and then asked me if the Phoenix roll was cooked or not???  Apparently, the employees do not have responsibility for knowing the menu. Nice job management!  Your training program is clearly paying off.  I guess we'll call for delivery instead.  I wonder what restaurant is going to lease that space after Hiro's goes out of business (again) in the near future.

- Another lost customer

This place is absolutely fabulous.  The food is wonderful. Freshly cooked in a test kitchen and Dave the executive chef/manager is very knowledgeable in his craft. This place obviously takes pride in what they do and it demonstrates in the flavor and presentation. Will definitely come back and would recommend to anyone!

Let me just preface this with saying I've frequented Coopers Hawk for at least two years now, but the experience I had the other night was just especially wonderful making me feel as though I needed to leave a review. Not only was my server Michael hilarious, he was extremely helpful and informative about many of the items on the menu making the choosing process so much better. He made me feel completely welcomed making the whole evening just that much better. Best burger melt I've had in forever, seriously! 

Thank you Michael!!

I'll start off by saying DO NOT get the rice pudding. Disgusting! I took one bite and did not taste at all like it was supposed to. Save your money and maybe try another dessert. 

Butter chicken was okay, again, not what it usually tastes like but still not bad. Comes with plain white rice. Vegetable samosas were the most decent thing I got, good filling and nice and crispy.
Just really good food. The employees were very friendly and would definitely go back there on my next trip to philly.

Smoked sausage had such an amazing flavor, in addition the various mustards was a tasty combination . Beer mocha stout was dark, creamy , rich . Paired nicely with the sausage. Potato pancakes were good only a slight to moist and greasy. The sour cream schnitzel was delicious. I love the crispy breading of the veal. The spatzle was bland and not worth mentioning. The potato pancakes Dipped in sour cream or applesauce is the best combination. The apple strudel capped off the meal. It was warm, comforting, and I loved the nutty flavor.
The pizza was okay, but the place was dirty (even though it was after the lunch rush) and the staff was unfriendly and unhelpful. There are better pizza options in the area.
Pleasant atmosphere, great food, and fantastic beer selection! Really enjoyed the friendly waitresses, especially ours, Ashley. She made the night fun! Plan on visiting again!!!!!!

Not a bad place -- good for something different if you get tired of the usual sandwich and chips for lunch.

I've only gone here maybe three times and have always had the Chicken Shawarma -- a full portion is more than enough food for lunch. Tender, juicy, and flavorful.

Service is OK but a little on the sluggish side.

I've never eaten in but the seating area appears to be decent. There's also a special room in back with Middle Eastern-style seating.... I've only glimpsed it when waiting on my order but it might be worth trying out sometime if you're out with a group.

There appears to be seating available outside when the weather is nice, but I'm not 100% sure about that as I've only gone here in the dead of winter.

Nice change of pace -- I'll be back and will have to sample some of their other menu items.

My husband and I came to Bacar to celebrate our honeymoon! We wanted to have some fine dining so we chose Angel Oak! Let me start off by saying that the outside seating has such a great and chill ambience. It's definitely a place to get dressed up for! The server brought us some prosecco to start off our celebration, which was very sweet. We ordered the spicy tuna on crispy rice, French onion soup, Caesar salad, and NY Steak! Everything was on point and delish! The Caesar salad was made with anchovies in the dressing and even tho I don't like the taste of anchovies, the salad was light and refreshing! The creme br√ªl√©e dessert was the best I've ever had! Highly recommend! The one negative thing I have to add is that the water tasted like dirt. Another table complained about the same thing! If that's a ruse for us to order bottled water, it worked.
Good, quick burger with no real frills. If you get everything on it - which is good but sloppy... Grab some extra napkins.

I want to give this place a 5 so bad, but we came during an odd time (half of their location was under construction).
We had made reservations and were seated in an odd room. 
It was very spacious, but not many tables so it was an odd feeling sitting in this room. 
BUT, the service was amazing and the oysters are a MUST TRY! They were like butter. So very smooth. 

Plus, they have a great happy hour to check out when you're in the area!

Went here for lunch on a weekday.

Service: Very friendly waitress and server. Seemed slightly understaffed when more people started trickling in for lunch but were never rude and reasonably fast. 

Space:
Seems like it's in an old KFC or some other fast food place? They still have the old drive in window up although I'm still not sure if they're using it or not...small space when the rush starts coming in. About 8-9 seats at the bar max, three 4-6 person tables and around 5-6 extra seats against one of the walls. Was able to grab a table but a group behind us had to wait a while for another. They do treat it like a full service restaurant though, waiter/ess has to seat you so no going to grab a seat yourself. 

Food: I had half the fried chicken, she had the chicken po boy, also split spiced tots. Fried chicken was very fresh. Breading is thick, very interesting spicy and sweet flavor which I really liked. They have a couple table sauces which go well with the flavor. She said chicken po boy was great. Spiced tots were unique with great flavor but my mouth was a little overwhelmed by all the chicken. I had a Southern Peach. Drink was well mixed, they don't skimp on the liquor. 

Would go back again, might try some fried nugz next time.
Very impressed with the quality of meats and friendliness of staff.  The Corner Butcher is a jewel in Fenton.

Did a reservation and got in at the exact time. Restaurant looks a lot bigger on the inside than the outside. I liked the temperature in the restaurant. Staff and waitress were nice. Liked that the food came out pretty fast. Price for seafood was reasonable. They didn't charge us gratuity for a party of six. My only cons were the oyster. Pricey for the quantity and quality for the oyster. Oyster's weren't soaked/rinsed long enough to get rid of all of the sand/dirt. The steamed oyster were so shrunk, they barely had any meat left. $16 for a dozen shrunk oyster is way to overpriced.

The worst Wendy's in the United States. The service is slow and unprofessional. The fries no matter when you go , are cold and hard. The sandwiches for some reason don't taste like they should. This place needs to be revamped. Wendy's is normally good, not this one. Just stay away

Oh my where do I begin? Being accosted at the front entry & grilled as to where I'm from if I live here have I been here etc, they are trying to pull pages from disneys play book but they fall abysmally short!
Now to the food-good thing they have the exquisite fish & famous fish tank to distract you. My fish tacos as well as being appetizer portion were dry fish, little cabbage, tiny amount of sauce-had to ask 2 people for extra sauce-not from our waiter who was nowhere to be seen-with only 2 other tables-the wine glass portion was 3 oz at most at $9/glass-guess they have to pay for the fish. No ketchup offered or available for the sweet potato fries that were cross cut frozen I really can't go on except to again say thank goodness for the fish tank that was definitely the star

I have been a long time patron of Ghini's  and it seems to get better with age. I can always count on Ghinis to have the freshest most delicious food that I know is always made with the utmost attention to detail. My favorite is that Caesar salad with blackened chicken. The salad is fresh and the chicken always so tender and flavorful but the dressing is like nothing else!!!! Easily my favorite restaurant in tucson and by far the best brunch spot of all time! You are missing out if you don't try it.

The traditional breakfast is always great here, but I honestly believe that one of the best Huevos Rancheros breakfasts I've EVER had is from here. The only thing I personally do not like is that they serve potatoes instead of traditional hash browns. But really, that's more of a personal preference. 

Their orange juice is not fresh squeezed, like they said it was. But only Jack, my husband, is super picky about fresh squeezed, not-from-concentrate juice. Highly recommended!

I have come here for my last 3 birthdays,  wouldn't miss another one. Love this place, really good price for the quality of sushi. One of the top 2 places in Reno to get all you can eat. 
Shout out to Riley!!!! Best server

Had the World's Fair burger with sweet potato fries and ate every last bite, even though I wasn't that hungry. The fries were just the right level of crispy, and that jalapeno cheese sauce was to die for.

Also had the Tiger's Blood, which was a nice sweet treat.

The service rubbed me the wrong way initially, but our server was very attentive and apologetic when he realized one of the burgers in our group had cheddar on it when the girl who ordered it explicitly asked for it to be left off.

It is pretty cold inside, so make sure to bring a light jacket.
Delicious food that tasted fresh and house made. I order the hummus and veggies with the Spicy Chicken Wrap.  Oak and Stone have an amazing beer selection that was fun to taste and explore.
This place is amazing. I've tried several things on the menu and have enjoyed them all. I like the spicy soup they bring you to get a taste of the flavors they use. I love the seating and vibe.

Joe and Danica have a homerun with MMG.  The food is awesome, they always have great specials, and their delivery is fast!  I'm a cheesesteak/pizza/wings guy, so I'm not one to sacrifice taste for anything.  But eating at MMG, I still get great food that's actually good for me.  Eating a few times a week at MMG has helped me drop over 25 lbs for this summer.  Thanks guys and keep up the great work!

We were a party of 4 and sat on the wonderful patio. Service was friendly and attentive. The food was excellent, particularly the fried chicken. West County needed this type of restaurant/bar - very reasonably priced with quality service and product. Not since having the fried chicken at Monarch have I enjoyed fried chicken. Kudos to Joey B!! You are a hit with us.

Came here just for some cocktails. The atmosphere is really nice, good for date night. The drinks were good. We ended up getting the Banana's foster which is made table side. It's very decadent and one of the best I've had. Worth trying.

The absolute best Starbucks I've ever been to! I think I enjoy the baristas and the setting even more than the delicious coffees they make. I have many fond memories of this place from studying, enjoying conversations with friends and co-workers. I enjoy their clover micro brew very much!

I live local (Largo) and like to check out all the new beach places. Went here when it first opened, and liked the view. Drink prices were ok, food was limited. After going there a few times with friends, they wanted $20 to park in their mostly empty garage and or outdoor parking. I tried to explain I wanted to go up to the bar for a few drinks, but there was no talking to the "in charge" parking guy. Bottom line, won't go back. There are many other good choices with free parking, Frenchies, Palm Pavillion and Crabby Bills to name a few. All of these have better food and drink prices. Sent an email to the company but never heard back from them, not surprised. Just another overpriced  tourist joint with a view in my opinion.
Great duckhorn wine pairing! Natalie our waitress was great! Potatoes were awesome and filet with bone in was killer cooked to perfection!

This is without a doubt the best Steak house and my favorite for many years. The ambiance is warm with outstanding service,
We celebrated our 52d anniversary last night, The Capital Grille made it an exceptional evening  wit its excellent service making you feel that you are with friends. We were presented with long stem roses and champagne as well as lovely deserts. 
Needless to say the stakes were perfectly cooked and tasted great. The best!

The prices are pretty great, especially the happy hour prices. The service was quick and our server was on top of making sure our drinks were refilled and our food was brought out promptly. The crab rangoons were very fresh and yummy. I got the dancing crab roll and it was amazing but my friend got the Godzilla roll and the tuna was a faded color with grayish hues. This was concerning as that is not the color red color that you would normally find with spicy tuna.
Ate here today with my daughter. The food and service were really good. The Cheese plate and brussel sprouts were a hit. Definitely a good spot to eat outside on a nice day.

GROSS GROSS GROSS DONT GO HERE found a hair in my burger and the floor was so dirty even the tables were filthy! Felt like I needed a shower after just walking in! Won't be going back ever!! You couldn't pay me to go back.

This place automatically deserves a 3+ star for opening AND DELIVERING 24/7.  

This is a unique place; they serve everything from dinner food (pizza, burgers, steaks, wings, etc) to breakfast food (breakfast sandwiches, omelets, toast, etc.)  I live in the university area and usually the latest open restaurants are pizza shops that close around 2am, so to have a joint open all night long is a jewel.

We actually ordered two omelets in the morning because we were having a lazy morning, and it turned out to be a great first experience.  The omelets are very customizable, and they are quite large.  It came with a side of toast, and a choice of fruit, home fries, or french fries (??).  It was around $6-7  The delivery guy appeared to be college age and was very friendly to be delivering food in the morning when everyone else was just waking up.

Definitely a place worth trying especially if you're a student who's got a long night ahead of you.
Who wouldn't love it here? The menu is awesome, and they even have gluten-free options! You can't beat sitting so close to the ocean. The vibe is killer. A definite MUST when you're in the area.

Came in here for a late dinner on Friday night. We sat at the bar, feeling like it would offer a spicier ambiance. The bartender was attentive although seemingly wanted to get outta there. After reading some reviews, I was convinced to go with the Lemon Basil Mojito..pitcher. At $34 - you get a large pitcher of this cocktail. 
We started off with the bacon-wrapped bleu cheese stuffed dates as I have an addiction to a version of these that I make with manchego and prosciutto - my version blows these away....way away. Mojo must deep fry their version as the crispiness of the bacon really turned me off. We also got the edamame curried hummus with some lavash crackers. This was simple but tasted really nice - lacked enough crackers to finish off the hummus. 
We got a flatbread pizza and a trio of sliders (Korean BBQ, lamb, black bean) for our next course. The flatbread pizza was forgettable and the best slider was the black bean for sure. The Korean BBQ had a really strange tasting slaw that needed some spice and salt. The bread pudding for dessert was the all-star of the meal and almost got Mojo four stars. Mojo offered good tasting food and solid drink, but doesn't warrant the price.

This was the first time visiting the general area. I personally think this place is a must- but the band that played tonight covered a lot of metal/rock (which is my absolute fav). Definitely a fun bar. I loved the band that was playing tonight.

Honestly it's a little flavorless. I suppose if you are vegan, gluten free, and trying to avoid sugar it's the only option but the flavor was really lacking without sugar. I bought a few cupcakes because I can't eat gluten, and didn't finish one of them.

I would say just make your own and leave out the ingredients that you don't want.

This pains me. After a long day of running around, my husband and I just wanted to grab a quick bite before going home. I make it a point to patronize local businesses and we chose Coach's. That was apparently our first mistake and it only got worse. We came in the side door to see a busy bar area; the bartender looked at us, said nothing and went back to her bar customers. Apparently, a server had to be called in, but after 15 minutes of being totally ignored, we were getting ready to walk out. When the new server finally made her way over to us, she was friendly but didn't apologize for the lousy service. She took our drink orders before dashing away again, and came back with them 10 minutes later. At that time, we ordered. I got wings and my husband a patty melt or something along those lines. During the 45 minutes, yes 45, we waited for our food, my husbands beer had been gone to 25 with no offer of refill. When the food arrived, it wasn't worth bothering with. Sloppily thrown together and not at all hot. The wings I got were of very poor quality. Many broken bones, and had an old taste to them. Sauce was flavorless. The blue cheese dressing was good tho. After we had been served, a couple of nice looking guys came in and sat next to us. The bartender (female) who had completely ignored us made a beeline for them. Was so friendly and chatty with them, but never once looked our way. I guess we aren't the "right" clientele. I guess Coach's 2 has enough business that they don't need ours, because we won't be back.

Terrible service, we were asked multiple times to move and ended up at a high top even though they claim you can sit where you like. Drinks went empty multiple times. The Pulled pork looked and tasted like it was just scooped out of a can. The onion rings were fantastic though and as usual the music was top notch

Only one size coffee.  I don't drink the fancy drinks, just coffee, and i like a large cup.  It's the tiniest cup of coffee and I wasn't impressed with the flavor either.  The lighting is dull and so is the decor.  I probably won't ever go back.   There's so many other places to choose from. 
The guy working behind the counter was super nice, good service!  He saved my my rating from a one star to 3 stars.  Good job guy!

Summer was amazing as a bartender and it was Spring! She was attentive and  fast paced. She took care of me and my friend as well as everyone at the bar. She accommodated everyone's requests for TV channels. 10/10 would Come back if Summer was the bartender.

Amazing!!!!  Great pizza done right. It is true deep dish. A fun selection of craft beers in cans and on draft. I highly suggest this place. Just keep in mind that a proper deep dish takes 45 minutes to cook. Eric the bartender is great.

The staff of this Hotel is extremely arrogant. My room was not ready on time they told me they would call me, they never did. They seem happy to have transient business ,rather than repeat customers. My reservations at the the buffet were not honored as well. It was a  very  poor experience. I will not return to this establishment!

This is perhaps less to do with the general decor as with the premise of the place itself (pun intended). It looks a little bit rundown, but the staff are absolutely lovely, the people seem happy there, and you can get lost for hours (for a flat rate! yes! it's real!) in hard to find, unique board games. This place just makes me really really happy. Come here if you want to be happy.

I usually hate chains. I usually make fun of people who frequent chains-with the exception of Maggiano's (and PF Changs). The food is good, I hate to admit it. It's not THE best Italian I've ever had, but it's pretty darn good. I've never, ever had a bad meal here, and I've eaten at many Maggiano's-Philly, Atlanta, DC. Sometimes it's loud, and sometimes you have to wait for a table, but the food is solid.

I've been coming here since the day it opened in 2012 and mostly loved it because it was quality food delivered fast. Usually the Crispy Chicken sandwich is a perfectly sized chicken breast although lately I've been receiving a pounded out thin chicken patty instead.  Either the crispy chicken sandwich is getting smaller or there's more of an inconsistency with it.  Wish I would've taken a pic of the 1/8" pounded out patty with 1/4" of breading. So is PDQ becoming just another fast food restaurant? Hope not but will give it one more try before making my way back to Chick-fil-a.

This place is awesome!!!! There are consoles set up for free game play to break up the spending on machines. Most games are 25 cents! Felt like a kid again- except for the part where I was drinking really awesome craft beers! Great beer selection. Cool people. Awesome bar Staff!!!

Was recommended this place by a hotel employee while visiting Philly on my last day of the trip.  First thing I noticed was how quiet it was.  There were a few others dining there but the music was very low, which kind of made the vibe uncomfortable.  Our waiter (I think his name was David) hovered way too much for my liking as if we were a nuisance.  I ordered the lamb sliders and mac and cheese.  They were both delicious and cooked to perfection.  Once the bill arrived it was combined for me friend and I.  (why do restaurants assume to female friends who are dining wouldnt be paying separately?)  Anywho, I asked, can you separate the bills.  To which David replied I can do it myself and itemize the bill and list which card was paying for which, this REALLY ticked me off.  So as I sat there trying to separate each of our orders, drinks and taxes he literally stood over my should, not to offer any assistance but to rush me.  We felt like we were intruding just by dining there.  Plus side, is there were great picture ops on the deck.IF I return when visiting Philly again, I'd definitely ask for a different waiter.

I called in a phone order, pepper roasted turkey sandwich, (no extras)and small Greek salad. Lots of confusion ordering on the phone. My bill was $20. I was  expecting alot,  I'm a big  eater and I  was very  hungry. Very disappointing after eating my sandwich, not full. The salad was so light and small, I grilled up my own  shrimp and threw it in. I looked at my receipt and gave them a call thinking their must have  been  a mistake.  The woman on the  phone  said yes,  she was sorry they did over charge me. She said next time  I come, ask for her and she  will  make  up for it. I have no idea who she was. There is nothing organic and they are not gmo conscious. Very pricey for what you get. I will never go back and I live right  down  the street.
Love this place! Great options for those watching what they eat and those who don't need to.

Moved to this side of town from the SW side. Was very happy to discover Kona Gold has excellent coffee and reasonably priced  tasty meals. Breakfast is served all day. I've been in several times and it's been consistently good. Parking is plentiful.

I wanted to like Ahi Sushi Bar, I really did!  A friend of mine is a server here and always boasts about how great it is.  I was excited but skeptical at the idea of sushi in Idaho so I told her I'd give it a try the next time I am in town.  

I went in today for lunch.  We were the only ones there at first and then the stampede showed up!  The one waitress working had to juggle ten tables by the time we were finished with our meal.

We had edamame for a starter.  It was very good but had a lot of salt on it.  Not a good choice for those watching their salt intake.  I ordered a California roll fried and my co-diner had a Winding Creek Roll.  I was a little bummed that mine didn't have any sauce on it and I kept using the sauce off the Winding Creek roll.  The food was alright overall, but not the best I've had.

The reason I'm giving this such a low rating is because I got food poisoning.  About 20 minutes after eating there, I started getting symptoms of food poisoning.  Fortunately the illness only lasted about 5 hours, but let me just say that the Cali roll didn't taste that great the second time around.  I didn't even have sashimi, so I'm not sure what caused this.

This was an awesome dinning experience!  Great entertainment, great drinks, great food excellent server Georgette (Gigi). Beautiful sunset!  Fun and a lot of energy, great vibe. We will be back!
Also, the best Reservation system!

It's literally hard to believe how good this place is. The wait for a table will tell you because it's not short, but the hostess manages it with skill.  The service alone is worth five stars and I will tell you why. We encountered a rude bartender who was openly upset, declaring he was aggravated that they were so busy.  He was rude to my sister in law who's birthday we were celebrating.  A problem seems to bring the best out of these people, the manager and the owner were the most engaged and professional we have ever seen. My brother is a chef at a resort (we will not name here) and he was the most impressed in our party.  But on par with the incredible service was the food. Everything our table received was exceptional. The omelettes are perfect. We had one of each between us. The savory breakfast bowl was very impressive, a great combination of ingredients and well executed. We will be back. And we will be sending a lot of people in the meantime, you can count on both.

The food is always great.  I don't live in Indianapolis any more but I used to try to make visiting a priority.  


BUT 

For every second you'll enjoy eating delicious food,  you will spend FREEZING your behind off.  And I know what you're thinking, "just wear a jacket."  Nah bruh.  This is cold-cold.  It's summer outside but dead of winter inside.  

I'm still going to come back but even if it's 90¬∞ outside, I'm going to be wearing a hoodie and some jeans.

Cool spot.  Upstairs makes a concerted effort to have music every night, and there were many fly couples of all ages/orientation cutting it up on dance floor.  My pork chops was the ish.  I'd go again homie.

In town for a convention... this place was close to the hotel.
This place has a smoky atmosphere, it's that simple. Choose wisely.....

Wife had a mushroom/Swiss burger .... nothing special just a burger .... 

I had the patty melt... was pretty good... good rye bread it was on ... 

Got fried pickles... sent them back ... way to salty... our waitress ( Keisha ) who was terrific. said she would get the kitchen to try again. She did warn us that they are prepackaged so the outcome was probably going to be the same. 
Some other waitress brought them out and told us that since they had bread everything in the back.... that she had them wash all the pickles and rebread them .( now I'm confused) 
Pickles were just as bad the second time. 
My guess is Keisha was right ... 
so with a full basket of pickles still on the table .... they brought the check with the pickles still on it and the drinks taken off..... 
Keisha if your reading this .... you are way better than this place ... run away .... go to a classier place ... 
it gets a 2 star for the rye bread and iced tea

Yes, they're in a mall foodcourt, but they're friggin' delicious!

I tried a sample and as a result the sample guy gave me a coupon. It was for a Chicken California with fries and a drink for $5.99. I jumped right on it.

They cook the meat right in front of you and still manage to get sandwiches out quick. My Chicken California was so good I actually made sure to eat it slowly and enjoy it. Chicken, provolone cheese, ranch, and other fixin's... I'm drooling just recalling the memory.

I saved almost 70% for lunch that day (I had been on my way to another restaurant for a $15.00 entree...must've been thinking with my stomach)!

Food and drink was amazing! Only took off a star because it took a little while to get my food.  Ate the breakfast sandwich and it was very good. Rosemary sourdough bread was delicious! I'll definitely be back but just be prepared to wait a couple minutes for food. Nothing crazy but don't be in too much of a hurry.

Let me preface this review by saying The Grill has always been one of my favorite Reno restaurants. Good food, nice atmosphere, and( usually) friendly, helpful service. Scott, the bartender that served us on Aug 4th has changed  the latter part of that statement. Never, ever have I experienced such rude, almost threatening behavior from any server, anywhere. He was obnoxious the minute we sat down, made rude remarks under his breath and generally treated us as if we were a HUGE inconvience just by being there.He actually became very aggressive when I had the audacity to ask for the bill. Sam Frankovich needs to remove this guy promptly before he has a lawsuit on his hands. So no matter how good the food is, if I ever see this guy behind the bar (or anywhere else) I will leave.

Nice place. Lots of TVs to see the games. Can be loud at times but it's a sports bar. The boneless wings are excellent. The Post its are good. We had the pepperoni post its. Basically a pepperoni and cheese quesadilla using thin pizza dough (I think). Big beer selection.

When I'm in Santa Barbara, this is my favorite place to let happy hour roll right into evening.  My friends and I go sit around the fire pit on the patio in the afternoon, drink 2 for 1 margaritas and eat the half off appetizers during happy hour.  I recommend the sampler platter, it never gets old!  Before we know it, it's always later than we think and sometimes there's live music or else a DJ and dance music gets going.  The club scene has never really been my thing, but at Sandbar I seem to always have a great time.  There's always fun people to meet and you can have a great time whether or not you like to dance.  I couple times I've been when they had a mechanical bull, we've got some hilarious stories from bull nights!  I wish they would have that bull more often...

I love to start my day with a good breakfast! I've been following these guys on Instagram and they make me so hungry with their photos! My husband I am we're close to them so we decided to have a quick breakfast. 

The Place:
They are located in front of David's Bridal, in a cute little building. It looks really traditional and old school. Yet really adorable and you had the feeling of comfort food. 

The Food:
Food was traditional breakfast and lunches, with great selection of Mimosas, unfortunately it was a week day so no fun Brunch, just breakfast :(
I got some coffee and water while looking at the menu. 
I ordered some "Traditional pancakes" and a side of scramble eggs- they were really yummy and fluffy. The eggs were amazing! They had a great taste, like if they just pick them up from the farm earlier in the morning (seriously!)
My husband got the "Eggs Benedicts" with hash browns- i stole half of his hash browns and they were so yummy! 

The Service:
The service was great, the food came out fast and we had breakfast in like 30 minutes which was what we were looking for. 

Overall: 4 Stars (Salmita's Scale) I still want to come back and eat with more time, try more meals and their mimosas of course! ;-)
This place has great food. Been for both brunch and dinner. Cool atmosphere as well. A little bit pricey but worth it from time to time.

I don't even know where to begin this meal was so good.

I will start off with the calamari since it was the first item I tasted. By far it was the best I have ever had. Often times I am disappointed with calamari because it's just fried nothing. This was the complete opposite.

For my main course I had a special which was an 18 oz. Delmonico cut ribeye. It was life changing. I didn't speak to anyone while eating it because I was savoring it so intensely. 

The service was top notch. I will be back soon.
Great upscale food with downscale prices in a quaint Italian Market location.  Have to try some of the cocktails next time we are there which I hope will be very soon.

I go thru the drive thru every morning to get a cup of coffee... when i got to the window,  the cashier asked if i wanted decaf... i said no.... she shut the window and i watched another employee fill the cup with decaf and then top off with the last bit of regular... she brought me the cup and i asked why it was decaf... she said it wasn't.. i told her i saw the other employee.. she said...oh... i demanded my money back... she took the cup back and brought me my money... i will never go there again,  for any reason.
Upscale with relaxed, friendly atmosphere. Delicious cocktails and bar snacks.  Returned several times while visiting New Orleans.
My family and I went to Jack's on Friday morning and we enjoyed it for our first time! But later my husband's stomach didn't like his French toast meal! But everyone else loved it

Went here when we were in the area looking for a place I haven't been to.  A good stop it was.  It was a late lunchtime on a weekday so it was empty but that fared well for us because service was a-one.

Many interesting items on the menu you don't normally see.  Surprisingly, there were a house special wings that I have never heard of.  Mambo wings.  Had to have them.  Not glad I did.  I liken them to crack or heroin.  If you never try it, you won't ever crave it.  I am a pushover for wing recipes I haven't had and I never heard of Mambo wings so I had to get them.  Now, I crave them daily.  

Waiter said they got the recipe from D.C.  Now I research them and they have been around a long time there although more often called Mumbo wings.  Mumbo sauce is apparently common in chinese take out joints in D.C. but has a large wing following.  Enough that there are Mumbo wing restaurants.  I have been a wing-head ever since they first came to this area with Hooters, Melons, Mugs N' Jugs and mostly because I lived across the street from Knockers (where the original Winghouse is now).  That was around 1989.  27 years of wings and I have not heard of Mumbo wings.  Damn you to hell 1933 Pub & Grill.

Not sold in Walmart.  Not in Publix.  Not in Winn-Dixie.  I must make the trek to 1933 or suffer the consequences of $15 per bottle on Amazon or Walmart.com.  This may be my last review as I may be broke soon due to the scarcity of Mumbo sauce in this area.

This place is now called Dany's Diner, Bar, and Grill.  It looks the same inside as before.  The sign has now changed.  But the food quality has plunged dramatically.  

I had the breakfast wrap my last trip there.  Absolutely no flavor in the eggs and veggies, no cheese which is a cardinal sin in my book, soggy tortilla wrap, and too much grease in the hash browns.  

New owners, this place needs serious work!  You just went from OK to BLEECH!

I would write more, but "BLEECH" seems to be so much more effective.

I searched online to find a place close to my Hotel since the Hotel restaurant were all closed due to low guess count on this visit (covid-19). 
I decided to sit in the bar area since I was alone. The restaurant was not full about 10 table occupied.
I waited sometime 15min before someone acknowledged me to let me know they would be back soon.
I ordered a glass of wine finally after the waitress came over to take my drink order.
Another 15 min and I had to get up to ask another waitress to get my waitress because I was ready to order my food, the waitress I spoke to took my order and told me they would tell my waitress.
After getting my salad and the meal "fish and chip" the fries were soggy and cold, it took another 15 min before I saw my waitress when I had to flag her down to get a glass of water.
Conclusion not a good experience and I could never eat here again, if it had not have been raining, I would not have stop at this establish again.  I know that we are deal with trying times, but that is no reason for customer service to decline.
I love the food. Service was great!! 100 % Mexican food. I feel like in Mexico. The concept it's nice!!

The food was bland and the service was awful my friends drink stayed empty for 30 minuted till I finally flagged down the waiter and asked for a refill typically I would totally understand this if they were super busy but they weren't then I left my Togo order setting on the table (my mistake) went back 20 minutes later and the manager told me the food had been thrown out I said "so you threw away $40 worth of food" he said "hold on" after waiting 15 minutes he came back and said "I checked all the trash cans it wasn't in any of them" I said "so the person that busted down the table took it" he said " nothing I can do about it" will not be back

Great little place to check out for noodles or dumplings! Place is on the smaller side. There are benches outside along the Main Street to sit as well. Dumplings are only sold in groups of 5 unless you head over on Wednesday when they have $1 dumplings. Typically you can not mix Sweet and savory but the counter guy was feeling friendly and allowed me to do so. My friend and I ordered a cheesesteak noodles and a 5 pack of dumplings. Taco, buffalo chicken, cheesesteak, apple pie and cheesecake. There are sauces on the table are great for dipping. As a condiment lover, enjoyed them greatly! The dumplings were packed with flavor. The cheesesteak was my favorite savory And the cheesecake my favorite sweet. Apparently cheese is the key to my happiness! I might have ordered another if they available individually.

The noodles were fresh. Ramen style but fancier. They were tossed in a white super gooey delicious cheese sauce with large pieces of cheesesteak and perfectly cut scallions. 

Looking forward to hearing back to try some more. Hopefully my next trip will be on a Wednesday where you can buy as many or as few as you would like!

This place shocked me. The parking is horrible but the food is fantastic!  Ending our wedding weekend and sending our daughter back to vet school; I was just ready to go home. My hubby got the Bloody Mary which came with unlimited refills... OMG. So delicious. The roast beef poboy was amazing and my party was impressed!!  I understand there are many locations...don't be fooled by "chains "!!

When you've had to much fun Saturday night, there's nothing better than brunch! Even if you're not feeling the effects of your previous night, brunch is never a bad idea! Now you could do the fancy brunch buffets, or pick the perfect patio to while away the day, or you could get right down to business and cure what ails ya with some serious food, like the brunch slice at Noble Pie! 

This piece of pizza is nothing to muck with! They top a large slice with their creamy and garlicky bianco Base, a light layer of mozz, prosciutto, sun-dried tomato, asparagus, and red onion, and then top it with spicy hollandaise and... wait for it... a FARM FRESH EGG! As soon as it arrives you've gotta slather that ooey gooey egg yolk all over the slice and enjoy. The flavor combo is dy-no-mite and it's the perfect piece to put that hangover out to pasture! 

On top of that beauty, Noble also rocks a full brunch menu with calzomelettes, sourdough toasts with eggs, cheese, and fresh veggies, a BYO Blood Mary and Bottomless Mimosas, and a full cocktail menu, all served up in a chillaxed atmosphere! Oh yeah, they also have gluten free crust and are happy to accommodate any special requests you might have.

Noble is an awesome addition to downtown Reno and a stop worth making for brunch, lunch or dinner. See you there!

First off I realize it's spelled "PHO" but it is pronounced "FU" as in without the "CK" ending.  This place was not so great overall.  It smelled a little off, especially in the back.  I got the curry chicken and the wife got Fried wonton & seafood soup.

The curry chicken was totally bland and also basically lacking one thing, chicken.  I was really let down by it overall.  The soup, which I did try, was okay but still not as good as our usual place, PHO 21.  We also got pork egg rolls for an appetizer which again, were okay but nothing great.

It was also about $6 bucks more for the same amount of food as compared to our usual spot as well.  They did have a wide variety of things to choose from on the menu but with what we had tonight being so poor I doubt we will be back to try much else.  The other thing I didn't really care for was our waitress.  She left me feeling like we were a nuisance to her overall because we had the audacity to come into the establishment and order food.

With so many Vietnamese places in Reno you can surely find one better than this place.  I highly recommend PHO 21 just off McCarran next to the Flowing Tide Pub, much better.
Omg. Anyone that goes to New Orleans has to go here. And when you do it's a sin if you don't try the grilled oysters the best in the world.

I had a good experience, and the food was good enough to make it our go to local pizza shop. You get a ton of food on the cheap, but yes, the service is a touch slow. I contribute it to cultural perspectives, but if I get a lot of good, cheap food- I'm cool to wait.

Yucky people hang around there cause I guess they do sports betting.  Not my type of atmosphere.

I went to this place because it was where I needed to meet a friend.  I had a burger and fries lunch special.  The burger was cold.  I am guessing it was precooked frozen meat maybe.  I was there to talk so I didn't even bother telling the waitress.  The fries were plentiful and good.

The waitress was excellent.  I just can't give it more then one star due to the clientele and my cold burger.  I will not go to this place ever again.  I doubt I will try another location either.
Chicken Alfredo was alright, a bit oily. My friend had the huevos rancheros (far left) and liked it though.

Me and the lady frequent this spot. We live fairly close and it's her favorite brunch place. I always get the Cubano sandwich and it's delicious pretty much every time. 

All of the staff are super courteous and last time we went we had Ryan as our waiter. By far the best dude there, and he even offered to give me some salsa in a to-go container after raving that I really enjoyed the taste.(Made in-house) 

It can get busy after 10:30ish am so just be prepared to wait if you aren't an early morning person. 

It's also pretty nice that the bar-top is first come first serve. Easy for 2 people to squeeze in quick if there is a long wait. 

Highly recommended

Woohoo is right! Hubby and I found this great place on our fifth day in this lovely city. I settled in at a nice table by the window and he ordered for the both of us.You order and pay at the counter, which is cool. He knows what I like for breakfast and that makes me happy. I got the egg breakfast with bacon and perfect over easy eggs. No toast but the best homemade biscuit ever.   Hubby is not a big fan of biscuits but kept sneaking bites of mine and said it was the best he ever tasted(bold statement). He ordered the Envie which is eggs,brie and ham on a fresh croissant. I'm telling you, we were both so happy after eating, it was sinful. The cook  (Steven I think), delivers your food  which is a great touch. Hubbys'  food was delicious and mine was very tasty. We both had the cafe au lait , which was nice and hot and creamy, I added cinnamon to mine. I love this place and will be back every time we come to this fine city. If you're tired of the touristy breakfast places in the Quarter, try this hidden gem just off Bourbon Street, by the river, in one of the oldest areas of the city. If you don't like cool, funky coffee shops with awesome open air seating, great food, and quirky but very cool staff, then I would suggest hitting a Starbucks for a $4 latte and a stale muffin, don't worry we won't miss you.

I tried the cinnamon roll French toast and it was delicious. My friend ordered the crab cake omelette with potatoes. Another excellent choice. Waiter was friendly and helpful. This is my new favorite breakfast spot on Clearwater Beach.
Two words.......crab claws.......every time we are here we come to Royal House and have to get an order. Do yourself a favor and do the same.
Food was below par for New Orleans. We had a fish po boy and shrimp and grits.  Both were disappointing. The hush puppies were nice. Service was quick, but I don't recommend.

The beer selection may be the best in the south. The food is also that good. And less expensive than it should be. 

I recommend a nice import craft beer and the dunder von bomb sandwich. It is huge and unbelievably good. Also, look for swinehakzen... Probably not spelled correctly by yours truly, it's a pork knuckle. Or order whatever, the beer and food will all be good.

Blech!  Ridiculous wait just to place an order.  Got their southwest wrap & threw most of it away. Really wish the Philly airport had more options since I always seem to be flying back at dinner time.

I've been to a lot of Mexican Restaurants in my life (yes, I am mexican - surprise) and Tequila's is one of the best Mexican restaurants I have ever been to. To start with, the chipotle, almond guacamole is hands down the best guacamole I have ever tasted (sorry, mom). It was perfect size and perfect taste. I tried looking for it on the menu but I didn't see it so I hope they didn't do away with it - if you are there ask about it! You won't regret it. 

For the main course, I had the molcajete de carne which was delicious and a BIG portion. I didnt share it but it might be good to share. If you plan on having your traditional mexican beers at this place forget it. They don't sell XX or any other mexican beers that you have tried in the past. They sell what they call "an authentic" mexican beer which is good. My date had a margarita that she thought was good. 

The restaurant has a pretty good feel to it - dim with traditional mexican decorations. I didn't really like our table as we were off to the side and it was kind of small. We were in the walkway so it was a bit uncomfortable. 

The waiter was knowledgeable, funny and attentive. He even taught my date a few spanish phrases which was cool. 

Overall great experience at tequila's a def must go if you are looking for mexican food in Philly.
One of my "go to places". I always get the Shrimp and grits with an IPA. I should probably try something new but that dish is so good.

This is the second place I found on Yelp in Tampa that I've loved. The lava sushi was delicious and the mango mojito tasty. The short walk from the convention center was definitely a huge plus. My friend had the lobster bisque and a California roll, which she said were both good. Despite how busy it was, we still got in and out within an hour and our waiter was great. Would definitely recommend this place for anyone. Really great atmosphere.
Service was fast and the food (pho) was good enough for a lunch outing. Would definitely come here if Miss Saigon ever burns down.
Who gives ketchup and mayo packets when you are dining in... low brow... and, what is in the packet tastes distinctly different than what is on my plate. Don't bother. Worth a walk to anywhere else.

Ate here for the first time on a Tuesday night. It was really good.

Food: Excellent. Everyone was happy. 
Atmosphere: It was Tuesday so it was quiet. No games were on TV.  No wait. Very few people were in the restaurant. 
Service: Very good. They forgot to bring us silverware and ketchup, but other than that it was great.
Price: Prices were higher than they should be for this type of restaurant.

What we had:
Nachos - delicious. Piled high with lots of cheese. Included guacamole.
Onion rings - loved. Though for $10 it didn't come with many.
Kid's grilled cheese - good. Especially the fries. 
Pesto Pizza - very good.
Chicken Pot Pie - very large and very good! Wished it would have included more veggies in it.

I have been in Tampa for two weeks for work and heard good things about this place. Well my service was absolutely terrible. I ordered a drink which was ok, but I also ordered a burger which took nearly an hour to come out and my order was then incorrect. The server didn't even ask to correct the order, so I just left out. Every server is different I hope everyone else has a better experience.

Not bad. Good pasta dish but lots of shells so be careful! Decent service enjoyable atmosphere. I'd come back. Pricey drinks but how often do I get to this coast? Not often so splurge. $85 plus tip for two people for dinner and drinks.

Probably my favorite broccoli Rabe hoagie anywhere, anytime-If they had a whole wheat sesame rolls, I would give them six stars! Primos has nothing on this place, with selections of smoked provolone and various roasted peppers, fruity tasting olive oil and plenty of garlic.  I wish they would open one up on South Street so I can eat them every day!

Yeah my trip to Blue Dog recently was less than spectacular. Where to begin, the burger I had was cold and the fries were even colder. The bar was filled with a lot of snotty nosed 21 year-olds acting like it was their first time in a bar, prime example was the fist fight that broke out between two of them. If I would have wanted to go to a frat party, i would have joined one during college. Some of us want to hang with friends and talk over a few beers, not in this atmosphere, family tavern my eye!

Incredible service, fun, family friendly atmosphere and great food. Although busy, the staff, especially hostesses, couldn't have been friendlier or more attentive. We have 2 toddlers that loved the playground. The pizza was great. Excellent experience all the way around, it is now one of our favorite places to go as a family.
Damn it. Wanted them to succeed.

Service was slow very slow. It took an hour to get an order of 10 boneless wings and when they came I asked for an extra blue cheese and didn't get it until I was done my wings and the table was cleared. Now I know why I only go if I have a gift certificate.

I go here for my break for work to get a nice slice of pizza. 

This place by far has the best gourmet pan pizza in Tucson. I have tried so many of the types they have i usually can never choose which one i want to eat when there. I would say though everyone needs to try out the buffalo wing and the potato pizza.
The guys who work here are awesome! They always make convo with me and usually know what i want to eat just by what im looking at and throw it in the oven for me. 
When you get inline you get to walk past the case of fresh pizza's and point out which one you want. They take a slice of that and toss it into the nice oven and get it out to you ASAP. 
The seating is First Come First Serve. Great place to go to watch the game with friends and have a pizza and beer.  You can definitly hawk/vulture tables till it becomes empty. Great college place to be at. They have a full bar in there too so you can go inside and sit. All of the restaurant seating is outside though. They have game day deals soo look this place up.

My boyfriend and I live right down the road so this an excellent place for us to have dinner! Sushi is always good, Mexican Roll, Super Las Vegas Roll, and the Plum Paste Roll are just some of our favorites! Love the green ice tea! We will be bring friends to eat here! The sushi has more personality than Sushi Garden's cookie cut rolls, and the sauces are yummy!!

Love it!!

The pizza is very fresh and you can tell because they have the pizza kitchen at the front of the restaurant so you can see them make the pizzas. For a couple extra bucks it's worth going here instead of other pizza places in the area. Might not be the place to go for large orders because the pizzas are not huge, but the sizes work for small family dinners. Not quite a "service with a smile" kind of place, but the pizza is quite good so it makes up for it.

I haven't been here in a while as the wait is usually long and their slow service isn't worth it, but today was different. They served us quickly and efficiently. The waiter was friendly and got us the sides we asked for. Usually when we ask for an extra sauce they won't come back but today they did. I went at about 1 which is one of there times when I usually see a line but there was no line today.

Overpriced. Undercooked eggs. Bland aesthetic. Confusing menu items with fake names. Manager listened to us complain about the food for 20 minutes then walked over just to tell us that he heard us. Said he was "sorry it didn't live up to your expectations". Rude. He comped our food but then followed us out of the restaurant to tell us we offended him. More like #fakebrunch

Been here a couple times. Nice people and inviting dinning area. I had my order mixed up a little both times but they were quick to fix it. I just don't care for the coffee or food too much, food was super salty both times.

I love this little place.

I started off with a frustrated taste in my mouth. It was no fault of their own, though. Google had listed them as being open during their transition from a coffee truck to a storefront and I arrived before actually having opened.

Several months later I finally got the chance to go back to an *open* Kaffeine Coffee. It quickly became my favorite spot downtown to work and caffeinate. 

The decor is a cool warehousey feel. The ambience is chill. The drinks I've had thus far--a Chemex with South American beans (Mexico, I think) and an Americano--were perfectly delicious. The staff are much more helpful than most baristas I've run into, particularly in the context of local, artisan type shops. 

If you're downtown and want some brew, don't miss the chance to get the best of the best here at Kaffeine.

Recent trip to NOLA for mardi gras and we hit this  bad boy up twice. food was soo bomb. I recommend the seafood benedict and the shrimp and grits. The fried green tomatoes were a hit too. I will say when we went Thursday after mardi gras they were a little short staff. ( the hostess was serving tables, passing water, and hosting) it was a little annoying but after seeing her move I was impressed. Not to mention the food was not skimped over at all. This is why they still get 5 stars from me.
Very friendly staff, delicious coffee cake and pretty good latte! Loved the vibe inside, have yet to try the coffee by itself but am definitely excited to. Will be back!

Based on 4 bowls of the Pho Tai, we were not impressed.

The broth was ok, not as layered and flavorful as I'm used to.  

The side plates with lime were good except for the lime on two plates: the end pieces with less juice than needed, and the bitter liquid from the rind squeezed out too.

But most disappointing was the "rare steak."  It was very tough and chewy, not pleasant to eat. Two of our party left most of it in their bowls.  One of our party kept casually listing all the pho places she knows that are better, not intentionally slandering this place, but saying what she preferred about other places, which turned out to be everything...

Except the egg rolls, which she liked a lot.

The Thai tea was good. 

Best about the experience was the service. All of the girls working there were great, kind and helpful.

I'm not going to have the pho again, but will likely come back to try the banh mi.

Bubble tea! Philly does it well and Mr. Wish is one of the best! It's a very clean and bright shop along South Street. The moment you walk in, the servers are more than willing to serve you. They have a large menu of bubble teas, but I recommend their milk tea with bubbles. It's very creamy and tasty. 

Note: Most of their drinks have caffeine in them.

My boyfriend and I were walking downtown trying to find a nice place to eat dinner. We came across this restaurant which was conveniently located by the parking garage. We took a quick look at the menu and decided to give it a try.

The server was friendly although extremely slow! I ordered the beer sampler which gave a taste of their 6 different beers while my boyfriend ordered a mojito. The mojito was horrible and tasted like pure soda water. We were able to switch it out for a sangria which was pretty bad but we didn't want to complain again. For dinner, my boyfriend ordered the smoked half chicken which came out extremely dry and flavorless. I ordered the margherita pizza which was the worst thing I ever ate! It was pure garlic throughout the entire pizza. I even got sick within 10 minutes of leaving because of how much garlic the chef put into it. 

Thankfully, the server was friendly and took the pizza off the bill even though we never even interacted with a manager. The ONLY reason I am giving this place 2 stars is because of how nice the server was. This place definitely looked promising from the outside but was a complete waste of time. We will never be back again!

I have been here a handful of times and I was never really "wowed." Their food is pretty good but it is also rather expensive. I guess in my mind, British pub food just shouldn't cost more than $10. They are always very busy (which is good for them) but it can take awhile to get seated. Their service can be hit or miss. (One time, we had a great server who was very helpful. Another time we had another server who we didn't have such a great experience with [my husband ordered beer for himself and when he switched seats b/c the sun was in his eyes, she assumed that he was giving me his beer and yelled at me and demanded for my ID (I was not going to have any beer, my husband was just sliding the beer across the table to his new seat!). Also, we paid via credit card but tipped with cash. We put down a bill and she just picked it up, never brought us change or asked if we wanted any. I guess she thought she deserved a 23% tip!) 

We haven't been here in awhile and I don't see us going in the near future. I think it gets a lot of hype b/c it's on Beach Drive. It's not bad, but it's also not that fabulous.

They know their pulled pork at Hoods. And judging from the length of the menu, they know how to cook just about anything. I enjoyed my omelette. But, as far as favorites go, I think it's between their burgers and pork.
Highly recommend this place. Food was great and didn't take long at all to get. The chorizo queso was amazing! Margarita was perfectly made & tasty!!

This place definitely deserves some more business. It's authentic Ethiopian (sambusa or ful anyone?) and that's DEFINITELY a good thing. This is the type of place I'd expect to find in NYC... it's thrilling to see Nashville sport that sort of variety.

I had a pure avocado smoothie, and the barista/chef recommended I squeeze fresh lime on it, which completed the flavor profile perfectly. Not too bitter, not too sweet. The actual coffee is rich and dark, as I'd expect from Ethiopian, Turkish, and other eastern beans.

Now I have another reason to visit East Nashville!

We love Joey B's. The atmosphere is clean & pleasant with a large awesome outdoor eating area; complete with fire pits, a bar and plenty of comfortable seating. Food is delicious every time we've gone. It's one of our favorites, but don't make the mistake we made thinking that all locations of Joey B's are the same! We recommended, and met friends at the JB's on The Hill and were disappointed in lack of atmosphere, crowded seating and loud, loud music! It's a completely different atmosphere, and we weren't expecting that.

Great view, pretty darn good food!  Great place to start off my 50th celebration!  Special thanks to waitress Tasia who helped this lost Chinese guy from Cali to start his Big Easy 50th BDay off right!
Best Breakfast I have had in Nashville! I had the biscuit egg and cheese with a side of home fries for only $9! Make sure to add on one of their homemade pop tarts to complete your breakfast

If you love historic buildings and yummy appetizers this is your spot... entrees not so much! But it's ok because they have a large selection of drinks! The bourbon honey fritters were GAS. My bulgogi entree was mediocre at best and I ended up trading my husband for his scallops. I haven't had any issues with scallops until then. They tasted great, presentation was ok (there's only so much you can do about scallops on a bed of white rice atop a metal tray... lol), but hours later I was not alright. I will definitely come back here and only order appetizers and drinks. Love the history behind the building and I'm sure it's a popular spot in the summer... absolutely beautiful and very clean inside! The bathrooms could use more attendance at night though, there was so much water on the wide counters that my shirt got soaked while I was trying to reach for the faucet handles lol. Be aware if you are going there as a couple they put smaller tables between 6-tops so we were sandwiched between two very loud groups. We ended up spending most of our dinner either texting each other or rolling our eyes at the inappropriate conversations coming from next to us lol!

MIMOSAS!!! 

We came here for start our day because of the mimosas. I ordered scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes and a pancake. Typical tasting everything. It was good enough for us to go back. My best friend got the shrimp and grits. Not what we expected at all. It was a grit cake. Weird but when you ate everything together it tasted just like it should. Service was quick and efficient.

Not bad for for a McDonald's but not great by far. The amenities are relatively but there is a lot of noise and Pickering from back in the kitchen. Otherwise this is basically your standard McDonald's maybe a little small.

Great experience.  Just walking around Main Street and decided to try The Black Pearl because of great Yelp reviews.  We were under dressed but they were great!  Service was top notch.  Wait staff courteous and helpful.   We tried the Pork Belly - yum, meat candy!  Lobster Risotto was the best I've had this side of the Amalfi coast.  Pate and  Bisque were excellent, as well.  We were happy foodies!

Great place with tons of choices.  Had a fantastic spicy shrimp appetizer.  It was great as was my pbj mahi.  Wife and I both did some beer flats.  Huge selection of beer to choose from.  Wish we would have tried the bacon appetizer.

Our friday night go-to, best pizza around, and you're treated like FAMILY.

Cheesteaks are huge, rolls are fresh as can be, never a bad meal in 15 years!

The store located at 17 11th street. We went there yesterday ordered the jumbo lobster roll and trios. I think they were smaller than what I had previously( not in the philly tho). The taste is great, the only complaint is they put a lot of lobster claw meat in the bread

I know most people would not bother reviewing a fast food place, but I have to say that this A & W has the friendliest staff and quickest service of any A and W I have been to and they are consistently providing this kind of service.  They have an attitude towards their customers that I wish every fast joint had.  Of course, the food is good and comparable to many other A & W's.

Great spot that was Channelside and now Sparkman Wharf. A nice spot to hang before Lightning game or just go to watch sunset and take in variety of eateries. Bowling available there. Cornhole and such. Lots of condos nearby to buy and you can call us to help 813.507.8348

Great service, meal had effort put into it, moroccan chicken on my salad was great, and best of all, free wifi. Best signal was in the back corner with all the booths. 

However, like any downtown upscale american joint, the prices were a bit high. Not only a little high, which i can deal with, but if you want a side or a starter it's gonna hit you even harder. But, the atmosphere was very good for a date and money is less important in that scenario.

This is my first negative review and I feel bad for the restaurant but I rely on honest reviews for a good meal. I created my own stir fry first with red curry. The flavor was so odd and after trying to eat a few bits it just became worse and inedible. They were very nice though and made me the same order with the sesame garlic sauce. Again weird taste but it was lighter so I tried to eat it, but it had a dirt taste. I couldn't do it. Down the trash it went. I'm from California and love dining on my travels. Tomorrow I'll be in downtown Philly with hopes of better food experiences there.
Tampa dive bar.  Fabulous. Friendly staff makes all the difference.  The sandwiches are huge.
Service and food was very good. The tables are too close together. Did not have to wait to get in which is a plus. Ask for a booth next time.

So I thought the point of a reservation was so you DIDN'T have to wait 30 minutes to be seated.  Also, how the hell do you not have air conditioning in 90 degree weather? They were out the tofu scramble,  chicken and biscuits, chicken and waffles, and cured salmon. That's 1/3 of their menu.  After my friend was asked to repick his entree for a third time, we left for a restaurant run by people who knew what they were doing. I am shocked this place has not closed down yet as it seems these are all ongoing issues that have yet to be rectified.

I have to agree with my fellow yelpers, this is a great place for brunch. Classic diner fare with a southwest twist.  We had Jonathan's famous fiery scrambler with homemade sausage and gravy on the biscuits along the new mexican breakfast burrito.  The sausage had a good flavor but was cooked into a hockey puck, so if you get it (and I do recommend you do) maybe get it in one of their dishes instead of on the side.  The fiery scramble has great flavor and I highly recommend it.  The potatoes were deep fried which is not the way I prefer my breakfast potatoes cooked, so they were just alright.  The burrito is huge, so plan for left overs.  You can add the optional green chili on top; we didn't and regret that decision.  Will have to come back and try it again.  The place is crowded, so plan for it.  The bus outside offers a place to grab drinks while you wait, so that is a plus.  Will definitely have to give it another try.  So many good things on the menu.

My husband and I came here for the first time last Friday. The food was very good! We had crab cakes, bruschetta, Mac and cheese, clams, meatballs, and one of the specials which was duck breast with duck fat shoestring fries, and chocolate decadence for dessert. The duck was amazing, perfectly cooked and the sauce that came with it was great. The only minor issue, if you could even call it that, is that the drinks were a bit slow to come out but they were packed and there is only one bartender so it makes complete sense, we just ordered our second drink before we had finished the first one and it came right when we expected. We were there probably 2 hours and didn't feel rushed at all to finish which I really appreciated. There's a lot more on the menu that I want to try so I'll for sure be back.

Glad this location is getting its long awaited face lift... But what it really needs is a renovation of its employees. Visited this location and received a McChicken without the chicken patty. This is the last straw for me - too much money wasted on food I never received and terrible customer service. I will not return to this store and will advise others to do the same.

Came here to only drink on a Friday night with a couple of friends. It was packed but there is a lot space outside so it was still nice. We grabbed a couple of seats and it was very nice to just chill and drink with friends. I will definitely be back!

Went here for late lunch prior to a movie. Looking at seafood, which a friend had suggested, but salad bar looked so good we decided to go lighter. We did opt for the shrimp fondue appetizer which was excellent but a bit greasy.

Salad bar was fantastic with many options. Lettuce, spinach, beets, onions, carrots, peas & wasabi peas, garbanzos, cucumber slices, zucchini slices (!), grape tomatoes, sliced mushrooms and more. Even pickled artichokes! Rarely see that. Plus potato salad, broccoli salad, carrot salad, pasta salad and apple salad. And peaches, grapes and cottage cheese, plus more.

And for another pleasant surprise, my Raspberry iced tea was delicious! When I was finishing my first glass I found crushed raspberries in it. Who does that? Great!

Woodlands is a great restaurant located on the West side of Nashville. It is close to the Parthenon and service is great. The food is authentic and tasty. They have a wide variety of options - cuisine from the North and South of India. The restaurant can get a little busy during lunch hours, but that is a good sign that the food is great and tasty. I recommend this location to anyone wanting to try great Indian cuisine in the greater Nashville area.

Worst steak and shake I've ever been to. All workers are playing and talking and not paying attention to customers. Took long to be seated and checked out. They'll look at you and notice your there but ignore you. Waitress would just throw things on table. So many things wrong. Won't be back.
Beer is alright, pizza is meah. Service is even worse then pizza. Skip this place if possible.

Ok so I had to clear the hype & tried the CBO's! Yes! They are amazing! I had a simple combo platter of shrimp/catfish. Really good & portions are huge! Almost everyone at our table enjoyed their meal & the one who didn't is a picky eater & disliked a particular spice. Great ambiance & Ana was a fantastic server! Also, if you park in the Hilton garage, bring your parking stub & your server will validate it for you for discounted parking! Not too shabby!
Can I just say PANCAKES, PANCAKES, PANCAKES! Yummy! I dream about their breakfast. Staff are nice and my order has always been correct.
Since I've moved out of Philly, there are few things I miss as much as Red Hook's breakfast sandwiches. So. Damn. Good.

Nice little English pub in East Nashville; tasty hops and really good mules (liquor drinks) their shtick, sandwiches made using pretzel halves instead of bread. I had the black bean sandwich with melted cheddar and carmelized onions and a couple of cold frothy Country Boy ipa (Lexington). Not too bad, maybe a little pricey. The outdoor patio was also a nice place to sit and people watch.

I've heard about the St. Pete location for a couple years now so was super excited when I heard one was coming to Wesley Chapel. Went there with my wife and two young children. We ordered a meatball pizza, the salmon dish, a house salad and a small Mac and cheese. Everything was fantastic. Probably the best Salmon dish we've ever had. The Mac and cheese was incredible as well, not your typical restaurant Mac and cheese. The meatballs on the pizza were great, as well as the fresh mozzarella, basil and caramelized onions. Highly recommend Noble Crust. We can't wait to go back and try other menu items.
Yes they food is good but the service is very slow and the drive thru takes way too long sometimes I want chic fil a before I got to work but they take too long and I won't get to work on time
I've only been there once so all I know at this point is that the Dan Dan Noodle and potstickers are OUTSTANDING. The noodles are to die for. I am definitely going back and trying some other things!

Love their spinach pie. Very clean kitchen area you can see when you order. Dining area also very clean as well. Enjoyed all the food we had here and the people working are also very nice. too. Used to go to Greek City but prefer this place now!!!
Stopped by after a long week of camping, and missing desi food. We were not disappointed. Spicy murg vindaloo, fresh naan, hot samosas. Service was good. Recommended.

Here's the scoop on Becker's. Becker's is a casual dress, pub grub type of establishment, not haute cuisine. The wait staff is friendly, beer selection teriffic, the burger are great and the sandwiches are very good as well.  If casual laid back friendly service and good pub grub food is what you are looking for, you will find it at Becker's. 

The owners also appear to take an interest in their customers as well. If you sign up for their mailing list, and provide the month and day of your birth,  you will receive a birthday gift in the form of a coupon for a free appetizer and dessert.. Nice touch.

The food is good, especially for late night fare. My biggest problem with this spot is the service. Speed of service in particular, I waited an hour for a po boy and fries on an early Saturday afternoon.

I've been here a few times. 2 brunches and 2 dinners. The brunch meals I have ordered were amazing and this is definitely a good brunch place. For dinner, I once just had a cup of their vegetarian chili which was amazing! Definitely will get a Bowl the next time. However, I was not so thrilled about their salmon burger. It was mashed up salmon with other ingredients. I thought it was going to be a piece of grilled salmon in a bun. Whatever was mixed with the salmon and the sauce that was drizzled on top of the patty did not go well together. The salmon burger lacked some flavor.

I'll have to find something else on their menu for a dinner option.

**movie trailer guy voice** In a world filled with fast food and bad pizza joints...

This place is quite literally a breath of fresh air. It's the only place where a quick, inexpensive meal that's made with real food can be purchased as far as the eye can see. Think of it as a fast casual version of Mongolian BBQ.  Pick a starch, a meat, veggies, a sauce and they grill it up for customers. 

The interior setup is awkward with customers having to cut the line in order to fill their cups with ice and tea, which are positioned opposite each other. Besides that though, I'm a fan. 

I ordered the subtlety spicy finadene chicken with brown rice, broccoli and mushrooms and left not even a grain of rice in the bowl. I finished it off with a piece of crazy good carrot cake, and washed it all down with some u sweetened tea. With the tip, it cost me about $15.

We were taken to this restaurant by our son. He said he had been there recently, saying the food and service was really good.  They did not disappoint us. 
We had a party of five and asked for seating in the patio area. They didn't have any cleared tables, however immediately cleared and cleaned one for us. I later realized it was the manager that was clearing tables to help the serving staff.

      Our waitress was very helpful with the various menu items, both food and drinks. She was very prompt with any request, or plate removal. She also made our dinner a relaxing, fun social event.
