We have been in the area for a week, and this place was probably our best dining experience so far. We will be back!
Really good food with a very fun and beautiful atmosphere. Yes, the wait can be long but it's a fun place.

Mmmm. Talk about some good pizza and their prices aren't too shabby either.  I eat here frequently since it's only 5 minutes up the road from me. I can go pickup a large 2 topping for under $9 tax and all, there's not any other pizza places around town where you can do that. I haven't tried any of their other food as I'm perfectly content with pizza. They've got one of the best marinara sauces I've ever had and their mozzarella cheese sticks are mouth watering.
If you haven't caught on yet, I'm a big fan of this place. I highly suggest you go try it out if your around town. You can do take-out/delivery/or dine in. They have a good size dining room with servers who tend to you. If you go on a weekend sometimes they have a live band or singer on the stage. That's right,  they have a small stage as well. Good times. Go. Try. Enjoy.  -TnT-

Good place for a beer or inexpensive lunch or maybe a wildcat game. It's bar food. Cool that is a Navy and SEAL themed and your supporting a vet. If your looking for a bar is a good option. 

Burgers used to be awesome but then they were hit and miss so I have since given up on them. I don't like wasting my cheat meals. So I usually get the chicken skewers app as a meal for my healthy choice. 

I do feel the food has been inconsistent, seems like product gets changed a lot like different buns, fries. But the service is always good, great servers. One of the bartenders used to pour a great guiness.

Really wanted to like this place, but sadly, I dont like anything about it. 

We ordered four rolls off the specialty rolls, and they were mediocre. And VERY VERY SMALL. 6 tiny pieces to be exact on these rolls, execpt for one that was 8. Such skimpy sushi. $42 for a bland meal. Unfortunate.

First time I've had dinner here, and I can't say enough about how much I love this resturant! The service is outstanding, the food is fantastic and the abiance is warm and inviting. Dinner for one with two glasses of wine is $50 so come prepared  ... but if you need a nice night out this is the place!

I've come here twice since first writing my review, as recently as 12/12/15. I stand firmly by my initial assertion that this is the best restaurant I've been to in Philly. How is it possible that the food can be even more delicious every time? I don't know, but Khmer Kitchen makes it happen. My sister and I got the fried calamari again, the weekend special which was a coconut curry soup situation, the lemongrass beef stir fry made extra spicy, and the caramelized pork. Sigh. Just wonderful. This time the lemongrass beef was tender and delicious! And wow...they weren't joking about the spice. We might have to go down a few spice levels next time. Basically everything I wrote before about the dishes we'd already had rang true this time as well. The surprise was in the weekend special. Wow...it was everything we didn't even realize we needed. The flavors were complex, warming, with a hint of sweetness and spice. I loved the giant, soft chunks of potato and carrot. My goodness, it was delicious. 

I love this place. I will take everyone I care about here, and you should too. 

Oh yeah, our waiter is always awesome! Really attentive and doesn't mind that we ask for a million bowls of rice :)
Awesome place to get drinks and watch free live music. A nice spacious bar upstairs with a lounge style room. Nice live music thu, fri and Sat nights.

Went here mostly because it was near where I parked and I had a craving for Chinese food. So I went in not expecting much. But it was really good! And very reasonably priced. What I wanted was not on the menu but they accommodated my request. I'll go back!

Be warned - I have a limited perspective of the menu. I went here for Happy Hour and just ordered a side of fries. I was not too impressed. The fries seemed overcooked and soggy (and at times burned). The upside is that the side came with A LOT of fries, so you can easily make a meal out of it. I tried the blueberry cornbread, which was good - but it was a little dry for my tastes. The mac and cheese was a solid option though. This place seems to be known for their drinks/burgers, so it might be worthwhile to come by to try that.

No shortage of great chow in NOLA. My primary stop has always been the Bon Ton Cafe-still great and will continue but Ron's is now a new go to for me. This place is the real deal. Chef Ron is cooking and looking at you as you eat. Your not happy, he is not happy. The balls are the best, jambalaya & gumbo were better than any I recall. I so wish that I had had room for dessert-next time. Strip mall space, unassuming but if you want great food-find this place. Food 5 , Staff 5, Stuffyness 0

I heard friends talk about the food here but I just never tried it out bc maybe I was scared maybe I was just lazy bc it is in the county. But man, when I did go the first thing I ordered was the fried tilapia and jollaf rice. It was so good. Came right out.piping hott and so authentic. I thought I had landed in Africa with my first bite. So I continue to come to AP about once a week and I have since then had just about everything on the menu and off. For first timers I would recommend the beef, jollaf rice, and plantains. So good. And I'm telling you once you eat it you will get periodic cravings which you will just have to fill. I really enjoy the place and it really feels like a little family when you walk in. Everyone is so friendly and the staff is pretty great.

Pulled in Sunday for dinner. This would have been our 3rd visit. Was greeted by an attendant who said their parking lot was full (though there were about 10 empty spaces) - was told "sorry". Pulled around and saw another guard and he suggested we find public parking somewhere. I asked why couldn't we park in the empty spaces he said because those were saved? We've been their before and the food is decent. The fishtank is the awesome. But this service is not what I would expect from a nicer restaurant. Sorry to say, I'll be scratching this off my list.

The food was really good I got the fried shrimp tacos and that sauce was to die for. I also tried the carne asada tacos but they weren't as good. The waiters were so nice and it really is a great place to eat.

Wing Stop, is one of the most affordable meals, that Reno could offer a college student. The meals are not that expensive. For example you could buy a meal with 10 wings, any two different flavors, with a basket of fries. The meal is cooked, right when it is ordered. And it should take up to about 14 minutes to prepare the meal. So you know the meal is fresh. 

The service that the employees provides make you feel as if you are in a family oriented environment. The environment is very clean. They clean up after everyone that leaves, 

THis is a great place to go
Food is great and fresh!! Love it here!  Servers are a bit slow at time but that wouldn't stop me from coming back!

How can everything on their menu be so flavorful? But more importantly, who cares? It simply is! At this point I believe I've tried 4 different kinds of their tacos, the chicken tortilla soup, cowboy beans, rice and black beans, all the salsas, guac, and their "almost guilt free" donuts. I'd honestly be hard-pressed to choose a favorite anything. 

Also, despite a poor first experience due to a corporate happy hour taking place while I was dining there, subsequent visits have been quick, courteous, and pleasant! I was in and out in an hour when taking a lunch break for work, even! 

When Nada found out about my lengthy wait times during my first visit they were extremely generous and provided me with a gift card to come back and try them out again. I couldn't help myself - I went back the day I got the gift card in the mail! You'd better believe I'll be back again soon.

Unfortunately our New Year's Eve was cut short due to food poisoning. Not something I expect at Creed's or any other fine dining restaurant!  Creed's used to be my favorite restaurant but something went seriously wrong with my last meal. I hope this was an exception to the normal quality that Creed's produces time and time again.

Sincerely,
A concerned customer

This has been by far the worst Boston pizza experience I have had in this city. Apon going for dinner with my family to celebrate my daughter finishing kindergarten. We were promptly seated. That was the only thing that was prompt. Our server hardly came to check on us. Our food was either under cooked or way over cooked. We would have added salt or pepper to our meal. However those basic things were not even at the table!!! I don't recommend this place at all!!!

I work one block away and unfortunately so I constantly have to go to this location The store manager is extremely nice and considerate but at the same time I have waited 15 minutes inside for a coffee and sandwich
The sangria is excellent. Just enough spice, not overdone. Do not miss the chance to have the stone crab bisque.

Our group of 4 came in on a Friday on this holiday weekend. The servers were great and attentive. We all wanted to try multiple samples of the beer, so decided on the Around the World Sampler. It was perfect for the 4 of us. The apps were good. We recommend the beer bread (dense bread with yummy dipping sauces) & the pretzel breadsticks were amazing. 
The portions are large. My group split 2 entrees. We split the prime rib sandwich with a side of potato salad and the other 2 split the mahi tacos with fries. People around us were ordering the mussels which looked good! Nice place! We would definitely go back!

Everything I had was amazing, and our entire group was really happy with what they ordered. Theresa was our waitress & she was fantastic!

I highly recommend the shrimp cocktail, the filet (Oscar style!) and their sea salt caramel ice cream!

We went to Muriel's for Sunday Jazz brunch. The staff was amazing and made us feel very welcomed. Even though it's a fancy restaurant, they still welcomed our 2 year old daughter and treated her very well. The drinks were excellent. The pork chop was the best I've ever had and that is not an exaggeration!

I've been in here a few times (always for brunch or lunch) and it's been pretty good. Sometimes service can take a while depending on how crowded the bar is and the last time I went, one of the bartenders was obviously not very happy about something but that's not enough to write this place off for me. 

Brunch is great, mimosas are really good and I've had the crab cake benedict and a breakfast sandwich before, both were awesome although I wish the portions were a little bigger, maybe. I tried some of their pressed cocktails over the summer and they were great, it convinced me to buy a french press so I could try to make some at home!

Came here today to pick up a delicious dinner. I got a side order of babaganosh and 6 falafels. Babaganosh came with delicious pita and was tasty and creamy. Falafel was tasty and crispy. The tahini sauce was very good as well. This was my first time here. The restaurant has a very nice feel with cute tables and very friendly staff. I will be back.

I used to order to-go twice a month from Spitale's about 2 years ago and thought their lunch fare was solid. Unfortunately, I went back to Spitale's on two different occasions recently and the food has gone downhill. The first time I went back, I ordered the Red Beans and Sausage lunch plate...the beans were beyond bland and the sausage was tough and rubbery. I could heat up Blue Runner beans and cook sausage at home and it would taste better than the $12 lunch platter that I bought. The second time I ordered a salad to go. I know, ordering salad from a deli is dumb, but it's hard to screw up a salad. The veggies were soggy and the chicken was flavorless. I don't think I'll be ordering from Spitale's anytime soon.

Let's start with the good.

The food was really good. Here's what we had:

Blue crab and corn fritters- The tarragon aioli was delicious and paired well with the fritters. The crab flavor was strong and the corn had a good bite to it.

Gumbo- M liked it more than me. He remembers liking it more last year. Not a big fan of all the okra.

Shrimp & Grits- Yum! I liked the heartiness of the grits and the sauce was tasty. Good amount of shrimp.

P&J oysters- I didn't have any but M like these a lot.

Now onto the bad. Our waiter was never really around. After having the fritters, we were served the oysters but our table didn't get cleared of the empty basket of fritters. After the our entrees came, the basket of fritters,the oysters, and dirty appetizer plates were still sitting empty on our table. We had not received the gumbo we ordered so someone else (still haven't seen our waiter) brought it out. 

When Matt was 80% done with his main entree, our waiter finally came to check on us and asked if we needed anything from him. Uhh... Yea! How about clearing the table? Or checking to see how our food was because maybe then he would have known we were served our last appetizer after we were already served our entree. 

Food was great, but the subpar service tainted the experience. We did let a manager know on the way out. If our server was around we could have told him too.

I have a favorite sushi place that unfortunately is not very close to me. I've tried finding one a bit closer that would compare with no luck. Until I tried Masami. I love this place, and the fact that they deliver makes it even better. It's not the closest place to me, yet they still deliver to my house and in a promptly manner. There's a lot of options, and I find most are really good. I highly recommend the spicy kani salad. That is both mine and my sister in law's favorite. The pork dumplings are really good. My mother in law is obsessed with the bbq squid. It's hard to pick a favorite roll. I like just about everyone I have tried.

Great quality cuban food ! One of our regular lunch places, fast and easy service. We never wait long to order and get our food and everything always tastes amazing ! We found the place very clean and the staff very professional and pleasant!

Woodlands is EXCELLET! From the Sunday buffet to the many selections on the menu.  I have been there at least 15 times in the past 3 months and I'm also ready to go again.  

Warning for the meat eaters (like me): This is a vegan restaurant with a lot of curry selections.  This place was a great new place for me and made me open my eyes to vegan cuisine.  :)  

-Shaun

Ordered delivery from a hotel that was close. Very quick delivery, food was hot and good. Ordered pizza, breadsticks, and kids cheese ravioli. My 8 year old ate all of her ravioli, and a breadstick. Would order again.

Ordered 2 Prime burgers at the bar.  Cooked Medium.  Waiter delivers saying they are past medium, but here this one is less well than the other one.  HUH?  I certainly hope this does not happen in the restaurant when you are ordering pricey steaks.  They are thin so I can see medium requires watching.  Based on this experience I would not return to try  the restaurant.

Came in from out of town. Huge menu. Got the blackened chicken sandwich as recommended by the owner. Fantastic.  Jerry (the owner I think) was super friendly. Everyone was for that matter. Cool place.

The blandest food I have ever eaten. It's like hospital food. The only thing worth eating is the marinated peppers they serve before your meal (for free). After the yummy peppers, the meal is that much more disappointing. This place is literally around the corner from my house. I would love to have a decent restaurant within walking distance; unfortunately, I don't.

In addition, the bar in back has a distinctly unfriendly vibe. People look at you like you're invading their space when you walk in.

This is our absolute favorite place to go out for breakfast! The thirty minute drive is always worth it. 

Although sometimes the service can be slow because they're always slammed, the coffee and food always make up for it.

This bar has a great relaxed atmosphere. Good beer selection although sometimes their draft offerings seem a bit dull. The food is excellent, I've had the grilled cheese, bratwurst, and the reuben and all have been excellent.  You can tell the cooks care about what they are serving.

We eat here every time we come to Reno. We love the atmosphere, food and drinks. Usually  a hit or miss with the wait staff. Last night however we had THE ABSOLUTE BEST WAITRESS BY FAR!!! JORDAN I believe  was her name ( sorry I forgot after the 3rd beer)please forgive if that's wrong. Talk about "royal treatment " she was AWESOME!  I didnt even get this kind of treatment when we ate her in January  for my birthday!  My hubby and son noticed some food  items were gone from the menu and she explained  to us about the new head chef. She asked us what we  usually order and made some suggestions  to try. I ordered my beer (wildcard)and she asked if I had tried any other brews from the menu. I showed her the ones I had tried and she asked if I wanted to sample any others(no one ever asked me that). 
Yes please! Big Dog IPA is my new fave!
The food was also delicious. My daughter,son and I ordered  pizza and salad. My husband had the street tacos. All were equally delicious. Decent  prices & good portions Of food. I had to take mine in a container as I was full from the beers. We all walked out happy and full ( and kind of buzzed). I made sure to leave her a good tip. We will be back soon!

Another "Delco Proper" hotspot! 

The restaurant is totally 70's with orange vinyl booths, faux wood linoleum, wood paneling, etc. The place reeks of smoke, and the regulars monopolize all the counter seats (and they are not friendly people). The waitstaff is normally decent; it's a diner so don't expect much. 

It is crazy how this place is open 24-7 and someone is always there eating something. We once saw a family there at 4am who were talking about how they just finished driving home from a road trip vacation, and all they wanted to do was eat at Tom Jone's, and then go to bed. On Sunday after church it is crazy, and the line is out the door. When we were in our early 20's we'd often have parties and send the late-night people to Tom Jones for some food to sober up. They always loved it. There is something about the atmosphere, reminds me of "Pulp Fiction" somehow, in a vintage way.

What to eat? BLUE RIBBON, Baby! Last time we bought... for $3.89 you get: 2 sausages + 2 bacon + 2 pancakes + 2 eggs + OJ + coffee + 2 slices toast !!!!

It is always done FAST and it's always decent diner quality.

Brookhaven is dry so don't expect any booze here.

It sucks, but CASH ONLY!

They have a walk-up pick up window on the side, but any time we ever did pick up they never used it.

(This place is so Delco, Tommy Pope's gotta know about it... hopefully we may see a rendition of it in his Comedy Central "Delco Proper" webisodes.)

Very consistent, which is important to me... I am picky and the owner makes my Greek salad the way I like it (even though he looks like he is not happy about it) :) ....I have had several items on the menu, and everything is delicious.  The salad dressing is unbelievable... (sold by the bottle, also)
Mediterranean wrap, Pasticcio, Greek salad(either size) and the gyro's are 5 Star..
Listen ... it is Greek business, so order the Greek food, but the pizza was pretty good also..
2 for Tuesday is great...mix and match, with a great assortment.. my order has never been wrong...

Wonderful dining experience all around. Attentive service (Diana was amazing), casual atmosphere, and delicious food. We got the ribs, chicken bruschetta, crab ravioli, and the chicken Valdostano. The ribs and Valdostano were our favorite but everything tasted great. Looking forward to coming back!

Great find ... Though I grew up in Tucson, we have lived in San Diego for 30+ years.  When we visit a few times a year, we try out local diners in the area for breakfast ... So we know that part of the Tucson landscape pretty well, and were very pleasantly surprised with this great find ... Definitely toward the top of the pack!

Good breakfast food (between the three of us we had the biscuits and gravy combo, a scramble and a walnut-banana pancake combo), great atmosphere and very nice staff.

Will definitely be back...

The hype would appear to be well deserved. Finally came here on a day off (Monday for lunch), and it was still pretty busy. But there was one parking spot free and several tables, woohoo!

I ordered La Mitraillette, and it was plenty of food for one person without a side. I also ordered a caramel granola shake (the special), which was fantastic, but the food was so heavy, I couldn't finish either. I also snuck a taste of my date's side of green beans with onions and bacon, which were also delicious. Both the burger and green beans were pretty heavily salted though, almost to the point of distraction.

Definitely don't go here for lunch if you need to be awake in the afternoon! #foodcoma

Service was okay. Several order issues, but corrected to expectations.  Gumbo had an off taste - burned roux is my guess.  Ettouffee was cold 1st try, but good on the remake.  The jambalaya was very good.  Oysters Rockefeller were very good, but not enough time to enjoy them since our dinner came fast behind -- that's my fault-- I know better than to order dinner at the same time I order my app. Overall, it was good, but not enough to compel me to go again.

Any pizza place that has vegan options makes my heart sing. 

This place is super cool, especially the decor, and they have a fantastic menu. The bartender/server was very knowledgeable about their vegan offerings (including their specialty drinks - I tried to order the michellada and he informed me the Clamato has oysters in it - GROSS!!) and was nice enough to make me a modified drink. 

The pizza was delicious and they had a ton of different hot sauces to eat your pizza with. Reasonably priced. Good service. 

A winner in my book.

Pros - Best place to people watch (inside and outside), BEST Bushwhackers (yum!) and a great place to just hang out. No need to get dressed up, just go as you are. You will see the most impressive mustaches there. The outdoor seating area is nice too.

Cons - Smokiest bar in Nashville, food isn't that great - but who cares when the drinks are so good!
Great spot to eat and watch the Eagles. We had burgers and crab cake sandwiches. No complaints. Our waiter was terrific. Would define rely return.

Very nice.  Clean,  good food.   Chopped wedge salad and brisket taco were great. Delicious rice.   The hot coleslaw was a bit mild.  Good selection of beers and they were really nice and handed out free donuts at the end of the night.  Would definitely stop again,  but I wouldn't call it authentic Mexican.

I was hoping this place would blow my mind. I studied the menu before we went more interested in the sides than the meat. I totally forgot to order the sweet potato fries. Ugh. I got the pulled pork nachos. My son got the ribs..still said my boyfriends are the best! I agree. My niece got the brisket and she gave this place a 7 out of 10. I have to say the atmosphere is divine and I want to go back for the beer flights.

What a fantastic surprise we had last night!   I had not tried this restaurant due to all the bad press when it first opened (chef walked out).  Now I am SO sorry I waited so long.   The food was amazing.   This is a high end Mexican restaurant that will not disappoint.

Very friendly staff and super tasty food! My boyfriend and I was visiting St Louis for a couple of days, and we went to this place twice. highly recommend ÁÜò‰∏âÊ†∑ and noodles! Staff is pretty responsive and good at multi-tasking. Â∞èÂì•ÁöÆËÇ§ÂèØÂ•Ω‰∫ÜÂìàÂìàÂìà

Great, prompt service and helpful staff!  A variety of the corporate boxed lunches (wraps and sandwiches) for a luncheon at work was ordered and got great feedback from everyone. They thought the food was delicious and liked that it was healthy (we opted for the pasta salad and fruit on the sides). A+++

I ordered the 3 piece chicken and waffle plate for $10, and while the price wasn't too bad for what you get, the food was nothing memorable.

You get to choose to have one item cooked into your waffle (blueberries, bacon, etc), but even with this I found the waffle to be average at best.  

The chicken was about as good as the behind-the-glass chicken you get at a grocery store.  

The atmosphere was fine, as they had a lot of sports games going on, but being a chicken and waffle place I found their chicken and waffles to be average at best.

If I had to return I would try something different.

I love the ambiance first off!  The inside of the Grand Ole Opry Resort is such a treat.   We sat next to a waterfall and just soaked it in.

The food was also really good.  I had the french toast and my husband had a traditional eggs/bacon breakfast.  The french toast is made with banana bread, which gave it an interesting flavor.  I love french toast and eat it everywhere I go just to compare.  I can't say this was my absolute favorite, but it also wasn't boring.  I'd eat it again for sure!   Just to have something different.

Their fruit cup was fabulous - really fresh fruit! 

The eggs and bacon were also delightful.  My husband said it was some of the best bacon he has ever had!   

And the service was stellar!   I highly recommend.

First time here. Called ahead and was seated within 5 min of arriving. I loved the decor of this place. There are cars in the building, the bathroom sinks are made of tires and the faucets from gas pumps. It really has a great feel to it. However, I was not impressed with anything else. I try not to bash service anywhere as I was a server and bartender for 10 years and I know how difficult the service industry can be. On that note, I'm sad to say that the service was very mediocre and the food was just ok. After being sat, we waited 15ish minutes to order drinks and then another 10 to receive them. It then took another 30-40 min from there to receive our food, making it an hour + from the time we were sat till the time we were brought food. Also, I got the spinach artichoke appetizer (which I give an A+!) AFTER the dinners were brought out. My first burger came out cold and well done. I do not like my burgers like hockey pucks. The manager made her rounds and I had to express this to her, which she immediately corrected. Because I chose to customize my burger, it was going to cost almost 22.00 to which I was surprised by when I received the bill! Fortunately the manager had taken care of it due to the mix up. If you order a burger here, pick one off the menu and customize that. It'll be cheaper. My oldest daughter also got a burger but she wasn't too happy with it because it was also well done. She just chose to suck it up and eat it. In the brighter side, My husband got the model A burger and he did love his. On the not so bright side, he also got a beer flight and they were out of quite a few of the beers he had chosen. My youngest two got children's meals and they ate them but they eat what we tell them to. The waitress seemed a little overwhelmed with all of her large tables and it was very loud so if you're looking for conversation, go somewhere else. All in all, it was ok. Not the worst I've ever been to, but certainly not the rest. My recommendation to Fords would be to hire more people or train them a little more. I might return to give it another shot at the husbands request, but it's not a place I'll rush to anytime soon.

After eating at this establishment several times, I feel I can fairly say it's a do it!

Cozy country kitchen feel and friendly staff make for a welcoming environment.  Although it appears crowded from the number of cars in the parking lot, there is seating on both sides of the building; I've never had to wait for a table.

I have only ordered the breakfast quesadilla as I'm one of "those" people who sticks with something she knows and likes, but my various breakfast companions have ordered food ranging from the chorizo burrito to eggs benedict to various scrambles and no one has ever had any complaints.  Coffee is refilled before you've even finished 1/3 cup, so it's always piping hot and fresh.

Definitely one of the better breakfast establishments in Reno!

I've been working in Whitestown, In for the last few weeks. My coworkers and I have found Carolina Grill and we all love it. We've got food from here the first two weeks of working here and will probably come here the next two weeks. I personally got the brisket entree and it's so good I probably won't try anything else.

We were visiting from Dallas to watch the Cards/Rangers series and visited here twice, b4 and after the games. Lots of selection at the numerous bars and a terrific staff. The food was great and the escape from the heat outside was welcomed. We had the pizza and nachos and both were delicious.

Hotel stay was fine but we left an iPhone in the room. Went back an hour after checkout to see if the phone was there and they said "sorry, there's no phone and nothing else we can do."  Called back an hour later and still no phone. I began yelling and threatening to call the police and after being on hold for a few minutes, the phone magically turned up. They are thieves. Do not stay here.

Stopped in for some good, yet inexpensive breakfast. 

Starlite came highly recommended by a friend of mine, so as I found myself hungry and in the area, I popped in. The place is super small, yet quaint and very friendly. I took advantage of one of the breakfast specials, 2 eggs, 3 bacons and homefries for $7. I felt bad paying so little,  especially after how good it was. I'm all about them homefries, and the cook does em up proper. 

My next time in, I found my go-to: the Greek skillet with a side of tzatziki sauce. Home fries, onions, peppers feta and gyro meat topped with eggs. Soooo good.

Food is outstanding, but the decor and service are deplorable. We were a party of eight on a Thursday night with a 7pm reservation, and the restaurant was a ghost town. The uncomfortable chairs with the dollar store seat cushions  were from an average reception hall, the table uneven because of the extended leaves transforming a square table to round and unless you are seated by a window, you could be in any average restaurant. The staff were dressed for a rodeo, clumsy and untrained, randomly picking up and dropping off dishes. The trendy, hipster manager spent more time smiling at his cell phone than engaging with guests. The average price of an entree was $35 with an a-la-carte option for salad and garnish. The only included item was the bread that was as fresh as the rolls at the box grocery stores.  Again, while the entrees were well above average, the rest of this experience is labeled a tourist trap and I doubt locals visit often unless they have a disposable income and overlook the lack of attention or concern to guest experiences.

I normally love this place, but tonight my Sea Bass was not thoroughly cooked and they had to take it back to finish. I didn't notice it was under cooked until after a few bites and then I told our server. She completely agreed so that part was not a problem. I was just surprised that they took the fish off my plate and back to the kitchen to cook further instead of taking my entire plate. Having the rest of my food and my utensils on the plate with under cooked fish made me nervous. I also was surprised that they didn't offer some sort of complimentary food or price break. When the Sea Bass was returned to me it was over cooked. Not horrible but enough that it was somewhat dry and tough. I will probably never return to Brophy's after this experience. I also sampled the clam chowder and it was very salty. I think this restaurant has gone downhill. Too bad. It used to be a great restaurant known for their freshness.
Doorman Wellington was legit, great guy. Kind, courteous, and great recommendations for a family holiday on bourbon street  would come again just for this guy.

I'm not one to go out of my way for a cup of coffee but I was out early running errands and decided to try someplace I've been eyeballing. I'm very picky about my coffee. The coffee was AMAZING. I got the boys treats too,  Nutella pop tarts and yogurt with homemade granola. I'll definitely go out of my way to go back.

This place may be a very commercialized taco spot but it is dang tasty! My go tos are the fish (fried), shrimp (grilled) and carnitas (there's black beans on it, SOLD!) 
Discovered this little gem on a trip to the new target in the area and because I love tacos decided to make a trip in. 
It's got beach, sunshine, and corona with a lime vibes that come at a decent price, depending on what you choose. I usually round out around $12. Presentation is great whether you dine in or take out. 
This maybe a weird note, but the water from pop machine is CRISP and delicious and they have some specialty brand of pops. 
I give this place two thumbs up in a Philly sea of just okay taco joints! Not super authentic but the flavor is there. And that definitely counts. If you're close to Fairmount/Spring Garden drop in!

My husbands family hosted our Rehearsal Dinner here in June.
The food was incredible, the service was quick, and the catering room was perfect for our event!
The menu consisted of salad, chicken marsala, veal parm, pasta, and veggies. They were so accommodating!
I accidentally left behind an item I needed for day of the wedding and they set it aside for us and were so grateful for our business. I loved it!

I've always enjoyed the food at Olive Garden. I lot of pretentious types out there like to point out how it's not as authentic as their college trip to Italy or whatever blah-blah "hey look at how well traveled I am" nonsense, but in all truth the quality of a meal, in my estimation at least, lies in the enjoyment of the food - not how accurately it can be paired with its inspirations.

My wife and I ordered the endless pasta bowl specials along with some fried calamari. The food was tasty and pleasingly filling.

With that said, the 5-Stars here are really for our server, Shelby. She was a fantastic ambassador for this company, taking outstanding care of my wife and I, balancing friendly and engaged with attentive and thorough expertly well. I certainly hope her management appreciates the quality workmanship she applies to her job.

We were excited about this place but the service seemed a bit chaotic. We were forgotten about in the beginning as we were told we could wait outside to be seated so we sat near the outdoor heaters at a dirty table. The table was cleared but never wiped down and our names never called.

After we were done eating and plates cleared we sat outside for a good 15 minutes for our check.

Went inside to ask and pay and it took three people to figure out that our ticket wasn't in the system or even an Im sorry for the inconvenience.

Ive worked in retail and food industry for over a decade and am aware of errors happening but this seemed unprofessional and unempathetic towards your customers who's first time it was visiting. Not a great first impression for me. I also do not want to be called "sis" or "babe" from my waitress. Very cringy.

My pancakes were amazing though and so was my mimosa so Id give that 5 stars for sure!

I hope the service can be a bit more professional and more of an I care about my customers time and service attitude.

I was on my way to basic training and decided to stop here for a last meal. To start the staff is very friendly. It's a clean establishment though I didn't enter the latrine so I can't say how clean that is. The environment is nice and I won't be too harsh on that considering they don't have much space to work with. Now onto the food! I had the Chicken Yaki Soba and a Dr. Pepper. The dish was very good and everything was cooked perfectly but they could have put a little more chicken in it. The Dr. Pepper sort of tasted like dish water. My fiance had the Shrimp Yaki Soba and being the typical guy I am I stole some of her shrimp. It was good so I can recommend that as well. All in all it's not a bad little place to eat though it is a little pricey for the amount of food they give you. I would eat here again given the chance though.

There is almost always a 2 hour wait on the weekends, and for good reason! This place is delicious. Definitely need to use the wait in line app to put your name in so you don't have to just wait outside for 2 hours. The food is always good, I never get the same thing and have always enjoyed everything I've ordered

Ordered dinner from here recently. I wasn't really a fan of my meal, but I was definitely very happy with the service. They labeled everything and made it all nice and neat and individually packaged so it was easy to distinguish what was what, which was GREATLY APPRECIATED.

As far as the food, I would say I probably wouldn't order it again. I got the spinaci insalata ..... spinach salad with chicken and bacon and a bacon dressing, candied walnuts, and more...

The combination of savory and sweet wasn't really appealing to me, but it normally isnt so I guess I wasn't surprised. I just really didn't like that dressing!

*AVOID AVOID AVOID*

My girlfriend and I went here for lunch while we were in New Orleans on vacation.  We ordered our meal and then waited for ONE HOUR.  OUR FOOD NEVER CAME.   We eventually left because we were on a schedule that day to return home.  

One of the few restaurants that I have ever walked out on.  The manager never approached us to update us on our food or to apologize, he just sat at the bar typing into his cell phone.  The (green) waitress we had kept coming over and shrugging her shoulders telling us that she didn't know what was going on.  

A horrible experience.

Awesome food and comforting atmosphere ! Chef Ron himself greets customers when he can and made conversation with us ! The gumbo is great  as well as the fried chicken !! Overall the food is really good. It's a small restaurant though, and parking is kind of tight.

I've been here a bunch and always had a good time.  I have never taken a tour, but definitely want to do that soon, as well as their tasting room.

You walk into a fairly large and open seating area, with a bar in the back.  For being a brewery, the seating area is pretty small, and gets tight with the pool table and shuffleboard.  It makes sense that they're moving to 5th and Spring Garden and I'm extremely happy they are, and can't wait to see the new digs.

Every bartender I've spoken with has been pleasant and everything from the Brawler, to the Pale Ale, to the IPA, is tasty.  Most recently, I got a flight of their different holiday-themed beers and they were all great.  You can't go wrong.

Overall a fun spot to chill, but beware, it gets crowded on rainy days.  With the new location coming later this year, I'm hoping for a larger area to hang, drink, eat, and play games.

I'm from out of town and needed a Tampa location to put on a high-end reception for approximately 100 people. Thankfully I stumbled across Jackson's. They were easy to deal with from the start, showing me around despite me popping in without even a phone call. And then when working with them over the phone and email, everything was straight-forward and helpful. The event went off without a hitch and the staff was ready for anything and everything. Everybody was willing to help, regardless on if it was their "department" or not. They saved me when my ipod stopped working; they took care of proper sound for presentations and even climbed up on a chair to cut down a banner I had hung. I highly recommend Jackson's for any sort of event - with the Waterfront Room being a top-notch location for a fun and memorable event.
I have never had a bad experience here. The food is always delicious, the service is great even during a lunch rush and the beer is great too!!

I was a big fan of Shogun in another state. I wasn't sure if this was the same or a totally different restaurant with the same name. Luckily, it was excellent. My favorite part of Shogun is the fried rice. I'm not sure what they add differently, but it's ridiculously better than anywhere else I've eaten. 

The steak was cooked like I asked and the rest of the meal is how you'd expect at a hibachi place. The sushi we ordered was great as well. 

I'm taking a star off for a few reasons. First, it's more expensive than hibachi places in the area. Second, the salad dressing was a little runny. Lastly, I'm not sure when noodles started to become a regular thing, but I wouldn't mind if they went away.

We visited for dinner on the recommendation of a local; the Salsiccia pizza was delicious - fennel sausage, roasted fennel, slightly charred crust.  A small was the perfect amount for 2 adults to share, although the waitress tried to upsell us on a large ("I can eat a small by myself").  The salads that we saw nearby patrons eating looked great too. Seating is communal - large picnic tables and bar seating (both by the bar and the pizza oven).  Open view of the pizza oven was entertaining!

We just moved to Boise from Ca.... We Lovvved our Poway Original Pancake House... And didn't think we would find one out here... We are Sooo glad we were wrong! We've only been in Boise a few weeks... And have already been to the Original Pancake House 2xs!! We Love the friendly staff and incredible food!! 49er flapjacks are the same as they are in Ca!! Consistency is hard to find nowadays!! OPH is our go-to breakfast spot!
The best sushi restaurant in the Tampa Bay area (well, it's my favorite--and I eat a lot of sushi).

Our second try at lunch today was a success!!  Ate off if their lunch pick menu and had a good appetizer, salad, half sandwich and fries.  Plus they had some local beer on tap.  Overall, good service and good food.  I recommend this establishment.

My place near work in DTSP. Enjoy a range of tasty treats for breakfast, lunch, and snacks. You can even have them customize what's on the menu if you are following a certain eating style...just ask...I enjoy a version of the Protein Scramble for breakfast...the fruit cups and veggie cups are great for snacks or a quick lunch. Glad they're neighbors!

I hosted a Breakthrough mixer with over 130 business professionals in Reno at Coach's. The staff was great with taking care of the set up and providing friendly service. They did a super job following up before the event to make sure it was successful.
Great food, great service, will be coming back!! They're more than the average pancake house :)

Very cozy and beautiful breakfast / brunch / lunch place in Zionsville. Finding parking was easy. For those preferring outdoor seating, they have an outdoor patio with umbrellas and nice floral decorations. Inside, the place has amazing chandeliers and other thoughtful interior touches. It looks and feels very home-like. 

Food was great, too. We ordered The Lemon Bar Breakfast Plate and and everything was delicious. You must try their Italian soda - there's nothing better than that on a hot summer day. Our server was friendly and attentive and we didn't have to wait long for our food. 

Lastly, their prices won't break your wallet and you can also get some fresh cupcakes before you leave. 

This place became one of our three favorite brunch spots in addition to The Garden Table and Cafe Patachou. Definitely coming back and would recommend to friends.

Electric atmosphere, creative artwork, attentive service and excellent ownership....and that's all without even getting to all of the impressive, ultra-delicious food items and multi-layered drink menus that you get to enjoy while in one of my favorite eateries in all of Tampa! 

non posso aspettare la mia prossima visita, ben fatto Jeff!

The kids wanted milkshakes so we headed to the premier location for milkshakes in Reno/Sparks. We ordered cheeseburgers, fries, and milkshakes (Vanilla for them and Marshmallow for me, a departure from my usual Pineapple). The burgers were fresh and tasty and the milkshakes were delicious as always, not to mention thick enough that my forehead almost caved in trying to suck it up through a straw! We solved that problem by working on them with spoons until they had melted a little. Overall a wonderful meal enjoyed by all of us.

BEST CATERING SERVICE EVER!!!! If I could rate this greater than a 5 I would!!! I have ordered catering for many events in my various positions and companies. This location, by far, was the cr√©me de la cr√©me on every level. Customer service was beyond superb. An 11!!! Bradley, Manager, was the most helpful, friendliest, informative, patient catering manager I've ever had the pleasure of doing business with. Seriously thought I was speaking with someone from Nashville, TN (as many Southerners are very hospitable and kind). Not only did this stop with the order but continued when I updated our order to the day of the event. They called ME! to check if I was still picking up at confirmed time, so they could place the chicken in warmers to be sure we got a fresh and ready batch!!! WOW!!! Then...the FOOD was perfection!!! Everyone at the event asked where this was from and raved about it. Generous portions and sizes. Great value for the price! Thank goodness we had some leftover for the guests of honor to take home for out of town guests and to indulge in one of their favorite foods (specifically from this establishment). Go here or order from here. You will not be disappointed!!!
FYI: Heard they're opening another location in Broad Ripple ;)

The shop is pretty neat, you have the option to order meals and also have the option to get food from the butcher. The variety of meat from the butcher is extensive and very good. The steaks and burgers are very good. My only complain being the truffle cauliflower gratin we ordered was ridiculously salty, I couldn't eat it. I will have to try more sides in hopes it redeems.

I always go to this place to pick up lunch. It may not be obvious but you can order to-go and they get food ready really fast. The owners are quite friendly. 

I love most of their meat sandwich (esp. Shawarma) as well as Hummus with meat appetizer (I can just eat that alone for lunch.) 

Overall, my takeout experience is much better than eat-in meal, mostly because of their service. Last time I had lunch there, our server didn't quite understand English and it took him forever to bring us our bill. I was disappointed. 

They do have minimum $10 credit charge. So if you ever plan to go there just for a sandwich, remember to bring cash!

Yes when we arrived the line was long.  We had a drink in the bar.  ICE COLD beer!  We got our table and soup and salad were fine but really no WOW factor.  I ordered the sirloin and lobster.  The steak was so tender it melted in my mouth!  Lobster fresh and totally delicious!   My boyfriend got the filet.  Really.a nice size piece and also so juicy and tender!!  Our neighbors got the filet and also chicken and shrimp.  Yummy!  We all had leftovers and it tasted even better the next day.  Highly recommend and just be patient to be seated.  Well worth the wait!

I've bee here several times and have always had a great experience. 

This morning my wife and I took our dog on a walk along fourth ave and decided to grab breakfast here. 

We like this place a lot because they allow dogs inside! We have a small dog so we thought it wouldn't be obnoxious for us to bring the dog in. 

The servers/order takers are always nice with good attitudes. Always. Maybe it's because the place is just a fun place to work. 

Their food always looks good. But today I ordered hot food. A breakfast burrito with ham. My wife got one too. The burritos are so big! Think Chipotle size. 

I really liked mine and my wife liked hers. 

I ordered a regular coffee and my wife got an almond milk latte. We got them in "for here" cups. I should have asked for to-go cups. 

The food came out relatively quickly. It was hot, fresh and yummy. 

The place also got pretty busy. I like the atmosphere inside, the workers and their dog-friendly policy. 

I'll totally come back!

Almost always get the Udon noodle salad but the burritos and everything are pretty solid. The only complaint is that the final product is always very inconsistent. Sometimes the salad will be drowning with dressing and the next time there will be barely any dressing. But service is friendly and atmosphere is nice and hipster.

An alright bar for when i am hanging out in the CBD. Nothing I would ever go out my way for. And I would also only go earlier - I completely agree with  Jessica R that it turns into the Boot for adults if you stay too long.

Sheri Punjab is deliciano. Tandoori chicken is good so is  the aloo matar. Since we were kids, we ate there off and on. The waiters always fill your beverages really quickly. The food was ready quickly and delicious. I would highly recommend Sheri Punjab to all who like this type of cuisine.
Looooove this little place the airport!!!! Can't wait to go back to it. Love the cafe con leche and their egg and cheese on Cuban bread sandwich !

The Crooked Tree is a nice little coffeehouse. They offer many drink options, and there are a lot of food selections. The breakfast items are pretty awesome. I always have some kind of eggs and meat (bacon or sausage) and it's very tasty and the portions are good. 

The service is so-so. The food takes a long time to come out, and when it's crowded you almost have to jump up right when they come out to keep someone from claiming your order. 

The place is small - very small. There's no way that a group could fit comfortably. The counter takes up about a quarter of the room. I just never know if there will be a place to sit on a weekend morning.

One of my favorite HH (3-6 pm) spots for oysters! The ambiance is very lovely and people are nice very. The first time we went we were seated right away and the 2nd time they were completely booked, but we were. Me to grab seats at the bar and ordered our food there! Great experience!

Totally overpriced. Sixty bucks for two  .  People $12 for a carne asada burrito a la carte and i even just had an appetizer!!  Presidente margaritas needed way more tequila...  service was excellent too bad food and drinks sucked

Great place! I was with a group of 4 others from out of town and we were looking for a good bar to go to-- at the end of the night we all left happy that we stopped in! We all had different drinks and meals and everyone loved what they got. From the drinks to the dinners and customer service--this place is top notch!

Got the BBQ hot dog.... AMAZING! King David's is my new spot for
Hot dogs!!!!
Food was very good. Had an 830 reservation and did not get food until 10pm. Our server was very busy and did not have the time. Once we complained, service was on point.

This is my favorite neighborhood restaurant!!
Treated like family with excellent authentic Mexican food. .  
Their creative daily "special" dishes are always great!!  The sea bass ceviche is a must have.

I have literally avoided writing bad reviews during COVID and have been deleting previous ones. But this is the one time I felt let down by Yelp. I came here expecting the 4.5 start experience and got something below mediocre even though we were hungry and would have been easy to impress. Firstly, yes it's expensive. But I have never had an issue with price when getting something worthwhile. The decor was not mind blowing and neither was the service. It was GOOD. Then comes the menu with "fattoush" and "tabouleh" labels and clear attempts to sound Mediterranean. Tabouleh had broccoli, there was NOTHING tabouleh about it. Would people call a bagel a croissant? Or a burger a philly cheese steak? That's what this place was doing. It is a little offensive to middle eastern people that food labels would be exploited to that level. There is so much room for creativity when it comes to modernizing traditional dishes but this place was just all over the place. Nothing made sense. The fattoush was literally kale and apples. Fattoush is traditionally a finely chopped salad with cucumbers, tomatoes, parsley, and toasted/ deep friend pita as the essential ingredients then it varies from one Arabic country to another but they ALL drown the salad with olive oil. This salad had no trace of olive oil or fattoush. We liked the idea of the carrot hummus but it tasted like bland pur√©e. There was no texture, it was so runny and just a major fail. I never thought it was possible to screw up hummus, but I guess I was wrong. The cherry on top was that the hummus isn't served with complimentary pita, we had to order a tiny pita. What are $2 for a fine dining type of restaurant? Why would you even charge your customers for bread? Customers who'd frequent these types of restaurants would be indifferent about an extra $2, but I know it simply does not reflect well on the owners. I wondered if perhaps the owners had ever seen people scoop out hummus with a spoon to eat it? I was very confused. That said, the complimentary side dish of fresh herbs, cucumbers and turnips was a nice touch. Secondly, 3 out of the 4 things we ordered were just drowning in dill. The menu had not mentioned the dill, but I felt like all I could taste was the dill. Garnish in Mediterranean food varies and dill is probably one of the least used herbs for garnish. The fish was the least offensive dish, (the one thing that is served with dill didn't have dill in it ) but the side of rice which had delicious chopped preserved lemons was drowning in an extremely salty scoop of butter. We had to dump the butter out to be able to enjoy the rice. I couldn't help but wonder if the restaurant had just run out of olive oil. Lastly, to use the restroom, I had to exit the restaurant, walk through a hotel lobby and use a beat up public bathroom. what kind of a 5 star dining experience makes you use a beat up restroom to wash your hands? I felt like this place was just a bit of a scam.  $100 for the two of us was so not worthwhile - I was genuinely upset for sacrificing my last meal in Philly to a place like this. In summary, if you're looking for modern Mediterranean cuisine, look up Illili (Manhattan), Albi (DC), or the following places in Philly: Zahav, Surayya, Cafe La Maude, etc.
Great donuts and boba!! It was packed when we went but that was expected for a Sunday morning and it was worth the wait!

Absolutely horrible, my pancakes & French toast were both burnt. Our server brought dirty glasses to the table for our mimosas, when I mentioned it - she stated "I tried my best to clean them". The wait was entirely too long for such a disgusting establishment. Wish I would've taken photos of my food before I sent it back. HORRIBLE!!!!

This place is GREAT! Food and Service. Our server Jessilyn was great, she was able to go along with our joking around and having fun. I highly recommend you trying this place out. 10 stars in our book!!

the lakeside is a great family style restaurant. the food is good and the serving are good sizes. pricing is reasonable. service is A+. tonight's special is a 1lb ribeye with frog legs for 30 bucks. it has a steady flow of people but not too busy
What a great meal.   The waitstaff was on par.   Had an absolute blast and lovely meal.  Thank you!

Just left here. Pizza was delish and a great price. The cheesy bread was also awesome. I would've given them 5 stars if it wasn't for the chicken wings. They are a good size and meaty but the 'Nashville hot' tasted kile they were dipped in sweet oil. Literally not a drop of heat/spice. The gentleman sitting next to us had the same and said the same thing. Hopefully they will change their recipe for those. Definitely reccomend though. Food was awesome!

Super delicious food! I ordered the steak burger. We came in with a group of 10 and they served us quickly. I called in advance for a reservation, you can also do that online. They are extremely celiac friendly, the manager even came to double check the order with my friend who can't even touch gluten. Our waitress Sara was amazing!! Incredibly friendly, quick, and organized! She checked on us frequently and was very attentive. Highly recommend for a more fancy place with great service.

The food was excellent, the service was great.

They have a salsa bar and always someone behind the salsa bar making home made tortillas, both corn and flour.

If you are in the market for some great Mexican food La Terraza is an excellent choice.

The mariachis were playing music. The bassist had a large visible sticker on his bass that read, "TIPS."

They got off stage and started interrupting couples who were dining apparently asking them if they had any special requests.
They asked me in Spanish so naturally I asked if any of the 3 amigos spoke English. 

The guitar player told me that they charge 20.00 per song. Naturally I lol...I have been blessed in my life with many concerts and when you break it down per song it is well worth the ticket.

20.00 per song? They must have thought that they were performing at the Madison Square Garden.

The worst customer service ever! Sure it was Thursday night and everyone was busy, but the attitude received from the employees was uncalled for. When I ordered 3 of the same thing, I thought that someone was gonna  jump over the counter and punch me. But when I added on one of the dollar tacos of the night I was made to feel like my presence was very unwelcome. She asked how I wanted it. I explained that it was for someone else. She snapped at me and said that they are made to order. I said that I did not know and to please make it like a taco. There were 4 employees serving the people. The 3 girls had some attitude that made me feel like I was putting them out. The young male was very polite and accommodating. I would just like to be greeted with smiles and friendliness every time. One of the girls is often there when we come in and always acts like she is so unhappy about being at her job. We spend a lot of money there and we aren't fussy people. It's not cool to be treated like that in any circumstance.

I just ate ice cream at 10 in the morning, and Mike made me do it!  

This quaint and cute, old-fashioned ice cream parlor hails back to the days when quality service mattered.  Each of their twenty-something ice cream flavors is "handmade" (although I'm not...quite sure what that means), and their frozen cappuccino is freshly composed each day, in house.  Pastries and touristy-treats are also available, although those are provided by outside vendors.  Service does take a little while, since each drink is made to order-- I guess you could say, "with love."  The ice cream is worth the wait, though!

Perhaps Mike knew that I was a tourist, or, perhaps I am just that cute *wink*, because I was served a scoop of Tennessee Fudge so generous that Texas would be jealous!  It was smooth and creamy, but not gluey, like some other gourmet ice creams can be.   I also sampled the Pistachio, Red Velvet, and Moose Tracks, which were also delicious.  

Yes, it was still so early in the morning that people were just barely arriving at work.  Didn't matter.  I was on vacation, and on vacation, what girl doesn't enjoy a fun and indulgent treat?

I used to work at this location and while I do love the Applebee's drink and food specials I do not feel terribly engaged . The staff is disinterested and rude most of the time. 

Fact is it's a chain and I'm not really into chains. Never have been. Never will be. But for the most part I don't mind coming in, throwing down a few dollars and enjoying friend's company.

I brought the boys here for an ice cream cone and we all were pleasantly surprised with their large, 3-tier play gym.

What was supposed to be a 15 minute visit turned into a 60 minute visit.

The place was clean, service was fast and the cones were OK.  

One negative: Maybe I'm used to how they do it in Las Vegas, but the ice cream on the ice cream cones were weak and pretty short.  We're all used to the ice cream being applied to at least x2 the height of the actual cone.

Aside from the nifty decor, I cannot say anything about the food, because I was never served. We stopped in for a quick lunch on a weekday amongst a crowd of business professionals. Ordering ceviche, soup and some nachos (none of which require much prep) we sat for 45min, with water and a basket of chips and salsa. We were not check on by our waiter once or told why the ridiculous wait for service. Ended up leaving with nothing...during week day lunch business, this place should be more receptive that people only have an hour to spare. No Bueno.

If you're craving Mexican and don't have much time, Panchero's is all you need. You walk in, stand in a line no more than 5 deep, and tell them what you want as you walk down the counter. 

I always get the burrito bowl since I can't have the flour tortillas.  Besides those, the only thing that includes gluten in the ingredients is the marinade for the chicken. So this is A+++ for Celiac's like me. =) and for anyone for that matter!

Ordered the BLAT (Bacon (THE BACON WAS AWESOME) Lettuce, Avacado, and Tomato) Sandwich - It was delicious.  Also had the sweet potato fires which were pretty decent, the sauce that accompanied them was really something.  Tasted like a spicy chili/honey sauce.....maybe even some Siracha in  there.  

I was the only customer that was inside on the rainy Tuesday I stopped in.  Service was attentive, but not overbearing, extremely polite, and the pace was immaculate in cleanliness.  

Wifi was a little lagging, or it could have been my machine, which I doubt, but ya never know.   Ill be back. 

4.5!

I now live in Florida but I used to be a faithful customer for years. I came back to visit the area a couple weeks back and I was thrilled after ordering the pizza...it was fantastic! Better yet, Chris, the owner, remembered our family. Drexel Hill Pizza is still our favorite pizza place!

Support local business!! Right next to yoga rebellion so I get smoothies here on the regular. Owner is nice, gets to know people that come in.  All I've had are smoothies (PBC is my shit) and the homemade muffins. I've heard the tacos are bomb, and sometimes someone's outside playing local music. Offerings are all made fresh and they also sell local products like handmade soaps, honey, etc. 

A little small but has outside seating. My smoothie is usually close to 7 bucks which feels on the expensive side for it, but doesn't stop me from continuing to buy them
One word - yum! Great service great food! We will definitely return to Cafe Ponte again and again. We have only dined for lunch so far and has been great every single time!

Words can't describe the fun I had!!!!!!!!!! Chef was so sweet, and so knowledgeable! Thank you for such a great time, and great food & conversation!!! And to get to talk to JFK who was from my hometown of Worth, IL! Just amazing!! Thank you and yes I will be back to pick your brain once again Chef!

5 stars all the way

Think of a Panera Bread , minus all of the processed crap food , where everything is made fresh to order and also is home made.  This place is very reasonable prices and the pizzas are A1.  

The soups are deep and rich , and made with high quality ingredient .  Forget chipotle , if you want a top level lunch at about $9-10 a head then this is your spot !

Great view , great service and great food. We had a beautiful view of the riverwalk while enjoying a pitcher of red sangria. I loved the fact they make it in front of you kind of like a Mexican restaurant does with guacamole. My husband had a Cuban sandwich which was big even for him. I had the special fish of the day which was plantain crusted and was served with a flavorful rice and sweet plantains. Bread is served on the side and it is warm n delicious ! Will definitely return!

I have never had chicken and waffles before, but I am damn hooked on this place.  I've already visited the counter a handful of times.  I had the fried chicken over the waffles plus the house brewed beer.  The staff was pretty friendly, the service fast and the fried chicken wonderfully battered, fried and crisp.  The waffles were fluffy, soft and so slightly sweet. According to the counter-man, everyone eats it differently, but he helped me mix up some crazy sauce: maple syrup+Sriracha sauce+Tabasco+Worcestershire Sauce.  I was totally comforted and hooked at the same time.  I know that fried chicken and waffles sounds weird but this place is totally worth visiting if you are in need of something adventurous.   Come with low expectations and leave having been comforted.
[note] the atmosphere is a bit noisy because it's kind of like a sports bar, but don't be put off, because the porch area is pretty quiet and when the games aren't exciting, the place isn't noisy, but is still alive and kicking.
I have:
Fried Chicken over waffles

What can I say that my fellow Yelpers have not already said. Great coffee, I had a latte with caramel. Was very good. I am not often in O'Fallon but do plan to stop in the next time I am in the area.

A 2 thumbs up for a recommendation.
I have noticed an immediate drop off in the quality of the dishes since the new sous chef was hired. What a disappointment. Let's hope they figure this out. I'm not going back in the mean time.

I have ordered from this place many times now probably almost once a week or so. I have always had a pleasant professional experience up till now and after today i am very upset and will probably never order from them again due to the way I was treated today. I called around 3 wed apr 6. I tried to order the "spinach alfredo" which was listed on the websites menu. The lady taking the order did not recognize the item so i was looking for my physical copy of the menu to see if it was on there (which it wasn't) then a very rude gentlemen with a heavy accent (who was apparently the manager) took the phone from her and demanded to know my order to which i said i wanted the pasta milano, he then repeated the order back to me very quickly and it didn't sound right and then he hung up immediately . well the order got to my house and it was wrong. It was the "pasta new orleans" which has shrimp in it which im deathly allergic to. I have worked in a lot of restaurants and normally i don't complain if the order is wrong and will just take it anyways but since it was shrimp i told the delivery driver i would not be able to eat it and i was not going to pay for it. He was kind and professional. He called his manager to see what to do, the manager asked to talk to me. Before i could explain he demanded that i pay for it since he had taken the call personally, he said "you did not know what you want i gave you what you want" i tried to explain  i would never in a million years order anything with shrimp. He would not listen, talking over me demanding that i pay for the order saying quote 

" F*** YOU I WILL CALL THE POLICE YOU ARE F***ING SH***Y CUSTOMER YOU PAY FOR THE ORDER" 

I have worked restaurant and service industry jobs for most of my life and buddy i gotta say don't say f*** at a customer is probably rule number one. Quickly followed by don't insult your customer... try to make them happy, quickly followed by make the extra effort for your regulars who are usually generous and have never complained before. I have never even thought don't call the cops on them because they are unhappy with their service was even eligible to be on the list of
What not to do but now im adding it to my list. 

So i told him ok fine go call the cops i would love to speak with them and i tipped the delivery guy a little extra for his having to be party to this and because i felt sorry for him that this a**hole is his boss. Well the cops haven't showed up yet i doubt they will but here is where it gets kinda creepy. The manager called my personal phone with his personal phone to tell me 'now you have my personal number' to which i responded "I don't need it" and hung up. so i feel a little threatened personally idk what kinda bad day this guy is having but i wasn't being irate or confrontational in the slightest with this guy at all. I didn't ask for anything free or compensation just simply 'i wont pay for that cause i cant  it sorry" and now he is threatening me? 

If anyone at Tazza is reading this i hope you realize you just lost a regular over this, that guy is not fit to be doing customer service and no one should be treated that way.

I was looking for a new place to check out for Happy Hour and my friend suggested Sub Zero. While the place is nice and service is great, I was tricked just a little bit. The bartender asked if I wanted anything for happy hour and opened the menu to a list of drinks. I asked what she suggested and she said the "chocolate caramel macchiato" (which by the way is amazing). Once I got the bill, I was surprised it was so high because I thought it was happy hour. Apparently that drink was not on the happy hour menu. In fact, the drinks that are happy hour are printed in the menu. She failed to mention that when she opened up the mine to the full price drinks :-/ 

With the exception of that little hiccup, Sub Zero is a nice after work spot to grab a drink at with friends in the CWE. The drinks can be a little pricey if you aren't drinking the specified happy hour selection. I'm willing to try it one more time.

Amazing place to get some good meats. Came in for dinner on a Friday night with 7 people  We got a bunch of starters for the group.  Then ordered the Delmonico steak special, the mixed grill for 4 and to top it all off the burger.  Everything was absolutely delicious! The burger was truly the highlight though.   Not recommended for anyone who doesn't eat  meat... vegetarians should stay away

Our favorite spot Oro Valley for Mexican Cuisine! Yummy salsa and chips and their spinach enchiladas are the best! Large portions and good guac! Ask for Renee for excellent customer service, he truly goes the extra mile to make his guests feel valued!

I have been to this marvelous local food-haven three times now.

Once with my wife who loved it & once with my 3yr old who loved it.
And they sure do have different tastes in food, if the Depot has both of them covered, then you'll find something to love, too.

The fish and chips are my favorite here in Reno, and I have even directed visitors from out of town (my father) here for the fish and chips. Their review is here : http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-depot-craft-brewery-distillery-reno-2?hrid=IeHMc0rfRgaFGG9ob9JWUg

-=-

I recently attended a Yelp Sponsored event at the Depot, where I had a chance to try the _amazing_ burgers and fries that this place offers, and I can now heartily recommend the Depot Burger to any omnivore or carnivore.
Lovely atmosphere, flawless service, jazz trio circulating around the restaurant.  Pork chop was delicious.  Do not miss Muriel's bread pudding... best you will have in NOLA!

I've dined at Keatings Rope & Anchor restaurant in the past, but was not impressed with anything, especially the service. It was not a place I considered returning to.  Since I was in Philadelphia with a friend for the day, I figured I would give it another shot and she may enjoy it. At first I thought to myself that I made a mistake by choosing to go there again. The server that greeted us didn't come back to our table at all, although I ordered a bottle of water. About 15 minutes later, another server named Maddie come over and and said she would be taking care of us. It was obvious that the place was busy and everyone was running around, yet she still took the time to make us feel important by being friendly, courteous and attentive. She was even helping people around her, cleaning tables, and talking to other guests. Maddie, this review is for you! You are amazing at what you do and certainly know how to give more than exceptional service!!! We will definitely be back to see you.
In a great location off poydrus near the 77 hotel Games laid back causal drinks off the hustle of Nola go early watch a game and play old school games bar food is average and affordable

I've been to this location as well as the Mt. Laurel one several times. I'm not sure if they are affiliated, but I have had good experiences at the Mt. Laurel location. I can't say the same about this one. The are a bit more expensive than most pho places in the area and they are not as good. Their broth tends to be very bland. The meat is usually very chewy. I also had their panang curry and was not a fan of it for the same reasons.

Old Fashion Italian Delicious! This place has every kind of Italian sweet your heart can wish for. This is always my after dinner dessert spot. I can never turn down a good cannoli and cappuccino! Also the tiramisu is to die for!

Best huevos rancheros I have had. Staff is very attentive and nice. My husband had one of the skillet dishes and really and blueberry pancakes and like them as well. The only reason I didn't give it five stars was because my hash browns and chorizo were mediocre at best.

Always excellent. I've been here many times and have never once been disappointed. The mushroom soup is absolutely amazing. It's a must try! The cafe and strawberry fields salads are also delish. The sea bass is good. I've also tried a special ravioli, which was amazing as well. Osso buco was amazing too but it's been many years since I've had it there so I'm not sure if they still have that one on the menu. The point is that you won't be disappointed no matter what you order!
Grant our waiter was excellent. Margarita was excellent. Oh, the scallops were amazing as well.

We are staying at the Westin and after a long day of travel ended up at Jacksons simply because of the proximity to our hotel. We sat outside which had a nice view of the harbor and the overhang protected us from the downpour. I ordered the filet mignon flatbread. It was absolutely mouthwatering. It was a filling portion filled with a blend of delicious flavors.  Would definitely go back except that I want to try many other places in the area. The only drawback from giving it a 5 star was the service was quite slow and the bathrooms needed some attention.

When I heard the name "Interstate Draft House," I thought it was going to be some behemoth-sized bar with a ton of beer options. I couldn't have been more wrong. Interstate is about the size of someone's apartment, and they offer about sixteen drafts. It was like stepping into any laid-back neighborhood bar, and that was just fine with me. 

My cousin, his gf, and I got there for happy hour. It wasn't terribly busy, we were seated right away, and our server was very nice. Happy hour, she explained, meant we could choose some bar snacks at about $3-4 and drafts on the board with a star were only $3. Yes, that's right: THREE DOLLARS FOR A CRAFT BEER DRAFT. Not everything was on special, but even the Rogue Chipotle (which is usually double the price) was included. We each went with different drafts: Dogfish Aprihop, Prism Shady Blond (a very local brew), and Bell's Oberon. 

We ordered beers and food. My cousin ordered the chicken tacos, his gf got the spinach-tomato pizza, and I went with the ancho honey wings. The chicken tacos, though just $2 each, came one per order, so he had to put in another order for a second. The spinach-tomato pie was the perfect personal size and the crust was super thin. It looked a little like a frozen pie, but I couldn't confirm that. My wings didn't have as much of an ancho flavor as I would have liked and weren't spicy. But there were six of them, they were on the larger side, and also came with some carrots/celery/ranch, so for $4 it was a great deal. 

Granted, it wasn't very busy, but our server never forgot about us and was ready to bring refills when we needed them. 

All in all, Interstate was a solid pick. I would like to come back and take more advantage of the super-cheap drafts on a day when we aren't busting our asses to get back home before a hockey game. They have two TVs at Interstate, but if you don't get a seat at the bar, you won't be able to see them.

*Also, I'm not familiar with the Philly mass transit so I can't comment on that, but we drove over to save some time and parking was super easy. We actually got a spot right in front of the bar.

Everything that we've had here, perhaps a dozen different dishes, have been great.  They clearly care about both the quality & quantity they serve which makes them a great choice for their location.  The homemade tortellini should not be passed up, specifically the veal (if you are a veal fan).  
The only criticism I have is that some dishes are better served with less pasta - specifically those with specialty sauces (seafood dishes in particular).  The parking lot is also a nightmare but they are making the best of it!

Update 7/1/2011
If you get pizza get the margherita, its excellent.  We've tried 3 or 4 different soups now, all good.  The eggplant parm is excellent however the veal parm was questionable - it was made with a VEAL PATTY??  This seemed odd to me.
Very good burger but small for the price. Obviously designed by a good chef that he is with a cool concept of regional themed burgers (e.g. New Mexico burger ...).

BEST. JAPANESE. FOOD. EVER. When I lived in Tucson I would go here about 3 times a week. The miso soup is the best you'll ever have, the Spicy Tuna Don volcano style w brown rice is so freakin delicious you can't really put it in to words when you tell others about it, and the spicy ramen..........sweet baby Jesus.....so good. I travel to Tucson from Austin, TX just to eat there for a weekend. The owners, the Fujimoto's, are some of the nicest, hard-working people you will ever meet. I've had some darn good Asian food in my time but Ikkyu is BY FAR some of the best. This place is for sure a hidden gem in Tucson and I kinda hope it stays that way...or they move out here to Austin, Texas :)

Smoked ham Benny- the hollandaise sauce flavor perfectly compliments the smoked ham. The eggs are over a biscuit. Everything tasted fresh. There aren't a ton of light options on the menu so be prepared to indulge if you go! 

Despite the temptation to head across the street to La Colombe after breakfast we enjoyed the coffee here  instead which is their personal blend from a coffee roaster in NY.   

If I could I would give this a 3.7 because I think more menu options are needed however the food was good!
Really great sushi place! My favorite is the Tampa roll. They have a very good urban vibe and a good lunch, takeout, and light dinner menu! Would definitely recommend

It was nice that they offered a veggie benedict and that they offered it on top of gluten free toast. However, when I think of benedict I think smothered in hollandaise and perfectly poached eggs. This place did neither. The eggs were overcooked so that the yolk was hard, the pesto hollandaise sauce was not impressive and they put only a small amount on top of each egg (it wasn't even enough to cover the egg). Maybe I just ordered that wrong thing, but I am not really inclined to go back.
