Yes I  loved it  I am  a fan of  there  shawerma. And the  falafel sandwich  taboly salad to  I am not sure if  they have  the  Jordanian  mansaf. But I am going to be  back  for  more things to  try

I went to 312 pizza yesterday with a friend. The atmosphere was decent. I went during lunch time, and it wasn't bust at all. Parking is street parking so don't expect to find parking right next to the place, but there is parking up the street. 

Our waiter was amazing, he was really nice and gave up time expectations on our pizza, which was very considerate of him. We had the pretzel appetizer, and the homemade pretzel sticks were soooooo good. The cheese sauce wasn't that great with the pretzel. I wished it was like Auntie Annie's spicy cheese sauce.... but the pretzel alone was yummy and I will definitely order it again.

We ordered the thin crust pepperoni and sausage pizza. It was a really good pizza for Tennessee. Did it taste like things crust pizzas  I've had in Chicago...which I've had many many times by the way... no its didn't. It wasn't in any way in comparison to the greatness that I've had there, however it's still a pretty yummy pizza. I do think the pepperoni was cut to thick.

The next time I go I will try the deep dish. I've had it once when I was a kid in Chicago and thought it was really really good...then I was scarred when Pizza Hut came out with a deep dish and I was in Chicago and my dad's best friend wanted to try it and ordered it, and it was horrible.... so I haven't tried any deep dish pizzas since... but I will go back to 312 here in the next couple of weeks and give it a try, because of the reviews on yelp about 312 deep dish.

I was going to give this place 3 stars because it's kinda small/awkward crowded for a brewery, the tour is OK not amazing compared to other Brewery Tours I've been on, and I only like one of their beers.
But then I remembered one key point: I don't like beer. 

I've spent 10 years trying to like beer and have resigned to be a sexy cocktail femme fatale instead of the cool down to earth beer chick. Which sucks, because being sexy does not come as naturally as the dirt under my nails. Buuuut the reason why I love this place is because of the Yards Brawler. Before Yards Brawler I was doing shameful things like ordering Snakebite and Bloody Ho's (beers mixed with framboise) and getting MOCKED for it. Now, The Brawler is my go-to order. My friend and I got the sampler pack a couple of years ago when we were young and experimental and it's like finding your favorite pair of jeans that never stretch out. You feel comfortable ordering it and people don't mock you-- in fact they mistake you for liking beer and being the cool down to earth beer chick.

Also this review is for the COMPANY which rocks a solid A in my books. They do so many things for the Philadelphia community (and beyond) that I love them. I mean this is the site where I've been to the MOST fundraisers oddly enough. haha! Love it!

It's Q'DOBA... Love the queso burrito, steak of course. Service was a little slow, but they were friendly. They have a DREADED Coke Freestyle machine(I HATE THOSE), but I am glad they have a bottled coke option. Overall, I will be back for another burrito sooner than later.

We were coming into town literally for one meal. Our plan A was crazy packed, so we found this place from Yelp! Anyway, super fun place. Our waiter turned out to be hysterical. He was straight forward about the menu, offered suggestions and answered all of our questions. He also interacted with my 2 year old, which was very much appreciated. 

The food turned out to be pretty good too! Our table tried the fries pickles (really good), the elk sliders, big boy fish and the ribs. The BBQ sauce was quite tasty- as was the ranch. 

It is certainly a place I would go again...just for the service!

Moe Joe's is a surprisingly delightful little breakfast place in Treasure Valley. The seating area is not very large- but don't let that fool you! They come through with serious flavor and quality in their food. My party of 4 ordered the Smokehouse Hash, Loaded Hash, French Toast, and I tried the Farmhouse Specialty. Everyone was happy with their food. The Farmhouse was a grilled biscuit (crunchy and a little tart- really good!), sausage patty, cheddar cheese, eggs and gravy. The gravy was the perfect thickness and saltiness. The house potatoes were also pretty good. 

I think this is the best breakfast I've had in the treasure valley. Very impressed with their food!

Interesting place off the main drag (Beach Dr) in St Pete, across from the marina. Small cozy place with a nice selection of craft beers. Had a bench right beneath the dart board, which tickled me to no end. 
We ordered a shepards pie and a bacon mac n cheese. Both were good. The smoke flavor on the pie was significant. I love that flavor and was ok with it.
Definitely will drop in again. Had a great time.
Absolutely delicious and flavourful.  Friendly service.  I had the lamb and it was falling off the bone.  The same for my wife's chicken.  We'll be back for sure.  A little gem.

Our server was very attentive and responsive.  The food is plentiful and the quality is delicious.  A nice benefit of the ambience is the following:

The 12 year old wants to know about Americana shown in photos on the walls.    

I recommend the following for 7th grade girls:

1.  The 'fredo is superb!
2.  Antipasta salad is magnificent.
3.  The fried Mac n cheese is out of this world.

Finally, I don't waste my calories on soda when I dine here.  I would rather consume complex carbs for my daily caloric intake.

But I do hope they serve gluten free pasta one day

Hugh improvement from the previous owner! Nice interior and music, friendly and helpful staff. I got exactly what I wanted without huge up charges for a small substitution. Everything came out nice and hot. If the bacon had been a little crisper it would be 5 stars. I had stopped coming but will now start coming back to this restaurant.

The best Reubens I've ever had. Corned beef, pastrami or both - it's all delicious. The beef sticks are good as well as all the knishes: New Yorker, potato, broccoli. The family is friendly, and the service is fast. The place is small, so there are no spaces for groups. 

Overall, the best Jewish deli ive been to so far in the area.

So yummy!!! We met locals and told us about this spot and went for our second breakfast of the day haha (we are big foodies). We wanted a carby breakfast so we ordered French toast , blueberry pancakes and banana pancakes - all so yummy!! GF available if you need it. 
Otherwise, place is super cute and has the nicest people. GO!  We are going back soon to try the rest of their menu :)

PNever in my life did I think I'd be eating at another fast food joint other than In N Out. 

My friend kept on raving about Chik fil A and now I understand why. It's just so fresh, delicious, and guilt free. 

One day I passed by and saw a loooong drive through line and decided to jump on the band wagon. 

I was surprised at how fast they were handling business. Pretty impressive being that they just opened. On top of that, every worker I've encountered has been nothing but nice and well informed. 

My favorite sandwich is the #2  spicy deluxe sandwich with Chick fil A sauce. It's so spicy, but in a good way. Eating the juicy spicy chicken patty along with the buns, cheese, tomato, lettuce and sauce is just the best. Everything is incredibly well balanced. 
I mistakenly ordered the regular spicy chicken sandwich without cheese, lettuce and tomato one day and it wasn't nearly as good. 

I was surprised at how fresh the chicken was. I could see the moisture after taking a bite out of it, just as when I cook chicken at home fresh from the market.

Chick fil A must have the healthiest, tastiest and smartest kid's meals on the planet. The nuggets are fresh and delicious just like their sandwiches. For sides they have great options- applesauce or a fresh fruit cup. Their fruit cup was legit. It had mandarin oranges, blueberries, strawberries and apples and everything was so fresh. I also love their drink options-milk or organic juice. To top things off, they include a fun educational toy such as I spy booklets or pop out assemble yourself animals. Doesn't get any better than that. Finally a fast food place this mom approves of. 

Did I mention that they have the best milk shakes ever? I never order milk shakes but they turned me around all right. Seems like they use real ice cream and fresh milk. Their Oreo and vanilla milk shakes are so delicious and refreshing. They use fresh crunchy cookies and  actual vanilla flavor. The thickness and cool mouth feel is just right too. They top them off with whipped cream and a maraschino cherry. 

Try all of their sauces!!!! Sooooooo good. The combinations are endless. I like the Chick fil A sauce the most but also like combining the ranch with the zesty buffalo.

I've been here more times than I can count because I'm truly addicted. I talked to many workers at every location I go to and all of them swear by Chick fil A, eating here while they're working and even when they're off the clock. That says a lot.

If grandma is Dominican, Cuban or Puerto Rican, you won't be disappointed.  It's not exactly as can be had in Miami but very close.  There is a Cuban and Dominican in the kitchen so the flavors are very close.  If you've never eaten Cuban / Dominican / Puerto Rican food, take the drive.  It's very good food.   Huge portions.   I don't expect the kitchen to be large and not built for high volume so a group of 15 plus a regular dinner crowd could have caused problems with food delivery.    There were four of us - not as fast as an Applebee's but then again, it's not an Applebees.    Waiters are college kids so they aren't familiar with the different plates available..

I don't like leaving poor reviews for restaurants, but unfortunately this location deserves one. 

You walk in and the only menu you can order from is a folded-up takeout menu that was somewhat greasy from previous patrons. The cashiers were cordial, but problems with the order either fell upon the cashiers taking the order incorrectly or staff making food improperly. 

I had multiple people in my party order everything from pizza to sandwiches to the wings and nothing was up to par. We were asked what sauce we wanted on the wings, but when the "wings" were served, they gave no sauce. When we asked them to fix it, we were given a dipping cup.

The sandwich was properly made, but it was somewhat undercooked and fell apart after the first bite. That could be the mark of a juicy sandwich, but in this case it was just shoddily put together.

The pizza itself was passable, but not terribly great for a namesake dish. The one silver lining had to be the drink machine, which really shouldn't ever be a silver lining for any situation.

The rest of the atmosphere was fine, if a little strange. There were an abundance of large TVs, but you would think at least one of them would be in Full HD (they aren't). The sliding glass door is always open, but I'm not sure why it was needed to begin with.

I don't know, it just seems like this whole restaurant just won't be worth most people's time. Yes, it really is that bad. Yes, you will probably regret it. Sorry to be the bearer of bad news, but that's the way Dan cooks his pizza.
Nothing really to say other than it kicks ass. The Alchemy bowl is the best thing on a menu of many stellar options.

So my honey suggested we try this & I AM DIGGING it!!  Such a nice place inside - yet the weather was unbelievable & here where it can get hotter than hades 3/4 of the year, you have to take advatage of this weather whenever it comes!!

Our waitress - super sweet & helpful as we were obvious newbies - showed us the drink menu explaining the juice bar - I decided to try the GInger Hopper ... YUM!!! that had a good kick to it (that was the ginger of course! SO VERY GOOD!!) & my honey got The Champ - very good too but no kick (no ginger duh!) :-)  - I dug them both!!

I got the Spanish Breakfast & my honey got the Huevos Rancheros - very good!! The back beans had a nice flavor to them - not plain but not overly spicey.

Can I tell you... I want more of that juice!!! mmmm!!!

4/9 - went back a week later (I have been craving that Ginger Hopper all week!!) & this time I got teh creamy oatmeal w/ carmalized apples OHMYGOSH!!! SOOOOOO GOOD!!! I also got a fruit bowl which I wans't abel to finish becasue the oatmeal was so very filling - sooo good!!!  Weather is still perfect enough to eat outside w/ a nice breeze & that GInger Hopper - I am addicted!!

My honey got a burrito w/ a side of creamy grits & really enjoyed those grits! He also had the apple spice juice & really dug that too!
yum!!

I went on a Monday evening, knowing it wouldn't be a good night for a busy eatery.  However, I was not disappointed with the food or service.  I enjoyed a nice glass of wine with an order of Fettuccine Pramavera.  Even though dinning alone, it was a very nice experience.
Very good food nice staff in town for Florida georgia line concert would come back again for next time I'm in town for concert excellent food

Very friendly and helpful staff, top-quality foods and not bad of a selection.  Wondering why they close so early.  I was hoping to meet with about 10 friends in the upstairs section of Dr Brunos for dinner, but they close before dinner time. Oh well.

Because there was ingenuity behind the plates, I wanted to like the food more but the end result left me puzzled.

The crawfish hushpuppies were a good idea because they are two wonderful ingredients, but where was the crawfish? The key ingredient was lost and further buried by the overly dark deep frying.

Combining frog legs and bacon with a spicy kick from horseradish and creole remoulade was a good idea, but what's the point of serving frog legs if you're just going to make them taste like chicken. Where is the amphibious funk? Also, be careful while eating because of the bones.

Fried pork rinds that popped and crackled when served was a good idea. It sounded great, but tasted like Styrofoam.

Transforming grits into a white cheddar grit cake as a base for the shrimp was a good idea, but why make the exterior skin so thick? Why drown the shrimp and grits in a "Creole BBQ cream sauce" that neither tasted Creole nor BBQ? Why use small, flavorless shrimp? To make things worse, the side of southern greens was harshly home-styled to the point they were difficult to eat.

Soaking pasta in alcohol for the "Drunken Angel" was a good idea, but why use cheap red wine? The wine wasn't going to cook down. Why use saffron? Saffron is one of the most expensive ingredients in the world. It's something chefs don't waste in a spicy arrabbiata-like sauce that was filled with garlic to the point where the saffron was hardly noticeable. Why put so much bread (a waitress mockingly called it a "loaf") on top of the pasta bowl? Not only was it carbs on more carbs, it was flavored like something from the disgusting Olive Garden (which doesn't realize that olives grow on trees in groves, not in gardens). Granted, there was good flavor from the crawfish and lobster broth, but why use so much cream sauce, again? And to top it all off, the pasta was overcooked and mushy.

Gastropubs frequently have smaller food items or "bites". No need to worry about not getting enough food here. The plates are plenty big so you don't "parish". Basically, don't order more than two plates per person.

Despite the repeated use of ginger ale, mint, and cucumber infused liquors when cucumbers aren't in season, the best thing about The Parish was the cocktails and the main thing saving the place from 2-stars. The Caribbean Mule was clearly the top drink of the night with its cold brightness.

Tucson is a town so small they get confused when I give a phone number. They don't expect the area code or The Parish doesn't expect many out-of-towners. The clientele also seemed confused where silly parents celebrate their infant's birthday with the baby in tow. Who does that? This is a gastropub, not a Chuck E. Cheese. Service was not properly coordinated between staff members.

Great food! Great prices! The waiters/waitresses were super nice. The people at the bar seemed to have fun. Played great dancing music! 
Overall great experience!

Went to Ale House last night. Huge portions of food and quite tasty. Beers are a little expensive, but they do have a large selection. I wish I had room for dessert after dinner, they look delicious. But, I didn't have room after dinner. Maybe next time.

Second time here and here's what I like...ordered the Downtown Delight Salad which I had the last time as well. Last time it came out topped with steaming, hot off the grill chicken breast which made it awesome!!!  This time the chicken wasn't hot and it was a little disappointing ...well the manager came by right after the meal arrived and I told here about the chicken...and bam, she apologized profusely, snapped that plate up and brought me back a new salad in about a minute! Just as awesome as the first time I had it!  Highly recommended !!
This place is the best Italian in town. It is consistently good food and service. It puts chain Italian such as Carabbas and Olive Garden to shame.

Oh Wawa, I love you after 12:00AM.  Anyway, I often frequent here after long nights of adult beverages and tales of yonder and the staff is always friendly to a accommodate my self needs and drunken self whether it is sizzlis at 2 in the morning or the weirdest hoagie you can think of.  Thank you Wawa.

Went here for brunch and thought it was a lovely quaint place. We got to sit outside since it was a beautiful day. The service was pretty good and I loved that they provided mats and bowls of water for dogs. They even had a doggy menu!! The food was great and I loved the atmosphere. I wasn't disappointed and would go back here again. I didn't go inside because it was pretty packed. When we first got there no seats were available. They took our name and number and within minutes of walking around they text us that our table was ready. I LOVED that option! We got back, sat down, looked over the deliciousness of the menu and finally made a choice and within no time our food was out. While we were waiting we snacked on chips and guacamole and it was SOOO delish! A def must have if you go here! Overall a great place to go and I wasn't disappointed!

I've seen reviews and a few pretty sweet instagram pics from this place, so here we go! 

We walked in and were instructed to sit wherever we wanted. Great, no waiting. We picked a spot by the window. We immediately received menus and our drink order was taken. Tea for me, Vietnamese coffee for hubby. Our order was taken very quickly, and drinks arrived soon after.

We got an order of 4 spring rolls to share, decent flavour, but curious that there was no chilli garlic sauce on the table. We made do with sriracha and chilli oil. No biggie.

Hubby ordered the pork & spring roll vermicelli bowl. Also curious was the fact that the noodles were served warm in this dish, as they've been served cold every other time he's ordered this dish elsewhere. Don't get me wrong, this wasn't a bad thing, the warm noodles actually elevated the flavours in this dish. The grilled pork was excellent as well. Yum!

I ordered a regular P1 w/no tripe and extra tendon. The soup was good, flavourful broth, tasty meatballs...but I did not receive the extra tendon I asked for (I have no problem paying extra for this if required). There were 3 tasty, but small pieces in there. One other thing, the noodles seemed to be freshly cooked rather that pre-cooked and added after. A small but nice touch. 

Once our food arrived, we had no other interaction with any staff other than when we got up to pay. No one asked how our meal was, no one brought us the bill. Almost like we were a nuisance, bordering on feeling like we'd been dismissed. Ok, so no warm fuzzies here. 

Good food, hot soup, chilly service.

Good beers and a very cool place.. The food is pretty good as well unfortunately the service was subpar at best.. Two bartenders and they barely acknowledged us for 10 minutes.. It was actually comical never came back and checked on us after our food and drink order..we basically had to flag them down to order more food and drinks and when we got their attention it's like we were a huge bother.... it's very easy to say hello and treat customers with a positive attitude and be nice..

This awesome spot just opened in my neighborhood. Delicious food! Tacos, bowls, burritos etc. All handmade and better that Chipotle. Fresher ingredients. Great atmosphere. Delicious fast service and healthy! We needed real Mexican food in the area and this place deliver.

LOVED THIS PLACE. 

Mushroom caps were phenomenal- the raspberry & goat cheese didn't really go well with the fried mushroom flavor, but the chocolate BBQ mushroom tasted awesome. Date & plum mushroom would be a great dessert option alone. The peach/mango was the best out of the 4.

Best friend had their chicken caesar salad (was kind of deconstructed) & had the best best pita slices I've ever had to go alongside.  

I had the ratatouille which surprised me when it was served on bread like a thincrust pizza, tasty though. My side was super fresh-tasting couscous with chunks of avocado (reminded me of summer & not the crappy weather we have now).

The cute waiter added to the great service we had. 

Will definitely try to come back once it's a little warmer out.

Stopped in to grab a beer and ended up staying the rest of the night, great bartenders, awesome pulled pork sandwich, and they were able to link up the music from the DJ upstairs so that you could hear it downstairs as well. The only thing that I found odd about this place was the amount of people that came in and out over the several hours I was there...Definitely one of Northern Liberties best kept secrets.

We came here just after open on a Friday and sat at the bar. Bartender was an unbelievable mixologist. Craft cocktailing at its best. Great food and great drinks. Wonderful ambience. Highly recommend.
Great fun and food for our first visit.  Delicious ingredients on the pizza!   Good selection of beer and wine Glad it is open again.  Back soon.
My family and I love Uno's. Pizza is great. Would give a 5 star review if the servers were consistent with their level of service. It's hit or miss with the server staff.

Zero stars we have been going here for years. We stopped going here about a year or so because everything went down hill after a lot of people and managers left. But last week we went back and got the steak and pasta special and it was pretty good so we thought we would try it again this week. Well we went Wesenday night and my husband and son both asked for no tomatoes in their pasta dish but both got them and it called for onions and they didn't get them but we didn't say anything. And then on Thursday the every next day I got an email about the pasta and steak special which included a drink. Well I guess this was our last time here..the 1st steak they gave my son was nothing but fat he couldn't even cut it so the brought him another one but it was cold and raw. Sp the manager came over and I told her about the night before az well..so she said she would take off 2 meals but when the waitress brought our bill she charged us for 3 cokes almost $9 I said No the drinks were part of the combo . So took the bill to the manager who came back and rudely sat it down kn our table but still charged us for one coke because the deal was 10.99 and she charged $10.00 and then $2.89 for one coke and also charged$2.49 for my sons salad which any other time would have been fine but since he had to send to steaks back. Like I said we have been going here since they opened.
The food is pretty good, can't deny that.  They have the best craft coffee, but when I found out the secret ingredient was paper sugar packet remnants, I was turned off.  Bring a black light!

Sad. Prep & Pastry started out fabulous, but the last two times I've been there, the pork and turkey sausages were under-cooked, potatoes tasted more of old olive oil and the center of the biscuits--cold. And the redone seating was not thought through. Large table placed in a large alcove that doubles as a "bandshell" for table talk which gets inadvertently amplified out into the restaurant making it almost impossible to hear your table mates or the waiter. Two seater tables placed so close to each other that the waiter has to assume the child's pose to service either table.  And lastly, being told that payments take place at the table after waiting in line at the cash register-- which I guess is just part of the decor--not a place to make payment for food? Ah well. It was nice while it lasted.

Lets start with service, Richie is already having your meal prepared before you can even finish ordering! He is a perfect role model for small business owner. He's friendly to everyone, and genuine to his customers. Breakfast sandwiches are piping hot, chicken is never overcooked, and the wraps are lean so you don't ever regret eating one, you'd just be tempted to buy another. He reminds me of what pizza shops should be like, as opposed to what they're like today

This new Tunisian-based BYO is a complete makeover of the Thai operation formerly here. The new decor is awash in soft, light blue (what else?) executed with exceptional taste. The overall effect is delightfully romantic, especially for Doylestown, which can use something "date night" like this even though the mellow vibe was diminished by a bright sconce light over our table.

The owners are obviously anxious to please, and could hardly do more to make folks feel welcome. We were warmly greeted, well taken care of throughout, and even given a complimentary after-dinner degustation.

Our appetizers -- octopus and a meatball special -- were absolutely spectacular, fully worthy of a great restaurant. The latter was spicy in the best sense, with heat used to enhance flavor using a delectable mix of herbs and spices from the owner's mother in Tunisia.

Were the meal to end there, Blu would qualify for a major detour and a solid five stars. Alas, the warhorse mains -- lamb couscous and moussaka -- were ordinare, albeit using superior quality lamb and other ingredients. Couscous was too dry and lacking in flavor complexity, while moussaka came off as little more than pleasant comfort food. If you want worthy moussaka hereabouts, try someplace like Philly's Estia.

The dessert of superior baklava and dates fared much better except for tiny portion size. If you're more than a nibbler, you're better off walking down the block to excellent Nina's or even Nonno's.

The owner has had long experience as a chef, and given the investment he's made appears to be playing it safe and predictable with menu offerings. Yet, he obviously has talent worthy of much greater things, so in time the main courses may expand to approach the quality and creativity of the apps we enjoyed. In the meantime, best bet is probably to steer clear of predictable menu choices and spring instead for the specials.

Worth mentioning is how clean this place is, and not only to the eye. We noticed that when a table was cleared off where a family with children had been, the floor area around that table was also wiped down.

We got out for under $45/person, plus tip and wine.
This is a favorite of ours for special occasions. Their breakfast specials always are so tasty and different from other restaurants. The place is clean and inviting and their staff is very friendly.

For a quick, little pizza this place is awesome ESPECIALLY if you are a healthy eater. One personal cheese pizza with whole grain crust has 420 calories...compare this to somewhere like California Pizza Kitchen which has over 1100 calories. No brainer. I used to call in and order a small personal pizza for lunch and pick it up in 20 minutes. Good cheese, always made fresh, friendly service, never a problem. If you're looking for "healthy" pizza, go here.
Seriously, the BEST PANCAKES EVER!!! Their fresh squeezed orange juice is delicious too!  Oh yeah, and the bacon is super crispy! So happy we got a location in Boise now!

The food was very authentic to the chef. Their fries were hand made and were very good. The pasta noodles were also handmade. Got their croquette madame and the shrimp pasta. I would def recommend getting the croquette madame because the flavors of everything together was so good. Although, it is a heavy meal. The pasta was very good and worth it because the shrimps in the pasta were big and fat with lots of meat!

Went to western village with no money took money out of the atm machine.Then broke it down in their cash machine,and was  given a counterfeit  5.00 dollar bill.So beware of any money you receive from them.

Totally fine diner food served by slightly salty wait staff.

This place has fairly typical diner food. Mostly breakfast food but also burgers and grilled sandwiches.  I had a patty melt. It was a little underseasoned. It started out well, but the second half was soggy.  I got it "Deluxe," which means it came with fries and Cole slaw. The cole slaw was generic cole slaw. The fries were crispy but unsalted.

Maybe it is because I'm not a regular, but my service was lacking the typical small diner experience. No friendly waitress calling me honey. No constant refilling of my iced tea.  

My overall experience was okay. I have other places I'd rather go for a meal in the area.

I ordered the tilapia and it came out almost completely raw. I then had to wait an extra 15 minutes for my food to come out. To top it off, they didn't offer us any discount or anything because of it. My mother ordered a shrimp dish and it had an excessive amount of garlic in it, to the point where she could hardly eat it. However, the waitress was still great.

All I can manage to say is wow. I have never eaten at a place that has such fantastic food, and served in a wonderfully cozy environment. I have come here on two occasions and will most definitely be coming back repeatedly. There is a certain beautiful flavor palette that is consistent throughout the menu which instantly shows how authentic the food is. Aside from that, the waitress is incredibly friendly and goes above and beyond regular hospitality in a normal restaurant. Simply amazing.

I was hesitant to go because it looked small, but boy was I happy I did! I ordered the lunch special 2 carnitas tacos with rice and beans on the side and a 20 oz drink for $6.95. 
Food was affordable and delicious! They also have a salsa bar which they make fresh so that was a bonus!
 I definitely recommend it and will go back. 
Only problem is that they close for dinner time. I'll prob stop by 30 min b4 close and pick up my meal as dinner on my way home from work.

We went on a Saturday morning and we were seated fairly quickly considering how packed it was...

The prices are very reasonable and the portions are HUGE. The staff was most excellent and I can say that we will definitely be back whenever I'm in Indy...

Had a great time! Major upgrade from bowling alley! And you don't have to borrow shoes used by others and, ladies, easy on the nails! We had newbies to experts and had a blast. Rosie, our hostess, was awesome and very sweet! Loved the socks, Rosie! Food was good, great service!
Great place. The food is fantastic and the management is even better. Ashton is top notch and takes care of every customer. Will recommend this place to everyone I meet

I was a bit bummed when Phat Bites moved to a new location, but I am pretty sure it's the same distance away from me, so no big loss! However, I drove past it the first time I visited, so keep your eyes peeled. It shares the same space as some nondescript business. 

I'm glad that the space is a lot bigger and they now have plenty of parking, even at peak times. The food, menu, and staff are the same. I came in for lunch a few times recently, and if you go early, you are golden. Anywhere between 11-12:00 you are fine. However, I stopped in around 12:30 and the line was long and order taking a bit annoying. I also waited about 15 minutes for my order, so it's not the quickest lunch option out there. When ordering take out, I like for it to be pretty quick, but expect to be at Phat Bites for at least 30 minutes at peak times. 

I still love the black bean burger that they offer. It's the best one I've had. I also have ordered a few sides. The kale salad is always great, and the hummus is out of this world! Phat Bites is amazing, so check them out!

I came on a Saturday morning the second weekend of January with the boyfriend for brunch and we were both really impressed. I had the prisoner egg muffin with a side of the house made rosemary sausage and to be honest it was SO good and I was so focused on devouring it I barely remember glancing at what my boyfriend had but given we both had hangovers from a night out at another awesome spot the Good Lion I'm just happy we were upright. 

I would highly recommend the prisoner egg muffin if you enjoy a sweet savory breakfast/brunch option; the egg was perfectly cooked on the inside just a slightly runny yoke and my side of sausage was really tasty, the perfect add on to make it feel like a complete meal. Definitely a must go in our book!

I love Capitol Cellars! It is such a treasure. I have walked by it several times, but my husband and I finally made a reservation for our anniversary there last week. We had the best croquettes in Boise for our appetizer, delicious salmon and steak for dinner (cooked as requested!), and a beautiful creme brulee for dessert! They personalized it for our anniversary, and we didn't even tell them up front that is why we were there. They are so attentive! The ambiance, food, and staff make this place a total new favorite in our family!

So when I first walked in I expected a bunch of old ladies, hipster UA students, and basically people I would immediately dislike based on their unnecessarily skinny pants, but I was wrong.  Sure, the guy who met us at the front looked like he belonged in Maroon 5, but my wife swore by this place, so I gave it a shot.

As every husband has become comfortable saying, "my wife was right, as always..."
Yes, this place is actually really well sorted.  I was concerned that the offerings would be overpriced, and portions too small, but I was happily mistaken.  Portions were right, well prepared, and the price justified it.  The Spicy Bloody Mary is fantastic, and their doughnuts are super good.

I will be back, I actually told my wife that as we waited for the check.  It just makes me feel uncomfortably hip....

Here with a large group. Great service. Pork nachos were pretty good. Cannelloni bites and sauce was very good. Spring rolls were excellent with sweet and sour sauce. Loaded tater tots were a good idea but I felt they were dry. Maybe serve them with a cheese sauce for dipping...? Clean, nice resturant. Good atmosphere.

Today a coworker and I decided to visit this restaurant for lunch and it was the first for both of us. Yelp showed great reviews but unfortunately it was not what we expected. We ordered burgers and I had a half caesar salad. The burgers were served to us very quickly which was impressive, however the burgers were no larger than a hockey puck and no thicker than the width of two McDonald's cheeseburger patties. Initially the sandwich looked great with artisan ciabatta bread, but the bread was humongous in relation to the little piece of meat that were considered burgers. They should have been served as sliders but were not. Regardless I just ate the pieces of meat and cut off small pieces of the bread for my meal. Now... the caesar salad is served and it immediately looked unappetizing. The lettuce was wilted but I still attempted to eat the salad. After three bites I realized that this salad was not good, and it definitely did not taste like caesar dressing. 

At this point I felt that I had dealt with enough with the burger, so I asked the server to return the salad because I was not satisfied with it. The server quickly returned and explained to my coworker and I that his manager had yelled at him because I returned the salad. Moreover he stated that his manager did not want to refund the salad of $4 and would like to speak with me as to why I did not want the salad. This perplexed me and was counter to the service that I expected. 

As I reached the counter to explain that I no longer wanted the salad, the owner did not ask me what was wrong with the salad as I expected for constructive feed-back. Instead the owner asked me what would I like in place of the salad. I stated that I did not want anything at all, but just wanted a refund of the $4 dollars. The owner immediately slammed down his fist on the counter in front of my coworker and I, and then refunded the cost. 

For this and previous reasons, especially how he treated his young employee, we will NOT EVER visit this establishment again. You do not treat your employees like crap, and definitely not your customers. Let alone as an owner show physical hostility toward your customers because they were not happy with a meal that you served. This is unacceptable and should not be tolerated. 

Unfortunately in our society there is far too much anger and physical violence in the workplace, and many other places that the community frequents. I am not labeling this owner but I could not help but to take a step back when the physically aggressive act occurred. 

Because of today's violence throughout our society, it is very important that we pay attention to the signs wherever we are. We must stay vigilant and do our part to bring attention to potential incidents all around us. It is our duty to our communities and to one another.

For this reason the owner's physical act of anger immediately caught my attention. I pray that I am overthinking this but better safe than sorry and if you ever frequent this establishment, tread lightly if you ask for a refund.

Signed,

Very unfortunate experience

This was a really great place to go. My whole softball team went for our team dinner over spring break. They have a great variety of food and quick service. This is a place where you order, then choose your seat while they deliver to you. Highly recommended!

My 2and time ordering take out and the 2nd time I've been extremely pleased with the service and the food. I'm a stickler for consistency and there were differences. I order the Biscuits and Gravy and add Fried Chicken. The first time..more chicken two biscuits and gravy. This time around two chicken tenders and 4 biscuits with gravy. Two chicken tenders are not worth the $5 they charge. Overall I still have biscuits and gravy for tomorrow so $13 is worth it. THE biscuits have the perfect texture. A little crisp on the outside, but fluffy goodness on the inside. The definitely stand up to the gravy meaning no sogginess. They are herb and cheddar. I could make a sandwhich out of these any day. The gravy ain't your mommas gravy. It's a duck fat sausage gravy. Creamy, rich, balanced goodness. All together..it'll brighten up your day for sure. I did notice a couple of folks eating inside, everyone wearing gloves and masks. I cant wait to dine in. Their take out service quick and they are always so nice.  Complimentary passion fruit unsweet black tea..YES PLEASE!!
fresh made to order entr√©es- varied menu & specials.  open & inviting dining area the with accommodations for large groups

I recently used J's Pitaria for a backyard party. I served up their savory stuffed Pitas in all flavors, as appetizers, and they were a hit! This little gem is already making a name for itself and the food is fresh and delicious....welcome to So City

Had high expectations. What we were served was on par with boil in a bag. $160 for four and we had tasteless tomatoes in the Caprese Salad, dried by heat lamp Rigatoni Pollo Formaggi and Rigatoni with meatballs to upset your stomach. Too many other choices in Nashville for you to choose from.

We went to Margaritaville Saturday night after the Predators game.  Our goal was a quick drink and bite to eat.  Unfortunately it took a long time to order, receive our drinks, then receive our food.  After what seemed a longer than average wait time we asked where our food was.  the server said it's coming soon.  The kicker was the table that sat well after us, got their food first.   Then when our food arrived and we asked for ketchup and mustard. It was "dropped" on our table. We weren't impressed at all.   I wouldn't go back.

I don't know a thing about beer, not that much about cheese (cept that I love it), and pretend to know things about wine (but really know nothing).  Tria put me at ease with all 3, and made my tastebuds rejoice.  Luckily, the first time I went, I had a friend who was a hostess guide me though the ins and outs of the clipboard menu offerings.  

Must. have. the. Truffled Egg Toast.  

Love this place for lunch, happy hour, dinner, and Sunday School which is when they pick one beer, cheese and wine and make 'em half off!  Oh, and what's this?  There's Biba, Tria's baby (sister/brother? or just baby) wine bar at 31st and Walnut.  Look out for a review!

I never considered chicken as breakfast, but I know the hazards of shopping at Costco on an empty stomach, so I stopped at the Chick-Fil-A across the street.  I had the spicy chicken biscuit, and I really liked it.  I didn't see an option for a chicken and egg biscuit, but maybe I'll ask about it next time.  I asked for orange juice, and got a mini-jug full of juice.

The service was fast.  Everyone working there was exceptionally polite and went out of their way to be friendly, even the people sweeping the floor and taking out the trash.

My kabobs were really tender and I have never eaten middle eastern food so this was a treat. Since I am not into lamb, I went safe and got chicken and beef. Both were delicious and literally blew my expectations for it. The rice was yellow and tasted like uncle bens rice. The gentleman that helped us was very nice and friendly. I like the atmosphere and how it is set up. Gives a nice middle eastern vibe.
Great food and service. You must try when in NOLA. Our server Price was excellent. The bread pudding is excellent!

My wife and I got the feeling that they couldn't be bothered with us.  We are 40+ affluent creoles with executive jobs and know how to behave in a restaurant.  The Caucasians were treated exceptionally well while we were ignored and our order was mistreated.  My wife order a Bloody Mary that was never delivered but the white people that came in after us received a Bloody Mary.  This went on with several tables were there were Caucasian people who were treated very well while we were not. It's a shame.  I want every minority who visits the French Quarter to know that they are not welcome in the Cafe Fluer-de-lis!!!

Had the Poo Pad Pong Guree and despite the unfortunate name it was quite delicious (the dish included tempura soft shell, shrimp, and crab meat). Everyone in our party of 4 was pleased with their food and left with a smile.

Super good pizza! Ordered a large jungle pizza and it was awesome. They have indoor and outdoor door seating, inside can get a little hot. This is a small pizza place though. Great local place with friendly staff I will be back.

I really enjoyed the meal I had and thought the prices were more than generous. The Greek salad was fresh, flavorful and had a ton of ingredients. The vegetarian platter was so much food for one person that you could easily split it with another for only $7.49! The spanakopita was light and flaky with a generous amount of filling. Everything was beyond my expectations. I'm blown away how this place serves such amazing food at such reasonable prices. I will defiantly be a repeat customer and I'm very happy I tried their food.
The Charbroiled Oysters are fantastic and Brandy C, our server was super helpful, friendly, fun, and all of her recommendations were spot on!

This McDonald's is at the corner of Route 47 and US-40, closer to Route 47. Far from being convenient, it's proximity to a major intersection in town makes it a bit tricky to get to from some directions. Since I was coming from the west, I had to enter via the CVS lot. However, I noticed some people driving the wrong way around the lot to get where they needed to be and that could be dangerous.

The food here is pretty much average for the fast food chain. Service was actually pretty good. I didn't like that most of the chairs in the dining area were hard. (So it seems I'm getting old. :) ) However, the dining area and restrooms appear to be renovated not too long ago and are in good condition. One downside is there is no self-serve beverage area, so you'll have to ask for refills at the counter.
Really disappointing dining experience tonight. Service was poor. Probably won't go back after three years:(

My boyfriend and I found this spot based on yelp reviews and are glad we did. We'll take local spots over touristy places every chance we get when traveling. The pork belly poboy was fantastic! It had great flavor with the rum ginger glaze and the lime slaw complimented it nicely. It's evident that they care about their food and you see the detail in their ingredients. It all comes through in their food. The staff was also very friendly and we had a chance to talk with the chef who gave us a few of his restaurant recommendations around town. If we lived locally we'd hit this spot regularly.

Went there recently before a playoff game. They lost our order in the confusion.  The manager profusely apologized and compted our whole meal!  Fantastic meat.  St. Louis is an amazing BBQ town and this place is one of the best.

Blown away by the amazing taste of their kebabs.

It was our first time trying the Persian restaurant. The restaurant has good parking outside as well as a beautiful exterior and interior. We tried a couple of different kebab platters. Initially the prices seem a little hefty on the menu but when we saw our entr√©es, it was all worth it. Be prepared to eat a lot of food. The kebabs are huge and full of amazing spices and taste. Staff is really courteous and helpful.

The desert which included a persian ice cream was OK. I will definitely go back to this restaurant for their amazing kebabs, not so much for the desert. Will definitely recommend this place.

I came here looking for authentic cuban food, but that's not what I came across. The food is not bad but it definitely does not have that "Cuban Seasoning." They have a few items on the menu that are from Cuban cuisine but not enough to call it a "Cuban Cafe." I asked if they had Cuban pizza and the lady had no idea what I was talking about. The only Cuban thing about that place was me when I walked in. Its more of an imitation of Cuban food, but definitely not authentic.
The service is nice and the food is delicious!! I always get the veggie pizza its soo good. Im not even vegetarian!

I decided to take an afternoon to explore Marathon Village and happened upon this lovely little coffee shop that looks exactly like the name would suggest: that you're having coffee in someone's garage while they change your oil, except the coffee here is incredible.  They have a particular treat served in a shot glass that combines espresso, caramel, and salt, and it will absolutely wake you up.  You can buy their signature blend, affectionately named Road Rage, while in the small shop.  They also serve up some snacks if you need a pick-me-up while shopping about the many adorable shops in Marathon.  It was without a doubt some of the best coffee I have ever had.  I would not recommend this as a coffee house for sitting and doing homework, as its too small, but I would recommend picking up a cup from here on your way to run errands.  You will have the most productive day ever hyped up on this incredibleness.

I am not the hugest fan of Vietnamese food, and I realized last weekend it's because I never had really delicious food.  At other places I frequent in Chinatown, I always got bun, pho, or charboiled beef over broken rice.  Same ol' same ol.  At le Viet, they had some dishes that was so interesting, we just had to try.

I had the spareribs in clay pot - AMAZING.  It was juicy and perfectly seasoned.  It's a "fingers get mess" dish, but totally worth it.    For appetizers, we had pineapple calamari shrimp.  OH. MY. God.  It was so yummy.  Normally I hate fruit in my food, but the pineapple is subtle and really compliments the calamari and shrimp.  You eat it over little shrimp crackers.  It's a delicious salad-esque dish.  

And of course, a meal is not complete without the iced coffee in condensed milk.  Okay, I think it's time for me to go back tonight!

Opening day so probably too early to really evaluate. Sat at the bar and took almost 10 minutes before one of the servers ask if I'd had my drink order yet which hadn't even been placed. The food was decent although the tenderloin to me seemed over cooked fries are nothing special. The new Decour is great and hopefully once the kinks are worked out it will be worth returning . I should note that the wine list is pretty non existent but hopefully that can chang

Second try
My wife loved the crab cakes and the tuna appetizer was good but I did not get the large clump of lettuce with no dressing. There has been no change in the lack of decent wines. The wine list at  their Italian House restaurant in Westfield is  outstanding as is the food. Wish they would blend the two.
We got carry out so we could have some wine on our boat but the fries were very average and the pulled pork needed more sauce although it was over powered by all the cole slaw on the bun
Seems like a work in progress-at least I hope

as others have noted it took 40 minutes for our food to show up. the place was only about 20%full.

p.s. in the end I will say that my whiskey river chicken sandwich was chicken to perfection.   which is hard to do with a chicken. 

so if you don't mind the wait the food is good and hot.

Best Happy Hour deal-- $3 off specialty cocktails, $2 off apps, $1 off beer. The cocktails are unique and delicious, and the atmosphere is charming and comfortable. The food is great and a good price. Definitely worth stopping in more than once.

Had a terrible experience tonight. I understand it was busy because of the Villanova game but that is no reason to be spoken to the way I was spoken to. A waiter (I don't know his name, he wasn't our waiter) brought out my wings (an hour after they were ordered) and my friend sitting next to me asked if he could clear off our table a bit since it was starting to get cluttered with empty glasses and plates. Rudely he said back, "Yeah sure, because I have nothing better to do, like work". Are you kidding me? That's customer service nowadays? I will never come back to this establishment because of that comment.

Might be the best burger that I've ever had. Didn't even think about asking for ketchup. The bacon potato salad was great. Only complaint was the waitress who only sprinted by twice. Otherwise it would have been 5 star.

Ha d a reuben. It was the way they are suppose to be. 

The slaw was a little weird. I didn't love it, but I didn't hate it. I ate all of it, but I would of asked for more. Good beer and craft soda selection. 

Place is more of a hang out with friend and drink establishment. But the cafe is on point. Have live shows some nights with exotic hip names. 

Check the place out, it won't disappoint.
Great lunch spot! Prices are great on both main dishes and sushi! Friendly servers and excellent food every time I have been! The sushi chef is very creative!

My partner and I had lunch here as part of a group of "older" artists and art lovers.  There were about 27 of us and we had called in advance.  Despite its sort of 70's, bronze window frame, stucco exterior, the interior is very well designed, simple but not boring, and very clean.  The service is kind and our waiter had the perfect balance of friendliness and professionalism.  The food was very pretty and mine was quite tasty.  I had a salad of red and yellow beets with almonds, arugula, and a goat cheese mousse.  I am a Vegetarian.  There were many other intriguing dishes on the menu but I am also a beet freak so this was a no- brainer.  I just loved it. There could have been a little more of the mousse, but that is just quibbling.  My partner, however, ordered the Cobb Salad, which was advertised as having grilled chicken, but had shredded chicken, which was unexpected and disappointing. The breadsticks which were offered in lieu of bread tasted like baked yeast with salt, and some bland olive oil was placed on our table in little saucers to cut the salinity.  The other people at our table were very happy with their food, but another of our party said it wasn't what she expected when she ordered and didn't sound too happy about it.  I don't live in the area so I don't know what restaurants cost there but the prices seemed reasonable, maybe a tad on the high side, but I didn't mind because I was expecting the southern Italian food that I usually encounter.  If I ever find myself in Wilmington again (it is a lovely town and the museum is a jewel) I would gladly return for another meal.

Went here with a group of around 8 on St. Patrick's Day. Waiter was adequate, and we got our food pretty promptly. That said, it was overpriced for what was a decent (not amazing) burger, and I was one of the few at the table to enjoy my meal. I probably wouldn't go out of my way to go here or avoid it in the future.

This was the Cajun Crabcake and Shrimp Alfredo. It was delicious! My homegirl had shrimp and grits, and my other friend had the Blackened Chicken Salad. First of all, the portions are huge! Second the food was great! We were able to share plates. I will say that I was underwhelmed by the crab cakes that came on the Alfredo meal but everything else tasted so good I was able to overlook that.  Now due to the location it is quite noisy and busy but the food came quickly and they had some nice drink specials. The meals are a little more pricey than what I would have liked to pay but you are paying for the inflation because of the location. The service was really good.  We got to watch a parade while eating lunch. I would defiantly return to this restaurant during a less busy season. I really wanted to try the bread pudding but I was too full.

Food was great. Will definitely be back. Had the brisket and chicken with mac and cheese and potato salad. The sweet BBQ sauce was on point. They only thing is that I wish the food would have been hot instead of lukewarm. 

If your kids hate pickles and green onions as much as mine do then ask them to leave it off. Had a ton on their plate and they threw a fit.

I came for the potato salad. My partner came for the spicy sausage. Guess what 2 things were on the long "we are out of..." list. The dill macaroni salad was an okay substitute, but they upcharge for everything, even sharing a plate. The pork and mild sausage sandwiches are worth returning for, if they have a full menu.

I've been to better Beef 'O' Brady's franchises.  This is not their flag ship in any way shape or form.  The service is beyond slow.  We went in for lunch.  There were 'only' 3 tables of customers in the place and 2 at the bar.  There were 'only' two servers working.  'One' server gave us a menu, the 'other' got us 'our' drinks.  Then we sat for 20 minutes until I asked if we could place an 'order'.  Another painful 30 minutes went by and 'out' came 'our' food.

This was my second time there.  The first time my food was 'OK' as far as bar food goes.  This second time, the food was just meh. It was very salty and tasted like it was defrosted.

'On' the positive side, there were a tons of TVs and a good selection of beer so if I went back, it would be 'only' to watch a sporting event I couldn't 'otherwise' get on my cable network.  'Otherwise', I wouldn't go back just to eat.  Skip it.
Great soccer themed pub. My favorite place to get a drink in Indianapolis.

I recently celebrated my Mom's birthday here. We called ahead and easily got a reservation for 10 on a Sunday at 6. When we arrived to the restaurant, the table was set and ready, and the restaurant was pretty empty. 

The service started out good, but slowly took a turn for the worst. When the bread was brought out I had to ask multiple different waiters for butter before they decided to bring it out. The staff didn't seem to pay attention to our drink refill needs. At one point the hostess filled our drinks- and got the cups mixed up so I ended up with a diet coke that tasted like ice tea-ew. 

The food is reasonably  priced and there is an okay selection. All of our meals were pretty good too. I had the mushroom raviolis, tasted great and was very filling.  

The quality of the food cannot trump the bad service I last experienced. I don't think I will be going back anytime soon- there are plenty of other reasonably priced BYOB Italian restaurants with better service in the area.

I'd definitely say it's worth making a first-time trip, but I'm not sure I'd come again unless it was to try brunch or hang out on the outdoor portion of the restaurant. I love the concept of eating on a boat; eating is one of the most enjoyable and frequent activities that I engage in, and it's fun to switch up the atmosphere a little bit every once in awhile. 

That being said, the boat was hauntingly quiet, kind of dark, and just generally somber on the evening that my boyfriend and I dined here. I can't speak to whether or not this is the norm, as it was a frigid Tuesday night in the middle of winter. 

Drinks were good, the St. James Lemonade was bomb. 

Food was definitely a little above average, but expensive. I'd definitely recommend scooping a Living Social deal if you see one.

We shared:

-Crab mac n' cheese
-Philadelphia roll
-Brussels sprouts
-Braised short rib gnocchi

The portions weren't huge, but we ended up having to take home a small box of mac and a few pieces of sushi because we were full. Everything was good, but the mac and sprouts were my favorites.

It happened to be my birthday, and our (really friendly & helpful) waitress brought out a complimentary scoop of sorbet with a candle in it at the end of the meal. 

Overall, it was a nice, quiet evening with solid food, but you're definitely paying a premium to be eating on the river.

I grew up in the area and I love the food. Pizza is delicious but we've stopped going here because we got tired of the owners grandkids running wild and interrupting our meals. Once one of the kids actually sat down at our table with us and played with his toys!  It's really a shame because the food really is good.

Service is always great, food always fresh. I eat here several times a week. They are on top of to-go orders. The "flying burrito" is my favorite. Recommend the specialty drinks. Frozen pi√±a colada was delicious. This place isn't over the top delicious but the service and environment make this burrito joint top notch in my book.

I have been here several times for breakfast and now for dinner. The food is incredible, I have yet to try something I haven't liked. 

My wife, 3 kids and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and had an incredible dining experience. Our server was fantastic, while we were deciding what dessert to order, she took the time to take our kids over to the gelato and help them pick a flavour. 

I see several people complaining about the slow service, this has not been my experience. I can agree that the staff is a little laid back, but you kind of expect that when you are eating at an organic hipster restaurant don't you? 

The only reason I would hesitate on giving this place 5 stars is because it is a little pricy for the amount of food you get. However being that it is an organic, locally sourced restaurant, you can't expect to pay a little more for your food. So 5 stars all the way. 

If you are looking for a high quality meal, and have the time to enjoy it... this is your place. If you don't have the time, buy a sub at subway or a burger at McDonalds and avoid having to leave a bad review on yelp for a restaurant that is clearly not what you were looking for.

The food is great here.  I suggest you try them out.  The service is great and the accommodated our party of 18 without a reservation even though we should had.....  This is one of my favorite hang outs, I will be back again.

I went to pick up a sandwich really quick after stopping in to get my nails done next door. 
It's not a place I normally go, but I have had sandwiches from Penn Station by my office so I knew they were good. 
First impression was horrible. I think someone had been urinating in the threshold between the dining room door and the outside door. 
The staff inside of the place seemed SO unorganized.. people were getting their food at random times, not first in first out.. which i thought was odd. 
The food tasted fine.. It still isn't going to be a regular place for me.

I made a reservation so being seated outside was smooth.   We took along my Lab for the afternoon and it was wonderful. Yes, even my Lab had a really good time, and the red water-doggie bowl added to the afternoon because it was so thoughtful.    
The server (Brooke) was excellent and made our afternoon so delightful.  The food was incredible: from the designer drinks (coconut lavender lemonade) to the fresh seafood appetizers (stuffed lobster dumplings) as a seasonal starter was truly amazing!  As we moved into our afternoon lunch - I can say that the taste, the timing and the presentation of our meal was so flavorful.  And the carrot cake we had at the end of our lunch was delish as well.  Earl's New American provides great service, and a top-notch dining experience.
Awesome food! Loaded fries are a must. Also had the burger, fish and chips, popcorn chicken and it was ALL GOOD!

American Social you are truly outstanding, I had a lovely experience here yesterday. Overall, I think this is a great, fun spot. Most of the food items are fantastic, their menu is awesome, I really like their Ropa Vieja Tacos. Staff is extremely friendly and will certainly help you with anything. Can not wait to come back to American Social. Definitely recommending to others.

When Anabella's was in Bristol the food was great and it was a byob.  I went to dinner at Fishers where Anabella moved to.  Similar menu items but not the same quality.  Wine list is poor and the red wine I ordered was obviously on a location that was hot.  Took till the end of dinner before it finally got to room temperature.  Though the restaurant was dead the service was horrible.  The waitress was more interested to talking to people near the bar then checking on us.   Will not go back.   A shame a very good restaurant is no longer the shining star it was.

This place is amazing!  We were staying right next door at the Hilton and decided to stop in here for a late lunch.  Street tacos are highly recommended,  especially the pork!  The spicy margarita was also a perfect balance of spice and salt.

Compared to the Drago's in the Hilton near the French Quarter, this one is a world above.  The quality is sublime, the service was fast and attentive, the food was hot.  The only qualm is that the food kitchen and the charbroiled oyster kitchen are supposedly two different kitchen, so food can come out at different times.  I prefer ALL food out at the same time. Freshness BE DAMNED. Lol. 

A great location, and it seems they're buying up the block.  All hail Drago's. :)

Awesome place!! I've been to a lot of sushi places in St. Louis. This is top three. My standard judge is salmon nigiri and it was spot on. Great rolls and excellent service. I will make the drive to Arnold anytime for this place.

My wife and I went there for New Year's Eve dinner. Was seated exactly at 7:00. Drink prices at the bar are $1 less than in the dining room. That was a bit strange. They had a special menu for the holiday. This meant higher prices. We shared the Caprese Salad which was very good. Nice large chunks of fresh mozz. My wife had the Ravioli Bellini which she said was great. I had the salmon florentine which I highly recommend. They did a great job hustling out orders of food during the busy evening. The only issue was poor waiter service from Vincenzo. He may have checked on us twice all night if that. We not only ran out of drinks, but also out of water. How bad to have the "water girl" walking around an pass us up with 4 empty glasses in front of us. We were able to flag her down to get not only water, but silverware to eat our food with. I guess Vincenzo thought we'd use our hands. The food was great, the service was marginal. The host staff and bar staff were very good.
Best Brunch in Manayunk, hands down. The bread is also amazing. The staff there is very professional and the place is always clean. Don't be surprised if there is a wait/crowded. It's worth it.

I had to take back a star. When I got back to my hotel room, I felt queasy and just assumed I had gotten some gluten cross contamination. When I rejoined my dinner companions today, the three of them each reported that they felt like they had eaten something "off". My conclusion is that this place needs a visit from Kitchen Nightmares.
Coupon for 500 extra points if you spend over $15 for breakfast! What a deal! I couldn't eat that much breakfast. Saved money and ate at Starbucks.

I have to give 1 star because they almost ruined my experience at Tampa. I finished a Bush Gardens and called to know the closing time, they said 9 pm, so I got at 8:30 pm and the 2 ladies in the front said kitchen was closed and they can't even take to go orders. I called back and asked again and "Cristal" said it was opened. The ladies continued in the same attitude, even saying there was nobody in the restaurant with that name. I know it is Christmas Eve, I work in a restaurant too and totally understand, but you should never do that to a customer. It's so irrespecutful  from these two ladies playing and lying just because they want to go home. The guy in the bar took my to go order kindly.

I don't even want to give this place 1 star, but I have to in order to place this review.  This place is absolutely terrible. The host/hostess are so unprofessional and miserable. We first got seated after about 15 minutes of no one paying us any attention, then to get seated and never have a server come over. I had to get up to go find a server. We then had to wait about 20 minutes before we got our drinks.  The food was absolutely terrible. It was barely cooked and had no flavor.  We then went up to the patio bar after we ate to again wait another 20 minutes before someone even approached us. (And this is after making complete full on eye contact numerous times). The bartender was so rude and ignorant (her name is Tiffany). I have never in my life experienced what I experienced at this place this past weekend. Every single person that works there is so cocky, ignorant and rude.  It's so unbelievable. Asked for a manger as well, and they never came over to us to hear our complaints. Will NEVER be going back there.

Went for a quick dinner before a show at the Kimmel center, so the place was relatively empty when we arrived but quickly filled up as it got closer to dinnertime. Service was quick and decently professional although our waiter was a little odd and over-eager...we shared the bureki (I didn't prefer the sweetness as an appetizer, but being Greek my mom and I agreed it was definitely authentic), the fattoush salad (yum, and refreshing!), and the dips of the day (babaganoush, a white bean spread and hummus - better than having to choose just one). Bread was served with our order too. The place is a little small (we were put in the corner even though we were the only ones there at first...), but music and food are totally authentic. Apparently it's a BYO, which I didn't know before, but the food is amazing, filling and fresh so would heartily recommend it to any Greek food / Mediterranean cuisine lovers out there.

I absolutely love this place! The grilled veggie sandwich was so delicious and makes eating healthy on the go easy and yummy. I also love the cruelty option they give for us vegans and vegetarians, can't go wrong with this place!

It has been a long while since I've been to this dump, still a dump only food was even worse than last time. Got food poisoned and spent the rest of my day wishing I had not gone in there again. The rancid grease flavor was a huge clue not to finish and I only ate about half of my plate. 

 NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I've heard tons of good things about Prep & Pastry, so when my fiance and I drove by last Sunday morning, I suggested we stop for brunch.

When we walked in, the hostess said it would be about a 45 minute wait, but she wasn't sure since some people had left without telling her. Looking around the restaurant, there were quiet a few empty tables, and there didn't seem to be too many people waiting, so I was slightly confused. But since we weren't in a rush or grungry (the anger of being overly hungry), we decided to wait.

Luckily, we had only been sitting outside for about 15 minutes when our name was called. The interior is super cute! I really liked the high ceilings and how bright the restaurant was. It was definitely the perfect atmosphere for a lazy Sunday brunch.

After much deliberation, we finally made our decisions and ordered.  I ordered the breakfast poutine and my fiance had the chx + toast (fried chicken strips, rosemary brioche french toast, and a blueberry syrup). My poutine was just okay. It was a solid portion, but kind of bland, and I definitely didn't see any cheese curds. On the other hand, my fiance loved his dish! I thought the different components sounded weird on paper, but once I had a bite, I was sold! The chicken was flavorful, and the rosemary french toast was the perfect savory accompaniment, but I do wish it was a little less soggy. However, I did think the chicken was on the dry side.

Although we didn't have room to sample their pastries, they all looked amazing. I will definitely be trying one on my next visit.

I think overall, I would give Prep & Pastry 3.5 stars, but I'm rounding it up to 4 since I think I would be happier if I got a different dish next time. Also, I don't think the wait would be so bad on most weekends, but the Sunday we went was super windy, so I don't think many people wanted to sit outside.

It's so nice to finally be able to have a sandwich again! I have to eat gluten and dairy free so it is a rare occasion that I can order a sandwich at a restaurant. Their sandwiches are very good, the only downside is that they charge you extra for gluten free.

Who knew the best Irish pub would be in Nashville?!  Seriously good food, our Waitress -Diane- was flawless. Wonderful live Irish music. I would come back to Nashville to come to this place.  If you're near... Stop in and you won't be sorry!  When you stop by tell Diane the guys from Connectecut told you to come!

We came upon this place while in New Orleans one day.. Obviously not what one thinks about as a New Orleans meal.. Lol.. The food is good, the place is clean and open, there is a separate bar area and you can even sit near the windows with a partial view out toward the Mississippi River ... Order nachos and have them add your favorites... It's pretty darn good! Lol

Msg laden pho.  Costs 4(?!?) extra dollars to upgrade the size of the bowl when the price of the pho is already higher than what it should be.  Meat quality is terrible.  

And they nickel and dime you.  Asked for a side of white onions and they said that it'll cost me.  Never been charged for something as simple as a side of onions and I've been to my fair share of Vietnamese restaurants.

The food was absolutely delicious! We were visiting New Orleans on a trip and we actually found this place on yelp. We came in thinking it was a little restaurant, however it turned out to be a bar that served food on the side.  The problem with that was since we were expecting to dine in, the bar was wanting to charge us a $10 cover fee per person in order to stay on the place..which wasn't what we were expecting. The live music seemed good though, but we ended up getting our food to go to bring back to our hotel.  The Kitchen was out of their wings and ribs (which happened to be their top seller). But the brisket and pulled pork was still delicious. We wish we had ordered more because one order was definitely not enough to share. Be sure to try out all their BBQ sauces.

Great place for a take out pizza.  Serivice is a little on the slow side and usually they are understaffed which makes for unhappy servers.  The pizza however is well worth the wait, have never been disappointed with the quality and taste of the pizza.  Always consistant which is very nice as there are no unpleasant surprises.  Lots of pizzeria's around so it's safe to say that is one is on my top 5 pizza places.

This place makes the best wings in Indianapolis, hands down. Amazing wings that make this place worth going back to over and over. I also love the atmosphere of the place, even if it is a little cramped. The beer list is always great as well. 

The only disappointment? The fish and chips. A place like this absolutely needs to nail this dish, and it falls totally flat.  A bunch of tiny pieces of fish instead of large and flaky filets and they are overbreaded. Maybe some of the worst fish and chips I've ever had.
Atmosphere was great!! Burger was only decent, alongside the mashed potatoes which were somewhat dry. My friend had a salad with Salmon and that looked great. Salad was a large portion.

After seeing that GQ rated this as the best cheesesteak in Philly, I had to check it out. Let's just say GQ was very wrong. I ordered the bacon cheesesteak which sounded like something they serve in heaven. Unfortunately my friends and I were pretty disappointed. Steak was of higher quality than most places, but sandwich was pretty small. Wasn't too happy paying $11 for a cheesesteak that size. You can find many other places that are cheaper and better.
Great food but the music is way to loud. I have to scream across the table. Excellent pizza at an excellent price. Will definitely be back.

We love the pizza here.  But, I'm giving two stars because they have a terrible pickup system for takeout.  Last Friday night I arrived at the time they told me to pick up my order.  I had to wait on a line for 10 minutes just to pay...and another 10 minutes before the overworked staff at the register gave me our order, which had been waiting and getting cold on the counter behind him that whole time. The other customers on line were complaining that their takeout pickup is always slow.  Every time we've gotten takeout from here the staff at the pickup counter seem stressed and disorganized.   If they could get it together I would give them 5 stars!

A very different steak and burger place.   Upstairs is very nice and perfect for biz lunch.   MUST TRY THE BURGER DIPPED IN BATTER AND DEEP FRIED.  It is a m a z i n g. Will definitely eat there again.

This place was recommended by a bartender at another restaurant we frequent, so figured it had to be good. Was disappointed overall to be honest. Outside of the great beer selection and service, the place was a real let down. Starting with the annoying flys that kept pestering us at the bar. Only to be followed shortly there after by the gnats that kept trying to share my beer with me. Sitting at indoor bar with a napkin over my pint is not what I expected. We order a couple of the apps only to be further let down. Too be honest I am not a fan German food, so take with a grain of salt. I for one have been there and done that and want waste my time doing it again.

came here on a whim and will come back anytime!!! get anything because it was actually all so good!!! sweetest staff in the whole world!! we wore shorts and a tshirt because we were about to get in the car to go home and we did not feel out of place! come here, so yummy!
All the food was amazing. From the spaghetti to the grilled octopus this is my favorite restaurant ever.

I heard nothing but good things here so I figured why not, try it out. And all I got to say is that this place will not disappoint you at all. Everyone there are super friendly and they do offer many selections. We got a dish called Carmen I highly recommend it was so good that I am definitely coming back. Mahalo & Thank You
Very good pizza and pasta. The service was very fast. The price was good and the place was clean.  Their hours are a little odd but I would recommend eating there.

I had been to Cava 3 times before, once in 1998, once in 2004, and once in 2009. Although there are some drawbacks to living with my parents after graduating from college, they do regularly take me out to dinner with them (score!). Saturday night was my choice of restaurants and I decided that Cava was calling my name.

I love using OpenTable for reservations whenever I can so it was great to find out that Cava was part of OpenTable. We had reservations for 8:15pm and were seated immediately in the back of the restaurant, close to the bar, fireplace, and fantastic live musician. She gave off a blues/jazz vibe, my dad and I thought it was a recording she was so good. The environment here is super relaxing and mellow, exactly what we want on our mini-vacation. 

The bottomless chips and salsa (one red salsa and one black bean salsa) arrive when you sit down, yum yum yum! All 3 of us had a REALLY difficult time deciding what we wanted because Cava has a fabulous menu, especially for those who love seafood. Our waiter was great, I didn't get his name, but he wasn't shy about recommending his favorites and what other people seem to enjoy. We started off with their most popular appetizer; ceviche. Los Agaves does have a large order of ceviche, but I preferred the one at Cava because it was served with their delicious fresh guacamole and pico de gallo to balance out the spicy lime flavor of the fresh halibut.

I ordered the Rock Shrimp Soft Tacos (Papaya salsa, sour cream & handmade corn tortillas), my dad got the Oven Braised Lamb Shanks with Toasted Orzo (slowly cooked with port wine & garlic), and my mom got the Fajitas with shrimp, scallops, and Mahi-Mahi. All three of us were thrilled with our selections, my tacos were easily the best tacos I've ever had. Their white corn tortillas provide a perfect base to the battered shrimp and the papaya salsa was phenomenal.

Our waiter also recommended the Carne Asadea a la tampiquena, which I may try next time.

Valet is complimentary (SWEET)!

We'll DEFINITELY be back here.
Great atmosphere and service! The views from the restaurant are very special. Menu options are varied and all of the dishes we ate were superb. Highly recommend this to all.

Nice atmosphere and nice people, BUT the food was amazingly flavorless. We had the shepherd salad (tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, feta). It really needed some help. It had nothing going on.
