To make it worse, the bowl it is served in is a disaster waiting to happen. It tilts over wildly and will soon elicit a class action lawsuit. The flatbread was terrible. I know flatbreads always stink but this somehow had no flavor whatsoever. The mussels were decent. The lamb kofte was decent but the sauce was horrendous. We really wanted to like this place but will not be back.

The food was amazing and service was excellent! ! Authentic Spanish cuisine and a hip vibe make this dining establishment one to seek out. The corn cakes were delightful and the rice and black beans are out of this world.

Outstanding atmosphere and excellent food made this a wonderful dining experience. Try the brown fried rice with chicken, shrimp, park and vegetables. Very friendly staff and our server Jennifer was outstanding. Strongly recommend this restaurant before or after a Rays game.

Meh.

I resisted my usual chipotle urged and gave this place a try the other day.  I have to say that I was a little disappointed in the food.  I measure all greek "fast food" places up against Louis Pappas- and this place was no comparison.  

I got the chicken souvlaki platter which had chicken on skewers, served over rice and a greek salad.  The chicken was kind of dry and I didn't care for the seasoning, the greek salad was fine, but nothing special, and the tzatziki sauce was not garlicy enough for my taste :)

The service was fine. Again, nothing special.

Oh, and they have pepsi products.

LOVE TOPGOLF!
Always have a great time with friends and family! Nice place to spend quality time. Food was okay, but don't really care to eat there. Employees are nice and change the TV to whatever we want. Very helpful. Would definitely recommend and return!

I went here for dinner with a friend the other night and left very impressed. It was casual, but not chintzy. We wanted to order the spinach and artichoke dip to start, but they were out. That was OK though; we went with the hummus, which came loaded with extras like olives and feta cheese. Yummy! They gave us so much I still have plenty left over in my fridge today. I also ordered a cup of potato broccoli soup, which looked like neither, but was tasty nonetheless. For dinner, I had a bacon and blue cheese burger with sweet potato fries. The burger was huge and savory. Realized it was a BYOB while I was there, which is always a plus. It was steady business around 6:30pm on a Tuesday. The server was a little odd and slow with refilling our sodas, but that's about the only complaint I had. All of the food was magnificent and the atmosphere was enjoyable. Looking forward to back for brunch; the menu sounded delectable!

Heard this was a really fun bar from my friend who lives in West Chester. Came here for my friends 22 birthday for some drinks , and the bouncer who was a bald older man with a beard continuously tried to tell me my ID is a fake. I had multiple forms of identification on me. This was honestly humiliating and he was basically making fun of me. Me and my group of 6 girls will most definitely NEVER be coming back. I will be telling my other friends not to attend either.

I have had many positive experiences at Kooma in the past, but tonight was a supreme disappointment. 

My partner was very specific in her request for no eggs or mushrooms in what we thought would be Vegetarian Pad Thai.

At first, the Pad Thai arrived with egg. A little disappointed but still patient at this point, we sent it back.

When we received the Pad Thai upon 2nd go-around, it tasted strangely fishy and unappetizing to people who do not eat animal products.

Our waitress then informed us that, despite this ingredient not being listed or mentioned on the menu in any capacity, fish oil was used as a special ingredient in the vegetable Pad Thai.

Frustration building, my partner and I asked for another vegan friendly dish. Surprise! This time it appeared with mushrooms.

Our waitress was clearly trying her best which did not go unnoticed, but it was hard to remain pleased as we were forced to continually send back food.

Eventually we spoke to a manager who placed the blame on us. We argued that we were very clear in dietary accommodations. Although we should not have assumed the Pad Thai was vegan, fish oil is not something this dish typically (or ever in my experience) calls for.

The restaurant was also quite cold and I was shivering by the end of this 2 hour ordeal.

Will not be returning.

Excellent breakfast, hands down it's still the best breakfast in the STL. 
1. Bacon
2. Omelettes 
3. Chicken Breast Breakfast 
4. Fried Chicken.

The Philly Cheesesteak appetizer was really good. I went primarily for the burger and I wasn't disappointed, though I wouldn't recommend the garlic parmesan fries, should've gotten the sweet potato fries. Unfortunately, my wife wasn't too thrilled with her chicken lettuce wraps. She had to take the chicken from one of the wraps and add it to the others so it fill the lettuce leaves better. She liked the flavors, but the amount of chicken was weak. The service was mediocre. She didn't seem too busy, but she was a bit slow to start.

Nice employees, very helpful when asked about menu items through drive through. 

Very high quality chicken and they pride themselves on that. Their sauces are made in house, my favorite is the creamy garlic!

Sweet potato fries are also really good for a fast food restaurant, love that spiced marshmallow dip. It is "spiced" as in a warm, fall "spiced", not the taste of spicy.

Only complaint is my Pumpkin Spice Milkshake, which is amazing, had PLENTY of strawberry pulp in it. I'm not sure how the milkshakes are made but I'd assume the machine is not regular cleaned after the previous shake is made... I am glad I am not allergic and only simple dislike strawberry seeds/pulp (or pulp of any sort), but honestly wasted my money because I did not drink it all because of the pulp present. Which is the reason for four stars.

What happened to my favorite restaurant in Tucson? I have been going there for many many years. The food and service were always excellent!

However tonight everything went wrong. We were four of us meeting there for what we thought and expected to be a great experience. The waiter first told us that small plates were no longer available in the dining room. He offered us to move to the front room. We refused and decided to order from the menu. 

We requested a bottle of sparkling bottle if badoit. It did not arrive. We had to ask 3 times. One person ordered the special smoked duck appetizer and the beet salad, another the smoked duck appetizer, the third the coquille st Jacques and the fourth a house salad and The bouillabaisse   

One salad arrived. Bread came afterward. Bread was at least one day old and re heated. The second salad did not come. We had to ask for it twice. We are French and we know bouillabaisse. It's a fish and seafood tomato based soup. The bouillabaisse that was served had no broth, it had 2 little pieces of white fish, 2 shrimp and 4 mussels. We told the server that it was not a bouillabaisse. He did not seem to know what is a bouillabaisse. We requested to speak with Gordon and were told that he was busy in the kitchen training a cook. 

In the past, Gordon used to come to our table to inquire how our meal was and chat with us in French. Not tonight. 

Other patrons seemed to have complaints as well according to the way they addressed the waiters and waitress. 

Too bad! It was awful!!
We were expecting an enjoyable meal as usual but it was really bad. We won't go there again
My favorite donut place in New Orleans! They also have amazing sliders! My favorite is the chicken slider and the porkbelly slider, and a bonus is that they have waffle fries!

Busy and noisy at 12:30 lunch on a Tuesday.   Quieter by one.  Nice interior gastropub.  My pork and arugala slaw sandwich was good.  It came on a bun that was soft enough to pull apart easily.  When I did so the levels stayed together.  The texture and taste of both the sandwich and the slighly curried potato salad side were good.  I found myself enjoying the overall experience and reluctant to leave.  A good value at less than $10.

Great burgers and a wide selection of toppings to choose from. Especially like the roasted red pepper & garlic dressing.  I really love the Turkey burger from here, it's not dry and is very tasty. If you like burgers Phil's is the place to go.

These bagels are on point! We got the Asiago bagel with the nova spread as well as the "French toast" bagel with maple cream cheese. Both were awesome! Service was good. Food came out quickly. Coffee was good.

Dear Jed's, 
You are a sports bar. It says so in your name. So why did you have the CMA's on the big screen playing out loud when I wanted to watch the Predators game? You switched it to the hockey game once the awards were over, but until then I had to read closed captioned commentary on the smaller TV while listening to Taylor Swift make some sort of dying animal noises into a microphone.  
Your food was really good (great fries & sliders), beer selection was good, and I love that it's 2 for 1 on Wednesday night, but I'm still a little mad at you. 
I'll be back, but please don't pull that crap again.

Sincerely, 
Hockey Fan
Really good food. The drunken monkey French toast was seriously amazing. Will definitely be back!

Not a bad place for a bite. 

The "Taste of New Orleans" is a good dish to share and the redfish beignets were pretty tasty.  

The broiled oysters were packed with flavor but seemed to be on the small side.  

Service was good.  They had a bar with the football game on so we just picked on some food while we watched the game.  The hurricanes at Royal House were pretty good so order one if you decide to check this place out.
Loved the fried green tomatoes, fried chicken and Bianca pizza. All fresh and tasted fantastic!

Excellent dinner tonight with my wife.

She had the flatbread pizza and I had a lamb shawarma sandwich.
Both were delicious.

Nice ambiance and staff. We'll be back!

I LOVE THIS PLACE SO MUCH!!! 

This is my favorite sandwich shop ever. There is a reason they were voted one of the best in the City. The place is tiny and simple inside, just a dozen tables. But it's quaint. The sandwiches, the soup, the potato salad and coleslaw are all the best around. You seriously cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. The Smoked Chicken Salad is great, the Big Bad Wolf, the Layton...all amazing. You get a decent sized sandwich of quality ingredients and amazing flavor combinations. Even the simplest club is unique and delicious. They have a very limited vegetarian selection, just a couple of items to choose from. I don't think they have many desserts, I've just seen a little basket of brownies on the counter. It's basically just sandwiches. You order at the counter, get your fountain drink and they bring you your food.
In another great display of incompetence, my bacon habenaro burger had no habenaro.  I guess it's a companywide issue that these burgers just don't get made correctly.

My boyfriend and I have driven by twice place since it's been opened and never stopped in until today. 
I ordered a baby back rib sandwich with a side salad and my boyfriend had a Monte Cristo Mac and cheese bbq tri-tip sandwich with a side of Mac and cheese. When we walked in we weren't sure what to expect. Their menu was nice, interesting take on the vegan choices. We were greeted by the owner, we ate in, and then our server was a young girl (early teens), she seemed to know what she was doing but was very awkward. Now I'm really not a fan of BBQ at all, unless I make it myself or I'm eating at Goodwood. I was really disappointed by the portion sizes, but was satisfied with the meat quality (I am the pickiest meat eater). 
Their Mac & Cheese alone is worth going there for, but I'm not a fan of their entree's or choices. Their food is INCREDIBLY rich and made me sick for 3 days with only consuming half my meal (which isn't very big to begin with). Their salad looked like they had pulled it out of a $.99 bag of iceberg lettuce and put it in a bowl. I know it's a side salad but I'd like more to it!
Overall, I'm not a fan. I didn't try their Vegan selection but I would contemplate going back. But between the OK service and the way I felt for three days after, that would be a hard bargain.

Fantastic Indian for delivery.  The gents are always well dressed when they deliver, which really isn't a big deal, but they are always prompt which is.  Their online ordering is simple and concise and their menu is awesome with some extra special specials thrown in for good measure.

Try the Chicken Vindaloo if you like it spicy and the Butter Chicken if you don't.  The Samosas are great and the Lasooni Naan is the best.
Delicious. So many great flavors. Definitely worth a visit. The ice cream can serve as a meal if you don't want to spend too much time eating and being away from the honky tonks.
Great atmosphere and great food just the way I like it I will definitely  be back gonna make this place my new favorite 10 out of 10 in my eyes thanks guys
Some of the best views of the skyline of NOLA can be seen from this old school showboat with jazz in the air and drinks to be shared.

If it was possible to give a place zero stars I would. As one of the only places uptown to get a good chopped salad, Fresh Bar has a lot of potential. That potential is completely destroyed by their unbelievably atrocious service. I have been here many times, each time hoping for a better experience, and each time disappointed. Not only do they have 1 person working at a time (not just making the salads, but literally one person working in the entire building going back and forth from the kitchen), but there have been several times I have come in and no one has been there at all. I knock on the kitchen door and the "employees only" door, but no one comes out so i have been just left alone in the restaurant. Not only is this stupid for their purposes - who's to say I wouldn't steal? - but it is actually comical to think you can run a business with no one working. Today I came in and waited over an hour for a simple salad because there was only one woman working and having to go back and forth from the kitchen. She also was literally not wearing pants. This place would be run better if it was run by toddlers. I am genuinely shocked that this place is still open.
I love this place! They have brown rice as a substitution option for $1 per roll. The service is great, and they don't skimp on the fish.

Searing and service was fast and friendly. We used a coupon, which was essy and worked well. However, the food was at best bland and unintresting.  I had lo mein served along a small serving of cold fried tofu. I was also dissapointed with the lettuce wrap.  I was expecting more than 4 peices of lettuce for a $6 dish  Theyre honey shrimp was good, but I was also let down with their rice.  Rice makes or breaks an asian resturant, and it wasnt that exciting. All in all, good environment and atmosphere, but sub par food. I won't be coming back anytime soon

Wow. I stumbled upon this online when looking up pizza places and was stunned to find that Apollos has an average of 3 stars. I've been coming here for years and the food is incredible. Sandwiches are gigantic and the pizza is awesome. Check out the pic.

Great atmosphere. Friendly staff.
Good service.
I had the bacon cheeseburger.
It was good but was undercooked.
The potato soup was good as well.
The bacon on it was not very good...
The food quality could be better for the price.
Worth a try though.

This location is awful! The service is bad & the food is even worse! I tried complaining to "a manager" & he told me he really didn't manage this store he's just helping out & he didn't know the owner's name or a corporate contact so that I could complain to the right person. Uh ok, but he still seemed uninterested in my complaint until I mentioned that I was going to tell everyone & yes POST IT ON YELP. At that time he apologized & offered to remake our order. No thank you! We just won't be back & yes I'll tell everyone not to waste their time or money here. 

**The pics are of a chicken sandwich we ordered. The cheese wasn't even in the sandwich, just thrown in next to it. The quality was just gross!
I've eaten at Bully's plenty of times but tonight we had a server named Ashley ( not sure of her last name that was top notch. Made our experience tonight awesome

All in all it's a authentic Chinese restaurant with good service and decent amount of food each plate, the spring roll is ok, but the  Chicken with House Special Chili Sauce is on point, boiling fish is like every other Chinese restaurant 's boiling fish, not very special. Lamb is a little too salty. Good veggie options, and I like food being served so fast!

Spectacular food. As a person who dislikes most cajun food, I have had a hard time figuring out why so many people rave about New Orleans cuisine. Three Muses changed my mind.

We ordered the mac and cheese, steak and cake, tempura shrimp, fish tacos, feta fries, and cream cheese brownie. All were very good but the highlights for us were the shrimp, fries, and mac.

We were also really impressed with the quality of music (Dr. Sick) and atmosphere. Definitely recommend this place and hope to return next time I'm in town.
Not much parking at this location. But great service! Plenty of tables and WiFi so you can get some work done.

We ended up here because we got a parking spot right in front of the place and since I hadn't done Moroccan in awhile I figured what the hey.  We walked in and it was tres dark with cool brass round tables and big couches. Due to the xtra weight i gained from eating so much, I had to lay down. I'm sure I wasn't the first. I figured the soup and the seafood Bastille would be enough for me; watching my weight and all that. We were approached by the waiter when we walked in and even though the place had only 2 other tables filled, he still asked us if we had a reservation. That sleighs me. Anyway, The soup was delicious; tomato with lentils, chick peas and spices.. delish! My partner ordered the chicken Bastille; but i make it a point to never order chicken at restaurants. I tasted it but it wasn't great and really sweet. My seafood Bastille wasn't much better but it did the job. Great ambiance and music. The waiter was not very good. But he had so many tables to wait on.... I wouldn't really recommend this place unless your a newbie foodie.
I loved this place. The food was amazing and you can't beat the prices for the amount of food you get. I travel for work and come to New Orleans a lot. I found my new favorite spot in NOLA.

I ate here as I stayed at the hotel it's connected to. For dinner I had the mushroom bisque with bread basket. The bisque itself was tasty, but lacking actual mushrooms and the bread came out cold and hard. The next morning I had breakfast with a colleague there and they never brought my toast out. I asked for my eggs well done and they came out still undercooked. The potato hash was the best thing about my meals here. Breakfast staff was nice, dinner staff not as much. Not worth the price IMO.

Fork is just another hyped up American food joint in Boise that is popular because of the owner. People in Boise love to go to the talked about restaurants to see and be seen, and sometimes forget about the quality of food. The menu is small, not many choices. I had the chicken entree one night, it was decent. The next time I had the steak sandwich, which also was decent. The atmosphere is nice, and the servers do a good job. They do have a good bottled beer list, but only a few beers on tap.

I totally love this place. If you have any ailments, go to Wholefoods and find your cure! I like to do my research before hand, so I know I am looking for. The people in the vitamin section are sooooo helpful but I would recommend that you have an idea what you are looking for.

We came for the prime rib special- amazing! The meat was cooked absolutely perfectly and the service was phenomenal. We mentioned it was our first time here and we got a free dessert! Definitely will be coming back.

The restaurant is in the heart of ambler borough. It's a small but chic restaurant that let's you bring your own wine(byo). Yay. Time to break out some cheap wine! But that's okay because Massa's great selection of food in various portions will impress you enough that the wine you brought will be nothing but delicious. (unless it's a bad wine, jokes on you, I guess) 
We walked in pretty late on a Friday night but our server was really welcoming and fabulous. We had the tuna carpaccio and octopus as starters then scallops and chicken for main course. The carpaccio was great with avocado and hints of pepper and sea salt. The octopus...I loved it. The whole concoction with chori√ßo(sp?) sausage plus potatoes plus bean sauce was really delicious. The main dishes were also delicious but wasn't the best scallops or chicken I have ever had. Still, it was very very very sososososo delicious. 

Service was also phenomenal, as the server gave beautiful and accurate descriptions of all dishes we inquired him about. Ice bucket was brought out upon arrival for our white wine and he kindly told us to take our time even after the closing time. Granted, there was another table in the restaurant that was full on drunk and stuck around until we left. Such tragedy, I tell you. 

Anyways, I can't wait to return soon enough. 

P.S. They serve warm, soft dinner roll with whipped butter!!! What can I say? It was inevitable that I immediately fell in love.

Dropped in here to kill some time before a show at The Ready Room and was very glad that I did!  The staff was incredibly nice and accommodating. The coffee was great and the atmosphere was pleasant.  It wasn't overdone like some places, it was just comfy and welcoming.  If you get a chance you should stop in!

I really enjoy the food and pastries at St Louis Bread Co./Panera. However,  on my visit on 6/13/2018,I have never entered a location that was as messy as this place. Tables were not bussed and the floors were a mess. I'm looking at four tables in view that have trays. This location needs help.
Incredible. Delicious food, low prices, giant portions, friendly staff. I will definitely be back here with friends. I was really happy with everything here.
Nice place friendly service simple Cuban favorites on the menu. The flavored were great buy the portions were small and most the sides are all extras which can send a simple lunch over the top

We came here late on a Sunday. We had been traveling all day and the gentleman on the phone suggested we could place an order and have it ready when we arrived. Brilliant! After eating we could continue our trip. I'm Indian and let me tell you these favors were authentic and delicious. We ordered the sag paneer, chicken tikka masala and malai kofta, as well as samosas. All dishes were served upon our arrival and they were very flavorful. The service was attentive and friendly. The restaurant itself is modern and immaculate.  We had a great break from our journey. Oh, and we had gulab jaman for dessert and it was very good too.  We wished we lived closer but we are hundreds of miles away.

I'll never eat there again. Not because the food or service was bad, but because I walked in at 9pm (there published closing is 10pm), and unbeknownst to me, just beat the manager locking the door. I asked for a table and the hostess suggested the bar, which I declined. She the said, "Let me see if the kitchen is still open." It was and she gave me a snotty look and seated me. I then heard the manager tell the kitchen, "We had another guy sneak in". I ordered their chili and a Caesar's salad, and the House Old Fashioned. The brisket in the chili had never seen smoke and was a bit fatty; if they don't use a bottled dressing for the salad, they should. If they do use a bottled dressing, they should switch. It was so overpowered by mayonnaise it was inedible. And the drink was too-too-too sweet. The waitress was great, and I tipped accordingly.

the food here is very good.  our server Karen was nice effecient and friendly.  Food came out hot and fresh although my rib eye was a little more than well done when I ordered it medium but that being said you could cut it with a butter knife so I did not complain.  We have hosted a couple of banquets here in the past and they were always accomodating and friendly.  Yes it is a bit pricey but well worth the trip.

Great Build Your Own Hash! I had a Russet potato, sage sausage, mushrooms, peppers, and sage aioli hash. I also ordered a black coffee which was deliciously strong. The hash was yummy (considering I made up the combo on the fly) and was given to us just before our hangry phase started. 
My friends and I drove into SB for the day and came here for brunch before laying out on the beach. We came on a 3 day weekend, so it was a little busy but we managed to find a table. 

Great little spot!

Well, it's beautiful in there, that's for sure. And I could speak to the waiter in Spanish, so my memory apparently isn't as crappy and useless as I once thought. That said, though, the crowd wasn't really my thing and I just didn't get the whole showy thing of the dudes putting the margaritas on their heads and then walking them through the restaurant. Ha ha - that is so cool - we get it. The food was yummy (what I ate of it, anyway) but the real winner was the drinks. Yeah tequila. Yeah salt and rocks. Yeah getting a buzz before you go out dancing. 

Viva la margarita!

Best place for live music! Cool venue, neat shops, good food, try the mussels!
Mango Margarita Rocks!

Checked out Chatham Tap on Butler's campus and was very happy with the food and service.  Love that they have Franziskaner on tap! Great local and craft beer selections.  Friendly severs. Try the garlic fries appetizer.  So flipping delicious!
Super nett und Top Qualit√§t. KFC war gestern. Das hier hat richtig klasse - vorallem die Saucen und der Service. 5von5

On Saturday I hustled my bustle to bread co so my mother could have b-fast.  I ran down the stairs and revved up the engine to my motor vehicle then I skirt skirted to my destination without Siri if you are wandering cuz Siri has been underperforming lately or I just cannot follow directions.  So at this particular bread co they had a drive thru so I thought to myself how beast of a driver I am just like the queen of NASCAR Danica Patrick.  Finally my turn and roll up to the window and order a bagel pack with two tubs of creamy cream cheese.  I assume the cream cheese came from a magestic cow with the finest raw milk utter to bucket, in short the cream cheese was not the problem.  The slicing of the bagels were.  I asked for the bagels to be cut I half and one of my bagels was not.  An innocent French toast bagel was sliced so horribly I began to cry as if the bagel had been told Natalie Wood is dead.  Natalie Wood was just amazing in West Side Story, so all y'all haters back off Natalie Wood she is a talented beast.  But back to he bagel, it was cut short just like scarlet Johansson's hair in her new movie (roasted).  In conclusion Bread co cut your bagels better.

My fiance and I stopped by here on a Saturday night when we were coming back in from out of town. Considering it was a Saturday night around 6:30, I thought this place would be packed but there was hardly anyone there. Because of that, we were seated right away. Everyone is nice enough, but was obvious that they weren't exactly thrilled to be there.

They had 2 for 1 margaritas so we both opted to get a couple of those. And the mix they use is so strange tasting. It's really sweet but tastes like they dumped a bunch of salt in it to balance out the sweetness, but it just didn't work at all. I opted to get the chicken flautas and they were decent. Not the best I've ever had but not terrible either. My fiance got some kind of burrito, can't really remember, and he thought it was just alright.

This is pretty standard fare in any of the Americanized type Mexican restaurants. Fairly cheap, ok quality, kind of eh service. This is the first Mexican place we've been to in the area, so not sure if there is anything else to substitute, but I'm sure if I looked I could find some place that I'd rather go to.

There was a girl that looked like she was high trying to get the attention of some guy working the kitchen for over 10 minutes. I think she worked here and was off the clock cause she made hearts at the manager/trainer that was surrounded by new employees. It was insanely cringy and annoying how she kept calling out to him and BEGGING him to give her an answer to something then saying pretty please and promise? PROMISE?!

Unprofessional. If I wanted dinner and a show, I'd go elsewhere. Not a good example for the new employees.

I never thought I will enjoy playing golf and have so much fun.

It's one of favorite places to go to hang out with my friends. Especially since all the other group places around like "bowling alleys" are old and beaten up, this place offers us a refreshing and quality time.

Luke was the best dinner I had on my recent trip to NOLA, and was a great counterpoint to the previous night's experience at Cochon.

This won't be a comparative review, but the two evenings were a study in contrasts. I was equally excited for each dinner, but all the anticipation I had for Cochon led to a bit of a letdown, whereas Luke delivered with excellence.

We were seated immediately after arrival (8:30pm Saturday reservation), and my friends all ordered the highly-recommended mint julep. They were well made and universally praised.

Soup course was 3 for gumbo, and 1 for corn and crab chowder. Everyone was happy, and the gumbo was probably the best we had in the city.

Dinner topped the soup course well. The hamburger was as large as advertised, and had a fantastic rich, char-grilled flavor. The fries were a treat as well. I had the duck breast and absolutely loved it. Cooked well, with great combinations of sweet and salty flavors. The nightly special of rabbit was also very tasty, and shrimp and grits were wonderful too. I'd love to gush about the food, but hopefully you've stopped reading this review and have already ordered your food at Luke.

As for dessert - we all got it, and we all liked it. Bread pudding was a touch too sweet, which made it unfinishable, although it was very good. My friend enjoyed the crepes, but I didn't sample them. The pot de creme was among the best I've ever had (better than my homemade!). Creme brulee was equally good, and notable was that it was served only slightly-chilled, letting the vanilla flavor really sing. 

Just go. Enjoy it. Order well, and savor!

I'm from LA and this restaurant just wasn't up to par with other breakfast places I've been to. The service was terrible. They tend to serve quickly so when my family had already waited over half an hour I decided to complain and ask where our food was. They shrugged me off and said it would be out in a minute. After another 15 mins still no food. I complained once more, but was more demanding. One of the servers came up to us and told us that the receipt for our food did not go through so we then had to wait another 15 minutes to finally get our food. When we finally received our food and tried it, it honestly was not that grate. Too much hype over this place. Would've preferred a local IHOP.

Our group eats Sunday breakfast there a couple times a month.  Service is always excellent, and the staff goes out of it's way to please.  In the last couple of months, they've developed a Gyro Hash that's out of this world.  Be sure to top it with feta cheese.  Over the years, Romano's has been a staple of fine food in the Brandon/Valrico area.  George and his staff will take great care of you.

We stayed at the Hilton during the Christmas holiday and were happy to have a well known restaurant right in the hotel! My sister had also recommended Drago's to us when she was here this past July. This restaurant was very busy and they had plenty of staff which can be good or bad depending how you look at it. In our case our waitress was very nice but didn't come around as much. My husband only had one Bud Light the entire time. On to the food we all know the "Star" of Drago's is the charred oysters and they didn't disappoint at all. I ordered the stuffed shrimp with boudin and it was very delicious. My husband ordered the Shucky Duckey the duck was tender and moist, the oyster were good but biting into his pasta you also bit into shells which was a little disappointing he didn't finish it. Overall great restaurant for Oysters and the food was good too.

Went here for lunch on Friday for the first time and the food was AMAZING! I ordered the chicken skins to share ... out of this world! I had the Bleu Steel burger and my girlfriend had a cheese burger. Eric, our server, was very nice and attentive. Because the skins were so decadent, we both opted for side salads versus fries  with our burgers. When our food arrived, all I could say was WOW!  I'll definitely be coming back and I highly recommend that you try the place for yourself. You won't be disappointed! The owner was sooo nice, and he actually thanked each patron for coming as they walked out the door! It doesn't get any better than that!

The place is gorgeous. We were greeted at the lobby and directed us to the elevator. The hostess was friendly who took us to our table . Our sever started good but as the restaurant got busy service was a little slow which we didn't mind because we were enjoying the sunset and the view and we're not in a rush . I ordered the shrimp and scallops and the lobster Mac and cheese. My husband ordered the pork loin and shoulder . Both our our meals was flavorful and cooked perfectly. For dessert we had the s'mores and it's delicious. I give this restaurant 5 stars . I highly recommend this place for a romantic date night and we would definitely come back .

Hubby and I pride ourselves on our low country boils. That being said, I thought the shrimp boil was priced well (though not as good as ours, LOL) and I asked where the oysters on the half shell were from. Bartender asked the MOD who said California. I ignored and ordered them--not good. Restaurant was also a lot more of a chain restaurant atmosphere than we expected. Hubby liked the crab cake basket; bartender was fantastic, but a manager who tells you the oysters are from California? That being said, the staff hustles, food came out quickly.

Favorite restaurant in Nashville for date night. I dream about the spicy crab noodles sometimes. The bar is perfect for a drink with friends and the place itself is beautiful. And for dessert get the chocolate cake thing (can't remember what it's called). It's SO TASTY and unique! Keep doing what you're doing because y'all are killing it!

The place is dirty and the bathrooms are disgusting. The  waitresses are more concerned about talking with their boyfriends and coworkers then taking care of customers. The service is not that good and the manager makes it an effort to see if everything is ok. I will not return after going there once a month now that Gators Dockside opened in Spring Hill. The there is GREAT

I was there only for a quick drink however it was a good experience.
I raised the question about the taste for a specific beer and got immediately offered a sample.
Service was fast and friendly. Nice experience was also that they showed a DVD movie and the whole bar was so focused on it.
I saw an announcement in the bar for a regular karaoke party...if I remember correctly it was Monday. A good reason to come back and learn more about this place.

I have eaten here several times. It doesn't matter if I walk in 30 minutes before they close, I get seated and the servers are so nice. I try not to inconvenience them by walking in so close to closing, but the servers treat me like I walked in way earlier. Their food is excellent, the bread is always fresh and the white bean dip is exquisite. I love the pork tenderloin medallions with the gigantic portobello mushroom and the garlic mashed potatoes. The menu says three medallions but usually there's a fourth and one time I got 5, so they don't skimp on food. I usually take the potatoes home because I can't eat them all, and I'm a big dude, so that's saying something. I have also had the Tuscan stew, and although its a bit spicy, its chock full of hearty seafood, which is great because I LOVE seafood. If you like tasty Italian food at a fair price and honest portions, try this place.

Best fish and chips since my last visit to the coast. They were served quick and hot!! Fries, delicious and a very large serving. I'm taking half my fish home. The beer was draft/half price. The server/ awesome and just her 3 rd day. Wow. I'll be back.

We have been to Gordon Biersch Brewery Restaurants in Myrtle Beach and Las Vegas and liked them. So, when we saw one in New Orleans, we knew we were going. We like their beer and have usually gotten good meals there, too. We sat at the bar. $3 beers-yay! Scott made sure our evening was was enjoyable. From advice about beer choices to making sure our meals were prepared properly. We appreciate his efforts. We shared the Bavarian pretzel and Fondu. It was very good. My husband enjoyed his salmon and my steak salad was delicious. Thanks for a good dinner.

Ella's:  great food, bad management

Ella has the best food ever-  including a few unusual things you don't usually see on the menu, like sweetbreads or bone marrow.  But don't be put off by these two choices-  there is something for everyone and all is outstanding!  Food could not be better, and the flatbread choice of the day is great- one night it was steak and another night featured duck.

But don't try to go there for Happy Hour.  The service is abominable.  They have the same person trying to bar tend and wait tables.  One time we waited so long for service, we finally flagged someone down.  We waited another 10 min without success and I finally got up to talk to the hostess-  and it turned out that the waiter/tress was doing an interview!  In the middle of Happy Hour (5:30pm).  What are they thinking? 
Another night the waiter was kind enough but had no clue about the specials, menu etc and was trying to serve too many tables. 

If the management would only staff the bar appropriately (can't they even hire a college student to bar tend a few hours in the evening when things are busy?), this would be one of my favs.

This chain Mexican spot is a solid choice for family dining, most adventurous eaters might prefer to look elsewhere though. The chain was started by 2 Mexican natives in 1994, and has spread throughout the east coast with over 30 locations now. It is definitely better than other similar corporate Mex places.

A groupon brought us here, and for an easy and economical family meal we were pleased. We liked the large space that had a more open feel than many south of the border shops that we find ourselves in. A sign at the entrance advertised some drink specials, when I saw $2 for a 16oz Dos Equis, I knew that would be what I was drinking. The menu was fairly large with most of the usual suspects, but also some more Americanized plates. Even a good selection of kid's meals.

We started with table made guac, you can tailor it to your own taste and the avocados were good and mostly ripe. But if you prefer it creamier as we do, you might want to specify from the start. The chips were not to my liking, definitely from a bag, I did like the salsa though. Both kids liked their choices, and we even had to order more beef tacos for the pickier of the two.

Trish ordered seafood chimis, but unfried. She liked but I thought they had a fake seafood flavor. She didn't think she would order again. I had chicken chimis fried of course, and I was happy with the choice. The chicken was tender and nicely seasoned, tortillas nice and crispy, with just a little bit of cheese sauce. I added salsa and jalape√±os to up the spice level. The sides of rice and beans were both pretty good too. We ended the meal with something the kids were not expecting, churros. 3 of us really liked them, warm and crispy with cinnamon sugar on the outside and caramel in the middle, plus a little container with even more to be drizzled on them at our will.

Even without the groupon the prices seemed pretty fair. With it we felt like thieves. Service was friendly and quick throughout, but they appear to do quite a business on a Saturday night, so plan for that. Armed with another groupon and the kids, we would probably return. On our own, probably not. 3.5 is there such a thing as an authentic chain Yelps

Very disappointed in the vegan pizza. They basically put no vegan cheeze on it - it didn't even cover the pizza or the toppings or anything, but was like a few sparse sprinkles here in there. It looked as if they had come across the last bit in the bag and just tried to spread it out to make it cover one pizza when it really couldn't even cover a quarter of it.

We won't be back again. We found out Panago Pizza has vegan options that are much better and actually give you lots of Daiya cheeze on your pizza - like a real pizza should!

Revamp your vegan pizzas and we'll consider coming back. But you've got a lot of competition with Panago, especially considering all of their healthy, delicious vegan pizza options.

Meh. I had been hearing such great things about this place, but I was disappointed. I had the BBQ nachos and they were pretty gross. I am a nacho connoisseur and these paled in comparison to Drifter's BBQ nachos. They were served on hard, greasy and overcooked homemade potato chips, with movie-theater cheese sauce (actually, most theaters have better) with all the slimy fat parts of the pork and very little meat. Its like they gave me all the "waste parts" and thought I wouldn't notice under the mounds of cheese and tomato. I rarely waste food but I barely ate any of it. The atmosphere is cool and the people are friendly but don't go for the food. I won't be back.

We went there today and I was excited to try a new place.  We will never return to this location for a few reasons.  Keep in mind it was the same employee every time but we are too skeeved out to ever go back.
1) The employee didn't know the menu and when I asked about a topping instead of finding out the answer he lied about it.  Had it been an allergen I was asking about the outcome could have been tragic.
2) He was rude and not friendly at all.  He acted as if we were bothering him.
3) All the tables were dirty and sticky.
4) We watched the same employee clean the bathroom then without washing his hands (I had my eyes on him the whole time) went to the front counter and brought us our food. Gross!!!
5) While the manager was refunding our money I saw the bucket filled with cleaner and water that they use to wipe the tables down with and it had stuff floating in it and filmy layer that was thick and gross looking.
I would avoid this location because it is a public health nightmare! The manager did give us coupons which I will use but I'll be visiting the Centerton Rd. location in Moorestown.

Great Italian food, great service and a great atmosphere! This doesn't even need a long winded review. This isn't really a casual italian restaurant, it's a little more upscale but the food is great, pizza, pasta, you name it. The best is their pizza, it's an outstanding thin crust, which can be hard to come by in the Santa Barbara/ Goleta area. It's a great place for a family night out or a Saturday dinner with some friends. It's elegant and comfy interior is upstaged by its even greater and delicious italian foods.

Food was really good; service was excellent. We were a group of four adults and one five year-old. The cook entertained everyone and pulled the shy five year-old out of her shell quickly. It was a good time and the prices were right in line with every other Hibachi grill.

Very delicious bagels and unique cream cheeses! Sugar cookie caramel cream cheese is amazing and tastes just like cheesecake. They do put a hefty amount of cream cheese on the bagels, which was unexpected, but better to have too much than not enough, right?

Great place for dinner! Food was great, especially the cheesesteak egg rolls. Waitress was very nice and offered suggestions while we were in town. Overall great place and I would highly recommend it!

Came here for Mother's Day. The food was "ok". The drinks were way better than the food. So let's get started. I would highly recommend doing the pre-seating on their website before you go. 

Drinks:
We got the Long Island Iced Tea. My hubby said it was good. I got the peach sangria which was GREAT! 

Appetizers:
The calamari was good. And the chicken spicy soup was great. Not very spicy, but good.

Dinner:
I got the linguine pescatore. It was ok, not spicy and very bland. Needed alot salt and pepper. Will not order again.
My hubby got the salmon with mashed garlic potatoes and broccoli. NOT good. The salmon was ok, but undercooked. The mashed potatoes were not good. The broccoli reminded you of frozen broccoli. 

Overall the staff were very good and very accommodating. Gabby was our server and perfect! She was a 10!

Since my hubby wasn't pleased with his meal the remade his meal and gave us generous discount.

Absolutely horrible bar service on my visit today. The service was so bad people were ordering multiple drinks when they finally got a chance to order because the wait was so long. Our office will no longer come back here for happy hours. After half an hour of waiting some in our group just gave up on getting anything. Once I was able to order my drinks the cocktail I ordered was very poorly made. If I hadn't already closed my tab and the wait wouldn't take forever I would've asked for another drink or my money back.

I actually didn't have any wings at this Wing House, but my sandwich was good and the service was very friendly and attentive. I guess because it's a fairly new location the interior is also much nicer than any other Wing House I've seen.

I got the salmon grill- cajun style with diablo sauce.  It comes with white rice and black beans. Well worth it's $13.95 price. It will appeal to those who like Baja - California style Mexican food.  

From 4-6 pm daily they have happy hour margaritas $1.50 off.   I didn't try one though.  The service was good they kept the drinks filled and brought more salsa.
If you like to drink and gamble, it's a good place for you.  I'm not a gambler so I waste my money mainly on booze and some slots while my husband plays the black jack table.

I live in Chinatown and there are a lot of places to get tea drinks, but Bubblefish is one of the more unique places to get them. I tried their fried calamari, crabmeat salad and pork sung onigiri, and Bubblefish roll and they were all delicious! The service here are friendly and made me feel welcome. I would definitely come here again.

This was by far one of the best burgers in saint louis hands down. The place is a bit small but nice with a bar on one side and a small market on the other with a seating area between...it may seem odd at first. The staff is super nice and extremely helpful. The price can range anywhere from 6 bucks to 15+ on a burger depending on how much you think tou can eat. Overall this place is a must upon burger places within St. Louis.
Had to make a reservation but when should up they rushed us to grab our own table?  As we were sitting the waiter puts a dirty beer glass right infringe of me , almost hit me in fact.

Very good Greek food. I had hummus as an appetizer and the pita bread is warm! It's delicious. I ordered a gyro and it's a pretty good portion. I couldn't eat it all and took half of it home. The atmosphere is fun. There is patio seating. I definitely would like to go back.

Giddee Up! This country bar was rocking on a Friday night when we busted during the 2014 CMA Festival. The energy was fun and upbeat.

There was a country cover band playing on stage, which kept the crowd dancing and singing during our meal.

The bar's service was attentive and we didn't have to wait long to place our food and drink orders.

The BBQ was above average, not the best; but still much better than some other bar establishments.

Had a great brunch at Pennsylvania 6 today. Three of us received a warm welcome and were seated upstairs. It was very quiet throughout our brunch. I didn't get why though; the restaurant has beautiful decor and service was friendly. 

About the food, no complaints here either. Firstly, their fresh orange juice is great! I ordered the eggs Benedict. What I liked about it was that the bacon was different from what I'm used to. It was thinly sliced, in little shredded pieces. They don't serve a lot of Hollandaise sauce with it which I prefer, and the poached eggs were perfectly cooked as well. 

I would definitely be interested in coming back for another brunch, or perhaps even for dinner.

Worst service ever I waited 25 minutes for my food got to the car and found they didn't have my fries so after I get home I start eating and found a long hair inside my sandwich DO NOT COME TO THE ESTABLISHMENT

I'm writing as a non sushi fan, so this probably isn't fair. However, I had the teriyaki chicken meal and it was probably the worst teriyaki chicken I've ever had.  It was grilled chicken drowned in cold, flat out not good teriyaki syrup. The rice was equally as bad. Not a fan.

We were never in here before but stopped by for lunch and had great service and great food earlier today!  My son "loved" the SW Mac&cheese with chicken and the sirloin steak salad was perfect. My husband also loved the pulled pork.  Stephan was great too and was an amazing waiter.  We'll be back again as new returning customers!

We were seated immediately, but without silverware or menus. Very sweet server took our drink order but it took a long time to get. There were 3 servers I could see and it was not busy at 10pm by any means. Service was slower than molasses in Alaska in January.

Everything took forever. Even getting our ticket after we were well finished took forever. Salt seemed wet in the shaker, grabbed a different one from another table. Other tables were not bussed. Food was barely warm. Burger was ok, fries not hot but not cardboard either.  Had just left Busch Gardens, I felt like we would be there all night. Ok to visit if you have all night.
Worst service ever at a Chick Fil A. Very disappointing!  Hope they work on their service and timeliness with customers.

way better than lucky strike ;p

Great weekly drink specials and staff is super nice. 

Food is pretty good too =)

We absolutely love this little place! My husband and I stopped in on a whim one morning with our two very young daughters. We felt like it was very laid back and kid friendly and we all loved the food.  A member of the staff overheard us saying how much our daughter loved my potatoes and surprised us and brought her some of her own. We spilled water and the little ones made a mess and when they saw us cleaning, kept saying not to worry and not to clean it. (Don't worry we left a big tip). Just very fun and friendly staff, and great food! We were also happy with the prices. We will definitely come back! :)
SO YUMMY. Really you can't go wrong - snacks, dinner, brunch. The owners and staff are incredibly accommodating and kind. And you have to pick up some of the incredible desserts.

NPS = 4

Excruciatingly slow service.

It took us an hour and 15 mins from the moment we ordered to get our food.  It was unacceptable.



The food itself was good, however.  The duck and hash was rich and had wonderful texture/flavor.

The bread pudding was also sweet to the tongue with the strong yet not overpowering taste of brown sugar.

The restaurant is right next to Jackson Square and they do have live music (a cello, a guitar and trumpet).  But sadly, the slow service just knocks this place off my list of places to visit.  The worst part is they told our party we had to be present at the time of our reservation or we would be charged.  We held our end of the bargain but Muriel's decided to not hold up to their's in providing a great dining experience.

Customer service is great and the ambiance. If you're looking for authentic Mexican food, this is not the place. It's more of an American style restaurant. I was craving a frozen margarita, however, oddly they said they don't do frozen because they don't have a blender (very weird). The food was okay, not bad, just okay.

It was a huge line, 30
Minutes wait, but worth the waiting.  First time visiting iPhiladelphia ask the tour guide where locals eat and he said Sonny's. The bread is unique, the ribeye steaks are thin and not over chopped cheese wiz was on point.  What I loved about it more is that it wasn't wet soggy.  
The french fries  super crispy delicious ... In the 3 days i spent in Philly, we eat at Sonny's 2 times couldn't help going back to try the different toppings they offer.

Great place very small.. sweet staff 
Next time in Philly definitely will stop by...

Can't get tickets! I was buying tickets for my upcoming trip for my birthday. I was on the website, 2nd in line and when I ordered my tickets I was booted and then I kept trying 3 times but it kept kicking me out of the queue- very frustrating.  Horrible process!!!  I'm just enraged at how difficult this was.  I didn't get tickets.  Please think about changing your process.  Thank you!
Worst fast food restaurant I've ever been to worst McDonald's in town rudest employees don't care service is horrible slow and always incorrect cannot believe they are still in business.

The best pizza to get in the Wesley Chapel-Lutz area, which is HUGE given how tough the competition is in a 10 mile radius. 

The dough for the pizza is always soft where it needs to be and crunchy where it needs to be. The delivery is quicker to my work, although to be fair they are a bit quicker. The customer service, fair warning, is no nonsense. They may not dress you up but they give you your food not a moment later after it's done. And that's personally what I like for my pizza joint.

Sauce? Robust.
Cheese? Melty gooey and yummy.
Pepperoni? Nice and spicy.

Granted I haven't had the WHOLE menu, but if you just like your pizza with cheese and pepperoni, this is the best place to have it at.

Watched the owner lick spilled syrup from my drink off of her fingers. Dirty place with stained couches. Eggs were microwave cooked and still partially raw. Worst breakfast I could have found in Bucks county

The customer service is horrible! Don't know if it's because of a young group they gave employed. We waited 15 mins before I had to get the managers attention to let her know that we haven't seen anyone since sitting at the table. The waitress didn't have good customer service skills at all.

The food is amazing and always tastes fresh. We usually call in the order on our way to work and pick it up 10 minutes later. 

Staff is always friendly and their desserts are epic! 

Great place to get a big sandwich. Their Turkey Avacado panini is our favorite.

Found this little gem around the corner from my hotel in a suburb of NOLA. I had the classic seafood gumbo, a side of jambalaya and the grilled veggies.  The jambalaya was not too spicy, totally just right.  The side order was a perfect amount.  The gumbo was my fav.  My only complaint was that there were a couple pieces of shrimp tail in the broth.  Not a huge deal but the only reason I didn't give them a straight 5.  Everything was delicious and the staff was super friendly.  Chef Ron even came out to greet me to ask how everything was and chatted everyone up. Lots of locals in the place which is always a good sign.  Definitely worth a stop in if you're in the area.

Every time you come in here it's a long long way today and 45 minutes 3/4 of the tables in there empty people are leaving quickly as they come in the door next time there's a 45 minute wait how about 40 people walked out of here you would think it would have enough sense to do something about that before they get run out of business

The Breakfast Boutique in Chestnut Hill routinely offers good food and good experiences but the same cannot be said if their new place in Mount Airy. Tried it today and the experience was horrendous; the wait staff was disorganized, disinterested, and inept at best. Not a good experience at all, I definitely will not be going back and will gladly share the same advice with others.

Had a delightful experience with my two favorite sister bartenders Mellissa and mikki.  Both had recommended the fish tacos and it was amazing 
Their crew is awesome and always have a blast
Will definitely stay here next time

We always have a good experience here. The food at first watch is creative and innovative which is one thing we look forward to. The staff are always very nice and it's kind of fun where there's more than one person who seems to take care of your table.

The last time we went I got the short rib omelette and it was outstanding. My partner got a frittata and absolutely loved it.

The only downside is they don't have booze so it's a dry brunch spot.
Amazing coffee & pumpkin bread! Can't wait to be back in the area to stop by again! Such a cute little coffee shop!

Placed a mobile order. Paid. Drove to restaurant to pick it up. Guy didn't even start on it. Had to wait on line before he would even make it. One would think they would make the mobile orders so they are ready by the promised time. I showed the guy my order, but he continued to make orders for people in line instead. What's the point of ordering ahead if it's going to be like that. This subway sucks. Never again.
Advice,,,,DO NOT go to this subway. 

I'm not. Ever again.

Red Owl Tavern is delicious. My fiance and I both had their burger with a hard cider and my mom had their salmon. The burger was a little expensive ($18), but everything was on point. Their fries were crispy and seasoned just right. The staff was really friendly as well and everyone was smiling and happy. For dessert, I got this blondie ice cream sandwich which was so delicious. The blondie was soft, chewy and super flavorful. The ice cream that they used was from Franklin Fountain. Overall, I would say that if you are visiting Philadelphia and want a delicious/casual meal, please do stop at the Red Owl Tavern.

Wife and I tried this place for the first time last weekend. We had the rotisserie chicken and a burger. Both we very good so we were pleased with food and the prices we commensurate with the quality. The negative in our opinion was the price of the beer. We each has two 16 oz glasses of the Firestone 805 beer. The price was $28 for four beers.  We feel they are over priced for 16 oz beer  I hope they consider a much more reasonable price in the future. 

Just sharing as others may feel the same and haven't shared. 

Michael and Betty

Was in town for the NCAA tournament games. So far I have ate here three times since it is inside my hotel The Pear Tree Inn near Union Station. Food was great along with the staff. Did take some time getting my food a few times. Other than that no complaints.

This is my favorite poke spot in town!  
Whoever thought of this concept is my hero!

They offer three options: rice bowl, salad bowl and  burrito.  I have yet to order a sushi burrito but they looked tightly wrapped and delicious.  

The produce is all fresh and well taken care of.  I seen them slice fresh avocado, not keeping too much out at once.  [Lettuce, chopped mango, cucumber, red onion, kani salad, tobiko, etc]

The star of the show.....salmon, tuna and crab stick, well they are tasty! Sometimes I get sushi that is too cold or too warm.  Here was just right!  The crab stick is soft and falls apart.  

Then to finish they have lots of sauces (ponzu, wasabi, etc) and crunch topping (lotus chips (the bomb), chopped peanut, nori slivers, etc).  

A perfect lunch!  I can't wait for tomorrow!  You can scoot right into the 30min loading zone on Arch or order via Grub Hub or Caviar.  

See you soon Oishii!!

We live nearby and just visited this wonderful cafe this morning.  Yes, they are sill working out some kinks but this place is NICE!  They've really seen to the details of decor and food too.  The pastries were top rate and the cooked food too was delicious.  It's important in a place tied to Joyce to get the breakfast potatoes right, and they did!  Coffee = quite good, and the service was outstanding.  Feels like London but without the crowds.  

Went back for dinner, and have to say that they are, in their first weeks, still figuring this out.  Food was good but even for a "small plates" place, portions on food and drink were just a little parsimonious.  Cheese plate was excellent.  Waitstaff very good and knowledgeable, and while I don't mind being reminded that portions are small, I dread restaurants where I'm told that "we recommend sharing the plates."  It's like dictating culture...I guess we can figure that out for ourselves, once we know the size of the plates.

These are not huge criticisms; this place is very good already and can be great!

Excellent menu! I wanted to try Econ it but settled on a jackfruit bbq sandwich. Meal was pretty tasty. Unfortunately the service was a little slow (only 3 other parties in the restaurant and still took 15 minutes to get a drink). There are many vegetarian options which is always a plus for me!

I can't give this place a completely fair review since I've only been once, but my experience was one of the better coffee experiences in Indiana. The baristas are friendly, cute, and seem to know what they are doing. I saw a couple of nice foamy lattes whizzing by as I was waiting for my iced mocha. The decor is cute and comfortable. I like take-what-you-want library they have. I was surprised by the interesting selection of books. The back room had some interesting art. Sketches and watercolors of sad Opus-like (the comic strip penguin) creatures. Two were bought while we were sitting there. They have a little deck out back for those who enjoy coffee and cigarettes as well. I'd def check it out again if I'm the Broad Ripple area.

Best place for home cooked comfort food. While not a huge menu, there is definitely something for everyone. This is my second time here and look forward to going back. After enjoying a great meal be sure to save room for dessert or take it to go. Worth the extra calories. The white chocolate raspberry cookies melt in your mouth. Found a new favorite.

We wanted to try something different from our Florissant/Hazelwood choices. 
French onion soup and hubby liked the clam chowder. Hubby ordered the pork chops! Received 2 thick chops! Enough to take home!!! Side salads, baked potatoes and broccoli were very large portions. Yes...we will be back. 
Rachel did a great job keeping us served and drinks full. The live music was also a lovely touch  Thanks for the lovely evening dinner Frederick's

Good coffee and friendly staff. We were staying at the AKA next door and walked over on a cold Sunday. I ordered the Nutella Mocha. It was really good, and the coffee was so smooth. I forgot how much I've missed La Colombe Coffee since moving to Dallas.
The girls were super friendly and gave us suggestions of places to go. I used to live here, but Philly has changed a lot, so much appreciated!

There is a parking garage right next door. We also saw plenty of people camping out on their computers.
We really liked this place! It's right across from our condo while on vacation and I'm definitely going back before we leave!

We were looking to try something new for lunch and decided to check this place out based on the Yelp reviews. We were not disappointed. They have a large variety of sandwiches and salads. Also, daily specials, that looked good, however we didn't try them this time. Nothing fancy, but plenty of seating for dining in. The service was great, we mentioned it was our first time trying this place and they helped us decide. The chicken salad sandwich was very good and the buffalo chicken sandwich was also delicious!

Have been wanting to try this place since it opened and was sadly disappointed.It is located in the back of the space where Borders used to be. Came here on a late night looking to grab a quick drink & bite. We were seated right away and I was really surprised by how large the restaurant was. It has a cool Mexican vibe along with loud music playing(which didn't really bother me). They also have a huge open window across the side which would be cool to sit near on hot night. I was mainly looking forward to trying one of their margaritas, as I have seen they have a lot of neat flavors. I ordered the sangria blur margarita which sounded right up my alley. After checking my ID, the waitress said she needed to see my fianc√©'s ID who hasn't turned 21 yet, even though he was not ordering an alcoholic drink. She said we both needed to be 21 for me to order a drink because of "sharing". Now the waitress was nice enough about it and it was clear it was just the restaurant's policy, and I wasn't going to argue. But, this is absolutely ridiculous. I could see if I was getting a bottle of wine or a pitcher of beer maybe since those are typically shared, but I was just getting a margarita! If I was a server here I would be pissed about this policy because it's obviously going to lower their check , and therefore their tips. When I told my mom about this later she couldn't believe we even stayed, but it was already late and we were hungry. 

We did not get a free salsa, unlike what other reviewers mentioned. But, we ordered a chips and salsa anyway. The chips were fine but they were mostly broken. The salsa didn't taste bad, but the texture of it was very weird. It was super thick, so much so that it was difficult to scoop onto your chip. I would have been unhappy with this even if the salsa were free! Again, this should have been a sign to get out here, lol. But, I ordered a chicken quesadilla. The chicken quesadilla wasn't bad, however it was no better than what you would get at somewhere like Chilli's. Also, what I didn't like was it came with peppers and onion which was fine, but there were more peppers and onions on there than chicken! Some of the dessert looked good, but at that point we were just ready to leave. The one good thing I will add about our experience was that our waitress was very friendly and attentive. Forget the mediocre food, the alcohol policy alone is enough to keep me from coming back here. It's actually kind of insulting. Now, we go out to eat A LOT , and I have never had this happen. So I'm not going to come back somewhere I cannot even get a drink. It's a shame because this place had the potential to be good and the location is convenient enough.

This was absolutely amazing! The fish was fresh, the rice was perfectly sticky, the portion was shareable and everything else was fresh too! I was very impressed with the customer service and they were so nice and polite, not to mention helpful because it was my first time there. 

The Bubble Tea was the best I've ever had. It is mostly tea based rather than just a milk and powder, and they use tapioca pearls that are soft and delicious. It wasn't too thick with milkiness like I'm used to, and the thickness of the dairy always upsets my stomach. But not here! It's light and delicious 

One thing I also noticed is that the place was very clean and organized and that made me even more happy to eat my delicious food. 

This will be what I eat every time I come to this mall, without a doubt.

P.s. I literally made a yelp account just to post a review
Delicious food! Get the charbroiled oysters! Order extra bread too! You're gonna need it. The Po boys are enormous so order accordingly. Great staff as well.

Walked in, smelled like Fabluloso cleaner.  Staff isn't trained.  I order a red eye (coffee w/ shot of espresso), she'd had no clue what that was. Then I waited for 15mins along with 4-5 other people. One couple got fed up and left. Another got their order wrong. When mine finally came out, it tasted weaker than airplane coffee.

Went here for dinner tonight with my family.  We got seated quickly and the service was good.  We ordered the crab fries of course.  They came out hot but the crab seasoning was overwhelming.  I ordered the lobster roll and had the same problem, way too much crab seasoning.  I had to blot my sandwich to try and get some of the seasoning off.  The rest of my family ordered cheesesteaks and said they were ok but felt that there wasn't a lot of meat on them.  We go to Chickie and Pete's fairly often but this time we felt the food was below par.

I went here on a date and was very impressed with the aesthetic. The restaurant is very beautiful and looks like it is much more expensive than it is, which I appreciate. We were sat by the window which overlooks the city with a gorgeous view. The wait staff was the perfect amount of attentive, refilling drinks and checking on us. The only reason I'm giving 4 instead of 5 stars is because the sushi is good but nothing special. They have fun and unique rolls that are delicious but it isn't the best sushi I've ever had in my life. However, it's an affordable way to impress a date!

Definitely a unique setting being that it is inside an old church.  Worth stopping by to grab a decent cup of coffee.  Better than Starbucks!  I didn't think the coffee was excellent but it wasn't bad.  It was just a fun stop along a road trip to enjoy the scenery and say I drank java joe in an old converted chapel.
Yummmmmm! Love everything about it. Everything I've tried has been delicious so far. The bruschetta is a must. Their cocktails are to die for. And half price at happy hour? Yes!!

Got the pesto pasta recommended by our server. Best Italian I've ever eaten. The atmosphere was great and the service was phenomenal thanks to our server Sarah. Will definitely be returning to Ava again soon.

Really glad Zeppelin opened in South Reno! Such a fun social experience and the food is delicious! We've been a few times since they have opened and they've changed their menu over 20 times based on customer feedback. 

Pros:
Great service
Food is fresh and delicious
Great selection of cocktails and wine

Cons:
No reservations
Lounge area is first come, first serve (not necessarily a com, but be aware!)
Drinks are a little pricey, but for this type of atmosphere, I would say similar to a club/bar


Note the the atmosphere is very social gathering style, so you may be seated at a community table. It is dark inside, so the photos don't do justice for the taste of the food!

I love this place as much as I love that I live a block away; I don't know how many times I've been.

My favorite things on the menu are the Most Triumphant Tots (think tater tots with nacho toppings) and the Breakfast Salad (spinach, blue cheese, an egg, bacon, and mimosa vinegarette... YUM).  My roommates all love the FYA Burger (deep fried bacon and an egg) so much it's all any of them order.  As previously noted, most items can be made vegetarian or vegan, which is awesome.

A few things set it apart from other places I've been besides the nummy food: there's all sorts of games there (not just board games- dominos is an option), the chillest bar cat, and a nifty looking small fireplace.  Only recently discovered that they play The Walking Dead on Sunday nights (why did I discover this near the end of the season?!?!).  They have a late night happy hour (10pm-midnight), where draft beers are $2 off.

Despite being a fan of this place, there are times I don't go there: Tuesday nights (staff has an attitude) and if it's super cold outside (the bar's not very well heated).

Good for airport food. It can take a little while to get to the table though, so make sure you have at least an hour to eat everything. Personal favorite- the calamari and the steak sliders. I prefer mine medium, mister likes his rare, but both are still delicious. 
Oh, and if you're a vegetarian, avoid it. Harry and Izzy's is part of St Elmo's steakhouse. Keyword- steak.

My meal started out with a mistake.  The five stars, is for how it was handled.  I ordered a meal to go because we didn't want to fight the Father's Day crowds.  When I got home, I found that instead of the Shrimp Carbonara that I ordered and paid for, they gave me Chicken.  Not a huge deal, but I like shrimp and I had paid a little more for the Shrimp.  I called and talked to the manager.  I thought she might offer to replace the meal if I returned to the restaurant, which wasn't going to happen.  She apologized for the mistake and offered to send me a gift card.  I received the card 2 days later, which more than paid for my meal.  Great customer service.  The chicken, also, wasn't bad.

Very fine Thai food. It's more contemporary than traditional. The sauces are great. The atmosphere is really cool/hip. It's a great date restaurant. As always, Pad Thai is my favorite, but i like the Pad Thai at Pad Thai House better.

Waiter was very nice during our visit. We went as a group and overall fairly good experience. It took a minute like 5 to get acknowledged when we walked in and then about another 10 minutes to seat a group of 10 which is acceptable. Don't order medium done burgers because they will come burnt to hell. Acceptable pricing for a city.
My most favorite restaurant I would recommend this place for anyone who is interested in a good meal me and my family and my friends will definitely be back shortly and I look forward to my visit
Loved the food, however the bartender is the best!!!  Had an outstanding BLT with fresh veggies and a mound of bacon served with a very cold Michelob Ultra. Will be back next time I'm in Nashville.
Love this place...first time eating here and everything was great including the service...I had the chicken arepa and was really good...definitely coming back here and would recommend this place...

This used to be one of my favorite restaurants in Nashville, after they reopened last week it is terrible, they serve frozen bread, samosa that you can buy in Indian stores. Never again will eat here.
Pretty good bbq. A little pricey and sometimes slow. Great live music in the basement

So we at Luke which was across the street from our hotel. We have eaten here on other trips but decided to review it this time around. We sat the bar and was helped with drink choices by our very great bar tender. She recommended the drinks all of which were nicely made and interesting. We started with the brussel sprouts which have to be the best we ever had anywhere. They print the receipt as many ask for it. Seems to be laced with pepper jam, bacon and sliced apples. Really ensure you have some when you try Luke. Also ate the redfish which was good, just a little wet from too much butter. Then we had the mussels which are always very good. Bread pudding was good but not special. We will eat here again and at John B's other restaurants in NO.

I have gluten, dairy, and sugar allergies which make it very difficult to eat anywhere. Daniel was kind enough to take the time to talk to me about the menu options that fit my issues. They were extremely accommodating and super understanding about my needs. I ended up with a very delicious fillet mignon, roasted brussel sprouts, asparagus, and a house salad with balsamic vinegar dressing. It was AMAZING!! I would definitely recommend this family restaurant to anyone and will be going back to eat their amazing food!

I've been craving a good crab meal for a while but with all of the new spots popping up in Nashville I wasn't sure where to go. One of my gal pals recommended Get your Grub on and also gave me fair warning I would be going to a garage! 

The owner Mr. Green welcomed me with a handshake, a personal touch I appreciated. I went with the crab leg platter which included corn, broccoli, potatoes, sausage, & shrimp. He made it fresh so allow about 20 minutes if you don't order ahead. He has a huge TV and satellite radio to entertain you while you wait.  

When he brought out the final product I just had to stare at it fora bit. A. Work. Of. Art. Once I got past the beauty I dove in. Instead of the normal butter sauce you find on these meals he has a special grub sauce that has a spicy kick that I love. No oily mess, straight flavor! I could have ate a pound of the shrimp alone with the grub sauce. 

I have a new favorite to get seafood!

The staff is usually quite friendly and they make their drinks well. However, it is always - without fail - super dirty. Every time I come in here, the tables have trash and crumbs or spilled drinks on them leaving them sticky. 

Today, two baristas let drink orders pile up while they were chatting with a friend about his boy troubles. Pretty unprofessional. :/

This place is fantastic. 

Huge variety, and fun atmosphere. Great for families or date night or groups or networking or happy hour or or or.. 

Don't miss out.

This was a favorite amongst my friends during our road trip en route to Louisville. There were so many tasty burgers to try and we decided to split three burgers amongst the table. Our server was very accommodating and provided plenty of plates and offered suggestions. 

FYI these burgers are huge! We split the Bourbon Burger, Bru Burger and Honey Chipotle Burger. All three were very delicious! My fave would probably be the Honey Chipotle Burger, which was topped with bacon, carmelized onions, BBQ pulled pork and an onion ring. Pretty much all the topping I look for in a tasty burger. White cheddar was a good choice of cheese and went nicely as a topping for this burger.

We split a basket of fries, which came with house made ketchup, ranch and chipotle sauce.

For dessert, we split the Peach White Chocolate Bread Pudding (OMG so gooood and very moist) and Whiskey Fudge Brownie (rich and went well with vanilla ice cream).

The server split our bill very evenly and provided excellent service!

While Pizza Week has ended, I continue my quest for the top slice in the Greater Tampa Bay area.  This is my 16th location as I try to hit every contestant in this years event. As before, this review is about the pizza only.

Oak and Stone on Central Ave in St. Pete is only the 2nd pizza joint to get a 5 star rating from me during my search for the best. I opted for a pie with the works on it.

The crust was near perfection, while not flavored, it had the right amount of thickness, a great char, awesome texture and a good feel in the mouth.

The sauce seemed a bit youthful and had a very nice flavor which combined agreeably with the rest of the pie. A pleasant surprise was how easy it was to cut the pizza slices with fork and knife. 

The toppings were fresh, delectable and savory. A delightful combination of flavors that came together perfectly for my happy taste buds. Quality product is the key and the marriage of flavors a nice bonus.

Be sure to give this scrumptious pie and Oak and Stone a try next time your in the burg.

This is another one of those occasions I really wish Yelp would give us the ability to rate a place 3.5 stars.
