It takes a big man to know when he's past his college party days, so I can thankfully say I have never been here for the much advertised all you can drink specials (although it was called Drink and Drown back when I was a kid).  The only times I've ever been to this place are during the very mundane times I've had new tires put on or an oil change done at the spot down the street. 

While I have to admit service can at time be a bit on the slow side, I've never had to wait very large amounts of time, nor have I ever felt neglected when I'm at this place.  Whether I sit at the bar or at a high top, my glass stays relatively full and my order comes out very quickly.  Not sure if some of my fellow Yelpers have just caught the staff at a bad time, but I've had full on conversations with the bartender and even with one of the very nice servers.  She walked past me and told me she had the exact same shoes as I had on.  We then had a 20 minute chat about what shoes we preferred for what type of working out and how she gets hers at a steal because she can get them in boys' sizes.  

All in all, this seems to be a great little neighborhood bar and restaurant when it's not UT party time.  The food is solid, the beer menu has variety, and it's a 2 minute walk from the oil change spot when you have to be an adult.

Just what, exactly, is going on here. It seems that I will never understand the Cosi clue! This location's low-level management is just awful and confused. I'm sure their intention is to IMPROVE, but obviously that ain't happening.

This location keep changing their in-store ordering setup. One day, you'll order here, go pay there, and come back here to pickup your food. Another day, you'll order and pay there, then go to the other side to pickup your order. Why you are trying to confuse us, Cosi?
 
Oh, you prefer to place your order online for pick up, make sure you got all your items, they have the tendency to miss either your bread or your coworker's bag of carrots, or perhaps they will forget the whole order. Re-think.

I believe that their management operation is just awful and confused. I try not to go, but it is around the corner from me, and it is one fast Ritalin food. Sometimes I cannot resist. 

I have another legit question, Cosi: Why most, if not all, of your employees are miserable and unhappy. 

One and half Yelps.
I've been here a few times now.  I was surprised how much I Enjoyed the #pizza here,  worth the money! Maybe one day I'll explore the menu :D

They finally have pho!  But I was in a charbroiled pork chop mood.  The pork was very tender and moist although the seasoning is a bt different from nam phuong's. The broken rice was perfect and the meatball skewers app was great. Prices reflect the area so although they might be high for Philadelphia, they are actually relatively low for the main line. About $8 for platters, $6 for banh mi, ad $10+ for entrees.

Decent pub menu in an urban setting with aluminum chairs and woodsy barstools, although I will say the TVs are a bit small. My salad with chicken was simple,  but the Smoking Goose brat looked great. The potato salad was very moist but flavorful if you like mayonnaise-based potato salad. The beverages are of course the attraction and a full assortment of their beers is available. We'll be back to sample more of the menu.

Not bad but not great. This place is very cramped or to be more politically correct...very cozy. The food is fresh but not too creative and overall pretty mild. It is  BYOB so that is a plus and the real reason I 'd go back

Well, they have a great cheese steak and show a variety of games, but that's about it. You would think that in an area heavily inundated with bars, they'd try to keep up. Not so much. There are no Saturday specials, even during games. Every other bar in the area has several. Annoyed when asked about specials or to see a menu. If you don't like crowds, I guess it's okay. I'd rather spend Saturday games at Mac's, Sto's, or Fox & Hound.
The wait was entirely too long, but otherwise good! Service was great!
Highly recommended. We had their fried shrimp special, grouper, cocktail shrimp..side of mashed potatoes and asparagus. Everything was amazing!

Even though we just missed breakfast, our waitress, Sandy, was amazing! Greeted by the heron out front we had the most delicious lunch with a side of mimosas to top it off! Ps we'll be back for breakfast before our vacation ends!

I got a giftcard to this restaurant for christmas and as my mother and I had both heard good things i'd thought we'd give it a shot. I knew the restaurant gets packed on friday and saturday nights so we went on a sunday night. There was a healthy amount of people and so there was some wait time, a little more than i think there should have been honestly.

The menu is pretty decent, all the standard tex-mex fair, burritos, enchiladas, quesadillas etc , mostly meat based but there are plenty of options for vegetarians as well. The decor is warm but super hipster and trendy. I appreciated it. 

Sadly, all the food we had was lackluster. I had a chicken torta which was alright except for the very blackened chicken which I never really enjoyed. My mother got a steak enchilada/burrito concoction which she didn't enjoy too much and from what  i saw appeared to be more peppers/onions than anything else.

Honestly I won't be going back here. It's just not worth it.

The chicken spiedini used to be so so so good but the past couple times (one being last night) it hasn't tasted the same.  Not as much flavor and is too chewy.  
Please make it like it used to be :)
Cozy and nice.  The steak special the night I went was great but my pasta dish lacked flavor.

We decided to try this place after seeing it on Facebook! My husband decided to get the succulent pig carved table side price $32! He received no more than 4 ounces of meat! PATHETIC! Will never go back!
Excellent food, atmosphere and service. Plus there is a lovely egret that hangs around outside and if you're lucky you can dine and watch him through the window!

You have never seen a brunch this good.  Period. Four stars because it was a little expensive, but this buffet had at least - at least now - 60 items on the buffet.  From salads to pancakes, they had everything.  Literally.  If you think you want something for breakfast, they have it.

AWESOME PIZZA!

I know that's a huge claim but it's based on numerous visits, many people I work with and multiple times we ordered it in for an office lunch. This place has stood up to the test or time as we've gone year after year and it's still consistent and just plain amazing. For a group that can never agree on anything for lunch, everyone always agrees upon this. I know that's subjective, but really...how often does that happen?

Try their meat lovers..all fresh ingredients and perfectly cooked. Nice thin/crispy crust and burn-the-top-of-your-mouth cheese...mmmmm

I cannot review any other of their products, I've only had their pizza.

Other points of note:
They carry both coke and pepsi products.
Tons of lunch specials
If you're by yourself, they have a old-school type bar you can pull up to
Order by the slice

The service was good, but the food is not authentic. Very watered down beans, rice, and my molcajete had nothing to do with how it really should be, it was more of a chorizo consistency, nothing to do with the real, authentic Molcajete dish. The restaurant over charges for what the amount of food is really worth, you get a little scoop of guacamole, beans, and rice. The chips that they give you are like peanut brittle. I would recommend Chipotle before I recommend this place.

We went for lunch on a Friday. It wasn't as busy as I expected. However, the fish and chips were more delicious than I expected. I could eat a meal of the cold slaw alone. Service was friendly and very quick. The beer selection was good too. We will definitely be going back!

We have heard so many good things about the restaurant from family and friends, we had to try it. We were not disappointed. As soon as we walked in the door we were greeted by a very nice gentleman who made us feel right at home. Our waitress was outstanding and the food was amazing. The view from our table was breathtaking. Decent pricing for good food. Definitely would recommend this establishment to anyone.
i got the whole wheat deep dish pizza. it was not all that. went on a saturday afternoon and it was dead inside. friendly service tho.

While vacationing and looking for a respite from the heavy Louisiana food, my husband and I took a shot at Tan Dinh. We left satisfied and impressed with our lunch there. 

Their banh cuon was nothing Ive seen before. It was stuffed with whole shrimp and BBQ pork. What?! I'm used to just the minced pork/onion/woodear but this was a pleasant surprise. The banh was soft, chewy, thin and well seasoned. It was YUM. Hubs got hieu tieu/ mi and all the fixings (ie cha, fish balls, etc.) were homemade! That's commitment. 

A few tables around us ordered some green colored drink, not sure if it was nguc mia or avocado boba, either way people were drinking it like it was liquid gold. I was too dang full to order one but next time....Thanks Tan Dinh. It was real.

Had breakfast here today. The website boasted fresh food and personable owners/staff. Well they were right. Very fresh tasty food that came fast. The staff, including Lisa herself were very attentive and cordial. The marble rye toast was delish. I had the corn-beef hash and eggs. It was fluffy and not greasy. I'm allergic to coffee. I know it's TERRIBLE. So I drink hot black tea with milk. They didn't have any. My husband drinks coffee and said it was the only let down. So add some tea to the menu and freshly grind your beans and you'll get a 5 star rating!

We always get the Roti Canai. It's so delicious. It comes with a piece of small chicken and a potato. Sometimes we just pass by and just order for takeout. 
We haven't try any other item on the menu yet but we will return.
Simple delicious! Will be back! Suggestion the staff need to smile more! Love the tunes playing!
Ordered take out last night and the food was amazing!  We ordered a rack of ribs, pulled chicken and baked beans.  Will def be back

I had high hopes for this place, but the food was subpar. I ordered the bulgogi nachos and elote street corn. Before I took my first bite, I noticed a hair on the nachos, which made me hesitant to eat the rest of the food. The refried beans on the nachos were so dry and the bulgogi meat was rubbery and hard to chew. The elote had flaming hot Cheetos seasoning, which ended up being very soggy and the corn was tasteless. After eating the food, I had a stomach pain that lasted for a few hours. The only reason why I gave this place 2 stars is because they were accommodating to others. Another patron's food was delayed, so Comida refunded their meal.

Menu has awful graphics, but if you bypass the looks of that, the food & service is well above average especially for that area... catering is awesome, & extremely affordable!!! Also slightly messed up one of my orders, made me a brand new one, no questions asked! Will always order Paris in this area... cheesesteaks even blow Claymont Steaks out of the water
Salty bones - Chill on the salt, everything was way overdosed on it. Brisket isn't cut properly, and looks more like short rib than brisket.
Rude employees. Could be a little nicer to your customers than saying "yep" with an attitude when asked a question.

I try to avoid this place in the PHL delta terminal. This terminal hardly has any good options. And this place may be better than most but their service is awful. Today I placed the order and kept waiting. After about 20 minutes I was like how long can it take to make a burrito? I asked them and they were like meh we will make you one now. The cashier guy clearly screwed up but the other people in the kitchen didn't care as well. 
That's just the service. Food quality is at par with airport food. Typically if I'm really hungry and have almost no time, I get something from the juice or smoplaces

Totally worth the wait!! Get the shakshuka, you will not be disappointed!!! The wait time is very conservative, we got in like 40 mins earlier than predicted, and you can walk around the Gultch and see the murals while you wait!

I have some food allergies. I tried to ask the waiter questions.
He was snobby and supercilious and told me they catered to the general public.
The food portions were small - the bread was white bread out of a plastic bag, and it was pricey.
It might be ? a good bar, but certainly not a decent eatery!

So-so rude experience (and desperately need a professional, friendly bar staff) but great outside service and food. Had a niciose salad that was AMAZING! Not a friendly staff inside the hotel which was a bummer for such a Tucson institution I would hope they would cater to a positive guest experience but that was no where to be found.

Been here for an hour and 3 people either got their food served wrong OR poor waitress service.  
Don't come here. Lol. Poor at best it's sad too since applebees has a decent reputation oh and they have the AIR on.... really ?  It's 50 outside

Some pretty low reviews here I'm noticing.  Never the less, I just stayed here for 3 nights and thought the place was pretty nice, grounds were clean and well maintained and the hotel was modern and nice.  It'spretty much set into the side of a mountain which is pretty cool, has a long driveway up to the front office from the highway which is nice (it's set off the HWY enough that your not listening to traffic).

I thought the price was good, think I paid something in the vicinity of 95 bucks/night...certainly not complaining.  Staff was friendly, the bartender could sling drinks.

My complaints though (every yin has its yang)...
1.  I was stuck in a back building and the parking sucked...plenty of open spaces, but poor lighting and a little bit of a haul to carry your stuff into my particular door there.
2.  Being on the backside, its surrounded by condos or whatever...and some of the locals decided to entertain EVERYONE with some Rap & R&B...not thrilled by that at all.
3.  I lugged a ton of stuff to my hotel room door and my key card wouldn't work (I'm by myself), my cell didn't have a signal...and I had to haul all of my crap back out to my car so I could drive around to the front office to get a new card.  Maybe this was a fluke (probably)...but it enraged me since I had three or four 75lb bags!

Good bar/restaurant up the street within a mile or so and I didn't see many cops on the HWY at all.

I'd stay here again, but I would be cognizant of where the room is located next time.

Great food, atmosphere. Easily found and parking wasn't bad at all. Good unique selection (brekkys) combined with traditional brunch foods resulted in a well-rounded menu.
Our first time in Manayunk and definitely will be come back to Greg's. Don't forget to check in with Yelp so you can get 10% off your order!

Small place in a strip mall but the food is good, a nice notch better than typical fast food. Nice selection of burgers, hotdogs, fries, and more. Free soda refills. They call your name when it's ready. And the place is friendly and clean. 

Just needs beer...

Chariot's might be your perfect pie place, if you like it greasy and cheesy; if not, then reconsider.

Ordered a large pizza with kalamatas, a Greek salad and breadsticks.

Pizza was greasy and the dough was rubbery and soggy. It was the same dough they used in the breadsticks which was fried dough topped with powdered parm, also chewy, not garlicky and not good.  The generous Greek salad was okay, but primarily relied on iceberg lettuce.

I like the fact that they offer a couple of Greek options and tons of sandwiches; maybe that's the way to go. My stomach still hurts from the other option.

Order and delivery was pleasant.

Back a few months ago, I'd probably give this place 5 stars. U Got Munchies has always been my favorite take-out place near Temple - everything was great. My absolute favorite was the Continental Burger (a bacon cheeseburger with french toast as buns, an egg, and maple syrup), the bar fries (ground beef, jalapeno, and sour cream) and several others. I ordered from here all the time.

When I heard they were closed for some renovations this summer, I was anticipating their return. I've ordered from them twice now since they reopened, and it just isn't the same. They got rid of my aforementioned favorites, but everything now just seems...cheaper. I just ordered their "red eye burger" (the continental, minus the french toast) and the bun just seems very generic. I ordered a different burger a few weeks ago and it seemed cheaper and smaller also. One upside is their new option for a vegetarian black bean burger instead of a regular beef patty - I love black bean burgers so this earns a plus from me.

As for their service, they're always super quick with delivery and I love their conveniently late hours.

Bottom line: still good, but not as amazing as before.

5 stars for delightful service from the lovely lady today! She welcomed my friend and I to the shop by explaining the concept behind Salgado Fenwick and was the lone person mixing up hot/cold drinks too at the back!

I had an iced chai with almond milk (they also offer coconut milk, soy and cow's milk) - and it was refreshing and yummy on such a hot day like today. 

My friend enjoyed her cappuccino and scone. 

They will be extending their hours during the summer with all the foot traffic. 

Three little tables are set up outside for those interested, as well as some tables inside!
The fiesta rose pasta is absolutely INCREDIBLE ! You also get bread and a salad with it, and the portions are HUGE! Well worth the money

So slow. So ambivalent. So not worth it  if you're going to have food service at an airport you may want to rethink your choice of hires. There is absolutely no sense of urgency or customer service whatsoever. It was like watching sloths at the zoo

The menu looked intriguing, the building and decor are cool, the greeters were friendly and accommodating, the food was almost inedible. We stopped and looked at the menu on our way to a show at the casino across the street, sat outside and were greeted by a very pleasant server. Everything we ordered was really bad, all across the menu, from deep fried microscopic lollipop lamb chops, to flank steak tougher than a shoe, nothing was worth eating except the wings accidentally brought to our table though we did not order them. The fails are all the kinds of things that indicate inexperienced kitchen staff, people who do not know the basics of food preparation, all very amateur for such a high profile location. We will not return.

Hawkers really wasn't good this time. The food was very bland and really not a big deal whatsoever. We had to ask our server and others several times for silverware. She was running around with her head cut off. I needed water and never got a refill.

I really thought the food and service was a big shambles. I won't be back!

Important: This review is only for Brennan's banana fosters dessert. The dessert ($10) was only average if not underwhelming. We had heard from a number of locals that there are only two places in nola to get a legitimate banana fosters, made table side; the first being Commander's palace and the second being Brannan's. For some reason my party had missed the dessert at Commander's so I knew it was imperative to try Brennan's. In terms of flavor, it tasted too simple, like vanilla ice cream with a banana and some butter-- so something that you can easily make at home. It was really missing the vibrance of the caramelization and the fragrance from the alcohol. Our waitress, being inexperienced, was talked through some key details and then left to her own devices. The end result was that she probably needed more practice in the back to get the technique down before making the hallmark dish for customers.

I love Chick-fil-a. Food is always fresh and hot. I love the fried chicken nuggets.  Real white meat chunks of chicken with a light scrumptious coating.  Can't forget the waffle fries. They are delicious too.

You can take two approaches to this place: You can do the fancy sit down dinner, hopefully with someone else who has a decent income and can pick up the check, or you can do the fun and relaxed happy hour. I have done both, and my vote hands down is happy hour.

Don't get me wrong, going there for dinner was amazing. All the food tasted really fresh and authentic. However, it is definitely one of the more pricey mexican restaurants in the city. Happy hour, on the other hand, was quite the deal. I got there at 6, and we were immediately greeted by the bartender with chips and two kinds of salsa. Two of us got margaritas (try the pomegranate) and one got their house tequila straight up. The margaritas were good, not too sweet, and only $5. We then ordered queso fundido ($6) and guacamole ($4). Both of which were amazing, even though it's hard to go wrong with melted cheese. They even gave me a free tequila popper at the end since it was my birthday!

So, the bottom line is that happy hour offers quality food and drinks for great prices in an awesome atmosphere. The inside of the restaurant is very ornately decorated but it gorgeous. The service was great, and the bartender and servers were nice. So nice in fact, that it was almost creepy. Almost.

The new decor is beautiful but it's sad to watch the prices sky rocket as customer service and food quality go downhill. They lure you in with coupons and then load you up with hidden fees. They no longer let you order lunch size portions but the dinner portions are now the same size as lunch. My braised beef tortellini was dreadful! I'm not a picky eater whatsoever but the brown sauce was absolutely disgusting. Our waitress was too busy to check on us so I ate what little I could tolerate and filled up on salad, which is the best and probably only thing still good about this chain, besides their breadsticks. Two thumbs way down for this place.
If you go to the puppy section make sure you stay. You give your name number to be called back, 30 minutes later check in hostess and she has lost the number; thus, did not call us. Rude

So today me and my wife decided to try this out. It use to be Rai Rai Ramen and they were good. But today after trying the ramen out. It wasn't disappointing but it wasn't great. We had the takoyaki the fried oysters Gomoku ramen and Hakata ramen. The app was good but the ramen broth lacks flavor and depth. Both are shio soup. The noodles it self is ok but I like mine medium well. Other than that everything was good. Food came out on time. Service is good (don't like servers that are too attentive) plus free sodas when you order ramen. The price though didn't match the ramen $10.00 to $11.00 for a bowl of ramen that lacks flavor. You decide. That's why it only gets three stars

Started with the bacon wrapped shrimp appetizer...absolutely amazing! Shrimp and bacon were both cooked perfectly. I had the California burger, it was great and actually cooked as I wanted medium rare. The beers on tap were great, and a huge selection. The atmosphere was great also.

Second time I've been here and both times they are hopping busy! I've only ordered the Pho (chicken). It's about what you'd expect. One thing I don't like is they put head lettuce in the soup which I don't care for even in a salad. I wish they'd use Bok Choy. It's very casual here and friendly. Large groups love it here.
Fantastic music and food. Great atmosphere and vegetarian options. Try the impossible burger for a fully vegan option.

Yolk was okay.  I meant to get corned beef hash but then aliens took control of my brain and I ordered chicken and waffles instead.  The waffles are "bacon waffles" which sounded exciting but there is not really enough bacon in them to make a difference.  They are served with that thick white biscuit gravy.  The coffee was good but the food took a long time to come out.  Total bill was $16.90.  I have nothing else to say about it.  It gets a solid "eh, okay".  I would eat here again, if I were nearby and nothing else was clearly available, but I would not go out of my way.

Google was deeply confused about where the restaurant is.  It wants you to go east from Monument Circle and then turn up Scioco Street, which is a useless little service alley.  This is all wrong.  To get to Yolk you should enter Salesforce Tower from Ohio Street.

They have an amazing happy hour special. Great food, great service.
I recommend the Sangrias and any of the deep dish pizzas.

I and  couple friends took the opportunity of  Besito's  Tampa Bay Restaurant Week pre-fixe menu deal. We ordered tableside guacamole which tasted really good with the chips .  We had chicken soft taco as appetizer.  My entr√©e was Mixtas  -good amount of meat and the red sauce was delicious. My side dish was Elotes del calle-a sweet corn dish that I liked a lot. Also the beans and rice came with every entr√©e were quite tasty. The chocolate cake dessert with strawberry and some whip cream on top was fluffy, light and delicious. Good Services and  great atmosphere, overall it was a pleasant  experience.
A delightful place. Full of charm, down home good service, and good food. The live music is icing on the cake. This is also a great family place. Gotta love it!

Small space with a few tables in which you order from the counter.  Cute ambiance with adorable quirky wall decor.  It's a bit pricey for a basic breakfast, but the quality is very good.  

I wanted the huevos rancheros but couldn't stomach paying $13 for them, so I skimped and got the quiche of the day instead for $4.25.  I should have just gotten what I wanted.  I learned the particular quiche I wanted was sold out after I ordered and sat down, so I opted for the other quiche.  It just wasn't very good.  Little to no flavor.

My sister had the refuel, and for $6, it was a great value.  Very filling and healthy start to the day.  My mom had the french toast plate ($13.50) which she also said was good but overpriced.  

I'm willing to pay good money for good food, but for whatever reason, when I'm on vacation, breakfast is what I'm least likely to splurge on.  I should have just gotten what I really wanted.  Refuel is a solid option with a great vibe if you're looking to treat yourself to a nice breakfast in a trendy casual atmosphere.  As vacationers just looking to grab a quick bite, it was okay.

Bf and i waited half an hour till they tell us there's a problem with their computer taking our orders so the wait would be 10 to 15 mins but somehow manage to take the orders of other customers who got there after us. I suspect racism from this restaurant because of the unhappy waitress who took our orders as the other customers ordered more than my bf and I .. or perhaps an interracial couple is unseen in this part of the city. It really sucks because we really were excited to try the food. Oh well, this place is very, very unwelcoming.

Mediocre char kuey teow and kuey teow thong. The food is not that bad but I have a personal gripe with the noodles used for both dishes. They require soft, wide rice noodles but instead came with ones you would use for pad thai. It was ... meh.

It's cool that they have an open kitchen door. Be on the look out for the guy making roti canai, you would have thought he's making pizza if I didn't tell you!

4.5

Whaaat? I'm late. I'm so very very late. It seems that most everyone who knows food in Middle Tennessee was already hip to the deliciousness of Soy Bistro. Mea culpa. To my credit, it's not entirely my fault that I am eight or so years late dining here. I don't get to Brentwood that often and I confused this establishment with another of a similar name and menu. But, still. My mistake. If you haven't picked up what I'm putting down is that you should probably get to Soy Bistro sooner rather than later.

I was a bit intimated coming here, as tales of a small parking lot and long lines stressed me out a bit. I was pleased to discover that arriving at 1 pm on a Friday afforded me a spot in front and a line that moved very quickly. The food gods were shining on me. When my lunch partner and I arrived at the counter, we were greeted with a smile and pleasant conversation. Stahp it, Soy Bistro. We're already going steady. I prepared myself for another potential bomb: I needed something that was gluten-free. Before my gut betrayed me, I was a Korean food-eating machine. But I know that a lot of meats and sauces are made with soy sauce so... I barely had the question out of my mouth before the gentleman behind the counter told me I had nothing to worry about: there were plenty of gluten-free items from which to choose and most everything could be made gluten-free.

Girls, hit your hallelujah.

There was no stopping me now. I ordered the kimchi fried rice and kept it moving. My lunch partner and I nabbed a table and started business talking. Within a very reasonable amount of time, I had a mound of beautifully red fried rice, packed with kimchi and spam and topped with a fried egg. Better yet, when the food came out, the owner grabbed utensils and napkins for us because we were just *that* out of it to miss it on our first pass. Oh, did I mention the spicy sauce that came on the side? I should. It added a surprising kick (I am usually not one for creamy sauces with Asian cuisine) and it was gluten-free. I broke the yolk, mixed it and and the sauce in the rice, took out my chopsticks (It had been way too long since I was able to eat with chopsticks) and went to town.

So so good. The kimchi was wonderfully pickled and spicy and the salty fat of the spam balanced well with the creaminess of the aforementioned sauces. The rice was a star of the plate, not a place holder. The chef (I met) knows what she's doing. We were checked on a few times during the meal and enjoyed some pleasant small talk. Eying the specials and house favorites, I made several notes to self of dishes to try upon return visits -- because there will be return visits.

Don't wait as long as I did; get yourself to Soy Bistro as soon as you can. The people behind the brand are really *really* nice and the food is as good as advertised... maybe even better. For all your transplants bemoaning the 'lack' of certain cuisines in Nashville... come get your fill in Brentwood. I know you have a car.

We decided to give this place a try. We were really excited that there is a new Mexican place right around the corner from us. We went in with open minds to not compare to Sabor.... cute place on the inside and our waiter was very nice. We both got house margaritas that we're good and the queso that was pretty good too. But that was it. We were indecisive on what to get so we decided to try the combo. And wow was it a lot of food but it was nothing that we expected.

It was all very bland the burrito literally had just ground beef in it that's it. So did the enchilada all it did was have a lot of sauce added on top it was supposed to come with a chile raleno but it was just a little slice of green pepper covered in cheese I wish I had a better picture but you couldn't see what it is anyways under all the cheese. It came with the what they so-called a Chalupa but it was just a soggy flat tortilla with a ton of guac and cheese on it. And a hardshell taco on top of it so you couldn't even tell that underneath it was supposed to be a Chalupa. The rice and beans were decent we ended up eating that and our chips n queso that was it.. not gonna lie we were excited to try this place but boy were we very disappointed. It felt like it was very sloppy and thrown together. Maybe we should've stuck with what we originally wanted which was a quesadilla and the fajitas. 


I don't think we will be returning but I hope the kitchen makes some improvements because it was the most bland Mexican food I've ever had. 



On the other hand we're going to go get sushi right now since we barely ate anything.

I happened on Edley's while intending to eat elsewhere in the 12th South district, but I am glad that I chose to dine here for lunch. The restaurant with wooden clean interior is housed in a warm comfortable place, and the menu of meat options as well as sides here was impressive. 

The food options are typical of a Tennessee bar bq restaurant, except that Edley's perhaps has the best Texas beef brisket in town, and it makes choosing between the brisket and the excellent pork sandwich pretty difficult. I chose the green beans and tasty mac n cheese for my sides, but I'll have to say that the Brunswick stew looked very enticing. The jalape√±o cornbread was a bit dry, but I loved that they grilled the cornbread before serving it on the plate. 

I had few expectations of Edley's, but I think it now moves to my top 3 Nashville bar-b-que joints, and it's a nice place to enjoy it too.

No stars. I ordered from this place a few weeks ago. Delivered my pizza, no problem. Call today, they don't deliver to my address. "Never have, never will." Okay, if your policy changes, but don't treat me like an idiot, take my order, then call me back and say nevermind.

First LOVE the concept of BFF Caf√©, the concept is long overdue, and SORELY needed! 

I tried BFF a while back on a Monday and found out there only do Fuel Packs, which is take and heat at home and or you can heat up there. That didn't interest me, so I said I would be back. 

I arrived today, and was excited to eat here, as I tried a small sample at a Yelp Elite Event (YEE). I ordered at the counter with a younger gentlemen and it wasn't busy to me, 1 guy waiting and 2 people already eating, and 1 couple behind me. 

I asked what to order as I was REALLY HUNGRY, and the gentlemen right off the bat said the Bison Burger ($16) without skipping a beat. I rarely eat bison and I was craving what I had at the YEE, and next he said Paleo Hunter Zoodle, either one was super filling. 

Total for food was $3 for Cauliflower Fingers, $12 for the Paleo Hunter Zoodle. A full check plus small tip was just over $17, that's w/out a drink! I consider this a high price point for a lunch. 

I thoroughly checked over restaurant, something feels missing here, not sure, what best describes. My best interpretation is it's feel like an empty cafeteria, order here, fill your drink here, get condiments over there, and bus your table, basically no service, order, and just wait. I had a number on my table and the food comes out, a bit slow considering there was 1 order in front of me, and I think the dish I ordered much of it was pre-made like braised beef, vegetable noodles, etc. 

My dish arrives and it looks naked, I only ate a sample at the YEE, so I didn't know why it felt naked, but I felt like there should be a sauce over it or on the side, as it looks very much NAKED, I was quite confused because my cauliflower (C) fingers had a salsa side. I tried the C fingers first, as it's my guess is it's the C pizza, cut into strips, to make the fingers. I had enough salsa for about half of them, and it was okay, kind of cool to be able to order a unique side, but wouldn't need to order it again, as the flavor was okay to below okay, not enough C for me (also no notations on nutrition on this dish nor other hand-helds???) 

I am looking at my main dish the Paleo Hunter, and again, it feels so naked, I start thinking about what sauces I can add to it, but nothing looks like a match, but I did notice a wasabi in the cooler when waiting to order, and thought if it's real wasabi that might give it a bit of flavor and heat, and at least add much much needed moisture to this dish that looks like it needed something to blanket. Please note, I did ask cashier, who said it was okay to grab the wasabi dixie cup from the cooler.  

I added the sauce very carefully and then being a professional salad tosser (Western Village Steakhouse) from 1994, I tossed my dish expertly and thoroughly in case the wasabi was super hot, which I was HOPING it was! It was NOT! I started eating the dish, and the first I notice it was below lukewarm in temperature, it was just between cold and luke warm, I was quite confused. 

I spent only about 2-3 minutes eating the C fingers, so that couldn't be it, the wasabi from the cooler was about 1.5 oz Dixie cup, carefully poured to cover the dish, why was my dish almost cold, maybe that's how they do it here, it's a unique place, serving unique, maybe they don't want the nutrients to cook off??? I wasn't sure, but then again, I really didn't want to just eat it and assume, so I waited to talk to the cashier, who really just takes orders and gets food from the back, but all of the sudden it took over 5 minutes and a phone order, to get his attention. 

I said, should my food be almost cold? He said yeah maybe, because it didn't sit under the heat lamp that long. I was still puzzled so I said, how was it cooked? He said on the stove. I was was still puzzled, his answer was that yeah, if it goes from the stove to the plate to your table that happens. Okay, I decided to eat the food as it was, and as I did I realized, I was never eat here again, so it's really simple, just eat, leave, and a solid review, to let my fans know the biz (I want to save you $$, if you value it)! 

Again love the concept of BFF, but based on today experience THIS PLACE IS NOT FOR ME! Last but not least, as I was relaying the story to co-workers, because you know the power of a bad experience, you usually share 10x and a good experience 1x, I remembered, looking at the menu, and then I remembered being at my YEE event, that this dish is suppose to have a Blanket, which today was Missing, and that is the Chimichurri Sauce! That was another aha moment of the terrible experience I had today. 

Last note the cashier told me that they had a big rush before me that's why the food didn't sit under the heat lamp long enough to warm up the food, I guess that big to go order before me really stressed the chef! The guy sitting down that I saw leave with a bag of food probably for a family of 2-3 adults and 2-3 kid, that's PRESSURE!

From DC. We had an amazing dinner night in here. Recommend by Amex card. We ordered 3 courses of meal. I had pudding,duck and crep. All the courses cost $42. Pretty reasonable. Our server was so cool. Love all the here!
Great spa!!! What a relaxing atmosphere! Their services are too notch. Next time I'm in New Orleans I will definitely be back!
Went here because of a groupon. Horrible service. They lost a chance of a repeat customer.

Atmosphere:  Ryan's is a bar......what can I say....you either like that or you don't.  It's not an issue for me.

Food: I only really come here for one thing: Wings!  They have the best wings in the area as far as I'm concerned!!  Get an order of the wings of your choice and an order of "vegetable of the day" (almost always green beans and carrots...but really good) and you've got a meal.

Service: Generally quite good.

This was a cool find!  When I first pulled in I was a little reluctant...no cars in the parking lot. This is typically a tell tale sign during prime dinner hours - a flashing beacon that shouts "go somewhere else".  

But I am glad I took the chance!  Food=Excellent. The burger could have had abbot more seasoning but it was fresh and not a pre-made patty. The service was excellent and super friendly.

If your a local (unlike me) take a chance on this quaint little spot and put it on your regular list!
as always this place is awesome!!! The happy hour specials are amazing and you can get so much for less than 20 bucks!!!

They are doing their best to deal with current global issue.  They are accepting to-go order on Sat & Sun only.  You can either order online or in person but only at the front door.  There will be no access to the premises which I agreed.  Safer for everyone.  The packing is good and service is excellent.

Came here with my buddy after a less than impressive meal at IHOP yesterday. It's a little more expensive than IHOP but very much worth it. I had the Cajun omelet with tomato gravy and my buddy hAd the flap jacks!  Mine was absolutely the best  omelet I've ever had and my buddy said the flap jacks were just like Grandma William's. He speaks very highly of Grandma William's cooking. Don't be sceered to give it  a tRy!!!
I found Eric at the bar. Lol. Him and Jess were great. Amazing food and wonderful service. Definitely coming back.

I would probably give this restaurant a 5 for the food but because the service was so terrible the night we were there I am reluctant to give them 5 stars.
The staff was not equipped to handle a large crowd .

All of the patios on the lake are so jealous of this patio. It's got the best view and probably the best food.

It's two stories of awesomeness but do yourself a solid. Sit upstairs and outside on the patio. INSIST on it. Understand? You won't be sorry.

The food was great (fried seafood platter which was easily splittable along with a bbq shrimp app) and our waitress was a bit of a weirdo but effective. What really stood out was the view. Sitting there, looking over the lake while sipping on my diet coke and munching on fried shrimp holding my guy's hand? Well it just doesn't get better than that, y'all.

One of the best pizza joints in town if not the best one. Delizioso! You can't go wrong with anything you pick from wings to the delizioso pizza. You have to come in and get a slice you won't be disappointed.

I have always looked forward to stopping here for lunch on the way to the beach.
I like their cheesesteaks and especially their chicken cheesesteaks .
I really never enjoyed the pizza and tonight we had the Italian Stromboli. It was honestly worthy of pats 2 star rating, but I'll give it 3. It is very thick and doughy, not my style and the meats were all chopped really small and I don't even know if there was any cheese inside.
Their fries are excellent and I had the cheese fries tonight and they were great.
I guess that I will have to stick with the chicken cheesesteak next time.

Its fine to go in for lunch or dinner but avoid for breakfast at all costs the staff is SLOW and not very friendly. They all walk around slow motion. I work near them and liked that I could pop in and grab a coffee quick, unfortunately it's anything but quick. I have gone in a few times hoping maybe I just got them on a bad morning, but each time they have disappointed me. Today I ordered a single pumpkin spice latte, it took a full 5 minutes before anyone even STARTED making it, even though there seemed to be plenty of people just walking around aimlessly in the back. Another 5 mins for the girl to even get it made and sulk out to where I was and rudely shove it in my hands. I get back and take the lid off and half the cup was just the whipped cream. The top of my receipt says 8:18, I got my latte at 8:29 and was late for work. Thank Panera, you got me for the last time.

Really great lunch spot ya'll. 

Met a friend to discuss business over lunch. Tons of younger professionals cranking it in during the midday hours. And the food was awesome! I got the the Bim Bi Bap with tofu instead of steak. It really delivered. From the flavor to the presentation, I was impressed. 

Fair warning, parking is a total nightmare during M-F but the Soy Teriyaki Bistro service and the expeditious line redeems step 1.

Great food, good value. Every dish has lots of flavour and I loved all the different cuts of meat that were done excellently. Tongue tacos, ribeye, skirt steamk. All great.
Atmosphere was also very relaxing, yet the room had a good energy. Two concepts in one and service was on point. Would recommend to any of my friends and family!
l Steak 'n Shake food reasonable pretty cheap, quick service, food has improved, kid likes the garlic burger

Me & my Son came here on a Sunday evening & the customer service was nonexistent; No one greeted us, acknowledged us or even looked our way so it became pretty obvious that no one would be waiting on us so we left. Very odd vibe given off by what staff we saw, but even who was actually working there wasn't very clear from the customers hanging out.... I very rarely write negative reviews, but this was all so mystifying that we left there miffed, confused & scratching our heads. The Guy boiling in the trailer out front was nice & noticed our dismay as we left but he offered us no solutions... didn't really seem like he had any, anyway.

This is most likely the best pho I've had living in South Jersey yet. The staff is very hospitable and always give the best service ever. I have a pho place 5 min near me but I rather drive 25 mins to get here. Worth the money and worth the time.

We were staying in the area for a family vacation and wanted to stay close to the hotel after a full day of travel and site seeing. Saw great reviews for this restaurant and gave it a shot. 

Arrived around 6:00 on Wednesday night and it was busy, but luckily there was a table for 4 available. The line of people after us weren't so lucky. It did move quick though, for such a small place.

I had the jambalaya and it was really good. My husband had the gumbo, which he said was good, but needed more rice. Overall a good first dinner of vacation.

We love it here!  Cannot say enough about this place and we go every chance we get.  Although the dinners are good the salads and burgers are the best!  The BLT salad with salmon is my favorite and the appetizer onion rings with ranch dressing are great!  Everything is good I have a hard time deciding what to get.  Service is always great too!
Chargrilled oysters are amazing. maybe the best single bight of food in all of New Orleans.

A friend of mine suggested this place and im quiet happy he did! 
It's a bit dark but that's ok, the staff are very friendly and polite and the food is awesome! 
I ordered the good dog burger and enjoyed it very much, the fries are very tasty too. 
My partner ordered the deep fried pickles and the hummus dip, I hate hummus because I think it's bland but the hummus is actually amazing! Thanks guys

Came for prime rib friday. For about $15 you get the prime rib, mashed potatoes, and steamed veggies - the quality of food wasn't anything to die for. Mashed potatoes tasted like they came from a box. Wasn't impressed with my meal but my bf's french dip was good. I'm willing to go back and give it another shot since the service was quick and friendly. Beer pitchers were pretty cheap too.

I have now been here twice for dinner and the food does not disappoint! We like to order a variety ie shrimp, lamb, and vegetarian and everything was unbelievable. Some dishes don't come with rice and they were a little too soupy but the servers gave us rice without charge. The servers all seem to want to make sure you are enjoying your time but they become a little annoying with the amount of times they come to the table and they also seem a little overwhelmed/chaotic. Wish they were still a BYO! But good drink selection otherwise. Highly recommend!!

A m b i a n c e:
Fast casual, has indoor and outdoor seating. Artistic garage vibes.

N o i s e  L e v e l: 
Kinda loud, open kitchen concept.

D r i n k s: 
Beer, wine, and soft drinks.

F o o d: 
Got the chicken pita and the Greko salad. Super tasty!! The salad was fresh and light, but filling. Tried the fries, really yummy with the oregano and cheese. Felt pretty authentic, we had visited Greece a few months ago and this was pretty comparable. 

R e v i s i t: 
Yes!

My husband and I love this place and have been coming here regularly for a few years. The food has always been excellent, always hot and very flavorful. Their fries are hand cut and always delicious. The owner is very nice and attentive to our needs. It is a small family owned business and we are happy to support the small businesses in our area.

Today was our first visit. The food was really good. I ordered the eggs Florentine and hubby enjoyed the southern scramble. The portions are large. The only negative is the service is slow but hopefully with time that will improve. We will definitely be back.

Tucked in the Drury Plaza ( my hotel of choice) by the arch, Carmine's is a part of the Lombardo's family of restaurants.  I will start by saying that the food was really good, but by itself more like a four. What shot this up to a five was the service. Our server had the perfect balance of quality service, knowledge of food preparation, and out of the way when not needed. At the same time, he made it feel like we were VIP's seated in his private dining room.
Had the toasted ravioli for appetizer, again very good. Entree was a petite filet mignonette served with their bacon mashed potatoes. Good portion size. My dinner party had some of the seafood options.  Would definitely go back.

If you're a beer drinker, this is a must-visit when in Nashville. It's a beautiful space with a large, modern, well-designed tap room. This isn't Nash-Vegas! Take a tour, and be sure to try everything to experience the full range of what this brewer can do. The bonuses are that the owners are super friendly and helpful, and they're focused on brewing efficiently and conscious of their environmental impact.

If I were just rating this restaurant on presentation it would receive 5 stars.  Unfortunately TASTE is very important to me and the flavors of the sushi just wasn't there for me.  I had a combination of rolls and nigiri and I was underwhelmed by both.  The fish wasn't super fresh and the rolls were very heavy on the rice.  The staff was very nice but there are places in Indy who serve way better sushi that focus more on the fish.  If you are a real sushi lover...you probably won't love this place

My chicken gyro was alright. Going in, I knew I had to keep my expectations low, because they have a huge menu of varied foods and types of cuisine, and that's never a good sign. It's like that saying: jack of all trades, master of none. They have tacos, and gyros, and cheesesteaks, and burgers, and and and ... 

So my chicken gyro was alright. It satisfied my appetite. My husband got the Philly cheesesteak, and he said it was OK. We also got a cheeseburger and fries for the kids, and they really liked it. Overall, our meal was just fine, and I especially liked that I paid less than $20 for all that food. The cheeseburger and fries combo even came with our choice of lemonade. We chose original.

Oh, that's another thing. You can choose different flavors of lemonade, but they really just have a base lemonade flavor (lemon), and then they will add squirts of high-fructose-corn-syrup-food-coloring water in your choice of artificial flavor. It's the kind of stuff that's squirted on snow cones. Whomp whomp. If you're going to have the word "lemonade" as a part of your business name, and you're going to offer different flavors of lemonade, shouldn't you make actual different types of lemonade? Anyone agree with me? No one? Maybe I'm just being grouchy. 

While I was waiting for my food (they cook it it up fresh to order, by the way, which is nice), I got to enjoy a Puff Daddy/Mase music video on the TV, which was amazing and almost made me bump this review up to four stars. A restaurant that can transport me to 1997 can't be half bad.
My boyfriend and I did a group tour our guide was Mike he was hilarious and made the tour amazing! Definitely recommend to anyone who likes beer and learning about it!
Undercooked fries...undercooked onion rings...this restaurant needs quality control...when I asked the drive thru cashier for ketchup she told me they were out. Not a great experience.

We just recently moved to the neighborhood from center city Philadelphia. I was very concerned about food options in the burbs, and then I found Trevi. A great go-to place for fantastic pizza in the area. I've only ever had takeout, but the Trevi Traditional pizza is perfect. Thin, crispy crust. Fresh mozzarella. And they have blood orange Pelligrino. Done.

In addition to the excellently prepared food and a high quality bartender, we were most impressed by the excellent service. We were constantly attenoby two servers, who worked well together. This was a real find, thanks to the reviewers before us!

I have to say, I wasn't as blown away by this place as I thought I would be.  I'm sure I owe it another opportunity.  

That said, overall the cr√©pes just weren't as great as I had been lead to believe.  I got the pumpkin pie crepe which didn't have enough depth to it.  It needed some additional fruit complements to it to make it more satisfying.  It was like one long bite of the same thing which make eating the crepe more of a chore than enjoyable.  

Next time I will try the Provence cr√©pe which sounds good.  I hope it delivers.  If it does, I will certainly amend my review. 

The coffee was fresh and well brewed.  Plus for that.

Sticky tables, poor quality food. Looks like packaged ramen. Miso soup=bad broth. Restrooms are messy-no soaps or towels in dispensers. Don't bother-empty on a Friday evening-should have just walked out!

I'd say it's a 4.5.  Can we talk about how colorful the dishes are?? More importantly, can we talk about how delicious the food was? 

So, I had the:
Salaw Machu Kreung (lemongrass soup with slices of beef lungs)
Pleah Sach Ko (Raw beed salad)
Prah Hok Kateeh (ground beef marinated with fermented fish served with vegetables)
Mussels with coconut sauce
Mussels with curry sauce
Frog meat with vegetables (Forgot the name)
Kah-Puh Chin (Fried shrimp with some sort of mayo/sriracha sauce)
Cooked (Grilled?) beef with fermented fish sauce
Some sort of chicken dish I totally forgot

Out of these dishes, my favorites are: Kah-Puh Chin, Prah Hok Kateeh, and the grilled beed with fermented fish sauce, and the raw beef salad.

My least favorite was the mussels with the curry sauce, which was surprising because I totally thought I'd like it based off how delicious it looks from other people's pictures.

It was my first time eating frog as well.  It wasn't too bad; it was like chewy chicken meat.  It was also my first time eating raw beef. Again, I was surprised I liked it.

Now make no mistake, Cambodian food is completely different from other Asian dishes.  I don't know how to describe it, but it's a more "ethnic/heavy" tasting.  The dishes use a lot of lemongrass.  Khmer Kitchen is authentic Cambodian food, but it's slightly on the sweeter side, according to one friend who just came from Cambodia. The food is still delicious, though!  If you're new to Cambodian food, I'd recommend the Prak Hok Kateh or Kah-Puh Chin.

The service is great; they are very accommodating and casual.  The restaurant itself was very small.  I believe there were only 8-10 tables that can seat a group of 4.  This restaurant is very popular.  I suggest asking for a reservation.  My group of 8 got lucky and got seated right away.  

Word of advice, the kitchen closes at 8 pm so come before 8 pm.  Also, cash only!!
Excellent gathering place.  Very good food and excellent service.  We had steak, salmon, and trout......wonderful.  I wished I would have come here sooner.

We have been twice and both times the food was very good. You order at the counter and they bring the food to you. They have a nice dining room and even a patio. 
The first time I did a gyro, but this last time I got the pasta special dinner that I think is only on weekends. It was very good. I was glad I went with that. 
I really like Greek food and I like Taziki's. It's very clean and a step up from some fast food Greek places we frequent without the price of a sit down. The food is quality and I like how fast it comes out, but still tastes great. The staff was very friendly and I like they came around to ask if everything was good.

I get the pork miso ramen at least once a week. Perfect for the winter time. Always my go-to when it's super cold out. The drinks at cheu are also the absolute best--Middle aged Samurai and Phuket on ice are my favorites. The fried chicken buns are also our favorite appetizer whenever we go. Definitely give Cheu a go!

Great meal this morning after celebrating Packers win last night!! Lisa was fantastic waitress!! My wife had the lobster Benedict and I had the traditional breakfast!!! Superb bacon!!! Baked with great flavor. Upgrade to the City GRits!!! They are incredible... best grits I ever had. Gouda cheese in them. First timers get free beignets!!! Also, awesome!!! Loved the place, very clean with super nice wait staff!!!

Wonderful food, great upscale market. Whenever we are in the area we make a point to eat at Chef's. All of the vegetables and sides are country style vegetables with a city flair - Taste great and look fantastic. The salads and fruit selection are the best in Nashville. Their fruit tea is good, they add mango and mint to it - I believe. The gift shop is filled with all kinds of nostalgic type items. Really lively and fun place to go shop, eat, visit, and take home some great takeaways.  You do have to order your food cafeteria style but it is great to see all the gourmet food offered.

Richard's is a top-notch Italian restaurant in Boise. For several years it was in a different location, and now it is attached to the new Inn at 500 hotel.

We tried some of their signature entrees, including cannelloni and chicken with forty cloves of garlic. The cannelloni was some of the best I have ever ordered in a restaurant. The garlicky chicken was moist and extremely flavorful! The service was great; our server Shana did an amazing job! 

The ambiance and atmosphere was classy and upbeat with a full house during dinner time.

I plan to definitely go back to Richard's any time I return to the Boise area.

Took 45 minutes to be seated then another 30 for food. Had to ask waiter for another drink twice, took 10 minutes in between, watched him help bus a table while waiting. Food came out room temperature

I am really striking out on my BBQ tour in Nashville. 
I service is horrible. The girl taking our order tonight seemed put out to take our order and even worse when we asked if she would make more tea. 
They were out of ribs? What? What I came there for. Ordered the BBQ nachos. Had a long hair in it and lost my appetite.
Pickles were good.

Was very disappointed. The filet medallion was not good, served on a bed of not very good rice. Fresh vegetables consisted of cold carrot and broccoli.
Very poor wine selection. First and last visit to this Texas Roadhouse.

As if I needed another great pizza option in St. Louis. Pi offers wonderful deep dish pizza with cornmeal crust. The pizza's are sauce heavy, in a great way. With multiple locations, a pie is never too far away.
Great fresh pizza!!! I will most definitely be back for the sausage & cheese pie! I love thin crust so this place was perfect & the fact that the ingredients were fresh was an added bonus!

This is my first visit - the mood is SET! Saturday nights has a female DJ she is AMAZING! the drinks are good, service is quick and everyone down to the buss boys are attentive! wow really loved the vibe it's a great date spot awesome ice breaker place, love the bar love the dj! will be back next saturday

I ordered a supreme pizza and eggplant parmesan sub with no cheese for my wife.  The pizza came as ordered and it was very well put together and tasted good.  The eggplant parmesan did not come as ordered.  The put cheese on it even though I requested that they not.  I called back to the store to let them know.  After checking to see how the order was placed and that in fact I was correct the guy on the phone kept talking about giving me a discount and never asked if I wanted it remade and to get another one.  After advising him that I needed it made correctly he agreed to make another one I could come get it.

When I got to the store he gave me the correct sub.  No apologies for making it incorrect.  I then asked about the discount that he kept insisting that I take vs making me the sub the correct way.  He stated that I would not get a discount on a future order even though my wife did not eat with the rest of the family because they messed up her sub the first attempt.  The reason that was given was because they remade the sub.  I was amused.  I advised him that he remade the sub that they didn't make right the first time, he didn't do me any favors in fact it took more time for me to get the sub the second time and my wife didn't eat with the family.  It was more of a hassle that was created for us than anything.

This was the first time that I have ordered from here.  I thought I would give the local store a chance since they are close to the house and I can get there in less than 3 minutes and the menu looked like it had a lot to offer.

I only give two stars because the pizza was actually good.  I am not sure I will be back.  They could have given me as little as a 10% discount for my inconvenience and I would have been happy.  But to tell me that there would be none after they insisted that was the route they wanted to go before I told them I needed a new sub and they never apologized for making it incorrectly in the first place.

Just stay here for the first time. The atmosphere is a lively and definitely just naturally puts you in a good mood. The decor is every bit of what you would think an Irish pub would have. I had sweet potato fries and cheeseburger sliders which turned out to be just the way I assumed they would be (in a good way). I was there with one other person, We were able to talk in a normal tone and hear each other just fine despite it being a pub atmosphere with a very high ceiling. I would definitely go here again and they would accommodate any type of group, personal or business. I did not have any alcohol this go around so I cannot speak to their menu in that regard.

On the 'Island' of Clearwater w/K & looking for a breakfast spot and saw so many highly rated reviews for this place.

All, well justified because the menu selections here are excellent. There is a parking deck adjacent and they have a few outside tables.
This particular Wednesday, the weather was outstanding so we sat outside and had a great experience with Bryce as our server. He had excellent knowledge of the menu and walked us through all the options, very friendly, professional and easy style.

I had the salmon Benedict & K had the  Sunrise Spinach Scrambler.
Both were excellent choices and cooked to perfection with tasty and healthy ingredients.

I would highly recommend this place especially if the weather is nice and you can sit on the patio and if you're fortunate you'll meet Bryce.

I had heard good things about Penang in Chinatown, so I finally caved and decided to try it out with some friends. We had seen huge queues out the door during prime times on the weekends, so we opted to try it on a weeknight. Walking in, it looked pretty upscale for a restaurant in Chinatown. The ambiance definitely resembled something of a romantic date scene. 

We opted to try the pad Thai, green curry seafood in a clay pot, and basil chicken. The food was a little slow to arrive but not a huge deal. The green curry seafood was pretty delicious, with a good amount of spice. My personal preference, but I would have preferred it to be a little thicker, as it was definitely a broth consistency. The pad Thai was also flavored well, with shrimp and bean sprouts scattered throughout the dish. I was not a fan of how chopped up the noodles were for it. They were so small, you couldn't really eat it with chopsticks. The basil chicken was a very solid choice though. Spiced well, the chicken wasn't dry, and it was an overall well made dish with presentation.

Stopped in for quick lunch, everything was amazing. We had the following sandwiches: falafel, chicken shawarma, and halloumi.  Everything was good, tasty, best falafel sandwich I've had outside of the Middle East.
Will definitely be back, thank you for the great food!

Had lunch here today for the first time. Great atmosphere friendly staff. Burgers were huge. We got the fried pickles which we loved. I don't even like pickles. But they were thin cut, breading was delicious and the sauce was amazing.

Been here several times over the years. They have a very enjoyable atmosphere (although it can get quite loud). The burger is something that always stood out and it's a must try. Other than that, their breakfast menu is quite good as well - the steak and eggs is definitely worth.

I usually get awesome, respectful service from Carlena and the remaining staff.  Last night, the owner's son (Jake Bartenope) was incredibly rude and unprofessional.  I'm very disappointed at the treatment we received and not likely to return.
BEST PLACE IN TOWN! Decor rocks .. Warm and cozy. Food... Out of this world! I am so excited about this place! Can't wait for downtown to open

Fantastic. The best filet, period. We ordered  Lobster and bone-in filet with lobster mac and cheese and bacon Brussel sprouts. The only downside was the Brussel sprouts, they were awful, a little too tart for my taste. The service was perfect and I will return the next time I'm in Tampa.

Won't be back for NCAA tournament games.  Waited in line at the back bar entrance for an hour on Friday.  I was third in line and planned to secure a table for a group of seven when the Ale opened (11:00). A few minutes after 11:00, the door to the front bar opened first. After about 30  seconds, the door to the back door still wasn't opened.  The people behind me (last in line) turned and entered through the front bar entrance. By the time the back bar entrance opened, the tables were all take by those who ran in the front entrance and through the front bar to grab back bar tables.  I've been a patron here for 12 years and seen some of the best college basketballs games of my life in the Ale.  Their food is fantastic and the bee selection is too notch (they had Zombie Dust on tap), but this experience was a slap in the face.  This entire process needs to be supervised by the manager/owner.  Completely wasted over an hour of my morning freezing my butt off to get robbed.  We ended up pushing tables together in the front bar, but it wasn't the same quality viewing experience as we should have had. I'll spend my $130 in another sports bar next year.  I hear Briton Tavern or Moon Dog calling...

The sweet and sour of this place (see what I did there?) is that the food is surprisingly good and fresh but the clientele sometimes causes me to question humanity. But, it's a buffet so what can you expect?

I've been going here for years as it's close to my work and its quick, filling, and cheap. No, it's not the best, but it is the most convenient for me. 

I've also noticed over the past few weeks that some of the buffet items are now getting cycled around; it used to be the exact same things every day.

I just recently noticed on Monday that they now have shrimp and mussels in the buffet....they looked ok, but I have a strict rule on seafood at buffet's so wouldn't be able to tell you if it's any good or not.

The waitstaff is consistent and has been the same for years. It's nice to see the same faces, but in the end, they're just keeping my drinks filled (which they do quite well and better than most well-established restaurants).

So yea, this review is a culmination of years of attendance through the ups and downs, but now they are on an up-swing and my co-workers and I go about once a week.

Notable item: the buffalo wings (I know, I know) but these are outstanding for some reason.

"Nobody goes there anymore. It's too crowded." While the novelty of Fido has worn off since I was a kid, this is still a Nashville favorite for most people, mostly because we all have nice memories of the place. There are better cups of coffee, better pastries, better food and better service to be had elsewhere, but not nearby. This is definitely your best choice for breakfast or lunch in Hillsboro Village ever since Provence went down hill. I hope it never closes.

Oh my gosh I LOVE Prep & Pastry so so much. Virtually everything on their menu is so delicious and the service is always great. The only downside is the extremely long wait. I've never waited less than 40 minutes for a table during brunch and it's usually around an hour or more. So unfortunate because I love it!

I can't believe this day in age, as a guest I still have to deal with racism. I went to the restaurant on a Sunday (today) during the day, and could not believe my ears as I was skimming through the dirty and sticky menu. The bartender I had to deal with was awful. It was a female with long blond hair. I believe her name is Kyla or similar. She called me cheap because I didn't tip, and even had the nerve to ask me if something was wrong with her service,  however the service was terrible and I don't think I've ever been to bar where the bartender seemed to be more preoccupied with gossiping than helping a guest.  The food was good but I didn't get to try it right away being that I had to wait for silverware. As I was eating, my cup was becoming empty and no water was offered or another drink. I stood up and went to the other bar across the dining room to get water and eventually I moved over there where I actually got good service and didn't feel as though I was sitting in the audience of jerry springer episode. I also don't appreciate the kyla/bartender referring to me as the "cheap Hispanic guy" to her Co-workers and her Co-worker which also looked Hispanic didn't seem very enthused either. I would NOT and will not ever return in the future especially with the same bartenders working there that I had to deal with, very and extremely disappointed
I've been to Bernie's more than once and I can't wait to go back. Awesome food and great service!

Wasn't impressed. Got the nachos with brisket. Very bland and basically a head of lettuce and huge chunks of tomatoes. 
The chips tasted stale and very generic. Homemade chips would have made a world of a difference. 
Got one of each of the tacos. One again nothing special and once again way to much lettuce. Obviously using it as filler. 
Service, fail again. Ordered a side of guac and the person brought out the food and it wasn't there. I asked for it and she told me she could not give me any cause it wasn't on the ticket and then left. So now  waiting for my server. Couldn't the person who brought the food just go get it for me and then to our server?  Won't be returning. Wanted to try the doughnuts they had one with fruity pebbles on it, but the whole experience was ruined from everything else.

Best new sushi joint in South Tampa!  I consider myself somewhat of a sushi snob and just love this concept.  Often I want to get take-out sushi but usually decide when I'm already out and about and normally have to wait 25+ minutes for my order to be ready.  At Kelp your order is ready very quickly and the quality and menu options are amazing and creative! The staff is friendly and knowledgable and the decor is trendy and clean.  You have to try this place!!!

First of all, the place is absolutely stunning... love everything about the looks, ambiance, etc (thus the 2 stars).  Went there for the food (not to golf) and the food and service were very disappointing.  Food showed up (after a long wait) quite cold despite the fact that they had food runners.  I would have mentioned this to our waiter but he was nowhere to be found.  Glad I went to experience the awesomeness of the place but I won't be returning.

well i'll definitely never be back on a sunday morning... walked in and the amount of people waiting was absurd but the hostess assured me that the wait would be 20 minutes. assuming she was correct, myself and friends waited... and waited... for over an hour. once we were finally seated, our server said that the kitchen was very backed up and we would be waiting a while for our food as well. we waited for another 40 minutes until we were able to eat pretty mediocre food at best. not super pricey but i definitely didn't expect to spend $25 on an omelette and small side of fries.

AMAZING!!!!!!!! Hands down one of the best local restaurants in the area. The service was impeccable. Our waitres- Kelsey was attentive and so helpful! The food came out hot and smelled amazing. The best of all was the TASTE! Jesus, the fried calamari were soooo good and the marinara sauce that accompanied the calamari was soooooo amazing, the flavors were explosive. For the dinner I got the shrimp and broccoli over penne pasta in a white wine sauce and it was fantastic!!!!! Everyone needs to experience Amalfi for themselves.

Was driving by and this place caught my attention with its interesting location. I ordered a burger (which was very good and fresh) and my girlfriend was craving pancakes (banana), which were delicious. I ate my burger with their delicious lemonade and then dropped it to finish the awesome pancakes. 

I will definitely be back for either breakfast or a solid lunch. Definitely recommend stopping by this place.
Can't go wrong with chicken salad sandwich and tomato bisque soup.  Nice clean dining room.  Absolutely loved the food and quick service.

My husband and I have been to this restaurant several times in the past. Each time we've come, the service has been incredibly slow (luckily, we never came in a hurry). Unfortunately, our most recent visit tops the others. We walked in on a Tuesday at 5pm and there wasn't anyone at the hostess stand. We wanted to sit in the bar area anyway, so we made our way downstairs and sat down. After about ten minuets of not being acknowledged by any of the three or four staff who were either at the bar or behind it, we decided to leave. As we were leaving a young woman said "bye, thank you!" And we looked at her and said "we didn't get served and never got acknowledged." She started to grab menus and we said "no, thanks. We're going somewhere else."  and left. Between the overpriced food and terrible service, we won't ever be coming back.

Within the week of my visit I was contacted regarding my visit. Customer Service is excellent and I will go back.

Go back, I did. This time on a Monday early evening. The waitstaff was awesome. She kept it all straight, was friendly, and on top of our needs. The food was delicious. I will definitely be comedy back.

What's not to love about this relatively new "secret" Jose Garces restaurant!? It definitely lives up to its title of giving off buena onda (if you don't know what it means, look it up!) 

Mostly, I love the clean and charming decor that oozes with happy feels! The service was also friendly and upbeat, and the food tasted great. I'd especially recommend the fish tacos, which is the essence of its menu. And yes, I'll reiterate again with everyone else that the free samples of beer while you're waiting in line might be the most ingenious treat that a restaurant has come up with!

I came on a Sunday afternoon with a fairly large group (approx 10 of us), and we took up a good chunk of the establishment. Since it was relatively empty that day, we were able to pool several of the tables together and had a great time! I'm definitely looking forward to visiting again soon!

Service 4/5
We were greeted and seated as soon as we walked in. This was 5:30 on a Tuesday so it wasn't very busy. Our waitress was friendly and attentive. 

Atmosphere/Ambiance 4/5
Really liked the decor in here, it's a neat little place! Only negative for me was the music was a bit too loud, they were just playing a local Top 40 station; there was a lot of Kesha for some reason.

Food 4/5
When we put in our order the waitress asked if we wanted soup or salad so we both thought these were included with the meal; the salad and soup were only $2 each so I'm really not complaining but it was just a surprise when we got the bill and learned it wasn't included. Just something to note. In any case both were very good. The salad dressing was really delicious, it had a hint of peanut, not your everyday ginger salad dressing that I've had at other places. We then got an order of the Gyoza. They were crispy and flavorful without being greasy. For sushi I ordered the Spicy Scallop and the Celebration Roll (one of the daily specials) both were delicious, the Celebration Roll was a party in my mouth! Husband got the Birthday Roll and the Fujiama Roll, he liked the Birthday Roll better. They also had a beer special going on, husband's Kirin Ichiban was only $2. I also received a $5 off coupon for checking in on Yelp.

Over all a good experience, we will definitely be back as they have a wide variety of interesting rolls we'd like to try!
great service great food the ribeye was perfect even the fries would recommend it for anyone

Food was good. Was given the choice of 16 oz or 32 oz beer and decided on the 32 oz Kilian's Red. Bill came and it was $18! I asked the server how it could be $18 and he said it came in a souvenir glass. How do I go into the Phillies game with a glass? I didn't want a souvenir glass and wasn't told it would come in one. Jim out server said he would save it for my next visit. There won't be one.

Typically I love going in here on lunch, or also for a snack and blow off a little steam. 

The decor is pretty sweet for what it is; typically the food is par or better. The Shewman Special is a unique burger that is a personal favorite. I've ordered this probably half of the times that I've had food. 

The appetizers are certainly not a dollar menu, but are typically what I would consider good in quality. Not gouging or anything. 

I've had some "questionable" service we will say... As a long time visitor here, I seem to feel like the service was much better in the past. 

I have a little bit bitter of a taste in my mouth from a lunch experience many months ago (part of why I really haven't been much anymore...). 

I ordered the endless soup lunch special. I ordered my third soup bowl after having been seated for somewhere around 25-30 minutes. Many minutes go by, I do not have my soup. I asked another server (ours seemed to temporarily be MIA). They said they would check. 

Our server reemerged, apologized, and offered a Togo soup (as our table had requested our bill, some needing to go back to work). I explained that it really wasnt needed, I was just going to pick away at it before going back to work. So they talk me into taking it anyway. Another server that was roped in came back and told me he was not aloud to give carryout soup since it was the special. Must say, was in a bit of a condescending tone too. 

You offered it, I said no, you talked me into it, then chastise me as though I'm trying to pull a fast one. All I did was ask for a refill 20 minutes prior during my lunch hour. 

I've been back a few times, but I'm still a little reluctant to resurface here too often.

However the wings however are Delicious. They are supposedly wood fired wings which is why they taste so good. You can eat there which is a little laid back or you can walk to the back to the bar area which is a little more lively. location 5stars.

My 2nd visit in the few months living here.   
Had an AWESOME Vietnamese Restaurant in Lake Park...
Nice people....
GREAT FOOD....
Next time I don't do take-out!

I came here a few weeks ago and was less than satisfied. The food was mediocre and the service was bad. I decided to give it another try but this will be my last.
