I ordered an omelette thinking that they should be pretty good in a place that features French food. The omelette was like a rubber ball with no seasoning, the bread(!) was stale and hard. My last visit here. If I could give it no stars, I would.

I'd been contemplating trying Rockstone Pizzeria & Pub since my visit to the nearby Wiseguys Pizza, but it was a recent visit by a friend that made me finally say "Okay, it's time." So, on a lazy Sunday afternoon I decided it would be a great place to enjoy a meal, watch the Colts game, and read my Sunday newspaper. 

Rockstone is located in a strip center just inside Fishers, Indiana with a Sahm's location and a Massage Indy location also located in the strip. It's not a particularly impressive building, but it's infinitely less divey than the nearby Wiseguys. 

I will admit that Rockstone lost a star before I ever made it inside. While they have a nice little curb cut that helps with wheelchair access, they'd rather ignorantly placed their outdoor signage on the sidewalk very close to an outdoor bike rack and it blocked anyone with a mobility issue from actually accessing the restaurant. While I was able to move it, it wasn't exactly simple to do so and a lot of folks with mobility issues wouldn't be able to do so. 

Once I got by the sign, I went in their double-glass doors and there was a host/hostess area with a hand-written sign to seat ourselves at the bar. That was simple enough and, in fairness, I did arrive at almost 2pm in the afternoon. So, I seated myself at a four-seat table that was for the most part out of the light from the outside. The walls had several televisions, all playing football games and all playing the Colts game with the exception of one. There were also a few booths along the outside of the dining area against the walls. The place was almost empty with the exception of a couple booths that were taken and a handful of bodies at the bar. 

I don't really consider myself high maintenance, but I do have this guideline that if you're an employee and you see me enter and sit down then you should acknowledge me whether you're going to be my server or not. So, I was a little disconcerted to have one server completely ignore me as she walked by me twice. Finally, a server came by and noticed my presence and handed me a drink menu before noticing I hadn't been given any other menus. I'm not sure why I needed a lunch menu when lunch specials are only applicable Monday-Friday, but I received one. 

The decor has sort of a pub meets industrial vibe to it. The drink menu is extensive, though I stuck with my usual iced tea. The menu consists primarily of wood-baked pizzas, appetizers, a couple desserts, and a few foccaccia sandwiches. While the idea of a whole pizza wasn't really appealing, I opted for a 10" pepperoni as I'd been told their wood-stove pizzas were good. 

The wait wasn't bad at all and within a few minutes I had my pizza. It was light, crispy, and to be perfectly honest I had no problem polishing it all off without feeling overly stuffed. Of course, I hadn't eaten at all during the day and that likely helped. The toppings were good and plentiful and balanced throughout each slice. 

Service was attentive and I did get my always desired refill. 

What's my overall impression? As I noted, I swiped away one star right away because of the unnecessary and inconsiderate accessibility issue. Thus, we're in the 3-4 star range here. There's a part of me that wants to give Rockstone a 4-star rating, but I have to be honest and say it lacked that certain spark that separates it from other establishments. While there's no question that the atmosphere is vastly superior to Wise Guys, I honestly preferred the Wise Guys pizza. This pizza, while I liked the wood-baked quality, was good but it simply didn't "wow" me like I want an upper tier pizzeria to wow me. The same was true for the service - it was attentive but not particularly inviting. In my opinion, really good service makes you want to go back and go back soon. I enjoyed my meal, but Rockstone will definitely not be a destination spot for me. If I really want a wood-baked pizza, Napolese is closer and superior.
Excellent food, Excellent service.  Melva is the best.   No long line to get in and Melva kept the drinks flowing and even closed the shutters when the sun got too bright.  Highly recommended.

Fresh coffee, good iced coffee, great vietnamese coffee, free wifi, and plenty of space. 

The only con is the bathroom is disgusting. Even just trying to get the paper towels from the dispenser makes me want to wash my hands again.

I am currently obsessed with Tutti Frutti!  I just discovered it about a month ago and I've already filled my punch card and earned free fro yo!  The flavors are good, pretty traditional offerings, except the coconut, which is amazing!! 

Inside is very clean, but it is so cramped in the seating area. You are literally on top of the neighboring tables. Lots of seating outdoors though. Parking is also a pain. Miniature lot.

Amazing place. When I walked in I was immediately greeted, and got my table. My waitress did an excellent job, and I walked away happy. As for the food, it is amazing, I ordered the Cambridge skillet, and it was one of the best things I have ever had. I highly suggest going here. 

P.S. Highly attractive staff.

Great place to stop and have a beer.  There beer and burger special is awesome. Cheap eats, good beer, and low prices make for a winning combo stop in after seeing the sights.  The service was great and very friendly staff. Highly recommend.

First time here but definitely not the last. The other restaurants in the area will have to step up their game in order to compete. 

Al carte menu and a buffet menu, WHAT?!

I did the olmette station vs al carte but the menu was extensive and no one complained. 

Party atmosphere but still chill and plenty of TVs if you want to watch.

I was disappointed in this pizza for several reasons.First the service was not educated on their own menu. I ordered a linked in pizza with bell pepper,grilled onion and olives.I got olives and jalepenos.I was not aware who even was preparing my pizza and when I mentioned that was not what I ordered they told me it was too late too late.The restaurant changed the toppings on this pizza but the menu did not reflect the change. They barely cooked my pizza in the oven. Rhe pizza was soggy, the jalepenos were not fresh,and caused the pizza to taste like vinegar. I was very dissatisfied and disappointed in my service because when I complained no one seemed to care.It seems that there was no one in charge so they can get away with rude behavior and poor service. I would rather spend more money at a restaurant that prepared a better pizza the way I ordered it. So sad because I love wood fired pizza.

My family and I wanted to try something different for lunch... and numerous 4-start Yelp reviews led us to 101 Taiwanese Cruisine!

It's a good-looking restaurant.  We tried their beef chow fun (under-seasoned and lacked wok-flavor), green onion pancakes (also under-seasoned), ginger fish soup (fantastic with a nice gingery bite), salt-and-pepper fish fillet (good flavor, fried nicely), and pork rib noodle soup (good but the pork rib was over-cooked).  The service was great and the food was decent.  I'd definitely come back for more of the ginger fish soup and try some other dishes.

I came here for dinner last night and loved the salad with ranch, the sweet rolls, chicken and mashed potatoes all from the buffet. Service was great and the restaurant was clean. Will definitely be back.

Normally a nice place to order from on lunch break. However, this trip wasn't the case. 1/26/19 at 2:15 pm cashier ( Ahyanna was the name on the receipt) seemed to rather be somewhere else and definitely not telling me what the soups were. Instead, I was greeted with a sigh and her pointing at the soup of the day sign. I felt like I needed to apologize for my inquiry. My company always uses this location to cater for events throughout the year and this isn't how a return customer wants to be treated. I won't be making that mistake again.

The new first watch location is adorable! The layout is very open and bright, and the atmosphere is like a cozy country kitchen. I had the eggs Benedict blt which was served on a brioche bread with poached eggs a hollandaise sauce with bacon and arugula and a small side salad (tomatoes removed for personal taste). It was absolutely delicious! My boyfriend the super food bowl which he describes as "refreshing". Everything tasted so clean and fresh I have to agree with him. Our server Camille was very friendly and hands on without being overbearing. They even opened the door for us when we entered! Overall a wonderful experience, a place I would recommend to anyone!

This place was amazing! The service was great and the food was worth every star. I love how they were so informative  and answered all our questions. The pancakes were the best both of us have ever had. The whip cream was even perfect. The basic breakfast is a great combo to get when you just feel like having a basic breakfast. The bacon was cooked to perfection along with some homemade jam. They gave everything we wanted on the side. I love the feel with the seating arrangements and music that was playing. We had an amazing experience and will be back again. Thanks for reading.

I moved to QV 3 years ago.  I visit Red Hook at least once a week.  I have found the staff to be welcoming and lovely.  Lattes are the best; food is delicious.  I am a baby boomer/grandma  (albeit with a nose pierce from Infinite circa 2009); I find no prejudice that I am not a cool 'hipster'...although I am cool!   Have brought my visiting out-of-town family members here...everyone loved it.  This is my go to coffee shop.  So very happy it is in my neighborhood!!

Random find in a strip mall (granted, it's in Carmel so it's a fancy strip).  Loved the 1990s-2000s music, menu with plenty of options too serve a big group (burgers and sushi!), drink specials ($4 mimosas on Saturday!), board games, and a kitchen that was all serving food at 11:30pm. Ample parking. Good mix of people--20s-40s.
LOL I liked this place alot! even tho im not a young kid anymore, i still enjoyed playing games here! won Hella toys!  and i won some money at the casino too! definitely a fun place to visit at reno!

I went for lunch one day. Beer selection is great! They have Chimay on tap which is fairly rare in Indiana. I had a short rib korean taco (great), Carnitas taco/spicy rice/beans (all just okay). Beans were in a super small cup used usually for a small cole slaw which was disappointing. A friend recommended this place due to having been to the one in Vegas. Atmosphere is really nice and dining seats almost 700 people. Full menu is extremely large so I'm willing to give it another shot. It is a bit on the expensive side ($13 for 2 tacos and small sides). With a beer, a couple could easily be spending over $50 for lunch if you dont pick from their lunch menu (which is $10, no drink). Might not be bad compared to other markets but is expensive in Indy considering the amount of options available.

Very fine sonoran style food. Has  maintained their quality during the thirty years I've been going. Yesterday I had shredded beef enchiladas. Meat not dry, favorable. Deep flavor in sauce good amount of cheese. Good size. Others had the steak fajitas. Meat good quality, tender. Many places use cheaper meat. We had a cheese crisp. Very thin and flakey, good amount of cheese. Probably the best in town. Staff very responsive, friendly. Success has not tempted them to cut corners.
One of the best restaurants I have ever eaten. Great food and even greater service. Interior ambiance perfect as is the piano bar. You need to go here!

I was greeted cheerfully at the front desk. They were able to pull my information quickly and assign a room in no time. My room had a stand up shower lined with tiles. Since I like such showers, I loved it. 

The room, carpet, bed, bathroom, etc., were clean. The room had all the amenities for a business traveler. It also had a coffee machine, microwave and a mini fridge. The hotel provided complementary snacks and bottle of water.

The first floor of the hotel is pretty much dedicated to conference and meeting rooms, which is nice if you're looking for such facilities. There is ample free parking available to guests.

All in all, great property and I would stay here again.

Not the best pizza I've ever had, but not too incredibly far from it.  We're fairly new in town and needed to establish a pizza provider, so we figured we would give this place a try.  I ordered a pepperoni and extra cheese pizza, with garlic knots, and a few sodas.  The pizza tastes truly like New York Style pizza with plenty of grease to go around, and to be clear, I'm a big fan of grease (yolo).  The garlic knots were yummy too and were included with a side of marinara sauce.  We'll definitely add Three Brothers to the family when seeking to fill our pizza pleasures.

I loved this place the minute I walked in.  Upscale food in a casual environment!  The service was spot on; attentive but not overwhelming.  We ordered three apps; snails, crabcakes, and baked brie.  So, in my imagination, the word "unctuous" has been waiting for a plate like their fried brie to find its true meaning.  This stuff is so good, and the sauce is a great foil for the richness of the cheese.  The menu is inventive, but not pretentious, and the pork I ordered for my main had an amazing sauce.  I'd definitely go again.

I found a dead fly in their pad ke mao dish . I sent an email to them regarding this and they haven't responded back . It's been over a month. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone as they are very sloppy
Our favorite place to eat in Florida. St coquille scollops to die for. Seafood crepe superb. Wonderful French sauces. Service great

Transcend has by far the best lattes in town! I normally go to this location, cause it's also close to a set of stairs I run on. It's a perfect go to if I wanna get a work out in, then stop in to get some work done. They have lots of plug ins and it's also attached to Bierra, if you're looking to transition from coffee to beer!

I've been on the hunt all throughout the city trying different lattes. And, Transcend wins by a landslide. It doesn't even matter which location you go to, the Ritchie Market or the Garneau location. That's what's so incredible about it. It doesn't matter who makes my lattes, it tastes the same each time. Consistence is key! They don't ever make their lattes too hot. It's perfect temperature so you can drink straight away. I always get it with almond milk, and it'd literally heaven when I take my first sip. 
I can even get it to go, or to stay, again, it's always consistently great.

I don't get pastries here too much. It would be wonderful if they started getting scones in. But, they have more croissants and muffins. I like their spinach and feta, or the chocolate croissant. However, they don't warm up the pastry at all. So, that's the only down side if you're looking to eat something warm. I'm giving it 5 stars solely on the lattes I've tried and just the overall ambiance of this cafe.

It's all about the Duck Confit.

I've tried everything on the menu. It's all good. But if you like duck, it's all about the Duck Confit, all day long.

The people who work here are affable, even at the busiest of times. They want you to enjoy your time with them. They want you to enjoy your food. I like that in an eatery!

I've lived out in Spanish Springs for over 7 years. We used to go to this location once a month or so until the food quality and customer service tanked. We would go and have a bad experience so we would swear it off. About 6 months go by and we would try again, still awful. Servers change but yet the service still sucks. Is it the management? The owners? 
Whichever it is, we will never come back after tonight's terrible service. It took 45 minutes just to get my water (after politely reminding the server 3 times) until I finally walked up to the serving station and began to pour it myself before our server offered to take over. Food was mediocre and overpriced, took about 40 minutes to come out. All I could do by the end was just laugh about it, not worth making a scene. I wish we could get a decent restaurant in Spanish Springs, Bully's certainly isn't one.

Solid tacos near Center City. They're not "so good I'd make an effort to go out of my way to go there" kind of tacos but you can go here and come away happy. I'll definitely stop by again if I happen to be in the area.

The Al Pastor meat is on a spit which means THIS is what you should be ordering. It's juicy and succulent though it could have a bit more flavor than it has. The tacos come on tortillas out of a plastic package, so I assume aren't made in house, but have a good flavor and aren't at all dry.

$9 for three tacos is a bit pricey, but hey tacos in Philly ain't cheap, and they force you to choose only one protein for all three tacos which is kind of annoying.

The green and red salsas are both great, each provide a different flavor and a small bit of spice.

Love this place! Fantastic lemon macaroons. They have a large and extensive menu of cold brews ranging from Brazilian and Columbian to Cuban. I was extremely impressed with their friendly and creative atmosphere. They mention being a young establishment (open for only about 3-4 years), but it seems they've done a lot to make this place a wonderful little cozy coffee shop. The location is in a fantastic laid-back part of town. With an outside patio to enjoy the coffee and pastries, Buttermilk Provision is certainly a must-stop location while relaxing in Tam

Love it! The staff are so genuinely friendly and food and drink were great. This will become my new go-to cafe for breakfast drive thru when in Avon and I'm tired of the static at Starbucks. I see they have so many options on the menu, so I'll definitely be back to try more. Look for more check-ins and photos to come.

If you're looking for a celebrity named restaurant then this would be a decent place to stop in for one drink, otherwise it's just ok. The place was busy and getting table service was very slow! Once service arrived it was very slow going and the Redneck Nachos were just ok, especially when you have to eat them with your fingers and without appetizer plates.

I'm so happy you opened in my neighborhood.  I bought a big box of various pastries today and am in heaven.  We had salami and cheese sandwiches on your baguette it was fresh and delicious. I gobbled up a rich tasty croissant stuffed with crawfish and bechamel sauce.  I just finished off one of the best cream puffs in my life and almost had an epiphany it was soooo yum.  Saving an eclair and carrot cake for later.  Good thing Im not testing my sugar today Im going to polish off this whole box lol it was soooo good.  The prices are good considering the quality of their food.

If book stores are measured by the amount of people that fill them then it baffles me why the Broad & Chestnut Borders closed down while this B&N branch is still open. But hey, it's not a comparison, it's a review of this B&N.

Books: Unfortunately their selection is large yet generic, geared more towards the "what's hot now". Granted, they do carry some gems and I still find myself spending hours on end browsing their sections but I also find that my knees really hurt after crouching for long times because unlike other book stores they don't have room to sit and sample the books. 

Cafe: It's a branch of Starbucks that operates under BN's logo, that said, who the hell doesn't brew bold coffee? Are you guys really that coffeegnorant? The food is nice and the selection and quality of their teas is amazing. 

WiFi: good luck with that one. The WiFi is free but also slow as hell, that's what happens when there are 75 individual IP's that use the same router. Do something about it! 

Staff: The staff is actually very helpful and knowledgeable; if you can find them or feel like going down to the first floor to the help desk. 


All said, it's still my favorite place to burn time and educate myself on new material.

Disappointing experience all around. A couple friends and I bought a Groupon and decided to check this place out. We called in advance as instructed to let them know we were using a groupon and made the reservation. We had high expectations based on reviews and have been to quite a few farm-to-table spots that were awesome. The ambiance is cool - it's in an old train station. The menus were tiny, about 6 "small plates" and 6 "large plates" listed, BYOB, no list of non-alcoholic drinks or desserts. No bread on the table or anything like that, which is a shame with all of the amazing local bakeries. The waiter tells us about a prix fixe special - $25 for a small and large plate as well as dessert. Small selection for this but two of us ordered it anyway since it seemed to be a good deal. I ordered the 16oz strip steak medium rare for $35, plus a cheese plate for $10. Cheese plate came out first, it was underwhelming to say the least - two types of cheese, one small piece of soft cheese and a couple shavings of another kind, plus toasted pecans and some blueberries (complete with stems). No explanation as to what the cheese was, which local creamery it came from, nothing. It was OK, not great but not terrible. Then comes the steak - completely well done and grey in the middle. Not a hint of pink. I typically don't send things back if they are slightly off on temperature, but this was just awful. For $35, I expected it to at least be cooked correctly. I called the waiter and he was completely unapologetic. I asked for the sirloin instead since it was $10 cheaper and would rather take my chances on a cheaper plate the second time around in case I had the same issue. The waiter made it seem like I was inconveniencing him and again, no apology whatsoever. The sirloin came out and was good but the service still left a bad taste in my mouth. I ate alone as every one else at the table was finished. After dinner, we ordered desserts which were again just absolutely underwhelming. It comes time to pay and the waiter drops off the check, explaining as if he were doing me a favor that he didn't charge me for the overdone strip and for the sirloin instead. Gee, thanks pal. We inform our waiter of the groupon. It's then that he tells us he can't honor both the groupon and the prix fixe menu prices. It didn't say this anywhere on the groupon, we called to make the reservation and was never told that this was the case. After some exhausting back and forth, we gave in and had him remove the prix fixe prices so we could use the $80 Groupon. That added an additional $20+ to our check for a total of $125. At that point we just wanted to get out of there so we paid and left, all completely underwhelmed by the food and the service. If you want farm fresh food done correctly and for a great price, I highly recommend Genevieve's Kitchen in Doylestown. We will not be returning back to the local and will definitely not be recommending it to others.

I'm very excited about future patio afternoons at Chago's Cantina.  While my first visit was lacking in some areas, I still very much enjoyed our food and drinks.

Things that were great:  We shared the fajitas w/ shrimp, steak, chicken and pork.  These were excellent!  We also shared the dip sampler that included some tasty guacamole, queso and pico de gallo (it also included some Mexican hummus that is in the not-so-great category).  I had a regular margarita, which was also great, though a little syrupy.

Not-so-great:  The aforementioned hummus just didn't work.  We tried mixing it with some of the pico, but no...  Also, we were pretty set on just sharing one order of fajitas as we had no way of easily transporting leftovers (we were in the middle of a long walk).  At any rate, the server tried to talk us into a second order of fajitas.  He told us it was a pretty small serving.  We resisted getting a second order, figuring we could just order something else if it didn't fill us up.  Okay, so all of that and the one order of fajitas was massive.  We didn't come close to finishing.  Another annoyance, is for the massive sizzling skillet of goodness, we were given three tiny tortillas.  No way you could have fit the meat and veg in three tortillas.  Of course additional cost, but it was necessary.  Another annoyance was the teensy ramekins holding the dips for the sampler.  A little weak for the price tag.  

So a few negatives, but the place is new and this certainly won't steer me away.

To sum up, I would say that Arpeggio's is consistently good.  I haven't had any meals that knock my socks off, but I'm always satisfied with the food and the service.  I've only eaten inside the restaurant once because I really go there to sit out on their "patio."  The restaurant is in a little strip mall -- a nicer strip mall, true, but still a strip mall -- so the outdoor seating is in front of the restaurant along the sidewalk.  You're really only treated to a view of cars and people going to and from their cars, but to be able to dine al fresco and enjoy a bottle of wine is pretty great no matter what.  I also find that the service outside is as good as the service inside -- you don't end up waiting longer or feel forgotten about when you're outside -- it's adequately staffed and promptly attended to.

I have visited this Panera Bread on approximately three occasions, and each time my order has been incorrect. The last experience was the kicker. The Fuji Chicken Salad I ordered had no chicken in it. I got my salad home, opened it up with ravenous anticipation, only to realize that there was no chicken. To make matters worse, there were about 60 pieces of red onion in the salad. "Would you like some lettuce with your onions?" I enjoy onions, but I'd rather not endure an afternoon of heartburn from eating dozens of pieces of them. Worse yet, it was my damn birthday. Talk about disappointment! 

And why was the baguette as hard as a rock at 12:00 PM? 

Panera Bread in general has always been a place of consistency for me. Fresh salads, hot soups, and you can rest-assured knowing that your order is correct. Nowadays, the only consistent aspect of Panera is that something will go awry with even the simplest order. It's a statewide epidemic!

If Panera didn't offer caffeine free fountain Diet Pepsi, then I would write them off for good. Once that goes awry, then I am "out"!
Awesome BBQ.  Hands down the biggest and tenderest pork steak ever.  And the baked beans are best ever.  Am I going back....hell yeah!!!

I've had so many great experiences with this restaurant but the past few times the service seemed to be a little less enjoyable than it normally is. Recently there has been times where some employees, especially the ones directing traffic have shown a little bit of attitude.-- he rolled his eyes at us while we tried to leave the parking lot because he had not seen us leaving and tried to direct a car into the drive thru while we were passing. I have been here many times and the food as been great. I do have to say that once I went and they did burn my sandwich.

We really used to love going to TailGate.  They do a good job of always having new beer on tap and that is a huge plus.  However, the service is just not good.  I am guessing there is a lot of turnover, because the staff always seems to be different when we go in.

The last few times that we had poor service, and I appreciate that the owners/managers reached out to me.  I am not the type of person who will go into a venue and ask for a manager just so that I can get something for free.  I also don't want special treatment.  I like to go in and see how the staff treats every customer.  

Last night we left and my BF said it was the last time we will go there.  It was the third time in a row that the service was just not good.  The evening started well.  We sat at the bar.  The restaurant was relatively slow for a Saturday night.  We were greeted and given our drinks right away.  But once again, it was hard to get another drink ordered.  We sat there with empty glasses while three staff played a game of Rock, Paper, Scissors.  We could not get anyone's attention.  Then a large group of people came in.  Two of the staff disappeared and left one guy at the bar serving all of these people.  Made no sense.  And so we continued to sit there with empty glasses.  That is when we decided to leave.  But we could not flag anyone down to get our check.

I get it when you are busy.  But look up, acknowledge that your customers are waiting and just say "I will be with you in a minute."  I just hate it when bartenders don't make eye contact, don't look at the bar to see who MIGHT need a drink or food or something and you get ignored.

This was my first time at Cheddars. I wanted a light meal and ordered the chicken tortilla soup. While the southwestern spices were nice, the tortilla strips were soggy and the soup was very, very salty. The server was accommodating and offered to bring something else, but by the time she came by to check on me, I was halfway done. On a whim, I decided to try the "new" Painkiller mini cake. It's supposed to be a coconut cake that has rum rizzled over it, topped by whipped cream, toasted coconut and a cherry. The cake was dry, and the rum flavor overwhelmingly  medicinal. I couldn't eat more than a couple of bites. Now, 20 minutes later, that medicinal taste strongly lingers. I do want to come back and try one of the regular entrees before passing full judgment, but this evening's meal was a real disappointment.

Inexpensive and amazing. So many dishes to choose from and Whatever the daily special is I can see you don't have to look any further. I spend most of my time eating in the city but this place is worth a visit. Excellent.
Amazing schnitzel- big whole mushrooms in the gravy, and delicious slightly crisp sp√§tzle. Not to mention great rotating beer selections. What more is there to say? Yum!! Will definitely be back.
Second time to eat here.   The food has been GREAT both times!   I recommend the Pita. The atmosphere is cool and trendy and the servers couldn't be nicer.

The place was ok for  me a first timer at kanella , my girlfriend raves about it and jokes that she can cry tears of happiness of how delicious the dishes are, expect alot of beans, duck hearts, and pickled things. my favorite was the custard desert tart it melted its way my heart.

A gem in Reno. First, the food --- the pot roast meal box. That braised pork rice is so delish. And that's just a side. The pot roast itself so flavorful and tender. The pickled vegetables added a nice touch to change the palate. The restaurant itself is modern, Asian (not to be obvious). Overall, it was a pleasant surprise.

Recommended by Vandy students so swung by for lunch on a Monday. We were seated quickly.

Got a Tennessee burger with tater tots: tater tots were hot, crispy, not overly greasy, and seasoned well. The burger was delicious, brioche bun and all. My only thing was maybe they prepped the bun too early so the top bun was really soggy and cold inside from the sauce. The flavors were rich and the bacon not a skimpy little thing. Burger meat was tender and juicy. Portions were not huge but very filling since I also am that person who eats all the tots/fries.

Ambience: clean, cool burger place in a trendy area

Service: our server was incredibly friendly and kept our waters topped and checked in frequently.

Fancy 
Foodie
eat
here!


You should come early - get your name on the list and expect to sit at a communal table.  ENJOY the experience - don't expect IHOP food this isn't suppose to be like IHOP - it is upscale ! :) 

My group waited well over an hour and had to grab a drink at Chilly Water , but we were fine with this!
Really great steakhouse in an out of the way part of town.  Ambiance and atmosphere was great.  Food fantastic.  Great selection of beers. Service outstanding.
Service was great! I've never had food this good in an airport. Thanks to Roseanne for the great service. The Airport tea was fantastic!

It's good, but I've had better.  My salad came after my pizza, which made me quite annoyed. The pizza was extra crispy and black, so it wasn't ideal for me. If you want a darker cooked pizza, then this spot just might be for you!

Outstanding service from Jasmine.  Friendly and attentive.  Great atmosphere and very clean.  The crawfish po boys was fabulous and the sampler with etuffe, gumbo, rice and beans was great!.  The pecan cobbler with ice cream was a great ending to a nice meal.

Had a horrible dinner the other night, New Year's Eve! Had great service- it seemed like he was the only server working on one of the busiest nights of the year. When the manager Paul came to the table so I could complain, he really had nothing but excuses and wanted to blame on server when it came down to the fact to food and drinks took way too long cause 1 person was working. Our salads came out the same time as our food. Management was extremely rude I will not be going back!!!!!! Feel bad server who was ridiculed- need better management and scheduling!!!

This review is for RyeBrew catering services.  Greg the catering manager worked closely with us to make sure our event went flawlessly.  He helped us decide on what was needed for the number of people we were having and his communication as well as his execution went above and beyond.  Not only was the customer service phenomenal but also people raved about the food! Thank you Greg and RyeBrew for helping to make our event a memorable one.  I would highly recommend RyeBrew for your next event!

Quintessential Philly cheesesteak joint... right? I wouldn't know, but if I did, I think this would be it. Admittedly this is the first "real" cheesesteak sandwich I've ever had, as we supposedly don't do it right out in the Pacific Northwest.

Of course you have to get a cheesesteak at some point on your philly trip, right? This was where we stopped. It's in the middle of a block in the heart of Old City, and looks like I hoped it would: a nice facade, but kind of like a hole-in-the-wall once you step inside. It was a little crampy in there, but we shared a table and all was well.

We all got steak+provolone, and it was delicious. I was full, but couldn't stop eating it (until I had 2 bites left... I was about to burst). Their fries are good, too. I may have to go back today to buy the tee shirt...

For me, the sausages all tasted pretty bland. Idk if that's a German thing or what. My fiance says they have pretty authentic food. If you're a picky eater you should try somewhere else. They offer German candies and other items of German origin for purchase and the cashier's desk

Was so great for breakfast we went twice. Best sweet potato pancakes hands-down ever had in my life. Hope I can replicate them at home. Service was top-notch. If you're from the north and you remember the old Woolworth store and diner counter this is just like it. Surprisingly great experience what a fab find
Amazing food! Great waiter!! Great drinks!!! Going for second day in a row!! Crab claws to die for.. voodoo juice yummy.. red beans and rice so flavorful

I never usually write reviews. But this place was so terrible, I had to write this one. I will never be coming back to this establishment for these four reasons.

1. Host service was terrible, we were told it would be a 10-15 minute wait tops. We sat at the bar for 40 minutes with no update until our table was ready.

2. Service was annoying. We were left unattended for the first 15 minutes, confused and hungry. We asked the runner that brought us a wrong order to bring us our server. And when we did get him, he had no idea if we were his table. 

3. FOOD. I wish I had taken photos of our table, because all the food was still there! The burger was underwhelming, weird patty, pickled jalapenos, and black shriveled bacon. We also got the french onion soup, wings, and tots. Overall the food was nasty, and overpriced. 

4. Last but not least, the management service was dreadful. We told our server how we did not like the burger w/ fries, and french onion soup (which we hadn't eaten). And the manager took off 10% of the burger off because the burnt bacon was apparently 10% of the order. Unfortunately, we drunkenly paid for our check, as we left still hungry by the end of the night.

SAVE YOURSELF THE TIME AND MONEY.

DO NOT GO TO SIX FEET UNDER.

Nice place.. We really enjoyed playing the slots.. 
and the concert area looks cool! Love the hotel and pool as well. Close to home, close enough that we got to watch the fireworks last year right from our front porch.

Their food is really good.... BUT....... 
if you order to go, don't. I asked for truffle fries and asked for truffle bacon aioli, asked for chipotle ketchup for the build your own burger. I also told them no pickles because im allergic. I even had the server repeat the order back to me and she repeated it back correctly. When I received my Togo order, they gave me regular fries, regular garlic aioli, no ketchup at all, oh.. And pickles!!  For the truffle fries and trufflie aioli and chipotle ketchup, there's an upcharge. And i didnt get any of those. I was really disappointed. I understand its insanely busy, but the food allergy for the pickles? Cmon. 

The two hour wait to dine in  is not worth it.  Did it once, took a server 20 mins just to ask us if we wanted something to drink. Told the server I'm allergic to pickles, and the kitchen STILL gave me pickles with my burger. Servers are friendly. I'm sure people in the kitchen are over whelmed, but i don't think its excusable to ignore customers food allergies when the server clearly rights it down. 

Its insanely busy. Once this place dies down and hopefully has more organization and decides to take reservations, I'll come back. It iust feels like the kitchen jips ur orders cause they dont think the customer will know the difference between truffle fries/aioli and the norm.

it's not a five star experience end of story.  Let me start with the cocktails - they were superb for Edmonton. No question just try as many as you please because there are no bad choices there. We ordered Gouda and onions along with hickory fries for starters. Not only did they take about 25 min but the onions were more raw than cooked.  Fries were smoky, crispy and tasty. There are about 5 mains to choose from. We all picked the steak. It's 12 oz so be hungry.  The steak was excellent but we had a lot of leftovers.  I would return for unique cocktails and appetizers but probably move on for dinner. Love the ambience but sadly not the food.  My stars are for beverages and service.

All in all it was a terrible experience at red lobster today, we got seated very quickly but then we couldn't get any biscuits over an hour. Our waiter was missing in action most of the whole time, not even another waiter could get extra sauce, tartar sauce, cocktail sauce. After we asked we got a free refill because we sat here and drank the whole thing. Now we're ready to pay and we can't even get a check or to go box  I just would NOT recommend this red lobster anytime soon!! I wanted to give ZERO stars but it wouldn't let me, I had to put one

Came here to grab something quick. Waited about 20 minutes for my food and while folks who ordered well after me started to get their food. The cashier kept saying it was coming and then when she finally asked the kitchen they said it was coming. Waited for another 10 minutes when I asked her did they even start and she realized she forgot my order. DO NOT go here if you are trying to something quick.
We just finish our dinner at 101, I have to say, we don't want to go back anymore, they got new menu and raise the price and the portion is much smaller.
Excellent seafood, terrific gluten free menu, especially for a southern restaurant. The staff was friendly and attentive and I recommend you eat here if you're in the French Quarter.

Note this visit was a couple years ago, but it will definitely keep me from going back.
The dishes were so dirty I didn't get a chance to taste the food. We had already gotten our meals, and I was about to ask my waiter for clean silverware, but it was taking a long time to get his attention because they were so packed. I went to take a sip of my water, and gag, half the inside of the glass was coated with a thick layer of what looked like Alfredo sauce, and flecks of white stuff were floating in it. I had already taken a sip before actually looking at the glass, so of course I was thoroughly grossed out. Couldn't eat a bite after that. 
No one ever cleared the table, and the waiter never came back to give me a chance to complain, despite my attempts to get his attention. He just came and hurriedly plopped the check on the table, either ignoring or not hearing me call out "wait!" as he sped off. By then I just wanted to be out of there, so I paid the bill rather than try to literally chase my waiter down. 
This restaurant might have good food, I don't know, but there are lots and lots of other restaurants with good food in New Orleans.

I love Tria, and especially this location. I always order the Truffled Mushroom with Fontina and occasionally the Sliced Italian Meats and they are great! I love mushrooms in general but the bruschetta here it's divine. Along with a glass of wine this is the perfect way to end a busy day. I've been there more than 3 times now and I will keep going as long as they have my favorite snacks.
Large serving of sambal Kang Kong, crispy fragrant fried squid, roti prata are my comfort food. Chicken rice could be better, stronger. overall best for those who miss home in southeast Asia.

Had lunch there this week with a co worker....excellent as usual.  Had the meatloaf and my choice of  (double) macaroni and cheese as a side.  Both were excellent and the portions were generous.  The service was great: quick, friendly and attentive.  No wonder it's our go to place for work meetings!

Food was great! Ordered a blackened chicken Caesar sandwich and wife ordered fajitas. Food was hot and fresh. Wife went again without me and said it was one the best pizzas she's had in a long time. Looking forward to going back soon!
They are small company that supports small companies.  The beer and find us fantastic.  The Wed farmers market rocks.  They support sustainable living.  Love love.

The food at Nada is delicious! Service is great and the prices are fair! Go and see for yourself! 
I went for my birthday with my entire family and everyone loved it! We all got something different and then we had a sample of everybody's dish. Who's restaurant is exceptionally clean. There is restrooms are the cleanest I've ever seen! I have the salmon tacos and they were amazing! Yummy

When my friend and I walked into the Bourse, we didn't have an inkling of what we wanted so we did two laps around to see what was open/looked appealing. We both circled back on Mighty Melt because we were feeling comfort food. We ordered two sandwiches and watched as they made it. They dump literally 5 lbs of cheese on thick slices of bread on the grill and then broil it to melt the cheese. That's a really good way to ensure the cheese is melted all the way through because let's be honest, what's worse than a grilled cheese with half-melted cheese (nothing). They make their own little pickled veggies, and you can add a (small) side of fries to your sandwich for a discount. I will definitely come back here and possibly share a sandwich with a friend next time because they are DENSE.

My first trip to Ripple Bagel deli was today and I cannot wait to go back to try the other sandwiches! I had the Indy 500 breakfast sandwich on a jalape√±o bagel. Great stuff. My girlfriend had the Big'N. It was really good as well. I saw the morning mess after I ordered and that will be my next order.

We also had the Indiana chili with cheese and crackers. Very tasty. 

I love the atmosphere and the staff was very friendly.
The best Asian food you will find in Newark! I highly suggest the Mango Chicken with Coconut rice. You will NOT be disappointed. Great service and delicious, high quality food.

The location can't be beat but the food and service leave much to be desired.  The staff is just not trained  and you can only blame management for the overall lack of attention.  Waited for a a table for 15 minutes although they were not busy at all -  just trying to sell more drinks at the bar.  Food was not served at the proper  temp - warm but not hot shrimp and grits.  Portion size was four shrimp - this was an entree not an appetizer.  You can have a better meal elsewhere in the Quarter.

Places like this are our McDonald's.  If we want something cheap and fast, we go to one of these chain type places.  Up until now O'Charley's has been a viable option.

I wish I would have read the Yelp and Google reviews for the Avon, Indiana O'Charley's.  It is TERRIBLE.  I have been to several other locations and they were tolerable.  This ruined me for life.

Our server took our orders and bailed.  We can't recall ever seeing her again until the check came.  

Apps and rolls came without plates because they were all dirty.  This was at 11:30.  They open at 11:00. 

Entrees came from food runners who stood at the side of the table and yelled  "BLACK AND BLEU CAESAR?"  "STEAK AND CHICKEN?"  Our table had two app plates and a salad dish on it when the first runner came with the food.  I had to ask for them to be removed and she acted like I was asking far too much of her.  

My Black and Bleu Caesar salad was so overdressed it was beyond edible.  It was like caesar soup with lettuce.  My husband ordered from the brunch menu.  That was a mistake.  I'm pretty sure the "omelet" was made off site as it looked like something they reheat at Dunkin Donuts. 

In the past, we feel like we've had decent enough food from O'Charleys, but what the five of us were served today was not good food.  

The bill was $82.  I rounded up to $90 and I FEEL TERRIBLE ABOUT IT.  We are standard 20% tippers and rarely does it fall below that.  As a matter of fact, I think this is only the second time we've tipped so poorly, but the truth is she didn't even earn that $8.

Having just moved to palm harbor, I'm on a mission to find the best pizza in the area. Queens is my favorite so far. Everyone is always very friendly. The pizza is very good. It's more pan style than New York, the sauce they use is excellent, not too sweet or overpowering, and they go a little heavy on the cheese, which is very flavorful, which I love. The Greek salad is excellent as well. Queens is my new go to pizza place.

Stopped in for breakfast while vacationing in St. Pete.  I had an iced coffee which has free refills and it was average. One of my biggest pet peeves is a nice coffee shop who doesn't offer fresh 1/2 & 1/2 which they didn't. They had the little cups. The best part of the visit was the food. My daughter had a hot ham and swiss croissant which she thought was very good. I had the bacon, egg and cheese croissant which was delicious and the Nutella and chocolate croissant which was equally delicious.

Took the family (5 of us) here two weeks ago and we were greeted by a girl that asked, "are you here to eat?".  What?  Then she went on to say, "our kitchen is backed up so we are seating any more "food" customers"

Oh my God, I have no more words to share other than...are you freaking kidding me??

Don't waste your time

Don't be fooled. The pickle tasted like a Claussen, the rye bread was Wonder Bread with a few caraway seeds, and there was more melted swiss than corned beef on the sandwich. Also the menu was very pork heavy. Here's a quote from the waiter about the Matzo Ball soup. "I haven't tried it but it sure smells good". If you're going to do something like this, do it right. This place reeks of investors who could care less about the food. Dr. Brown's Cel-Ray, bacon, and fatty Pastrami doesn't make a good deli.

We came here about 7:45 am.  We were the only people in the restaurant,  which was fine.  The manager was our server and he was very nice.  I got  the early morning breakfast and my friend had the breakfast burrito.  Everything was just ok...I'll give them another shot...Maybe dinner
Fast, friendly service.  Getting in and out of the parking lot is rough during heavy traffic times.

Best restaurant ever , food is great prices are super affordable, the staff are friendly super nice they make you feel like part of the family. I go here every morning and let me tell you everything is delicious .

J Gilberts is usually our go to special restaurant but we were disappointed this time. At the table I ordered a Stella draft beer. It arrived with 1/3 foam. I asked the server to redo and he brought out a still beer with absolutely no head and filled exactly to the line on the glass leaving a noticeable unappealing gap between the beer level and rim.  After finishing that I ordered a second and received the same presentation.  If I'm spending well over $200 on a meal, I certainly don't expect for the server and bartender to play games with me over an extra ounce of beer. I should also mention that my $32 pork chop was overdone.

This is a good ole diner; breakfast, lunch, and dinner. They have an old school counter, but no one is behind it and couple of tv's and tables and booths that look old. The wait staff is Lifers; most are 50 something's grinding it out every day. They know their stuff and can make suggestions. They order with an IPad so they're not stuck in the past and service is good. 

Every lunch I've gone there is families, single old dudes and Ladies on the patio. It's the kind of place older folks go to every day. They get the same: Sunny side up eggs, crisp bacon and a black coffee. I've been there twice and the same lady showed up again. 
I've only had the Cobb (see pic I posted),the BsT, and the shrimp crab bisque. I was happy with the salad and sandwich, but the bisque is kinda watered down.
I liked my lunch there and think old school diners are awesome.
Do yourself a favor and get the Bst it's a great twist on the Bacon,lettuce and tomato classic.

Amazing local selection of beers and spirits - I believe all the beer and spirits are made right here and everything was just so so good. The bartender was also really nice and added some rhubarb bitters to my Dark and Stormy. Dang if I lived near St. Louis I would come here all the time. The prices are also so reasonable ($6/pint for beer and $7 for my cocktail...). This place literally cannot be BEAT.

My favorite lunch spot! (Except Mondays, no lunch. Wah.) The beer selection is on point and the food is pretty darn good. Always consistent and comforting. I love the vegan bahn mi, lettuce wraps, roasted veg salad, fries, and black bean burger. They have a nice selection of vegetarian options and often a tasty soup I can eat as well. The outdoor seating area is good for people watching and the indoor seating is perfect for hiding. (Sometimes I come to have lunch + a beer in my pajamas. I work from home!) Polite and knowledgable staff, fast service, great location.

This is one of my all-time favorite places to come! They have a great selection of drinks and always have fresh baked goods available. There are always tables available because they have so many. This is one reason I come here often because I'm usually trying to find a place to get work done. 

I also like this place because they are one of very few coffee shops that are open until 10pm! It's very difficult to come home after work and find a place to go, because most cafes close at 6 or 7. Definitely check this place out!!
Great quality shushi amazing dishes and motivated wait staff. I took my kids and we had an amazing experience. Highly recommended!

This is my favorite restaurant in town. Whenever my husband and I can sneak away for a date we go here. We have never been disappointed with the food. All locally used foods and such a creative chef. My favorite thing in the menu is the butter cake!!  
We just spent our 10th anniversary there and it was by far the best experience. We got the best seat in the house, perfect for people watching. Our server Jeremy was amazing, recommended wine to go with my trout that paired perfectly. 

And after they found out it was our 10 yr they added a very special touch to the evening with a sweet message and the manager stopped off to say hi. Love the staff, love the food
Love this place !!!! Great spot to chill, friendly staff; a must everytime I hit up south street !

Extremely disappointed! 
Took my niece, from out of town, to her father's favorite Haunt as a kid. Valley Green Inn has been a "go-to" for decades because of it's location, ambiance and (maybe not great but) good food.
Not this time.
Shared the Caesar Salad, which was large and tasty. The lettuce was huge, barely cut up.
Two of us ordered the "Strip Steak". It really takes some nerve to call what we got a Strip Steak. It was less than half an inch thick. Almost had to wonder if they only had one steak left and divided it, to have two portions.
Ordered them Medium rare but how do you cook a steak this thin to any given temperature? One was over done the other well done at one end and rare at the other.
$32 for this steak that looked like something that should have been made into cheese steak!
Wish I had the nerve to tell them to take it back.

My husband ordered Sea Scallops - which was a better choice but still pretty bad. Received 5 scallops all different sizes, all smaller than a half dollar. All over cooked.

Our waitress was a gem!

Tir na Nog can be a really hard place to like somtimes.  The drinks are expensive, half the food isn't great, any girl in your party is going to hit on by 30 yr old former frat dudes in their young republican costumes and  the weekend cover bands need to learn something other than Journey or Fountains of Wayne.

That being said, there are some things that make Tir a blip on the Center City br radar.  The bartenders and staff make some good goddamn drinks.  I'm buzzed after one (and I was in the Navy), but I don't make the yuck face after every sip.  Perfect hiding of drinks that have too much booze in them.  They have a good beer selection and even when busy, your drink gets remembered and you feel well taken care of by everyone from the doormen to the busboys.

I do end up spending half my time there in the alley smoking, but they let you bring your drinks out there and you don't have to be coralled in the smoker's cage like some places.  

Half of their food may suck, but the other half is perfect snack fare off the bar menu at least.  I recommend the popcorn shrimp or the sliders as table sharefood.  

Go when you already have a heavy buzz and at least three of your friends are going to be there.  Be prepared for semi-cougar, really drunk and probably married broads to 1.) spill a drink on you 2.) make you dance with them to an awful cover of Stacy's Mom 3.) Fall down

I've had some really good times there, but I once saw a really chubby Asian guy with a beard take his shirt off while dancing by himself to Billie Jean.  Then he walked around the bar hanging his shirt off his finger hitting on all the girls still lingering around at closing time.  It's really a crapshoot.  You decide if it is worth the risk.
